title: SONO DEI LADRI NON PRENOTATE - THEY ARE UNBOOKED THIEVES
text:
Sono dei truffatori , non prenotate in questo hotel , ho prenotato con Booking e per avere la camera pagata su Booking mi hanno chiesto soldi extra , dicendo che non hanno messo loro le foto su Booking , dopo che mi sono rifiutato mi hanno detto che se lasciavo la struttura mi rimborsavano totalmente , invece mi hanno truffato e non mi hanno dato più i soldi !!! State lontano da questo hotel !!!

They are scammers, do not book in this hotel, I booked with Booking and to have the room paid on Booking they asked me for extra money, saying that they did not put their photos on Booking, after I refused they told me that if I left the structure they would reimburse me totally, instead they scammed me and did not give me the money anymore !!! Stay away from this hotel !!!

title: DO NOT book this hotel!
text: Just like many others, I made a reservation only to cancel it later. Despite following the proper cancellation procedure, I have yet to receive the full refund. Worse still, the hotel is a master of ignoring phone calls, emails, and even direct messages on Booking.com (but they urged me to settle the prepayment when I hadn’t already done so earlier). It's like they vanished into thin air! This place is a scam, plain and simple. They should be blacklisted from every hotel booking website to protect innocent travelers. Spare yourself the agony and choose ANY other hotel. Don't let them ruin your trip like they did mine.

title: AVOID
text: I wish I had read these reviews prior to booking. As seems to be the case for others, I have not received a refund nor can anyone at LuxUrban or Wyndham tell me the status of the refund for my fully refundable reservation. Hoping this review might save others from the same frustration.

title: Definitely not 4 Stars !!!!
text:
Terrible experience! 
The worst hotel we’ve been to in NYC
The whole place needs a renovation
We didn’t like anything about this place 
The room was small and there is no possibility to open the windows.. bathroom is ok although the decor is 1980’s style

title: Absolutely unreliable!
text: I booked a room from booking.com on 26 genuary 2024, the same day I deleted it with free cancellation policy. I did not receive any refund yet (i paid 1623 dollars)  and the hotel is ignoring my emails. Hope you will answer soon or I will have to contact my lawyer

title: Hotel charged me for the whole amount (6 nights) for a refundable reservation and money not refunded
text:
Do NOT make a prepaid reimbursable reservation in this Hotel 57 by LuxUrban because they will not refund you if you cancel. This hotel charged me more than 1,500.00 US dollars  and is NOT REFUNDING the charge.
I made a reservation in November 2023 (for April 2024) via booking.com with cancellation free of charge and I cancelled the reservation on February 13, 2024 (I cancelled the reservation after reading the terrible reviews in Tripadvisor, Booking and Google). Today, March 28, 2024 I am still trying to get my money back. The hotel only answered me end of February telling me to be patient and since then they have not answered any of my messages, also the phone provided by booking never answers. On March 15, 2024 I got in touch with booking.com and they say they will refund the money if the hotel does not, but I am still waiting. The hotel is not answering to Booking either.  My only hope is that booking.com makes the refund because if not, this Hotel will have swindled, scammed me more 1.500 US dollars.

title: Terrible experience with pre payment and further refund
text:
Terrible experience with pre-payment and further refund.
I made a reservation and was told that i will pay only at the check in. Not only was totally charged in the moment of the reservation, I later cancelled it but have not received my refund yet

title: Very pleasant stay in Midtown East
text: Had a very comfortable stay here. I chose here as it was a short walk to the Roosevelt Island tram and was visiting a friend there.  Also is a short walk to Central Park. Conveniently close to subway also. Room was great and had no issues at all with the place. Will definitely return again.

title: Loud construction next door, no breakfast, staff do not care
text:
We spent four nights here. We chose the location because it was not far from
where my daughter works. There are other comparably priced places that we considered but this hotel also advertised complimentary breakfast so we booked it. 

The first morning, we were awakened early to the loud sounds of constriction workers right outside our window! So disappointing - I wish they told us about this upon check-in.

And while there were coffee and pears available, there was nothing else offered during our entire stay. No breakfast as advertised. 

Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but the place is dated and the elevators are not super reliable.

Perhaps the most disappointing was the lack of care I encountered with the person at the front desk while talking about our issues with the hotel.

title: ABSOLUTELY TO AVOID
text: I too was deceived by booking on booking with FREE CANCELLATION and PAYMENT IN THE STRUCTURE. As soon as I entered the credit card for GUARANTEE they immediately charged me the entire sum, without being notified. They are impossible to contact, email and telephone are non-existent. They tell you to write to emails that don't exist. I'm still waiting for a response and hoping for a refund. YOU ARE SCANDALOUS in 2024 you don't even have a reference email either on booking or on the site. There is no transparency and clarity. Unfortunately I read the reviews of other travelers too late but AVOID BOOKING IN THIS HOTEL otherwise it will be a nightmare to get your money back.

title: Don’t refund money
text: They don’t refund the money back when free cancellation occurs. I booked a room 1110$, but due to some reasons I was obliged to cancel but till this day I haven’t got my money back. I wrote to Agoda. They try to contact them, but they can’t get response to.

title: Do not make a reservation with this hotel, they will not give you your money back
text: Be warned that this hotel will not refund you your money, Terrible experience with this hotel. I made a reservation through Booking in December which I had to end up canceling. I spent 2,500 dollars and I am yet to see a single cent back from the hotel. Furthermore every time I try to call them they will not pick up the phone. If Booking does not manage to get my money back I will sue this hotel .

title: Be careful when booking and cancelling! The hotel will not refund you, even after 60 days!
text:
The hotel has a nice location in Midtown Manhattan. The rooms and beds are OK. My room didn't have a safe, others had one for a fee, and there was no fridge either. Calling breakfast breakfast is a disgrace, you can only get 2 muffins and a coffee. Seating is very spartan. 
If you want to leave your luggage on the day of departure, it costs $5 per piece of luggage.
The biggest disgrace, however, is that you have to pay the hotel in full when you book. The cancellation policy states that you can cancel free of charge until shortly before your trip. I canceled this booking a week after booking. To this day, 2 months after the cancellation, I'm still waiting for my money! Even the hotel manager, Gabriel, could only shrug his shoulders and put me off! Absolutely impossible! So be careful when booking

title: Refund
text: I had an extremely disappointing experience with this hotel. I made a refundable booking in December 2023, which, unfortunately, I had to cancel. Despite the clear terms of my reservation, I have yet to receive the refund for the charge that was immediately applied to my credit card at the time of booking. I have persistently reached out to the hotel staff through phone calls, only to be met with inconsistent responses and no resolution. Furthermore, my attempts to communicate via email have been completely ignored. This lack of accountability and customer service is unacceptable. Terrible experience overall.

title: The photos are a hoax, don't go to that hotel. but
text:
I arrived at the hotel on the 12th, entering a totally old, dirty and neglected hotel, the lobby, the elevators, the hallways, the carpets. They gave me a room with dirty curtains, the bed in poor condition, the mattress completely expired, a shame. The heating did not work in the room, there was a stove. I asked to change rooms and the response was that that was the best room they had. I complained to booking that it was the company through which I hired that hotel, and they responded that they could not do anything since the payment went to the hotel directly. After spending a very bad night, and sleeping dressed in the bed that was not in good condition and caused intense back pain due to the mattress, a girl between 28 and 35 years old appeared, dressed in jeans and a T-shirt, totally informal for apologize but they couldn't do anything, that was their response

At the time I checked out of the hotel, on March 13, and bought a ticket back to my country, ending my vacation in a horrible way. It's a shame, a scam since they sell something that is not real. I requested that they contact me urgently to offer me a full refund otherwise I would initiate legal action, and they never answered me.

title: Refund for cancelled booking
text: I am waiting for refund for cancelled booking and its a nightmare to wait for refund. I am aiming to visit in August. Did my booking last month and cancelled haven't received refund which is not a good service. Please improve it and refund soon

title: THE TOWER OF TERROR
text: A disaster, the hotel is a very old tower, its furniture in very poor condition, the decoration is that of a hostel without category for a 1-star hotel, the building when you enter is dirty. It is for young boys who are sightseeing in the city. I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT. The photos are not true

title: Great staff, comfortable rooms.
text: Raymond made us feel welcome at arrival and gave us a great tip on breakfast location. Beds were comfy, room was clean and rooftop view was a nice plus! We had draining problem with sink and it was corrected immediately. Great Location! Will stay again!

title: Mixed review
text:
The hotel is well located close to tourist attractions.
Our room 619 was clean and away from any annoying noise..
The hotel is dated. Breakfast is in name only. The first day there was no coffee. The choice of food is very limited and there is a poster limit of two per person... (unheard of in a hotel)
The staff at the reception go from friendly.. to not looking up to avoid saying hello...

title: Nightmare cancellation sxperience
text: Dear Gabriel Kolendrekaj, Lilly and Tarik! You all promised to help get me a refund to a prepaid, but cancelled booking but do not. It has been 7 weeks since I booked, paid in full and immediately had to cancel. Hotel telephone number constantly out of order, no answers to emails, not possible to send attachments to emails - filtered as spam. Phone to front desk 100% out of order. Never has a booking experience been such a  nightmare. I actually think this must be a total scam. A Non-existent hotel actually. Prove me wrong. Publish a front desk number that functions.

title: No refund of a free cancelation reservation, and they ignore my emails.
text:
I canceled a free cancellation reservation more than a month ago (by booking.com) for a week of about 1599 USD, but after 40 days I have not received my funds back. But even worse, I tried to contact them by mail and my booking.com but have not received a reply so far.  

If you book a room in this hotel,  after my experience NEVER pay a fee for the reservation.

title: Good hotel, fair prices and proximity to the metro
text: Decent hotel 5 minutes walk from the 59 st metro. Clean and quite spacious rooms. Fairly competitive price, but pay attention to the breakfast included proposal. It is not a real breakfast but a snack with croissants and muffins, fruit, American coffee and tea. Furthermore, the management asks that you consume no more than 2 desserts per person

title: Estadia en New York
text: La cama un desastre, muy vieja, ademas me perdieron mi pijamas y no se hicieron cargo. La limpieza bien pero tampoco para destacar. El lugar un poco tenebroso al menos nuestro piso. No tiene relación el costo con lo que es el lugar. La ubicación muy bien pero no fue de nuestro agrado el lugar.

title: Lav budget hotel
text: Der er én ud af 3 elevatoren som virker. Skiltet med vådt gulv, har stået der 24/7 i 3 dage. Så der er altid kø. Der er 17 etager med mindst 15 værelser på hver etage. Morgenmaden er et æble, croissant og kaffe, med MAX 2 stk. pr. Person. Det virker til at være et studie hotel, hvilket nok er mest rammende. Dog er personalet rigtig flinke.

title: Worst cancellation process - avoid booking
text: Cancellation process has been a nightmare. After booking this property for a stay in June, I had to cancel the booking. I have sent multiple messages to the property on booking.com and have had no response. This has been the worst cancellation process I’ve gone through and would honestly advise NOT BOOKING this property. From the reviews below it is clearly a regular reoccurrence.

title: Perfect - everything we needed & more
text: Take negative reviews with a pinch of salt. This hotel was everything we needed. We upgraded to a balcony room on level 15. Lovely view, clean room, comfortable beds and quiet at night. No issues at all. Coffee and muffins provided in the morning - but also a Dunkin donuts next door that do great coffees!  No city tax which was a bonus - just a £150 refundable deposit- which was back in my bank before I even got on the plane home. Thank you for a lovely stay for my first trip to NYC!

title: Good stay
text:
Great location, fine for our needs. Yes the rooms are a little small and dated  but we were using it as a base so was perfect for us. 

Rooms spotless and were cleaned every day. 

Lovely helpful and friendly staff. 

Would stay here again as was a great stay.

title: Attenzione agli addebiti anche con cancellazione gratuita.
text: Ho prenotato questo albergo a gennaio 2024 per un soggiorno a marzo 2024, con cancellazione gratuita su booking e pagamento poco prima del soggiorno. Purtroppo non era chiaramente visibile durante la prenotazione ma l'albergo puó addebitare in realtá l'intero importo in qualsiasi momento ed é ció che ha fatto a poche ore dalla prenotazione. Purtroppo ho dovuto cancellare la prenotazione il giorno seguente (quindi giá da almeno 15 giorni) perché ho trovato un'alternativa migliore e mi é stato detto da booking che possono impiegare fino a 30 giorni per restituire la somma per un soggiorno che non é mai avvenuto.... e leggendo le altre recensioni temo che dovró combattere con questi tizi per molto tempo per riavere i soldi!!!!praticamente trattengono i vostri soldi per mesi senza che abbiate mai soggiornato in questo albergo!!!! Pratica al limite della truffa!!!

title: Scam.
text: The hotel is a scam. I made a reservation on booking. It was with FREE CANCELLATION in a 6 months time. Nevertheless the hotel charged me the FULL amount of the 6 nights stay SAME DAY without any warning. After my several attempts to get in touch with the hotel were left with no response at all I cancelled the reservation. 2 weeks later I have not heard anything from the hotel and obviously have not received my money back. The hotel responds neither to my nor to bookings messages. What annoys me the most: they charged the full amount on the day of reservation, but do not keep to the same timing for cancellations. And not responding makes me think this hotel is a scam. Avoid.

title: Ótima experiência, vale a pena!
text:
Recepção ótima, funcionários muito queridos e educados. 
O quarto maravilhoso, super espaçoso, era limpo todos os dias. Quarto super silencioso (algo difícil em Nyc que é bem turbulento).
Além de ter uma estrutura super ampla tem um ótimo chuveiro quente, televisão com Netflix, ar condicionado e a cama perfeita pra descansar depois de longa caminhada.
Localização muito boa, perto de vários pontos turísticos além de ter metrô perto também.  
Tivemos uma ótima experiência, voltaria novamente com certeza e indico de olhos fechados!

title: Attention, before booking!
text: Even though I had made a cancelable reservation up to 1 week before the stay and even though it wasn't possible, the hotel immediately charged the full amount of the stay. I had to request Booking's help in 3 different circumstances to get the sum back. The hotel I contacted avoided responding. The sum was eventually returned almost 2 months later. Heartfelt congratulations to the hotel that has devised a system to finance itself behind the backs of customers, avoiding requesting loans from banks! Be careful who books this hotel!

title: Vivement la prochaine fois ! Excellent établissement
text: Nous avons passé 3 nuits dans cet hôtel, son emplacement est simplement idéal !!! Le personnel a été particulièrement agréable et très serviable,  une petite pensée pour Elisabeth qui a été hyper top !!! Malgré les avis négatif que j’ai pus observer je ne suis pas déçus de cet établissement bien au contraire. Si je devais, enfin, la prochaine fois que je retourne à NY c’est la bas que je prendrais une chambre. Le petit déjeuner est simple mais complet ( café à volonté, viennoiseries, thé, cake et même des fruits). Les chambres convenaient parfaitement par rapport au tarif que j’ai payé. Il y avait tout ce qu’il faut. On n’y est que pour dormir !!! Mais malgré cela tout le confort y est !!! Beaucoup se plaignait de la saleté mais moi j’ai trouvé l’endroit agréable. Il y a un étage (3ème) avec un working aera, salle de sport. Si vous voulez un très haut de gamme je vous conseil d’aller dans un 5 étoiles dans ce cas et de payer votre chambre 10 fois plus cher. Personnellement je recommande cet endroit ancien en brique rouge, et deco américaine à l’ancienne. !!!

title: A warning against making reservations at this hotel.
text: I warn against making reservations at this hotel. They engage in, to put it mildly, unethical practices, if not outright fraud. Booking.com should immediately terminate its partnership with this hotel to maintain its reputation. As a victim myself, I have been waiting for a refund for my canceled reservation for over two months now! At the time of booking, they immediately charge the card even for reservations a year in advance. However, when it comes to refunds, they delay the process, claiming to ask for patience and similar nonsense. Maybe I should also write to my bank not to charge me interest on the unreimbursed amount because Hotel 57 by Lux is asking for patience. Mocking the customers! Avoid at all costs!

title: Brilliant holiday!
text: Booked for 4 days and was a wonderful experience staff were super friendly and helpful. Room was a little small but other than that our holiday was brilliant. Only a couple mins walk from subways and bus stops to get to locations which was perfect! Only main issue we had was construction work outside our window at 6.30am which woke us up a few times.

title: Worst Customer Service - No Refund Given after cancelling hotel room with free Cancellation
text:
The worst Customer Service Experience ever. Booked a room with free cancellation through booking for almost $1k however due to change in plans I had to cancel.

I have been chasing around to get refunded for a month already. AVOID this hotel at all costs. Am praying I do get the refund asap.

However seeing the comments here I think I am in for a ride. Funnily enough the messages I sent through booking got deleted.

title: Well situated hotel in centre
text: Very nice, quiet and well situated hotel. Very nice personel. The standard of room for this price in the centre of NY was very nice. One minus for air conditioning acting weirdly and waking us up (hard to manage) and the pressure for shower (but I think is the problem all over the USA...)

title: No refund.
text:
Infelizmente tive de cancelar a minha estadia.
Cancelei dentro do prazo previsto pois selecionei a opção de cancelamento gratuito.
Mas mesmo assim cobraram me a estadia. E faz hoje 30 dias e não me devolveram o dinheiro. Tenho estado em contacto com a booking.com para resolver a situação. E eles nem a mim nem a booking respondem. Tanto email como chamadas.
Uma vergonha.

title: Arbitrary Charges, Mixed Customer Service - Refund and Room issues seem to be true
text:
The only saving-grace with this hotel is the location (Upper-East Side) and the initial hotel staff that greeted us upon arrival. They were very friendly and accommodating. I forgot the lady and gentleman who helped us, but we came to the hotel early and requested that we be notified when our room was ready and she promptly notified us a few hours earlier than expected! Now with that said.

I don't care much for rooms and can overlook a lot with hotels because I view them as a place to sleep, but all the room and refund issues people are talking about seem to be true (still in the process, will update accordingly). There were some issues with the room I don't really care about, but could see how some people would. I couldn't lock the bathroom door because the hold where the hook is supposed to go was just empty like someone just ripped a chunk off the side door wall. The wooden panels next to the A/C vent look like they were just placed on and if you sat on it for a second you could have easily broken it. The room definitely feels like it was pieced together last minute, but I didn't care because of the price/location and we didn't plan on spending much time in the room anyways.

My main issue is that I booked this hotel with credit card points and was told by the initial front desk staff that it was pre-paid and nothing else had to be paid besides a $150 refundable deposit for potential damages. I stayed for 2 nights total and checked my credit card statement and found a charge for $311.xx and the $150 deposit still pending. First off, if you're going to charge additional fees there should be some sort of communication or invoice with the customer. This is a horrible business practice to randomly charge someone's card with ZERO communication. Secondly, what would I potentially be getting charged for? We were barely in the room and I was already informed everything was pre-paid by the initial receptionist and that the only thing was a $150 refundable deposit.

I called the front desk to bring up this issue today and was put on hold 3 TIMES after getting in one sentence in between each hold by Jennifer for a total of 20 minutes. If you need to handle other customers that's fine, but the fact that she was not helpful and rude while constantly putting me on hold gives me a sense of how this hotel operates. After finally looking into my situation that should have only taken a few minutes I was told to "reach out to my bank" as an initial response like she didn't want to help at all. After pushing for a direct answer because your hotel charged my card, so there should be some paper trail or invoice to refer to, not my credit card company as some generic response to get me your back, she finally replied "The refund should take 2-3 weeks, let me email the GM for further help." This tells it all, that she had the ability to help me from the beginning, but told me to reach out to my credit card company like it was their fault that their hotel charged my card as some cop out answer really leaves a sour taste in my mouth. I don't expect to get a refund for the 311.xx charge and deposit in 2-3 weeks and I expect that I'll have to reach out to my credit card company to dispute the charges, but we'll see.

Overall, thanks to the initial hotel workers, but everything after has been absolutely horrible.

title: Rating refund/customer service only.
text:
This review does not intend to rate the hotel per se as I had to cancel my reservation ( via booking); review aims to help other customers  to be prepared with what can happen with cancelled reservation under free cancelation policy.
The hotel is allowed to take the total amount of reservation and they say they honor refund policy, however, it took ages  for me to get the refund of ~6k $ ( precisely 3 months after cancellation and 6 months after the amount was taken) with poorly /not responsive / rude customer service and months of continuous follow-up from my side and "booking" team. If you cancel your reservation, check if the amount was taken and if so, make sure you will be refunded!

title: Needs full refurb and improved standards
text:
Arrived 24th December for 4 nights and was so disappointed. Waited at reception for 1 hour for a receptionist to book us in. I spoke with another member of staff that updated us to say he had gone on his break and they couldn’t contact him as he left his cell phone at reception. He had left the premises and finally arrived to book us in, with no apologies. After a full days travel from the UK it was the last thing we needed! 
Hotel downstairs looked nice - once you are passed that it all disappoints - in a big way! All communal areas on room levels are old and tired - like going back to the 70’s! Then it gets worse - the rooms are awful! Very old - loads of wooden panelling and hardly any storage. For a family of 4 we had to live out of our cases for 4 days. We had to get the next days clothes out of cases and put them over chairs or on the window ledge. Just enough room to walk around the beds and that was it! Cases had to be placed in the bathroom as nowhere else to put them! Only saving grace is the beds are comfortable! But don’t look under them - filthy and haven’t been cleaned in a very long time!
The only positive is the location on 57th - 5 mins to Bloomingdales, Tiffany’s or Subway at 59th.

title: Would stay again!
text: My partner and I stayed at Hotel 57 for a week and we enjoyed our stay. We initially booked a deluxe room but after checking in we discovered it did not meet our expectations. After speaking to Jennifer, she did everything she could to improve our stay. We were given a room that was perfect for our week long holiday. Another highlight was the location of the hotel. We were able to walk to many places of interest as well as multiple subway entrances were very close by. Each morning, there was coffee and pastries available to either take and go or sit in a nicely decorated sitting area. The bed was very comfortable and all staff, including the cleaning lady on level 17 were very friendly and helpful.

title: The rooms are clean. There is a sufficient amount of everything you need for a comfortable stay
text:
It was great experience!
Nice room and taste breakfast. 
Everyone was super nice to us. 

For my point of view it is the best location in New York. 

We stayed for 2 nights and will definitely come back here again

title: no refund room fee
text:
The hotel does not refund room fee even if the room is cancelled in due time to receive the full payment back!
I booked a room at the hotel (by bookin.com) for a week’s visit on august 2024. At the booking the hotel withdrew the total amount from my credit card. Due to changed plans the room was cancelled in due time (in decembere 2023). I have sent three mails

title: Vorsicht Betrug bei Stornierung
text:
Vorsicht, dieses Hotel ist Betrug!!!!
Die Kreditkarte wurde sofort nach Buchung belastet obwohl innerhalb von 24 Stunden storniert wurde. 
Es wurde mir mitgeteilt, dass die Rückerstattung 15-30 Tage dauern kann. Auf Rückfragen keine Auskunft mehr. Ich kann nur warnen vor diesem Verhalten

title: Cheap but unpleasant
text: Location is great, but there is a reason for the cheap price. Extremely rude staff, old rooms (very cold at night, no AC), there is no grab an go breakfast (they put a couple of croissants and no coffee) and the front desk at Night Shift it’s just an absolute bitc…

title: DISGUSTING HOTEL AND STAFF
text: Horrible hotel. Outdated rooms, awful front-desk staff and ridiculous prices. The entire hotel was full of rats. They had no breakfast, it’s an absolute scam. The receptionist Jennifer was ridiculously rude and arrogant.

title: GREAT VIEWS, GREAT PRICE, GREAT STAFF, IN THE HEART OF THE CITY!
text:
The GM Gabe was a great host by far!

Christopher at Front desk was very accommodating and friendly. Great pick on having him there during check in process. 

Excellent location 
15 min walk to time squares.
12 min walk to Rockefeller. 
17 min walk to empire state building.

Feeling lazy? subway center across the street.

Balcony deluxe rooms with awesome views of the city,

Great mini breakfast to grab a bite and go.

EXCELLENT STAFF ACROSS THE PROPERTY,

AFFORABLE PRICING BEING YOUR IN MANHATTAN.........

THANK YOU ONCE AGAIN FOR THE GREAT HOSPITALLITY

title: Good choice. Nice suprise.
text: Highly recommended in all terms. Great location to stay at the heart of Manhattan. Kind and helpful employees. The right choice to enjoy NYC.  The hotel is located near to many interesting places to visit.

title: Horrendous customer service and poor hotel manager
text:
Unfortunately we would not recommend staying at Hotel 57. During our stay there was an issue with our room that led to a burst pipe and flooding of our room. As we were checking out (2 days after the incident occured) I was informed that the $1,000 damages charge on my credit card had been declined and asked to provide alternative payment.
Upon asking to the manager he rudely asserted that the damage was our fault as we had not noticed a small sign written in English only to refrain from placing items on a vent as they *may* cause damage. Even in the case it was agreed the damage was our fault we were not informed of the charge or given an invoice whilst we were there and still able to discuss it, instead the hotel tried to place an arbitrary charge with informing us. Furthermore we agreed to discuss this further once an itemised invoice has been sent to us but the manager saw fit to place the charge on the credit card again (without my authorisation) which has no gone through. Since then we have received no communication and the hotel is ignoring our attempts to get in contact with them. As mentioned, even if we did not dispute that the damage was our fault, it is not acceptable to place the charges without communication or explanation, nor is it proper business practice to lie and ignore communications requesting information we are legally entitled to.

Absolutely disgusting behaviour and customer service.

title: Good values
text:
This hotel is great. It has all the facilities needed and offers a good access, due to its location, to Manhattan. The room is clean, big, confortable. 
There is water disposers, a gym, a wonderful rooftop. There’s even a little breakfast ( some pastries) which was a really good surprise. It was a very pleasant stay.

title: Zum Schlafen reicht es.
text:
Das Personal ist sehr nett.
Das Bad ist schön.
Die Fenster ließen sich nicht öffnen, somit war lüften nur durch die offene Tür möglich, aber auch im Flur ließ sich kein Fenster öffnen. Die Zimmer wirken auf den Bildern anders als in der Realität. Wenn man morgens kein Frühstückstyp ist ist es ausreichend, aber für Frühstückstypen ist es zu wenig. 5 Dollar muss man zusätzlich bezahlen, wenn man nach dem „Check-out“ die Koffer noch da lassen möchte. Die Lüftung, sowie die Heizung zu bedienen ist nicht so einfach. Es liegt zentral an der Subway und hat um die Ecke einige schöne Lädchen zum Speisen.

title: Worst experience ever
text:
The breakfast promised  on the booking page was not there. NO coffee , no tea or juices. Only a jar of water with an orange slide inside. When we ask they say is Wigan they have ! 

If you want to leave your luggage at check in or check out some hours you need to pay ! For every package received you will need to pay 7usd. 

The manager is not nice at all .

Definitely I will never choose this hotel again.

title: Great location , great rooms but poor dealing with luggage after check out.
text: So close to greatness, but let down on the final furlong. Charge $5 per bag to store, then don’t keep it in the store but in a lounge which is then closed to customers. There is only a tiny lobby to sit in so as well as paying to store my bags I couldn’t sit down until enough t people had left.  The lounge=ge should be available to patrons all day within reason. My visit ended up frustrated by lack of access to the hotel lounge. So easy to fix! Please do it

title: Great place
text: Clean, nice, beautiful hotel! Room was spacious, and clean. Located close to major sightseeing points in NYC. The staff were welcoming and sweet. Breakfast was good too!!!!!! Will come back again!!!!!

title: NYC Visit
text: Very clean and friendly staff. Exceeded my expectations. I loved our stay and breakfast was good. Good pastries. They also had coffees. It’s also in a very good location. I would definitely come back here!

title: Christmas trip
text: After an initial hiccup - which wasn’t the hotels fault, we had a fabulous stay at the hotel. Very comfortable rooms and well located. Didn’t get chance to use the gym sadly. All the staff were really friendly and willing to help us. Breakfast was a  little disappointing but we weren’t expecting it anyway. Would have been nice to have hot drinks available with the pastries. But there is a Starbucks very close by.

title: Great hotel to a good price in the central of Manhattan
text: The beds were soft and the rooms were tidy and fresh. Perfect place to stay if you want to stay in the central of Manhattan for a better price compared to other hotels. Good croissants at the breakfast.

title: Very comfortable stay at a great location
text: Very comfortable stay at a great location. We were offered complimentary breakfast with croissants and muffins. The rooms were clean. The only feedback is that the rooms could be a bit spacious. There were many closets.

title: Enjoy
text: L’hôtel est très bien placé, proche des métros et points clés de la ville. Dommage que le petit déjeuner propose uniquement de l’eau et des muffins pas de café ni de thé. Le personnel super cool et accueillant ☺️

title: Beware of cancellation SCAM
text:
Firstly I have not stayed in the hotel as I had to cancel my stay due to no accessibility rooms.

WARNING DO NOT BOOK this hotel with free cancellation.
Full money was taken up front a couple of months ago in 2 transactions (accommodation fee transaction + tax fee transaction).
I had to cancel on 5-Oct-23 due to no accessibility rooms.
I am still waiting on full refund.
Communication has been dreadful, they did say that the full refund was processed but still 10+ days on I have only have the tax fee transaction refunded.

Again silence from all lines of communication .

Easily the worst refund and cancellation process I've come across

title: Location, price, size all good
text:
Very clean, staff very nice. Big room, nice roomy bathroom. 3rd floor same floor as fitness center and filtered water. Top floor balcony nice if weather is. 
Breakfast is just pastries. Room coffee was good

title: Great place to stay
text: Location wonderful, especially for the subways. Bloomingdales is very close by. Fifth Avenue also is close by.Bedroom was spotlessly maintained. All staff were pleasant and helpful. Would have no hesitation in staying there again.

title: Excellent experience in Hotel57
text: Very nice room, clean and idealy located !  The hotel is at 10 minutes walk from central Park and also from the 5th avenue. There are also two subway stations near the hotel, so we used it really easely!

title: Staff made the stay!
text: Staff are so helpful and will always help with recommendations or tips to make your holiday better. Hotel location is spot on for either downtown or Central Park with most attractions in walking distance.

title: Great location
text:
YES-location is great, rooms are clean, beds preety comfortable 
NO-not really breakfast (no coffe or tea, old croissants);  fee (5USD) for keeping bag after check-out (never experienced in my whole life).

title: Good hotel
text: Great location to see city. It was a nice experience and staff very friendly. Buffet eith muffins fine, just no coffee or tea. That is a bit if a shame. We walked to subway close-by every morning and were on our way!

title: Great!
text:
Great location, friendly staff and amazing hotel hair dryer!!
Really great to have the free pastries offering in the mornings. Hotel didn’t have an adaptor. Beds really comfortable. Room had everything you needed

title: Great place !
text:
Great hotel, we spent 4 nights there with some friends for Thanksgiving
Excellent location in Midtown Manhattan (either walking or metro) which makes it super easy for tourism 
Friendly and welcoming staff always available

title: Great location and staff
text:
This was a perfectly convenient hotel for Broadway shows, the Met, and shopping.

The beds were comfortable and the staff from the reception folks to the house keepers were helpful.

Would stay again.

title: New York stay
text: It was comfortable to stay. We have stayed for thee nights at the hotel. We enjoyed the hotel because of the premier location in the center. Close to metro and Central Park. The staff was really friendly and was of good help during the stay

title: Comfortable stay in excellent location
text:
We enjoyed our 4-night stay here right in the heart of NYC but away from the hussle and noise. Our room had a lovely view of the street and was very quiet. The comfortable bed also allowed us to get a great sleep in every night.
Excellent location being close to 5th Ave, Central Park and subway. Walking distance to many cafes/restaurants and Times Sq. Will stay again next visit to NYC.

title: Hotel 57 :))
text: It’s fairly well located. Walking distance from Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and Central Park. A lot of restaurants and coffee shops around. Danny, Christopher, and Diana were great and all the rest of the hotel staff was kind and helpful as well!  Good pick :)

title: Good Value, Great Location
text: The hotel is well located in Manhattan and close walking to subway. Front desk staff was very helpful. Danny was an incredible resource on logistics and recommendations. Coffee was not available during our stay at breakfast service, but service gal kept up with pastries, fruit and spa water. The double bed room was surprisingly spacious. Elevators were not all working, but were able to resolve having 2 out of 3 working. The gym is well equipped. Roof top view is wonderful. Housekeeping did a great job with making sure we had towels and toiletries. Amazing value for what you get. Highly recommend seeking this hotel for your stay.

title: Great spacious rooms
text: Great room, very spacious! Beds were very confortable as well! The location is so good! Would love to stay here again! Good muffins and croissants for breakfast. Nice working gym. Spacious bathroom and modern

title: Pleasant Experience
text: Nice people, pleasant experience.  Super small elevators.  Staff were very nice.  Odd that they don’t offer any coffee with their breakfast offerings, and coffee in the room is substandard.  Had a nice time though, great location!

title: Amazing room, great cleaning
text: Very cosy confy room, with a great view. Great cleaning, very confortable bed! Defenitwly recomend! The best location in town ! You should defenitely stay at this hotel, we stayed for 7 nights! Awesome

title: Great Location & Service
text: Perfect location! Great service from Daniel A! Rooms clean, front desk very friendly. Love it, certainly will come back! Close to a lot of attractions. Safe and convenient hotel to stay as a family trip

title: Hôtel central et confortable
text:
Hôtel avec un emplacement très pratique pour visiter la ville avec 2 métros à proximité immédiate ! Lit confortable et chambre spacieuse !
Petit déjeuner avec des muffins et des viennoiseries mais rarement du café ! A recommander !

title: Very welcoming  - Danny A and Yuko was so lovely at checkout
text: Very clean and comfy - The room was cleaned every day and the breakfast was lovely… shampoo, conditioner and body wash and moisturiser was all included which was a bonus.. We will most definitely be back

title: Fab stay - would recommend
text:
We had a great 5 night stay. 

The room was very clean upon arrival and maintained to a high standard throughout. The room also had plenty of storage and space. 

The location was great. Close enough to everything but far enough away from the hustle and bustle so you are able to get a good nights sleep. 

A thank you to Danny who helped us with our luggage on the last day. Super friendly and helpful. 

I would recommend a stay here if you are looking for a reasonable, no-frill hotel in New York.

title: Disappointing hotel
text: Spent two nights with family at Hotel 57. The hotel is in a good location, however very run down and tired. Only a single working plug socket in the room - hidden under a table. Compact room with small double beds. Very light breakfast offered, poor selection of pastries and the second morning the drinks machine was out of order - no coffee or tea available. Charge for leaving bags at hotel after checking out.

title: Hotel in NYC
text: Overall the hotel was nice and well kept. They had coffee in the morning and pastries. The staff was very friendly and Helpful.  Only issue was only 1 elevators was working. Beside that my stay was good and I would come back. Very central to everything.

title: Alles bestens!!!
text:
Sehr schönes Hotel, sehr sehr freundliche Leute und eine super Lage! Wir haben New York in vollen Zügen genießen können!
Direkt zwischen der Lexington Avenue und der Park Avenue gelegen, waren es nur wenige Schritte zum Central Park oder in die Shoppingmeile 5 Avenue!

title: Nice place
text: The hotel exceeded my expectations. Impeccable service, well located and spacious rooms made for a delightful stay. The central location allowed easy access to key attractions, enhancing the overall experience. Highly recommend for a memorable and comfortable stay in the heart of the city.

title: Great
text:
Our stay was great, Daniel Machado that looks after the bags was amazing and very welcoming, and Raymond from reception was so kind with us. 
The room was clean and the bed confy. 
I will recommend for sure

title: Great hotel and excellent staff
text: A really lovely, clean and friendly hotel. Staff were very helpful and welcoming. Great location too with subway very close by. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, would stay again. Can’t recommend enough .

title: Charming hotel in good location
text: Charming hotel with good sized rooms and classic decor. Be sure to head up to the 17th to see the Chrysler building from the roof terrace. The grab and go breakfast wasn't ideal, but no shortage of places nearby.

title: Muy buena
text:
Muy bien situado, muy bien comunicado con los metros y los autobuses   están cerca.  Es acogedor, unas vistas increíbles desde la terraza. 
La limpieza esta muy bien y el desayuno cafe, bolleria, fruta, tes y poco más, pero para suficiente .

title: Awesome!
text: Great hotel, great experience! My teen daughter and I traveled together and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. Grab and go breakfast was good for a quick start to the day. Highly recommend to travelers.

title: Centro de operaciones en Manhattan
text: Cómodo lugar en medio de la ciudad. Cama muy cómoda, el personal es muy amable, la instalaciones no son muy modernas, pero si tú plan es visitar la ciudad y dormir el hotel cumplirá tus expectativas sin lugar a dudas. Tiene una bonita terraza en el piso 17.

title: Hotel muy bien ubicado en manhattan
text: La habitación sencilla pero muy funcionable, todo muy limpio, cada día. Hotel muy bien ubicado y con vistas preciosas desde la terraza. El personal del hotel muy amable y servicial. Sin duda una muy buena opción para visitar Manhattan y tener todo muy cerca, a un precio asequible.

title: Very nice and friendly personal
text:
Very nice personals
Very clean rooms
A little bed
But a perfect service
It was so nice and good 
Maria was so nice and raymond too
I have great birthdY here in new york city
The place is so safe and the central park is nere
There are cool restaurants here

title: Recommended
text: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. The room was very big, with comfy beds and pillows. It is very well located, close to many spots in NYC, such as Central Park or the Chrysler. There is a nice rooftop with views to the Chrysler! Highly recommended!

title: Best hotel for travel!
text: The hotel was in an excellent location in midtown and close to the subway. We could go anywhere and felt safe. The rooms were clean and spacious and cleaned everyday.  The staff was super friendly. I’m staying here again!

title: Good review
text: I had an amazing experience the hotel was close to everything we wanted to do, the accommodations were nice as was the staff. The cleaning service was very good and the breakfast were as well, I would recommend this  hotel if you are staying in New York

title: Great Time
text: Had a great time! Perfect place to stay to explore the city. Very kind and helpful staff. Very close by to Central Park. Which is a must see and the best place to experience the fall colors. Also super close to time square and other sights.

title: Nice and clean hotel
text: Very nice hotel with great view, especially on the rooftop. There is one negative point though, it is just a bit noisy when your room is close to the elevator. The staff is really professional and nice

title: Excellent hotel with friendly staff
text: Excellent hotel in midtown Manhattan, good space rooms, bed & pillows very comfortable, great bathroom. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Great for business & sightseeing. Recommend and will stay again

title: Visita express y acogedora
text: Hotel centralizado en la zona turística de Nueva York , excelente servicio del personal que nos atendió y las  dependencias adecuadas para venir con niños, las camas grandes y cómodas , les recomiendo el hotel de todas maneras . Muchas gracias por todo

title: Great hotel, great location
text: My entire stay at Hotel 47 was flawless! From Raymond and Diana's customer service at the front desk, to the server in the coffee area, front door and house keeping, everyone's attention to detail and pleasant attitude made this such an enjoyable stay during my first trip to NYC. The location was great, I felt safe coming and going at all hours and there was a great variety of coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. I highly recommend staying here!

title: Very Hospitable
text: I had a really great stay here! The room, lounge and kitchen area was always clean. Room service was very helpful as well as the rest of the staff. Everyone was very hospitable, Especially Raymond. He was the kindest. I absolutely recommend this hotel.

title: Nice stay
text:
Nice stay, great localization of the hotel and a walking distance from all major attractions of the NYC. Good room service, rooms clean and tidy (furniture a bit old but everything is working as it schould). Sweet breakfast (muffins, croissants e.t.c). Thanks to Diane, Danny H. Generally would recommend the venue and would stay here again.
Monika and Peter K.

title: Great service with a view
text: Stylish, comfortable, huge room. Very clean and comfortable bed. The view from the room as well as from the rooftop is amazing. Diana from the front desk was extremely kind and helpful, sorting out a small technical issue, also Dannya help a lot with storing my luggage.

title: Great location and very nice Hotel!
text: Great location in Mid-town!  It is easy to walk to Times Square and other great venues.  The room had nice views and was very clean. There is a balcony on the 17th floor that offers great views of the city. The staff was friendly too.  We'll stay here when visiting Manhattan again.

title: Great experience
text:
Great position, close to many attractions. 
Spacious room, very clean and beautiful view. Very silent room all day. 
Lovely staff. 
Special thank to Danny A, Diane, Nam, and cleaning ladies for their kindness!

title: Voyage à New York
text:
L’hotel est tres bien situé, à deux pas des stations de métro. Il est situé dans un quartier tranquille, calme et permet de bien programmer tout ce qu’il y a à faire à New York.
La chambre est correcte et on s’y sent bien.

title: Very nice hotel
text:
Very nice hotel, clean and spacious rooms. 
The staff at reception and cleaning is super friendly and the location is great. The subway is just around the corner, but many attractions can also by reached by foot. The price was in very good relation to the service.

title: Really good hotel
text: Staff was accommodating and very friendly , would come back again!  We went and checked in a little early and they also offer free water and pastries, location is near 5th avenue and accessible to the subway.

title: Great location, recommend for staying
text: Our room was at the top floor, it was nice and clean but a little small, however perfectly sufficient for the two of us as we were in the city all day. Also with a lovely view and a big terrace. The location of this hotel is perfect, also we couldn’t hear so much noise from outside the street as we were expecting. Staff was excellent, always helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend if you’re planning to visit NY and spend all day in the city.

title: Good place to stay to explore NYC!
text:
Great location and good value for money overall. 

-Breakfast grab n go was very tasty. No coffee for my first 3 days (boo!) but machine mysteriously appeared on day 4! Hope it's there to stay :)
-Location is awesome. A minute from Bloomingdales and a subway too. Loads of clothes shops/cafes on your doorstep. 

Make sure you have a card with your name on it to check in - I arrived an hour before my husband with his debit card, and was told very firmly (and a bit crossly, which didn't make me feel great...) that I absolutely couldn't go to my room without him there as card wasn't in my name. I'd paid in advance so was only the damage deposit that they needed it for. 

I understand now its a common US policy, but its not a requirement I've ever experienced in the UK, so caught me off guard.

title: The worst hotel
text: By far the worst experience I have ever had with a hotel, beware!!!  They overbooked at least ten people and had no rooms available nor did they try and do anything to help us, leaving us stranded in Manhattan with no where to go, it was only a 24 hour trip to see a play, all rooms in Manhattan last minute were over $1000 a night. Never go here, at their whims they can just cancel without any warning

title: Great location, comfy bed but a few draw backs..
text:
Initially we were really pleased, we were able to leave our bags for free until our room was ready,  when we headed out we realised what a great location the hotel is. On check-in, staff were polite and helpful and we were given a room on the 9th floor. 
Before I write much further I will stress that I am fairly low maintenance as a traveller, I read other people’s reviews beforehand and thought people were being fussy for moaning about the lift. But my god the lifts were slow and full quite often. 
There was a water and ice machine on the 12th floor which was great but annoying when you needed to fill your bottle up in the night. 
There was no fridge in the room which was sad. We had a coffee machine which we used for hot water, they gave us coffee but no English breakfast tea so we made a note to ask. 
Bed was comfy and air con worked fine. Shower gel was empty and wasn’t filled up the entire time we were there (5 nights).  
‘Breakfast’ is advertised as ‘grab & go’ and it consisted of 2 water dispensers and paper cups, loads of green tea teabags, hot water and paper cups and the same 3 varieties of pastries/ muffins. When I asked somebody if there was any fruit or English breakfast tea I was told ‘no’. One of the staff said they were going through a change of management, but I read somebody said that on a review about a month ago. Like I said we stayed here 5 nights and there are only so many muffins and pastries you can eat. 
One member of staff was quite rude to me in the breakfast room and snatched my water bottle out of my hand. Wasn’t greatly impressed with that. 
The location was really great, we were up and out most days so really only needed a place to crash. For the price we paid those things I mentioned were quite disappointing.

title: Emplacement parfait , personnel adorable
text: Great - no: perfect location; the staff has been so kind and helpful; pour ce qui est du petit déjeuner, il est bien indiqué que ce sont des viennoiseries à notre disposition à emporter - du café. Ce serait génial, mais après tout on en a dans la chambre. Nous avions une petite chambre (1706) certes mais très propre et  tarif au vu de l’emplacement vraiment correct ; au même étage vue sur le chrysler building et roof top : priceless. Nous reviendrons ! ( en réservant peut être une chambre plus grande mais vraiment on a apprécié !)

title: Misled and disappointed
text:
I booked this hotel in NYC because, besides its good location, it offered a "free continental breakfast" (as advertised on Booking.com); however, that was not true.
They offer pastries, fruits, flavored and hot water for tea, but no coffee, milk, disposable plates, or cutlery. The room music in the "breakfast" area is so loud that it seems to be done on purpose, to drive the guests away as quickly as possible. Also, the food is not replenished quickly. The person in charge of fetching pastries or fruits from the storage area was neither in a hurry to keep them available to guests nor to smile/greet the guests.
When one sees the photos in the hotel's ad, it seems that the entire building has been renovated, but the elevator cabins are old, and the room furniture has seen better days.
We arrived during the heaviest rain I've seen in NYC in years, and the gentleman at the reception desk showed no empathy to two wet guests, saying: "If there are rooms available, we'll charge $75 for the early check-in."  If we leave the baggage there after check-out, they charge $5 per piece. If they receive any online merchandise, we were told that a $7 charge per box would be charged.

title: One Star Service for a Four Star Hotel
text:
One Star Service for a Four Star Hotel
One Star Bed Matress
One Elevator out of Three in service
One Person at the Front Desk for 17 Floors
Zero Doorman
Zero Coffee or Tea Bags in the Room
Five Star Hotel Prices for a One Star Hotel

title: PÉSSIMO!!!!!
text: O Hotel é uma M. O pior no qual já fiquei. A academia sem ar condicionado funcionando, o elevador é a pior coisa da história. Primeiro, sempre cheio e com fila. Segundo, você tenta apertar o andar após colocar o cartão do quarto, mas não vai!!! Ficamos dezenas de hóspedes sem conseguir subir aos andares certos. As recepcionistas grossas. A booking FINGE que o lugar tem café da manhã, mas não tem. Veja a foto do papel que te dão logo que você chega (anexa) a essa avaliação. No "suposto" "café da manhã" (que te vendem como se estivesse incluído) não tem suco, nem café, nem M. nenhuma. NADA MESMO (o próprio Hotel diz que não tem café da manhã, mas a booking vende como se tivessem). Só água e uns snacks. NÃO É CAFÉ DA MANHÃ. A privada do banheiro quebrada (foto anexa - pulava para fora cada vez que apertávamos), quartos fedendo, sujos, velhos. Tive até alergia do cheiro de mofo dos lençóis. Dos 4 dias que ficamos, só em 2 limparam o quarto. Para piorar o que supostamente não dava para ser pior, pedi um quarto silencioso. Me deram o primeiro andar de quartos (terceiro andar o Hotel) e com janelas para a Avenida!!!!!!!! NAO DORMI NOITE NENHUMA e quando reclamei disseram que isso era um "pedido especial". PEDIR UM LUGAR SILENCIOSO É PEDIDO ESPECIAL?????????????????????? VÃO POR MIM, O HOTEL NÃO VALE NEM DE GRAÇA A VIAGEM,

title: A Room With a View
text: I had the most wonderful time staying at Hotel 57, which is fabulously located at Lexington and 57th, close to The Park. Stayed in a queen with terrace (loved it!) and it was very clean and spacious . Very attentive and helpful staff, especially Raymonf, the Concierge. A magnificent ambassador for Hotel 57 and NYC!! 😁❤👏⭐

title: Perfetto!!!!!!!! Grazie siamo stati benissimo
text: Ottimo sotto tutti i punti di vista, prezzo, pulizia, posizione, servizi, insomma noi lo abbiamo  trovato perfetto spendendo poco per una città come NY e nel punto dove ci trovavamo. Due metro vicine, quartiere bello e con tutto a portata di mano per noi e’ stato da 5 stelle.

title: Enjoyable short stay
text:
Had four nights at this city centre hotel.
First impressions very friendly welcome and swift check in. We arrived late in the evening and our room was small but clean and comfortable. We could not find any tea or coffee in our room just a coffee machine with no pods, no kettle and an empty box that had the some left over sugar in. I rang down to the desk thinking they had been forgotten and I was told that the new management had decided that no coffee to be provided or tea they could give me a kettle and some green tea, for a four star hotel I thought this was poor. The receptionist advised me to go out and purchase my own !! really at that time of night, so we managed with water from the 12floor machine, thankfully we had our own water bottles.
The free grab and go breakfast was a pleasant surprise…sadly again no coffee but for some reason milk and cream available?
All the staff are all friendly and our room was cleaned daily, the hotel is in the perfect spot for commuting. So near two entrances to the  subway
The view’s from the roof stop terrace are wonderful but not able to sit up there no tables or chairs.
We would go again possibly for its location and friendliness of the staff re think your coffee and tea policy!!

title: OK experience
text:
I had stayed in other hotels run by LuxUrban and generally I was quite happy and therefore decided on this one. Unfortunately it had the smallest room and the 3 of us with the two beds felt very cramped inside. Just be aware, if you're just there to sleep then its not a big issue but it was quite small.
Good location, clean and offered some small snacks for breakfast with a coffee and a tea. Snacks were fruits and some pastry/muffins so again be aware. Small sitting area which meant that sometimes you could not get a table and then it became just a breakfast to go.
Good location with many attractions around and places to eat, subway station was close.
Overall, OK experience.

title: Très bien
text: Bel hôtel ancien en briques. Mobilier plus ou moins moderne pas très neuf dans les chambres , mais agréable. Très bien situé pour activités à New York. Proche du métro. Et autres moyens de transport. Une terrasse au 17ème accessible à tous ( à condition d'avoir une chambre dans l'hôtel ) avec vue magnifique. La chambre double lit , grande et literie très confortable. Pas de frigo dans la chambre. Très propre. Personnel serviable et agréable. Petit déjeuner...no comment , il y a tellement de commentaires à ce sujet que je n'en dirais rien. Très bon petit déjeuner dans l'angle de l'hôtel par contre. J'en retire une belle expérience dans cet hôtel pour ma première fois à New York. Ce n'est pas deux petits désagréments qui vont me faire désaprécier cet hôtel.

title: bad
text: This hotel is scam! I made 3 reservations there for me and my family, but something went wrong and I had to cancel then. They were free cancelation and I’m still waiting for my refund for 60 days (they told me they would refund me in 30 days).

title: Refunds.
text:
Do not book this hotel with free cancellation.
My experience I booked for July 24 and then cancelled on the 28/8/2023.
They bill you and it’s a nightmare trying to get in contact to see when your refund will be on your credit card, .All you seem to get is automated replies.
I’m still waiting .

title: Poor customer service
text: Hotel 57 has a great location. The room was small but that’s not surprising for NYC. We had an early flight so we arrived at the Hotel at 10:00 am. The guy at the front desk was dealing with an unhappy person on the phone. When he finally got off the phone he pretty quickly dismissed us and told us there was no way we would be able to check in until 2-3. I knew it was a long shot to check in early, but he never asked my name to confirm the reservation and to give us a more specific check in time. The lounge was closed our entire stay, so we could not get a cup of coffee or even some cold water. No water or coffee in the room. Another person at the front desk sent us on hunt on another floor for a water dispenser without cups. Stay wasn’t horrible but the customer service was lacking and very disappointing. Would look for other hotels in the same area before I would stay here again.

title: Poca claridad de los cargos que cobran
text: Fuimos 10 días en septiembre 2023. Cuando llegamos, no nos explicaron ninguno de los servicios que ofrecía el hotel, nos dieron la tarjeta y listo. Por suerte, como habíamos leído varios foros sabiamos que había dispenser de agua ( piso 12), y consultamos porque habíamos leído que daban algo similar a un "desayuno" y nos dijeron que de 7 a 10 ofrecian algunas cosas de desayuno ( aclaro que como infusión solo había te verde, no había ninguna otra cosa). Preguntamos si tenían información para hacer excursiones, y no tenian contacto con ninguna agencia ni supieron asesorarnos a donde consultar ( nos dijeron busquen en internet). Otro punto a tener en cuenta que creo que lo aclara pero es importante considerar, es que las hab no tienen frigobar ni heladera. Por último y lo que mas nos disgustó, es que el dia que haciamos el check out quisimos dejar unas horas las valijas antes de irnos al aeropuerto, y nos dijeron que nos tenian que cobrar 5 usd por valija ( cosa que de entrada cuando llegamos las dejamos tambien hasta que nos dieran la habitacion y nos nos cobraron nada). Es la primera vez que nos pasa tanto a nosotros como a familiares y conocidos que cobren por dejar la valija unas horas el mismo dia que estas dejando el hotel. Pedi libro de quejas, y no tenían...... la gente de la recepción muy amablemente me dio el mail del gerente a quien le escribí, me respondió con mucha celeridad y segun él esto estaba aclarado cuando uno reserva ( cosa que cuando nosotros reservamos no lo decia). Y segun el gerente, lo cobran en todos los hoteles, cosa que tampoco nos paso ni a nosotros ni a ningún conocido. Por último, como nos cobraron 15 usd por las 3 valijas que dejamos en guarda, pedí una factura por los cargos que nos iban a cobrar, y aun estoy esperando que me la manden..... en síntesis, no volvería a elegir el hotel. Según los empleados de recepción, habían cambiado justo los dueños y estaban modificando algunas políticas del hotel, no se si eso tendrá que ver. Saludos

title: Many reasons to recommend this place
text:
I grew up in the city area and we found this to be a good base while visiting cousins in the city,seeing a couple of Broadway shows, and checking out old favorite restaurants.
  Regarding the 57, I liked the gym---but the AC needs fixing.
  Good laundromat nearby: "bubbles."
  There is a breakfast table set up in the morning, for which thanks---but no coffee?
   If you arrive early, leave your bags with Danny and go out and explore. 
   Turning left as you go out the front door, "the palace" restaurant has a good breakfast (diner style).
    All in all, this is a useful and competent hotel. Emwe need that morning coffee though.
     Travel safely.

title: The staff at Hotel 57 is the best!
text: The staff at Hotel57 are fantastic - absolutely the best! Whether it is the bellman Daniel or Jennifer at the Front Desk. They are friendly, helpful and always inquire about what brings me to the city. The hotel is located in a great area and I always enjoy my time there!

title: Ok, but not the best
text:
Pro’s and con’s to this hotel.
The staff are friendly and welcoming and the lobby design is cool
We had no safe in our room no tea/coffee facility. No coffee at breakfast, only green tea. Room not the cleanest (dusty phone) and the room decor is tired and in need of a refresh. No seats on rooftop area to sit out and enjoy

title: Ottimo hotel, pulito e confortevole
text:
Ottimo hotel in midtown! Lo abbiamo scelto per il prezzo e non siamo rimasti delusi. 

La camera - una normale full room - era piccola ma molto pulita. Arredamento un po’ âgé, ma vista dalla finestra impagabile (13º piano). Il bagno è dotato di ogni comfort, il letto comodissimo (con topper, Barbieri docet).

L’hotel ha un rooftop visitabile a tutte le ore, ma con silent hours nelle ore notturne: peccato non ci tengano nessun tavolino, più di una sera abbiamo cenato lassù da asporto!

La colazione si consuma in una stanza molto bella dietro la hall; non è continentale ma molto contenuta e il caffè va preso da Starbucks di fronte. La colazione offerta consiste in qualche frutto, muffin e croissant, con acqua e tè dal bollitore. Considerando che a NY non si trova molto spesso, è stato apprezzabile anche solo avere quello spazio dove portare l’asporto di Starbucks da consumare con calma.

Lo staff è molto gentile e a disposizione. Non ci sono più tariffe obbligatorie (menzionate in altre recensioni), l’hotel stesso mi aveva confermato via mail che ora il prezzo definitivo è quello pagato al momento della prenotazione (per ogni info la reception risponde molto velocemente alle mail).

L’hotel si trova a pochi minuti da due fermate metro mentre e si può raggiungere agevolmente a piedi la 5th Ave, Central Park e Times Square. 

Ottima esperienza nel complesso, ci tornerei se volessi stare a midtown!

title: There’s good and bad
text:
The location is good. The price is good. The staff are friendly. 

The elevators are old and barely functional 

There was a train in my room pretending to be an air conditioner. It was that loud. 

So, if they renovated, the hotel could be superb. As it is, it’s so-so.

title: Good room, good value
text:
If you need a good room at a value price, Hotel 57 is a good choice. The 4/5/6 subway is a couple of blocks away making a trip downtown or to the upper east side easy. 

If you’re looking for a full service hotel, the 57 is not your choice - no restaurant, no bar.

title: a very good hotel stay
text:
Our room given to us by Miss Yuko was one of the best with balcony and ample space. Even though not on the website there was a coffee maker and tea available in the room. The server, Erdal from 
Azerbaycan took us to our native language with much friendliness. I made a good choice with this hotel, transportation to the train station, to the restaurants I wanted to go was very convenient. Overall a very good NYC trip. Causation for NYC for further travelers, usually in the summer on weekends, Saturdays, there are bike days in Manhattan, closing the whole Park Avenue. Try to make your travel day besides Saturdays. Thank you.

title: ALWAYS A NICE TIME AT HOTEL  57
text:
VERY NICE SERVICE - GOOD AIR CONDITIONING-  I NOTICED THERE ARE A FEW MORE TV CHANNELS WHICH IS GREAT! 

I WISH THE WAS A SOAP DISPENSER BY THE SINK.  THE SOAP IS SO SMALL AND NO WHERE TO PUT IT.

I THINK YOU SHOULD STEAM CLEAN THE SHOWERS AS I NOTICED MOLD AND MILDEW BUILD.  THE MINI FRIDGE BY REQUEST IS GOOD.

I WISH YOU SERVED BUTTER AND JAM WITH MORNING BREAKFAST ITEMS.  THEY CAN BE DRY JUST EATING PLAIN. SOME COLD PEACHES OR SMALL WRAPPED CHERRIES WOULD BE NICE.

YOU SHOULD MAKE A DEAL WITH DUNKIN DONUTS NEXT DOOR TO SUPPLY FRESH DONUTS EACH MORNING.

THE STAFF IS VERY NICE,  I LIKE THE HOUSEKEEPERS, DANNY AND DANIEL.

THANK YOU

title: Ottima struttura!
text:
Siamo stati in viaggio di nozze in questo Hotel per 7 notti, senza trattamento colazione, anche se era incluso nel soggiorno un buffet nella lobby dell’hotel con muffin di vari gusti, mini croissant e il classico american coffee.
King Room, ottima metratura, completa di tutti i servizi necessari (frigobar assente), moderna, pulita e ordinata.
Personale estremamente cordiale e gentile, dai facchini ai receptionist.
Posizione dell’hotel perfetta, 10 minuti a piedi da Central Park, a pochi passi da Tiffany e grandi marchi.
Ci torneremo sicuramente!

title: Let op 50 dollar per nacht aan resort fee bovenop alle andere kosten
text: De lokatie in New York is uitstekend maar het hotel is niet eerlijk. Wij hadden 5 dagen geboekt via booking.com. Dit was duidelijk inclusief alle belastingen en toeslagen. Er zouden geen extra kosten meer bijkomen. Toch schreef het hotel een ‘resort fee’ van 50 dollar per nacht af van onze credit card. Ze weigerden dit terug te betalen. Dit noem ik oplichting.

title: Terrible stay
text: My daughter lives just up the block on 57th and I have stayed at this hotel for many many years through all the changes. When I arrived the sidewalk was littered with trash and there was a homeless man at the door adjacent to the hotel. I requested a tub prior to arrival but did not get one. I requested an upgrade but did not get one. My room backed up to the elevator which would have been nice to know. When I left I showed the sign you have in the elevator to the girl @ the desk: " We have quiet hours 11:00pm to 7:00am (daily)* During the tine the hotel respectfully request all hotel occupants to keep noise to a minimum, ion order to allow our guests a restful sleep..." Her response was that this was the room I booked. So  disappointing. Will not stay with you again.

title: Don’t bother with breakfast!
text:
The front of house staff were great. Especially the door men. 
The room was clean. 
Breakfast was an utter disaster. 
I understand it’s a grab & go, but there were no plates or serviettes. We had to wait ages for the pastries to be filled up. There’s no coffee only tea & green tea. The man & lady who do breakfast were miserable and unhelpful. 
On our last day we had to walk out. 
There was nothing to eat only fruit and green tea only! What a joke!! 
I would not come back to this hotel. 
Either stop doing breakfast or sort it out is my advice

title: “Great safe location, comfortable accommodations, WONDERFUL staff!”
text: Enjoyable stay at this pleasant boutique hotel conveniently located near SEVERAL NYC bus & subway stations, and within walking distance to The Plaza Central Park area, Rockefeller Center/Radio City Music Hall & 5th Ave. stores. Neat, clean decent sized rooms for NYC with nice upgraded bathrooms. Rooftop patio had cool views, but no patio furniture. Lovely breakfast grab & go or stay breakfast area with pastries & fruit- impressive coffee/expresso machine- being a tea drinker was happy it was available to! Staff goes above and beyond to assist in making your stay absolutely wonderful! Shout outs to: Raymond, Elizabeth, Jeremiah, Danny Macado, Eloar, & the young ? Asian decent male (didn’t catch his name) who assisted with our baggage holds on 6/23  AM check out

title: Central location
text: Great place rooms were bigger than I thought. Breakfast was a joke no plates or napkins and one of the customers told me it was a good day you got coffee there usually isn't any. It was centrally located to everything.

title: Esperienza da non ripetere.
text: L’unica cosa positiva è la posizione…per il resto non è consigliabile!Colazione scarsa e senza la possibilità di prendere il caffè che non viene servito…pulizia della camera mediocre e personale della reception poco cordiale!

title: Io non lo consiglio
text:
Albergo datato le foto non sono attuali ma di molti anni fa! L’albergo ha più di 100 anni mi hanno detto!!!  
Poi…………. La colazione……..inesistente , pessima , senza caffè, senza cose da mangiare( le portano contate), senza i TOVAGLIOLI E PIATTI!!!!!!!🤦🏻
Senza acqua calda per il thè.
Le due persone li anche molto scocciate quando chiedi qualcosa.
Tutto questo non per un giorno, la stessa scena si è ripetuta per 4 mattine di seguito. 
L’ultima mattina ho chiesto i tovaglioli e la cameriera alla terza richiesta ne li ha portati e mi ha detto che quelli li aveva portati lei da casa!!!!!!!
Aiutooooooooo 
Tutto molto anziano

title: Location good rooms petite lovely staff
text:
Great location central to most attractions. Bloomingdale’s is across the road and subway just past it. 
Breakfast was disappointing. However if you have a sweet tooth it would be perfect cakes muffins and tarts. Some fruit oranges apples pears and banana. Staff were very helpful .

title: Hotel room/amenities are good and staff are friendly; billing/reimbursement transparency is not so great
text: Chose a flexible reservation and had to cancel the third night of a three night stay (prior to checking in). Invoice from hotel indicated I was due a reimbursement greater than what I actually received: was not reimbursed the taxes/fees associated with the third night, only the room rate. Also had an extra charge on my credit card for what I have learned from another Trip Advisor comment to be an obligatory internet/gym/breakfast charge. This is NOT reflected in the quote provided. Hotel is actually pretty good - great location. Just wish I received a response to my written inquiry on the charges/invoice differential.

title: Great NYC hotel.
text: This is a very nice hotel.  We’d never stayed here as we usually stay on the west side.  It’s small, clean, great location.  We didn’t use much of the amenities as it was a short stay, but, honestly the thing that stuck out was the friendly staff. Not super common in a NYC hotel.  As an example when I returned with my hands full from grabbing some Dunkin, right next door, always a plus, the doorman, bell attendant helped me to enable the security feature so I could push the button without dropping stuff or putting it down. I didn’t as for help, he just came!  That really stuck out. The person who checked us in also accommodating.I’d recommend and definitely would return.

title: localização ok mas não otima, faltam opções de alimentação boas
text:
hotel antigo, precisa de manutençao, colchão ruim, café da manhã pessimo
não recomendo- quarto muito pequeno, banheiro ruim, metro a 2 quadras, fotos não correspondem à realidade
pessoal da recepção não sabe informar nada

title: Awful
text:
This hotel is really poor.  We stayed for 3 nights prior to a Cunard cruise.  The room overlooked a construction site for a new skyscraper, and noisy work started at 6am every morning.  They are at the foundation/basement level so this is likely to go on for many months.  Yet there is a full charge for the room, and NO warning on their web site. The reception staff could only say "nothing we can do about that" !!!!!!! 
The reception staff were terrible; it took 20 minutes to book us in, yet we had paid in advance and they had all our details.  Grumpy and unhelpful at all times, yet the concierge staff were brilliant, helpful and friendly.  
The hotel charge $40 per day extra for "facilities" yet we used none of them, and incorrectly charged us (actually they charged us twice, both times for the incorrect amount) and we are still waiting to hear from them.  
Just awful.

title: Bad experience.
text: Bad and expensive hotel. Room was very old and dark, with small windows next to a noisy construction on 56th street. Nobody came to clean the room on Sunday. I ordered three books from Amazon and they charged $ 7.50 for each package!!!. Personnel in the lobby was very mean. INo way to come back.

title: Wonderful Stay at Hotel57
text: Wonderful staff, super nice and helpful! I booked this hotel for a mother-daughter weekend and my mom definitely loved it! The location is perfect for shopping at 5th avenue stores and walking to Central Park.

title: Check in/billing concerns but property itself was nice
text: Still trying to resolve my billing.  Arrived at 4:15 to check  in but room was NOT ready.  Advised i would get a credit.  instead i show an extra billing.  Still waiting on emailed invoice from our checkout

title: Hotel 57 is the way to see NYC
text: The staff here are fabulous. Once you get over ‘superior queen size room’ doesn’t actually mean that, this is New York after all, settle in and enjoy. William on the front desk is the most professional individual and Dennis couldn’t have been more helpful. The room is spotlessly clean, nice bathroom and comfy bed. The air con is deafening so put it on while you’re out and it’ll be cool when you get back. Water on 12th, outside view on 17th and walk up 57th towards 5th Avenue and you’re at Tiffany’s and the Park. Perfectly placed to see everything. The staff couldn’t be nicer and the whole place has a chilled and friendly vibe.

title: Noisy pipes 13th floor
text: Well located and clean. The room is dated and bed and pillows are very small. It’s OK for one night but our room was extremely noisy - there’s a constant noise of something that resembles water moving through pipes that is very loud - I had to turn the AC fan on (white noise) to block out this noise and be able to sleep.

title: Perfect location!
text: I booked 1 night as a last minute travel change, and I was surprised at how much I loved this hotel. Every staff member I interacted with was super friendly and the location can’t be beat! 2 blocks from the Subway on Lexington, 5 minute walk to Central Park. The room was small, but comfortable considering the location is the key. Overall, I would stay again!

title: Outdated..
text: First off the positive, we were able to check in little earlier since they had a room available. The front desk service was very friendly and attentive. Bathroom looks like the only part that was somehow updated and the water pressure was amazing. The rest of the room was just soooooo old, the wood panels are coming apart on edges and the carpet is just very, very old looking. Next morning I checked out their breakfast room downstairs and was very impressed with the espresso maker. I love me some good quality espresso in the morning. It was accompanied with with complimentary fruit and muffins. We stayed only for 1 night, which is good because it sounds like they are in the middle of renovations that stared at 8AM. But I guess it has to be done, just not on my dime.

title: Last minute trip
text:
Had to do a last minute trip to NYC. Got room on same day we left. The woman that checked us in was very nice! I also noticed that another front desk personnel saw me standing and offered to check me in, not realizing I was being taken care of. I loved to see the helpfulness. 
The room was nice. Did not hear any outside noise, unlike the last hotel I stayed at in NYC, 
The front desk that checked us in gave us dinner recommendations. Very helpful. The gentlemen that stashed our bags on check out day, was great!! Great sense of humor, funny guy. Valet parking was easy. The top floor look out was so cool. The free breakfast was nice. Would stay here again if I need to be in NYC again.

title: Awesome hotel In the  Big 🍎 apple
text:
Amazing !  5 stars. The hotel is in a great and safe location. Room are upgraded and the bed is comfy. Truly enjoyed the delicious  European pastries (yummy)for breakfasts and fresh fruit with tasty ☕ coffee. I had an awesome time being back 
 in my sweet birth home town after 20 years. I love NY....!!!. 👍☺️

title: NYC overnight
text:
