All staff with which we interacted were very pleasant and kind. Our checkin went smoothly and was nice after a very long day. An individual in the breakfast area was very helpful and kindly took an extra step when he realized I was confused as to where to get hot water for tea. The individuals staffed to the luggage room were efficient and friendly. Staff we ran into in the hallways were all pleasant.

Conveniently located close to transit.

title: Great walkable spot for a safe stay in Manhattan.  Extremely happy that I chose Hotel 57.
text:
Had a wonderful 4 nite stay at Hotel 57.  I was nervous about choosing a hotel as I hadn't been to New York for twenty years and I am an older female.  I picked Hotel 57 because of the mid-town location and other reviews.  Plus Hotel 57 offered special deals on their website.  I ended up taking an upgrade from a superior to a superior suite. The room was clean, spacious with big closets, and very quiet despite the fact I looked out at 57th street and Lexington.  Good coffeemaker and mini-fridge in the room. The room also had a safe  and  I could adjust the temperature in the room.  The bed was very comfy and plush.  The elevators were super fast and the breakfast was okay ( coffee, fruit, pastries).
The staff was friendly and I always felt safe.  It was very easy to take off walking to the many nearby sights or to catch the train.  It was also easy to grab Ubers in front of the hotel.  Many shops within a block to buy water, wine, snacks.

title: Family Trip
text:
Nous avons apprécié le calme et le charme de cet hôtel, très bien situé.
Le personnel est aimable, le salon détente agréable.
Le centre fitness parfait.
A recommander pour un séjour appréciable sur New York.

title: Det er fint å bo på 57
text: Hyggelig og rent hotel med plettfri beliggenhet om du har business på Manhattan. Stort rom, stor seng, god dyne, god service, masse skapplass. Fin pris med dagens elendige  kronekurs. Har du glemt støpselkonverter, fortvil ikke, alt er på rommet pluss usb- uttak. Frokosten er ikke frokost, men snack, så den kjøper du feks på dineren next door. Eller rusler opp til ikoniske Broklyn Diner. Vennlig betjening på hotellet.

title: Great place to stay
text: Hotel 57 was a gem. Although it’s old it’s updated well. It’s very close to central park, if you wanted to walk there. All of the staff were super friendly and accommodating. There’s a lounge area or you can order drinks in the afternoon and get breakfast in the morning. I had a great stay and I would definitely come back.

title: Best location and happy service
text: If you're doing any work in Manhattan, I recommend this hotel.It is 2 blocks away from the express Subway at 59th and Lexington. It took only 20 minutes to get to Wall Street.It is also near a lot of shops and great restaurants as well as an easy walk to Lincoln Center.I found the staff very friendly and helpful.The rooms are clean and the bed is firm just as i like it. I was able to take care of my business in the morning and then enjoy my other few days at Hotel 57.

title: Great location & Great staff
text:
This was the first time was stayed here but as we knew the area, though we would try it out. Upon arrival, staff were extremely helpful & professional. Nice clean hotel & even though our room over looked a construction site, the room was clean & building work started when we were not in the room as we were enjoying the city. 
Basic tea & coffee set up in the room, fresh towels & normal basic US TV stations. We weren’t there to enjoy the room so there were no complaints about the basic set up. Bathroom was very clean with great water pressure for the shower. Air conditioning was controlled by the panel & worked perfectly. We didn’t try their breakfast as we’ve always was the local diners & The Morning Star Cafe around the corner was perfect. 
The gentleman who handle the bag storage are fantastic. They also asked when our flight was so & organised a taxi for us as the yellow cabs have a set rate for JFK & Uber worked out more expensive. 
Would highly recommend staying here & we would definitely look to book again. 
We are still waiting for our deposit to be returned & will email the hotel soon.

title: Can't beat the location.
text:
We just spent 4 nights in Hotel 57 in NYC as our last leg of our US trip.
Thumb up:
1. Location - absolutely fantastic. Hardly used the subway, so easy to walk anywhere (weather was on our side). Brilliant
2. View - we were on the top floor. While not quite suitable for my fear of heights, the view was fantastic and a nice spot to sit with a beer after walking around town the whole day.
3. Daniel from concierge - lovely guy, very helpful and always smiling. Thanks buddy. 
4. Also the team member who helped us set the sofa bed on the first night, sorry for not getting your name but you made us feel straight at home. Thank you.

What could be done to improve:
1. Bar staff - could show more compassion and respect to the young generation. When a child is getting herself a glass of water, it is advised not to mutter how glass and ice usage are only for paying customers (btw - we were). This was already discussed with the relevant team at the hotel and am certain it was handled correctly by them.
2. Bar in general, would have been nice if it was open every night but I guess this is based on experience and actual usage of the bar.
3. Sofa bed - looks fantastic as a sofa but quite hard as a sofa bed, even for a young child.

Overall, would recommend this hotel, for its location most of all.

title: Very Minimalistic Hotel
text: Hotel 57  was well-located for our activities. It was clean, neat, and the customer service and security for getting to the floors was good. However, the room was minimalistic. The bed was too hard. The room lacked draws for clothing. There was no in-room refrigerator, nor was there the ability to obtain any bottled water or ice without leaving the hotel. The bathtub was slippery and could have caused a fall. We will probably stay elsewhere next time.

title: Renovations stopped at the lobby…
text:
Described as a “boutique” hotel, however it appears more old fashioned & run down. 
The lobby decor is nice but after that it looks like it hasn’t been touched since the 90s. 
On check in we were hit with an extra charge of $400 for the 5 nights stay, to “cover” WiFi, use of the gym, business centre, & coffee in the morning. This was compulsory even though we did not want to use any of these facilities. There was no mention of this extra charge on booking!! 
The room was as spacious as expected for NYC, but very dark with 2 small windows and the only lighting a bedside lamp & wall lamp. 
Good wardrobe space with a full length mirror. The only other mirror was in the bathroom which was again old fashioned with an over bath shower which was not adjustable. The sink filled with water as you washed your hands. 
Very noisy air con unit in one corner of the room so couldn’t be left on at nighttime or you would get no sleep. 
No mini fridge or water supplied in room. 
The decor & facilities definitely need upgraded to match the 4* status!

title: EXCELLENT Hospitality and accomodations!
text:
Stayed here for a friend's birthday weekend trip in April. I booked through a third party and the booking was meant to be for a room with two beds, however, the third party defaulted to a room with a single bed.

While the third party was useless in helping me, Michele and Nancy at the hotel really helped me out in a situation that could have ruined the entire weekend. They were able to acomodate me and my friends. The housekeepers we encountered were very approachable and welcoming and our room was always serviced with fresh towels etc. 

The rooms themselves are very clean, well kept and comfortable! The penthouse also allows you to have a nice selfie moment with friends. I will go out of my way to come back here simply for the reason that I truly felt the staff cared about me and my experience here. Everyone here was a pleasure.

title: Sorpresa súper agradable!!!
text:
Publique mi review en inglés y como no lo veo va en español.
Escapada de 3 noches a NYC con mi hijo de 34 años.
Pasamos bárbaro!!! El personal espectacular, la ubicación y la vista desde la habitación buenísimas.
En el correr de nuestra estadía tratamos con Elizabeth, Yuko, Maria de Polonia (piso 15) y Milagros, nos facilitaron y resolvieron absolutamente todo.
Los bellmen cordiales y serviciales siempre. 
El desayuno correcto y practico, no sabíamos que estaba incluido. 
El hotel colmó ampliamente nuestras expectativas, no dudamos en volver y recomendarlo.
Eduardo y Rodrigo S.

title: Great place for your NYC (H)OliDays
text: Clean, friendly, big rooms! Close to Central Park, Smith and Wollensky Steakhouse, subway just around the corner and on 57th Street a great get away to 5th Avenue - in my eyes a great hotel at a superb location!

title: Perfect location for Midtown Adventures!
text:
From the moment we checked in til the moment we hopped into a cab for Penn Station, all the staff at Hotel 57 offered a warm welcome and were of true service every moment in between. Our room was clean and quiet. And the location was perfect walking distance to Central Park, MOMA, Lincoln Center, Time Square, and great food and shopping all around! We'll definitely be back!

Hotel highlightsQuiet · Great value
RoomsClean and beds and linen were super comfortable.
Nearby activitiesLocation was perfect to Broadway, restaurants, shopping.
SafetyFelt safe and secure. Especially with needing room key to operate elevator.
WalkabilityDefinitely walkable to many of Midtowns great sites!
Noteworthy detailsStaff was warm, friendly, and so happy to serve and accommodate.

title: This is a great place to stay in mid town.
text: Hotel is an excellent location. You are greeted with top-notch music in the lobby all day long with super family and accommodating staff. The room was ample with great lighting and comfortable bed. Comfy comforter. The shower was delicious- in deep set tub, great water pressure. If you have a difficult time climbing just be aware that the tub edge is high to get in.

title: Fine hotel with great location and breakfast.
text: Clean room, comfortable bed, clean bathroom.  Breakfast downstairs.  Bar is open in the evenings but without any food.  Courteous desk staff.  I felt safe and that the staff wanted to be as accommodating as possible.

title: Not a 4-Star Hotel
text: Facilities and room decor are outdated. There was no hot water in the shower. I had to take cold showers on a freezing cold day in new york.  In addition, don't be misguided by the photos of the rooftop space. There is no rooftop bar or restaurant at the hotel. It was only a rooftop with no chairs or tables.  Finally, the hotel doesn't offer slippers, water or any other basic things you'd expect a 4-star hotel would provide.  I'd rate this place an overpriced 3-star hotel. Would not recommend and definitely not going to return.

title: Excellent boutique-y hotel at 57th and Lex
text: Raymond at the front desk is like a personal concierge. Always ready with recommendations, directions and a welcoming personality. Room with two double beds was large for a NYC hotel, quiet and all staff were very accommodating. Definitely A+

title: Great location in a clean and comfortable hotel
text: We had a great stay. Surprisingly quiet. My big gripe is that the advertised price of the hotel is not yhe real price. They charged $40 a night extra for a service charge, which apparently covered things like wi-fi and the gym! That added 15% to the charge.

title: Hidden costs
text:
While hotel stay itself was ok, at the time of check out I was charged for "facility fees" (40 USD per day). The receptionist explained to me that, at the time of check in, I had apparently signed a paper agreeing to this. 

This may be the case, but no one ever informed me what these facility fees would include (and these then should be optional). Plus, if you make someone signing papers after 13 hours of travelling over 7 time zones, it may happen that they will not read "fine print".  Very unpleasant experience at the end of the trip.

title: Overcharging on the credit card
text: This hotel has charged my card 2 since I checked out. Only charge that should have came off is the $100 deposit for 2 rooms. They also charged me for a reservation that was canceled due to Covid. The service could have been better.

title: Great Location
text:
Clean, friendly, lovely lobby, elevators work great, expect small rooms (its NYC y'all) 
The coffee was delicious.  I highly recommend visiting the patio on the 14th floor. 
The beds are a double bed, two people sleep comfortably.

title: Great service, rooms and location
text: Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and very clean, the whole staff is very kind and attentive, service oriented. Location of Hotel 57 is ideal for upper mid-Manhattan stay, bus and subway very close and all kinds of shops nearby.

title: Elevator Noise in room
text: I stayed at the 1107 suite and could not sleep for the 2 nights I was there. I thought it was the people upstairs and called the lobby twice the second night out of desperation… inly to be told it was probably the elevators. Unfortunately, if it’s the elevators then there id not much that can be done apart from just NOT booking the room. The noise sounded like someone was building something and it happened every time someone ordered the elevator. These rooms behind the elevator should simply not be booked or be soundproofed because it is no way to sleep!

title: Hotel 57, great service!
text:
The hotel is situated in the best of all avenues and districts.  The rooms are comfortable, however the air conditioners are noisy.  There are building works next to the hotel, which is rather noisy during the day.  The breakfast is very poor.  The quality of the croissants is not the best.  I suggest bagels and cream cheese rather than the dried out pastries.  the coffee was good. A nice touch to have coffee available in the lobby from early morning.  A fabulous coffee/expresso/cappuccino in the breakfast lounge.  
Overall, the experience was good.

title: Coming back again and again for the staff alone!
text: I'm from the West Coast and this was my first trip to the big city, alone! No offense to East Coasters, but most of my interactions did not provide any comfort to the fact that I was alone in a new city. My first interaction being yelled at by my cab driver on the way to the hotel... But upon arriving at Hotel 57, I felt hopeful again. Raymond's warm presence made me feel so much better! He was very helpful from the moment I stepped in. He knew it was my first time and that I was traveling alone so he made extra efforts to make me feel welcomed and well accommodated. He gave me a nice room so I can have a view. He even gave me a call to let me know where to go and to remind me to be careful, being alone in NYC. It was so nice to know that there was someone like him looking out for me while I tackle the big city for the first time. The amazing hospitality wasn't limited to Raymond. The rest of the staff was so welcoming and checked up on me the whole time. I may have done a solo trip, but I definitely did not feel solo, in the best way possible. I cannot wait to come back and come to this hotel every time :)

title: Great Room Great Staff
text: Pleasantly surprised with both the room and staff.  The room was spacious, loved the soaking tub. Friendly and attentive staff. Can’t beat the location. One other plus you might not think about unless you stay at a lot of NYC hotels is , the elevators are fast!

title: Clean but rooms are a bit dated looking
text: Very clean hotel, prompt service and easy check in / check out procedure. The housekeeping was excellent, providing anything we asked for anytime without any hassle at all, extra pillows and towels made our stay so much nicer.

title: Great location, excellent team!
text:
Only con is that the room is quite small.
Other than that everything is perfect: location, staff, design, overall cleanness and even a surprising  grab and go breakfast!!
Will definitely go back again!

title: Good, but a bit pricey
text:
PRICE is a bit steep for what you receive. You pay for a facility fee at the end of the stay in addition to the room. We got a cheaper, and we think, better hotel downtown. 

LOCATION is excellent close to 5th Avenue etc., but a bit noisy with the traffic right outside the hotel. Luckily, it usually became quieter at night.

BREAKFAST consisted mainly of pastries and some fruit. It was difficult to eat healthy here for breakfast. 

STAFF were nice. 

ROOMS were big, but could use a bit refurbishment. Would have loved if they had a fridge in the room.

title: Last minute hotel had everything we needed
text: My husband and I had to find a last minute hotel in the Midtown East area of New York. The majority of the places were over budget but then I discovered Hotel 57. I almost passed up on it because we went to the room with a mini fridge and it was not listed under amenities. We bought the king junior suite and were surprised at how large the room was - especially for New York standards. The bed was incredibly comfy. The room was spotless. And we had a mini fridge! (It’s the small things that count.) I was able to get a robe on request which as my husband pointed out, was nicer than my robe at home. Continental breakfast was exactly that - no more, no less. (I saw reviews complaining about there only being pastries, fruit, and coffee which really had me shaking my head at. That literally is the typical continental breakfast. This saved me from going out and buying a crossiant and coffee. The location of the hotel was another big bonus. Everywhere we needed to go was less than 15 minutes to walk to. My husband and I already decided, when we return to Manhattan, we definitely will stay here again.

title: Back in the city!
text: What a fabulous hotel! For the price, its hands down the best in the city! We had two different queen rooms and both were amazing! My room was huge and folks...it had THREE windows! Huge amounts of storage in each room, and they provided me with a mini fridge just for asking! The shower was lovely, only the shower floor got a bit slippery withe the shampoo and stuff but just put a towel down for traction, theres plenty of room in there! The bed was like a cloud, and everything was super clean! The staff was so nice and we just loved everything here! And then...the rooftop! Some incredible views of the city, and of the Chrysler Building, we did some fun photo shoots up there and soaked in the lights and energy. The only thing lacking is that they haven't put seating or tables back out there yet, post Pandy. Even spaced out, a few small tables and chairs up there would be so nice! Can't wait to come back!

title: Great little find
text: I was looking for a good, not to expensive hotel on the East Side as this year’s ISPA Congress was being held at Hunter College. This was an incredible price for NYC and for such a nice accommodations. Continental breakfast was a nice treat.

title: Hotel with helpful staffs
text:
All of the staffs were helpful and friendly.Location is perfect.Nearby to everythin,supermarket,restaurant,pharmacy,shops..Value for money….
Will surely come back here for my next New York trip……Thank you

title: Skip this place.
text: Do not stay here. The check in staff hate you if you use Hotel Tonight and are not happy to see you. The standard rooms are smaller than most rooms in Europe. Bellmen are nice though. Third party vendors such as Expedia should be ashamed that they are doing business with these clowns because the rooms advertised online look completely different.

title: Don't book here! Great location, but everything else is mediocre, and management isn't intereted in hospitality.
text: We stayed for 3 night in a regular King room. The room is pretty small, which we expected. Everything is clean. The problem with the hotel is there are no public areas in which to sit and relax when not in the room. No restaurant, no bar, barely a lobby. The doorman was never able to get us a cab, something we expect while in NYC. We had stayed at this hotel a few years before when it was a Renaissance, and we remembered it being much nicer, with better use of public space. When we were waiting for our cab to the airport (which the doorman couldn't get for us, despite promising he would) there was no where to sit in the lobby. There is quite a large room used for breakfast, and so we went and sat in there. A woman, apparently a manager came in and said we couldn't sit in there, because that room is used to store luggage. Can you imagine, the luggage is more important than the guests comfort? Pretty insulting. We had to get up and move, while they arranged some uncomfortable chairs for us to sit in the draft of the doorway. Just miserable. The whole exprience was not very hospitable, so we won't be back and will warn anyone we can not to ever book at Hotel 57.

title: Terrible experience, inadequate bedding
text: We paid over $400 for a junior suite to accommodate our 4 person family. There was a king sized bed and a grubby sofa/futon. We had to ASK them to make up the futon for a bed - I wonder how they thought that 4 people would be able to sleep in a room with only a king bed. They came with a skimpy sheet, a skimpy blanket and 1 pillow. It is December, cold, and there was cold air blowing on my kids from the “heating” system. It took multiple requests to get a second pillow, and to get another skimpy blanket. They refused to provide anything else, except for a skimpy duvet cover, but no comforter.. The operations person I spoke to was rude. Additonally, this hotel bills itself as 4 stars - I would say it is closer to 1 star. I do NOT recommend this hotel and would NOT stay here again.

title: Hotel near Central Park
text: I brought my 80-year-old Mom to NYC to see the Rockettes for her birthday. The location of this hotel could not have been better. Away from the noise of Radio City/Times Square but close enough to walk to everything. Less than 10 minutes to Central Park. The subway stop is a short walk away and the bus stop is just outside the hotel. We had a spacious Jr King Suite and the beds were very comfy! The bathroom had a large shower and was also very spacious. Great staff, special shout out to Eldar who made up our extra bed at night and ensured we had everything we needed during our stay, always with a welcoming smile! The complimentary continental breakfast had delicious pastries, fresh fruit, water with orange slices, tea and coffee. Bonus was the terrace on the 17th floor with great views of the Chrysler building and downtown Manhattan. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay here.

title: Nice hotel, in less busy part of town
text: Hotel 57 is beautiful. We were lucky to get a corner room-1401, and it was very spacious! I picked this hotel for the local and the few of the city. It is only a few blocks away from 5th Avenue and very close to two subway stations for easy transportation. It was in a very nice part of the city and I was surprised at how quite it was. I do think they could do a few things better like add refrigerators and put a few bottles of water in the room. It was very close to several coffee shops, pizza shops, etc so it was easy to get food and bring it back to the hotel. Someone mentioned there is not a sign on the building, but there is. It was not hard to locate. There was a man who checked us in that asked about our trip and recommended several things for us to do and eat based on our interests which was a nice touch. The breakfast at the hotel itself was not much, but I was in NYC and really wanting to eat out anyways. Liberty bagels is nearby and the place is amazing. There is a nice rooftop terrace that gives beautiful views of the city, but I wish there were chairs on it to sit and enjoy the view.

title: Recent NYC visit
text: We stayed this past weekend wasn't impressed. First there is no sign outside showing the name of the hotel. The temp gauge in  room is 2 feet from the floor so you have to bend down to see it it didn't light up so you couldn't see what the temp was_ in 50 plus years of travelling have never seen this. No restaurant no store to buy anything_ morning coffee room offerings were very limited front desk staff were hit and miss could use some customer service training uncomfortable chairs in room other then all that was great. $700 A night? never again

title: Worst Hotel experience Ever
text:
If you want to spend a good time in NYC, run away from this place ! They charge Palace prices (more than 400$ per night !) but you get no service AT ALL, not even a bottle of water in the rooms, and you have to ask your 2nd towel for your bedroom.

Cherry on the cake, they charge you an extra 45$ per day (!) to use the Wi-Fi and other facilities we never used and were never asked to use.

This is called robbery and I swear we didn’t ask for much. To make it short: we got completely screwed.

title: Emplacement super mais hôtel à fuir!!!
text:
Le seul point positif de cet hôtel est son emplacement 
Les chambres sont très petites , pas de service ( pas même une bouteille d eau dans la chambre , pas d adaptateur pour les prises ) et on doit réclamer pour le changement des serviettes de bain.
La seule personne agréable est le « portier » un monsieur agréable et super souriant .
Excepté lui, tout le personnel est extrêmement désagréable et dédaigneux!
La chambre est hors de prix pour ce type de prestation et cerise sur le gâteau lors de votre départ ils vous chargent plus de 40 dollars par nuit pour l utilisation du wifi!
Un comble !! Personne ne vous prévient à l arrivée et on vous balance la facture au moment du départ 
Une honte!!!
A fuir …

title: My first stay in midtown Manhattan
text: It's my 6th trip to New York but this is the first time for me to stay in a hotel within the heart of the city. My cousin's husband booked me at the Hotel 57, formerly known as the Renaissance . I arrived in New York on the 6th of November just in time for the New York marathon. So I had to  avoid going into the city avoid the event. My cousin drove me to the hotel after staying in my cousins place in Teaneck, New Jersey. I didn't really get to see the hotel facade as it was late already when I checked in, also jet lag was kicking in from my long trip over to the US. I feel right asleep when I entered my room as I was dead tired from the trip. The next morning I woke up, had a quick shower and proceeded to have a light breakfast of bread, coffee and a banana. After which I went out to explore the streets to see what shops and food joints are near the hotel. The hotel in not new, but it has a certain character that I feel makes you feel the  real New York vibe. My two days stay in the hotel made me feel like I was a native New Yorker even for a brief moment. I would  definitely want to stay in the hotel a bit longer on my next trip to the big apple.

title: Excellent boutique hot
text: NYC hotel rooms are notorious for being soo tiny, but this one was a well-thought out space with fabulous storage! Entire room and beautiful bathroom squeaky clean. Bed comfy with really nice linens.  Location excellent; we walked everywhere. Highly recommend Hotel 57 and will stay again next trip to the Big Apple

title: Great Hotel in New York
text:
The staff are extremely helpful and friendly.
Great place to stay.  The room was always cleaned and well serviced.
A wee bit of a walk from the action at Time Square but well worth the walk to see the surrounding area

title: It’ horrible room
text: The hotel reserves the rooms in the photos on the site only for those who book directly from the hotel site, for others it is a scam, they put you in horrible rooms that vaguely resemble what you booked!  The staff cares, I won't be going back.

title: Systems Down and then a nightmare of an experience
text:
Let's just say the staff idea of customer service is deal with it and upper management support those ideals as well. 

Look else where, especially if your coming for to visit with family cause if anyone in your party runs into a problem they no doubtly will leave a bad taste for all parties

title: First timer in NY
text:
We stayed on the 14 floor. Room no 1416 with a good view. Spacious room. The hotel itself very clean. If you are a first timer in NY the location is good too

But there is one BUT. They say there is a continental breakfast included. Thank God there is a good restaurant next door to the hotel, as all they offered were apples, oranges and muffins. Nothing else.

title: No place to sit
text:
The Hotel 57 was a severe disappointment.  With tiny rooms, blocked public areas, and outrageous charges, it is unlikely we’d ever stay here again.

Rooms -- The rooms were not nearly as shown on the website.  Our room, one of the few with a terrace, was substantially smaller than the terrace room shown on the website.  The website showed multiple flat surfaces (vital for travelers.)  Our had only a small desk.  No other accessible flat surfaces.  The only storage drawers were three tiny drawers in the nightstands.  Lighting was inadequate or non-existent except in the bathroom.  Windows were inadequately insulated, so, even up at the 15th floor, we were awakened by sirens at all times of the night.  There was only one chair, at the desk.  With two people, one had to sit on the bed.  While the room was adequate for sleeping, it was totally inadequate for spending much waking time.

Public Area -- With such minimal furnishing in the rooms, you would think they would provide public areas to relax and congregate.  There were two small seating areas, holding perhaps 6 people total, in the lobby.  There was also a lounge that could accommodate 20-30 people, and did so for continental breakfast until 11AM. However, access to the lounge was blocked all afternoons, and most evenings.  This area should have remained accessible to guests at all times.

Value for Money -- Hotel 57 is not a good value for the money.  Our rate for a week-long stay was $445 per night, including an outrageous $40 “resort.” fee and tax.  Friends, this is not a resort.  The fee covers a never used “gym,” business center, the above mentioned breakfast (which cost $6.00 around the corner at Matto) and internet access.  That comes to more than $30 per day for internet, more than it costs on most cruise ships.  There are many hotels with better amenities for much less money.  We’ll be staying at those hotels in the future.

title: Do not ever stay here
text: Elevator bank shared a wall with my room. Noise all night, could not get any sleep.  Room smelled like years of smoke.  We spent over $500 per night, and we travel often. Made the mistake of staying here, now you don’t have to.

title: Make sure the staff is clear on policies
text: I was told by a desk clerk by phone that I could leave my suitcase at the hotel a couple of hours after I checked out. I wanted to visit museums and they will no longer let you check luggage at museums, which I did not realize. On the phone, the clerk said I could return and check my back since I had recently checked out. I gave my name and room number. When I arrived the person at the desk went to get someone (a manager?) who said I COULD NOT leave my bag. The hotel can have whatever policies they want but THEY SHOULD BE CONSISTENT AND MAKE SURE THE STAFF KNOWS WHAT THE POLICIES ARE. This unnecessary detour diminished the precious hours I had left in the city by wasting my time. Otherwise the hotel was fine except terrible lighting at the bathroom mirror. Very expensive, but maybe just because of demand for the date.

title: SIMPLE PLEASURE
text: WELCOMING, PROFESSIONAL STAFF, room is always clean and stocked with towels and "paper"...cannot beat this location..easy to travel west, downtown and of course midtown. Starbucks, a great hair salon and lots of restaurants within walking distance. It is my preferred venue for my solo NYC trips.

title: Nice hotel in a convenient area
text: Very nice hotel with a convenient location. The bed was comfortable and there is the option for housekeeping. There is internet and a grab n go continental breakfast included in the $45/day junk fee. The hotel was clean and the breakfast area was continuously restocked with pastries and fruit.

title: Great location. Excellent service.
text: I booked this hotel because of the location and the price. I was pleasantly surprised by how helpful and friendly the staff was. Everyone from the doormen to reception to maintenance and cleaning went above and beyond to make my stay a pleasant one. The room was spacious and clean. The continental breakfast bar was a nice touch too. I’ll definitely be back next time I’m in town.

title: Excellent stay
text: The most important points to highlight, the hotel and the room are impeccable, with everything you need, excellent location, very friendly staff, professional, to highlight the attention of the front desk, the room attendants, bell attendant .I am grateful that the hotel include continental breakfast , something that these days in NYC is a rarity, I would just like to suggest that the pastries be fresher, or that the hotel offer breads that can be toasted instead of pastries. I recommend to visit the terrace.

title: Soggiorno
text:
Hotel in posizione strategica e centrale, vicino alla metro e, con una breve passeggiata, a Park Avenue.
L'hotel è pulito e con interni molto belli esteticamente.
Personale alla reception gentile.
Dato che avere la colazione compresa a NY e una rarità, il servizio ci è piaciuto, anche se potrebbe essere migliorato aggiungento qualcosa di salato o magari mettendo qualcosa di dolce di diverso da tutte quelle varietà di muffin.

title: Great Location Away from Times Square
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel 57. It is a great location near Central Park and Upper East Side that is still within walking distance of the theater district and away from the chaos of Times Square. There are some great little restaurants and pubs nearby, as well as a great little spa that we found.

title: Great hotel with friendly staff
text: The hotel was very accommodating when we arrived way before check in time. Our rooms were clean and spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly, especially Daniel who have us tips on where to go and always had a big smile. Breakfast was good as well.

title: Convenience, courtesy, comfort
text: In the city for a conference a few blocks away and booked room at Hotel 57.  Stay was excellent and exceeded by the courtesy of the staff.  The room size was generous and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  5 star rating from me for sure!

title: Ridiculous daily charge and NOISY
text:
No frills hotel if you just need a place to sleep.
The hotel charges an additional $40/ PER DAY "resort fee."  Yes, they literally call it a "resort fee" to access their "business center" "gym" and get the free breakfast (which btw, is a few muffins and coffee).  It doesn't matter if you use any of these things, they charge you anyway.  Also, I had to sleep with earbuds in every night because the sound of doors slamming shut in the hall all night kept waking me up.  It's not as cheap as it might seem given the additional fees and it's def not a place I would stay with children since it's so loud in the rooms.

title: DISSAPOINTING OVERALL
text:
NIce location but Hotel outdate 
Continental Breakfast" nothing offerred!
No bottled water in room nor front desk nor anywhere
Carpet torn and stained

No soft drinks/drinks for sale anywhere!
Hotel is operating on a shoe string with $300+ rates???
for this price a rip off/lousy value.
Ojutside room deck filthy and no chairs nor table??
Rooftop deck accessible by every guest-loud partyijng, pot smoke and tobacco smoke permeates "ptemium" 17th floor rooms until 2am!!-  CLOSE IT AT 11PM!
CLOSE IT! PEOPLE PARTYING PAST 2AM

I know this is NYC but...

Never again totally lacking

Front Desk staff wonderful but not enough to offset.

They send a confirmation with no totyl price??? I had to call 7 X to get a copy with the total cost!??

title: Localización perfecta
text:
La localización del hotel es inmejorable. A tan solo cinco minutos a pie de varias paradas de metro y muy cerca de Central Park y de la 5ª avenida. Se puede ir caminando a la mayoría de sitios turísticos de la ciudad.

Habitación cómoda aunque no demasiado amplia, baño reformado y moqueta en todo el hotel. Servicio amable e instalaciones bien mantenidas.

Muy recomendable.

title: Excellent hotel for NYC trip!
text: Loved our time staying at 57! Close to the best sight seeing in New York! Definitely recommend checking it out. The staff is extremely attentive and the rooms are very clean. The rooftop is a cool way to experience the big city.

title: Nice lobby and free breakfast
text: This hotel is located in a nice area, fairly quiet and the lobby is very nice along with the breakfast room. The hotel is old and the rooms need to be updated. There is a lot of wood cabinetry in the bedrooms. The bedrooms are small. No small refrigerator or safe in the rooms. The bathroom is nice, needs updated and the sink is very small.  The staff were all extremely nice and accommodating. The free breakfast was very nice, fruit, pastries, coffee and tea. I’ve never stayed at any New York hotel that has offered this.

title: Good location
text:
Pros - Great location close to everything.  Friendly staff with nice continental breakfast area.  Comfortable bed/pillows and rooms seemed clean.
Cons - Older building that they've tried to update some but still showing age.  Price point was high for the quality of the hotel/room.  Upgrade to terrace room but there is presently no seating or chairs available on the terrace so not really a usable space. Thin walls in the room allowed us to hear the neighbors talk and every time they flushed their toilet, which was kind of weird.

title: Loved it!
text: I recently took a solo trip to New York. I picked Hotel 57 because it looked really cute and quaint. Every one of the employees there were extremely helpful and friendly. My room was super cute and I even had a view. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Manhattan. It was close to everything, and super easy to get to. Again, I highly recommend.

title: Amazing 2 week stay
text:
My daughter & I stayed here for 2 weeks while she participated in a precollege summer program at NYSID so this hotel became a 2nd home to us. The location of this hotel is perfect. It’s convenient and felt very safe. We stayed in a double bed room on the 8th floor. Our room was a decent size, clean, & stylish. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of storage space. In the mornings, the espresso & coffee were great, the fruit was fresh, & the breakfast pastries were delicious. The staff was welcoming and professional, especially the door attendants, ground’s keeper, and housekeeping. The staff was probably the best part of staying there, but the location, cleanliness, comfort, and price were all incredible too. Before I became a nurse, I worked in hospitality and this hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. I’m actually a little homesick for this place. 

Tips: I would recommend bringing a sound machine if you are a light sleeper because sometimes guests can be pretty loud coming down the halls at night. There are not fridges in the room, but I just bought a mini fridge to use. And the pizza place next door (My Pie) was the best pizza that I’ve ever had.

title: Amazing gem in NYC!
text: From the location, to the staff, the room, views you name it Hotel 57 batted this one out of the ball park. We were able to get a slightly early check in, which was important as my wife had a video meeting she needed to get to. Check-in was a breeze, front desk attendants we always friendly and welcoming. Doorman was personable and courteous. Housekeeping did an amazing job. Queen Terrace Room was just ass good a advertised, if not better. RM 1508. We will definitely be back. There is a roof top terrace, which we simply did have time to get to, but as we will be returning to NYC we will definitely book here again.

title: Veldig mye for pengene
text: Hotell i eget bygg på rundt 17 etasjer med sentral beliggenhet til Central Park, flere metrostasjoner, restaurant/take-away, ferskvarebutikk (Whole Foods Market) og apotek/kiosk med dagligvarer. Selv om hotellet ikke er nyoppusset var det grei standard på rommet og en god dusj med bra trykk og varmtvann. Kan ellers trekke frem veldig god service fra alle de ansatte, og spesielt flere av dørmennene. De som rydder rommene (daglig) gjør også en veldig god jobb, og det var fint å komme tilbake til et ryddig og oppredd rom etter en lang dag i byen. God aircondition, utsikt mot byen/gaten og helt grei støydemping. Eneste som var savnet var kjøleskap på rommet og litt hyppigere påfyll i snackskiosken om morgenen, da det alltid var skrapt for det meste der nede. Stedet anbefales, også med småbarn!

title: Best coffee I've ever had at a hotel!
text: Their breakfast included access to one of the fanciest ($30,000) coffee machines I've ever seen at a hotel.  It may seem small, but our days started out much better.  The view from our balcony was amazing, and it was worth the upgrade!  The location was great when it came to getting around New York as well.  The staff was great, and our hotel stay felt like part of the experience of visiting New York.

title: Wonderful staff!
text: My family and I spent 4 nights here, and were very pleased with our stay.  I can not say enough good things about the staff - front desk -  including Jennifer and Elizabeth, bellman, and housekeeping.  Everyone was friendly, helpful and went out of their way to help us.  The beds were very comfortable, and we enjoyed the quiet location of the hotel.

title: Great location.
text:
Our stay at Hotel 57 was great. Staff very friendly and a lovely atmosphere. Reception is beautiful but the rooms slightly dated but we found everything to be clean. 
Location is amazing, safe area with subway close by. 
Only comment was an issue with our booking via booking.com. Not the hotels fault (I think) but initial emails to the hotel were not responded to after several (5/6)  attempts. 
However when I did get a response they helped out perfectly. 
Would definitely stay again.

title: A germ in Manhattan
text: Our stay at hotel 57 started off alright, the staff were kind and welcoming with a furnished lobby and a standard elevator. The second we shoved our way through the tight door into our room things took a downward turn. We looked up and saw a very small and cramped two bed facing a TV room. My son had a small laugh and said “well this is quite small.” I glanced around and the thought “this is not what I paid for” bounced around in my mind but I hoped for the best and started unpacking my luggage. My son went to go to the bathroom and tried to shut the door behind himself but the door had fallen off its hinge and wasent able to shut all the way. A couple of hours later in our day we noticed that one of the light switches didn’t work and we had to rely on only one of our lights along side a lamp. I do have to give props because although there were many issues the water pressure in the shower was nice and the beds were comfy. (Note: The towels were very thin and I recommend that you ask for new towels at the front desk) In conclusion this hotel was overpriced and overrated.

title: A Gem in Manhattan
text: Hotel 57 is one of the best hotels I've stayed at for the price.  It was a great value. We had a double room that was very clean, comfy beds, and while small (most NYC hotels are) was spacious enough for two adults with luggage.  The only thing missing was a full-length mirror. The free continental breakfast was great.  They served good coffee and food, it was perfect for saving a little more money for shopping especially if you are someone who doesn't have a huge morning appetite like me. I was able to fill my water, grab coffee or tea, and get some fruit. If I was being more leisurely I probably would have indulged in more of the food options.

title: Ideal place to stay
text: A great hotel to stay in that is not tourist trap area but still in the heart of the city. Great rooms very comfortable and good amenities.  The staff is both friendly and helpful. A wonderful place to stay, especially if you want explore the city or remember why you came here.

title: estafa
text:
alprecio de la habitacion le sumaron 50 dolares por dia en concepto del buissnes center,estabamos de vacaciones,no lo usamos,ni sabiamos que habia ya que no nos informaron de su existencia y menosel cargo diario
aparte la habitaciones viejas
mala experienci!!!!

title: Do not book if you are under 21 Years Old.
text:
In New York this May or may not be an actual law.  What it is definitely is a crazy way to run a hotel business.
I can book this hotel on booking.com.
I can pay my money.
However, if this is for my son he can turn up at the hotel and be refused access to the hotel that I have paid in full for him.
Okay so you want to have these silly little rules which make no sense in a country where you can drive aged 16.  Get married. Have children.  Buy a fully functioning machine gun aged 18……
You can fight for your country in Vietnam aged 19….
However, you can stay alone in a hotel under the age of 21.
And if I had not found this out by ringing the hotel then my son would have no where to stay and I would have lost £1500 / 💵 1820.
So here’s an idea.  Rename the hotel 21 to 57 to give people a vague idea all under 21s are banned from entry without someone 21 staying with them.

title: Good experience overall
text: Big room with balcony at reasonable price, great location, staff were helpful. Breakfast was bare bones, stale croissant and muffins. Rooms lacked amenities such as fridge. Noisy even on 15th floor, but that is NYC.

title: Finally an update to an earlier review
text: I stayed at Hotel 57 in March, first visit to the hotel. My experience included pros and cons - at the top of the list of pros was Jennifer at the front desk, who was very kind and helpful from the minute I walked in the door. She is a keeper! The housekeeping staff was lovely and one of the doormen went out of his way to hail a cab for me when I was leaving while roads were closed/rerouted and there was traffic chaos after the NYC half marathon (I think that's what was going on) - unfortunately I did not get his name. Also, the classic NYC old-fashioned feeling restaurant next door had a surprising gluten free menu filled with yummy options, and as a celiac that was a wonderful surprise. The hotel location is great too. Cons were basically similar to what other visitors have mentioned. After I posted an initial negative review here because I had no luck getting someone to contact me regarding issues and questions I had, management then was very responsive and I appreciate their efforts. I would consider staying at Hotel 57 again.

title: Hotel 57
text: The Hotel is located near Central Park with all of the great amenities nearby. Staff are friendly and helpful. rooms are tidy and well equipped. I love that there are 3 elevators that are fast and never crowded.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: We were in New York to see our son graduate from Pratt Institute. He recommended the location, and we were not disappointed.  We were just a few minutes from Central Park, few blocks away from St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Hall.  The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating.  The room is a little quirky with the layout, but we had two queen beds with a terrace.  Everything was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The shower was nice and plenty of closet space for your things.  They had muffins and fresh fruit, coffee, and ice water to get the morning started.  We would definitely stay again.

title: Best for Solo Travel
text: Check in experience was not great, but everything else was fine.  I arrived 90 min before their official check-in time and they could not provide a room immediately unless I were to pay an extra $60.  I've not seen that blatant "profit-grab" in years.  A room was available when I returned a few hours later and it had a nice modern design, with an updated bathroom with shower.  But the room was extremely compact - it had a full size bed and I felt cramped, so couples should carefully check the room types.  The room was clean and the shower worked well.  It could have used more hooks for toiletry bags / hanging a towel, but that's a small nit.  Checkout went smoothly and I noticed that the cashier remembered my name.

title: Great Location
text: I stayed three nights at this hotel. The location was great and the room was very clean. However, there was no water in the room and no mini frig. The hotel is right beside Dunkin Donuts so there was close access to water and coffee. It would have been great if there had been a small snack bar and a lounge. The staff was friendly and very competent.

title: Good Classic Hotel in Uptown
text:
Located in a great spot in uptown, next to Central Park but close to times square. 5-minute walk to underground and with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Property itself is a classic NY hotel with usual pros and cons of classic NYC Hotel.

In bright side, outstanding front desk, bell boy and staff, classic hotel means excellent people. In the contrary hotel looks tired not old neither rusty but a little outdated for modern hotel standard. Our king room was in top floors, elevators are outstanding, fast and reliable in a big building. Bed superb, Wi-Fi excellent and our only con was rooms are little outdated (old wood NYC style). A/C was a little noisy but running smooth must be updated soon.

Good location, superb staff and good quality/price. Recommended

title: staff second to none
text: never had a staff as nice as the staff at your hotel.  They went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and any issues we had were resolved in a timely manner.  The room was fine.  the location was close to the subway for easy access on and off.

title: Hotel 57
text:
Hotel 57 exceeded our expectations. The staff was amazing and friendly helpful and kind. 
If your looking for a location that is central to everything this is your place. 
Thank you to all the staff and management at Hotel 57

title: Sadly deteriorated
text: Perfect location.  Kind, friendly, responsive staff.  But I am so sad about this hotel where I’ve been staying since it was a Marriott and had a restaurant and coffee/cocktail area (at least 8 years).  The rooms are so deteriorated and dated.  Painted an old, faded pinky beige.  We had a junior suite this time, with an old, hard futon (“pull out couch”) and a couple of pleather footrests for a table.  The bathroom is a real problem.  The walls Surrounding the bathroom are topped with opaque glass, meaning that if you have to get up in the night you can’t turn on the light without waking everyone else up.  We navigated with our phones.  The little lobby is filled with flight attendants and pilots who have contracted to stay in between flights.  Tiny rooms, which is why we took a jr suite this time.  There was a $40 amenity fee!  For what?  The one pathetic bottle of body lotion was old and rancid.  I recognized it from the Marriott days.  Not from the same line as in the shower (attached to the wall). There was an oldish keurig coffee maker hidden in the closet, but no one refreshed the plastic cups or coffee.  The pictures look nothing like the rooms.  Old, old.  I wish they would fix this up, because it’s getting seedy.  I’m somehow attached to this little hotel, but it could be a very lovely boutique hotel. The new owners don’t seem to care anymore.  Too bad.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Excellent hotel. the front desk were very helpful and nice, specially Michael. The room was great, very clean, bed comfortable. Location is excellent, tons of restaurants, close to Central Park and many other things. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Dad & daughter
text: Very Nice two double bed room. Above  size compare to other hotel. Very clean, not noisy, good neighboorhood. Sincerly among the best quality/price/location in midtown hotel. Plenty of restaurant on Lexington ave. The view on the 17th flood terrasse is wonderfull

title: Great Team at the front!
text: Upon checking in our room wasn’t ready and they recommended going to the restaurant the Palace next-door. When we return the room still wasn’t ready and my Fiancé  needed to change for meeting so they offered to put us in another room versus changing in the lobby bathroom. The view was amazing on the 17th floor. Raymond was professional, patient and offered a solution. He even called once we got to the room to see if it would do for us. Daniel Machado who clearly enjoys his job and treats everyone with a smile and a joyous attitude. These two gentlemen make up for some of the challenges with the room decor being slightly damaged. However; the location is perfect and the price point is also very reasonable for New York City.

title: Convenient location
text: Not good for business travel. Good because of its location. The friendliest people on staff during my stay were the door men. I wonder if staff shortage explains faulty communication and finding someone's sock under the bed

title: Another great lodging and hospitality experience at Hotel 57
text: This is my NYC go-to. I check in as a guest for long weekends to a week 4-7 times every year. Never disappointed. Great staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Quiet housekeeping. Little to no regional street noise. Location is central to subways, shopping, parks and museums/galleries. Highest recommendation! I look forward to my next stay at Hotel 57!

title: The photos do not tell the full story
text: The photos on various websites give you the impression that the front of house decor quality/standards  translate to the rooms. This is not the case, like all NY hotels the rooms are small even the executive ones are all decorated minimally with brown/orange as the dominant colours. It is important to understand the $40 charged for facilities fee buys you WIFI that's it. No bar, no restaurant. Front of house is impressive, the lifts too but not the rooms. Housekeeping is excellent.

title: Clunky check in but smooth afterwards
text: We booked this hotel through a BA package deal with a group of 4, first couple checked in with no issues but the lady said she had no record of the second booking which seemed odd. Even though we were able to provide them with the BA email confirming 2 rooms had been paid for they wanted us to pay for another room for the first night while they looked into this. We declined and asked to speak to the manager, who was more competent as he found the other booking...however this room has been given to someone else with the same surname! We eventually got a second room which should have been the end of it however when we compared our two rooms it became apprarent that even though we had paid for the same room the new room was half the size of the first with some fold out bed, therefore we went back to reception to ask to have what we had paid for, to be fair to them they changed the room straight away. The rest of the trip there was great after the initial hitches, clean large rooms with good views and the hotel was in a good location, would recommend staying here

title: The nicest staff
text: We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel 57. It is a prime location, great price, and has the best staff. They have gone above and beyond to make us feel at home. They have provided us with everything we have asked for - they even had a sewing kit when we asked!

title: A perfect stay in this hotel
text: What an absolute gem of a hotel. Our 6th stay in NY. Brilliant location just off 5th. Walking distance to all the best shops & galleries. Staff absolutely lovely & attentive. Our room was huge two very comfortable double beds, large sofa & coffee table and desk area. Ample wardrobe space with coffee facilities. Large bathroom with shower over decent sized bath. Great for a soak after a long day of walking. Quiet no outside noise & good aircon. Good price with no hidden extras. We will be back!! Happy Christmas to all at Hotel 57. 🎄🎅🏽🎄🎅🏽🎄

title: Nice people, but poor hotel
text:
Pros - friendly staff, large bathroom with good shower

Cons - terrible bed, non-working safe, missing light bulbs, very thin windows (no soundproofing), very expensive

With so many NYC hotels available, there is really no reason to select this one. There is just nothing unique or special, and too many cons.

title: Canceled room but was still charged.
text: Booked a room for our yearly party in the city - but had to cancel due to illness. I canceled 4 days out of our stay on Hotels.com as well as made a phone a call to Hotel 57. I was assured by both parties the reservation had been canceled and no charges would be incurred. However on Monday, I saw a pending charge from Hotel 57. When I called the hotel, they told me I was a no show, after explaining i had canceled, I was told Hotels.com never contacted them and this happens often.  I then emailed them the cancelation confirmation - but that was not enough. I had to call hotels.com and have them call the hotel manager to confirm I had indeed canceled the room. The manage then said the charges would be dropped. Not one were the NOT dropped - but I was then charged the full hotel stay 2 days later. It has been nothing short of a nightmare to try and get my money back from this hotel for the cancellation.

title: Great location and service!
text: Really great location and nice hotel overall.   Raymond at the front desk goes above and beyond (although one other staff member was not so nice!).  It is my new go-to for a quick business trip to the City.

title: Nice location. Tired property. Unhelpful staff.
text:
This is the fourth time we've stayed at this hotel in the last 10 years. The rooms haven't changed a great deal in all that time and ours needed a makeover quite badly.

I've uploaded photos of some of the areas of the room that we weren't happy with but it was generally tired. However, it was a big room and we'd got it at a decent rate so we decided we'd just stay put rather than trying to move rooms.

However, what really bugged me and spoiled the trip[ was that the room was on the corner of lift shaft and ice machine... so we got woken every night by the sound of ice clattering. This is a sound that can be ignored most of the time but in the early hours when its very quiet, this sounds alarming.

The first couple of nights we were awake at odd times due to time difference/jetlag but by night four, I tried to call reception at 3 in the morning to complain but there was no answer. The following night I emailed in the early hours. I emailed again the following night. 

On the last day, I noticed that the ice machine had been turned off. 

The staff had made ZERO effort to reply to my emails (still no reply) or contact me but just turned off the ice machine one day before we left.

Sadly this kind of shoddy service means I couldn't recommend this place ever again.

title: Fantastic stay
text: This was an amazing stay - great location, just south of central park and a walkable distance to times square. The service was amazing, we needed extra towels and blankets and they were provided to us at any hour of the day immediately. The rooms were clean and room service did a fantastic job. Definitely recommend for a quick trip.

title: Great stay at a reasonable price
text: A clean, comfortable place to stay in midtown at a reasonable price. E line from Penn Station or theater district to lex/53, with a few blocks to walk. Several groups of flight crews staying there. Lots of food options nearby and

title: Friendliest Staff in NYC
text: THE STAFF! Location is great.  Starbucks across the street,  restaurants nearby, walking distance to whatever you need.  But the staff...every staff member was personable, helpful and welcoming.  I've stayed in smaller rooms in NYC. The rooms are not huge but big enough, closet space galore, big bathroom. The Jr suite had a couch/sitting area. Linens were good, I'd give the mattress a 6. But I would stay here again and again based on the way I was treated.

title: WONDERFUL!
text: In every respect, we were very, VERY pleased with Hotel 57.  When we next travel to NYC, we will plan to stay at Hotel 57 again.  We were especially impressed with the pleasant, well-informed, and accommodating personality of each and every Hotel 57 employee with whom we came into contact.

title: Amazing Place TO stay in NYC area.  one Manhattan top Boutique Hotels
text:
IMPRESSED with the Full staff once again, From the Front door to the cleaning staff, 
But Raymond and Brad where exceptionally, helpful and kind.  In this new world, it is so nice to be Treated kindly plus with respect. Both, Raymond and Brad took care of very question I had for them. 

It is a GREAT place to stay, I have been a few times and it gets better each time.

title: Great value and service at boutique hotel in ideal location.
text: From the doorman to the front desk staff to the lovely housekeeping staff, everyone interaction was so pleasant. This boutique hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan and is an excellent value.

title: Wonderful small hotel
text: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay here for a long weekend.  It was quiet, clean, and most of the staff was helpful and friendly.  It was a 5 minute walk to the subway and 15 minute walk to Time Square.

title: Great location and service
text: Hotel 57 is in a great location.  Close to shopping and transportation.   The room sizes vary, but i've been in many of them.  All are very comfortable.  Well lit, great bed and bathrooms surprisingly large.  while maybe just a bit dated its very clean. also one of the quieter hotels i've stayed in though NY seems to have less sirens these days.  i have to say Raymond at the front desk is terrific.  Professional, helpful and very knowledgeable about the area even for this veteran New Yorker.  i am and will continue to be a repeat visitor.

title: Terrible
text: Bathroom smelled like cigarettes, I informed the staff that first night and they went from door to door to check all rooms, well the following day I saw my neighbor smoking . I informed the front desk and they reassured something would be done and I would be getting a call back from the manager as I requested and I'm still waiting for a call back.

title: Great weekend hotel stay
text: Had a great time in NYC and staying at Hotel 57 only made the visit that much better.  The room was perfect, clean and a good size.  The hotel location was great and made it easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan.  Would definitely stay there again....and have.  I'm a repeat customer.

title: 10 Anniversary Trip to NYC
text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in this boutique hotel on Lexington and 57th. While we spent most of our time exploring NYC, every morning we were greeted by the front desk and bellman (Danny Machado - genuine, kind, awesome) and sent off on our adventures with a smile and answers to any questions we had. We could not have stayed at a better hotel in the heart of the city. Every evening we returned to a warm, clean room lit by the sparkling metropolis below. Accommodating, welcoming, fun, and the balcony on the 17th floor was a great spot for morning coffee and evening cocktails! Thanks for making our trip so special!

title: Hotel 57, special thanks to Raymond
text:
Dear All, 

I stayed at the Hotel 57 in New York several times so far, this was always a great experience! 

My special thanks to a receptionist Raymond. I would say you are a heart of the hotel. The hotel management team should be proud of a colleague whose manners and professionalism impressed me so much. 

Thank you very much so, Raymond! I highly appreciate your help and dedication. It was an absolute pleasure to deal with you professionally. 

Looking forward to stay at the Hotel 57 very soon. 

Sincerely, Tamara

title: Small rooms!!!
text:
We stayed at this hotel coming to town to visit our daughter. 
Knowing that we would land before check in time, the day of travel I usually call the hotel to see if I can have an early check in…. The lady that answered the phone told me if I wanted an early check in, I would Have to pay $40 for it, so, as I was to be arriving at around 1 pm, I declined and would go to my daughters first….. once landed I decided to try and see if being there and having a room available, I could check in so I did arrive at 1 pm… the lady that answered the phone was in the front desk, Elisabeth…. And told me she remembered my call and that she told me the fee for early check in was 40, this time with a tone…. Negative points for the hotel and she even told me she does not make the rules…. (Darling please stay behind doors and do not treat public!!) As if this os my first time in a hotel….
Well I asked for a king size bed room and saw in my reservation that the room should be around 300 sq ft. Well the room was king size, but far from that size…. Very small room…. Not even a counter to put my wallet etc… small desk next to the side of the bed…. Well, minuscule room… if you don’t mind this, this hotel is ok!
No water in sight or in the hotel to drink, so take note of this.
The bathroom is ok, ok towels and ok amenities….
The shower is good with curtain and tub.
The bed is ok and pillows are average.
The room was clean.
All in all I will most probably not stay here again!!!

title: Great stay at a great location!
text: We stayed at Hotel 57 over the Memorial Day weekend (very very rainy!). Check-in was quick and easy, the room was clean and functional. It was quiet, and just a few blocks from several different metro stations. The temperature was well-controlled, and although I would have liked a fridge, it was fine without one. We would absolutely stay here again!

title: Great South Central Park location
text: Location is less than 4 blocks to Central Park and Upper East Side. Room was very clean and the bed was out of this world. Front desk staff very helpful, especially Raymond. Everything and anything we needed was taken care of without any problems and timely. Highly recommended. Will be headed back regularly.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: This hotel is where you want to stay. Centrally located in the midtown area, cafe and city sights within walking distance. Safe area. The Hotel staff are polite and helpful. Rooms are clean, comfortable, with in room coffee or tea and a safe for valuables.

title: Thank you, Raymond
text: This review is mainly because of Raymond from front desk, for being incredibly helpful and kind. He is one of those few people who cares about every customer that approaches him, and does his best to assist. I asked for some help retrieving a package I had ordered at the hotel, after having a really horrible experience with one of his colleagues, and he was patient enough to listen to what the problem was, solve it and more! After the issue was handled, he was so nice to give me a small guide of places to eat and his recommendations; he really made my day. I hope management knows that he stands out and is able make up if anything goes wrong, even when it's someone else's fault.

title: Customer Service Issues
text: The hotel is very conveniently located for business as well as pleasure travel in NYC. The beds are comfortable and the room was clean. When I arrived I was greeted by a wonderful hotel team member- Raymond. He could not have been more professional and kind. The young bellman was wonderful too. Unfortunately, the next day - I had an extremely rude and unprofessional experience with the front desk team member, Lucy. I asked to speak to management. Tyler was the manager on duty, and he was even more unprofessional and even ruder than Lucy. Unfortunately, the incident was so nasty and disturbing that I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Convenient location
text: Front desk staff is amazing- friendly and informative.  Room was very clean.  Restaurants are close and you can walk to almost everything   Looks like an office building converted to a hotel, not welcoming decor but location makes up for it

title: Amazing customer service
text: I stayed at Hotel 57 from 18-19 February. After arriving the hotel from a long day at work, I’d like to share my experience throughout the stay. I’d like to dedicate my gratitude to Jennyffer and Eldar for making my stay here such a wonderful experience. I’ve never met such kind hearted hotel staff that goes over and beyond to accommodate to my needs. I truly appreciate their gestures to make my stay as comfortable as it can be. I received a small keychain when I arrived to my room and every time I look at it now, I’m reminded of how warm my stay was at Hotel 57. Definitely looking forward for my next stay and I wish the best of luck for Jennyffer and Eldar.

title: Not a clean place
text:
This is possibly the worst hotel imaginable.  I stayed overnight during a predicted snow storm and Covid. No one was even gracious enough to welcome me. I had taken a junior suite for a two night stay. The lobby was dreary, the staff uninterested, the room was disgusting. Every surface was dusty or dirty. The sofa had big buttons popping out all over, unusable. The chair was stained and filthy. Only the center of the room had been vacuumed. Towels were so threadbare and dingy  that I could not shower. 
Luckily, I had two pillowcases and a sheet in my bag. I sat up all night 
Stay Away

title: not too bad
text:
my floor and room were outdated (old) - 3-stars
small down pillows are not good for a bad neck, asked the front desk for foam or a stiffer pillow and received more small down pillows.
staff were outstanding !!!!!!!!

title: Comfortable Stay
text: Room was larger than expected and quiet. Beds were very comfortable. Marble bathrooms with hair dryer.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free WiFi,  bottled water. Reasonable parking rates during COVID.

title: holiday visit
text: Raymond at the front desk was very helpful and friendly during my visit in December.  The rooms are nice and the top floor has an outdoors area for extra $$.  HOWEVER the website shows the top floor plan for junior suite and you have to ask for it and pay extra.  The standard junior suite is fine but small sitting area, not the one displayed on the website..   Overall a good value and excellent location..

title: Excellent hotel in mid-town Ny
text: Excellent view, very nice and clean hotel in mid-town new York. the front desk staff is marvelous her name is Jennyfer Boyd she was helping us all the time. Sincerely very good hotel to be! 100% recommended

title: Service is amazing! Rooms need work.
text: The service at Hotel 57 is amazing! In particular Raymond made our stay feel very personal and special. The rooms are dated and need to be renovated and repaired. We had a leak from our sink that ruined my leather toiletry bag. Heating/air conditioning noisy.

title: Quality hotel in a great location...Don't let the price fool you
text:
I had the best night sleep at Hotel 57.  The rooms are super quiet and have extremely high quality bedding.   I wish my shower at home was this good.  Amazing water flow, pressure, and shower head.   The towels are the best I ever had, something like I once experienced  in Italy. 

The rooms are five-star.  The location is super.  Best value and quality in Manhatten.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: We were looking for a budget friendly hotel for an overnight to celebrate my wife's birthday and discovered Hotel 57. Terrific location, super clean, and an excellent staff. Just a terrific experience during a very challenging time. Bravo !

title: Wonderful Hotel, Friendly Staff and Perfect Loaction
text: We had a wonderful stay and couldn't be more pleased with the location and staff. Raymond welcomed us at check in and was extremely friendly and helpful. He gave us restaurant recommendations and was so kind. Danny M and Danny A were also wonderful in helping with our bags during check in and check out. We were impressed from the minute we arrived until we left.

title: Raymond is an excellent person,staff and New Yorker!
text:
My colleagues and I stay in this hotel very often and staff are very hospitable and accommodating. They try to provide their guests' needs as much as they can and they are all polite.

 I'm leaving a review as I was delighted by one  of their employee's service, RAYMOND, whose hospitality skills were exceptional. He was very friendly,informative and very sincere when I needed help. He was very genuine and kind and I'm always grateful for it. I myself am working in the hospitality industry for years and I would say that he takes an extra mile to assist their guests as much as he can. 
Over all, I'm grateful that I am able to stay in  a hotel with friendly staff especially right in the heart of Manhattan.

~MARY D.✈️

title: Good
text: Excellent location! Walking distance to 5th avenue and Central Park. Rooms are small but comfortable. Bathrooms are spacious. Smart TV. WiFi disconnects continuously. Staff are prompt. No room service but many restaurants around or you can oder food.

title: COVID'19 CARE & SUPERB STAFF "Mr Raymond"
text:
We stayed 2ice in last 3 months  in this Hotel which is at the centre of Manhattan best location . 
it was one of few hotels operating with safety guidelines.
We were so pleased with the management & the staff that leaving no review will be a disservice to the privileged  treatment we received .
The hotel rooms specially bathroom  is more spacious then other hotels around in the same lines.
Rooms are clean & well kept , The service is prompt & needless to say they go out of their way to help the guest . 
During our stay we found we were in the safest & most sanitized property . 
Raymond was supper professional & his kind acceptance to all our demands made our stay wonderful .
he helped us with the parking first & a very  reasonable rate.
keeping the covid exposure in mind he suggested us best ways to move & also directed us hygienic & good places to shop which reflects value for money .
He also helped us with delivery apps for food & gave us a list of restaurants to dine in.
Eventually grocery guidance was also given for which my wife was so happy with . 

over all a great experience & recommended hotel to stay .

title: Outstanding service.
text:
Raymond gave such a warm welcome that I have to take time to write this review. This is more than a compliment, it’s an appreciation!
Raymond was so welcoming. He was very helpful with the different room requests for my colleagues. He was so patient with us as there were so many of us. He was never seen looking annoyed or negative but super positive attitude. It was a very early morning check-in and he was so full or enthusiasm anticipating our arrival. I must say I haven’t seen any service personnel giving such a warm welcome ever! He was so genuine and I have so much respect for him. This hotel is really lucky to have him around. I highly recommend this hotel as service to me is more important than anythg else.

Rooms and locations are great just like many other hotels around in this area. 
Everythg was great about this hotel but Raymond is better than great....!
If you appreciate the human touch more than anythg, Raymond and his colleagues would not disappoint u.

title: Amazing hospitality!
text:
Very friendly staff greeted us with warm welcome upon arrival and this set the tone for our wonderful stay at Hotel 57.  Very clean hotel and our room is spacious and cozy. Our balcony allowed us a fantastic view of Manhattan especially at night.

Location is perfect being in mid-Manhattan.  Shops and attractions are walking distance.

This is one experience we will never forget and we would like to thank the GM and staff for extending amazing hospitality to us. A memorable hotel experience!

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We had a wonderful stay at Hotel 57. The hotel's staff is very friendly, including the cleaning ladies that always asked if we need it anything extra. I have to give a special shout out to Raymond at the front desk. He helped us with a special request,  and every day gave us ideas on where to eat, and places to visit. 
The beds in the room were so very comfortable, as were the pillows. One feature that I really appreciated were the high ceilings in the room, the absence of noise of people walking from  the top floor, which you get from chain hotels. I would describe this hotel as pleasant,  quiet,  and comfortable.  I'm hoping to come back next year with my kids, and I look forward to my future stay at this hotel.
I. Castillo

title: excellent service
text: even if limited, because only room service the staff, everything including the maid, were excellent and I wish you a 100% recovery as soon as possible. Perfect location and total absence of noise, a little sad because it is not the NY I know but we slept like a charm, with fantastic beds !!

title: Cozy with nice personality
text: Upon first entrance, hotel lobby may seem small for a big group, however with the efficiency and friendliness of the staff, lobby wait time is minimal. The rooms I've been in so far have a nice view of the streets and shops nearby and the beds are very comfortable. Additionally the hotel is located right in the center of everything where you may access restaurants within less than 1 minute. I have also been blessed to meet staff Steve and Lucy who are very friendly and polite, they both have excellent customer service skills and make you feel right at home.  Definitely looking forward to my next stay.

title: Staff Make the Hotel
text:
Hotel is a due for a freshening up but the staff are all top notch 

Everyone was helpful friendly courteous and professional. 

Would recommend this hotel to anyone. 

Perfectly located - and $25 overnight parking with voucher!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Completely impressed with our entire experience.  From the doorman, to the front desk staff, everyone was very hospitable and made managing our short visit very enjoyable.  Location and value were awesome, so we will definitely be back.

title: Good
text: The room next to us had a party and we had to down grade our room , that was unfair to us, but the guy at the front desk was really nice and lut us us a decent room. He did try is best to talk with the other guests but they did not care .

title: Great people!!
text:
I was in NY few days ago for work.
The Hotel is very nice and located in a good position in Manhattan.
Rooms are clean and confortable.
Because of Covid all the amenities are closed, but the personnel at the reception is willing to help you.
I had  a problem,  but  Mrs Elizabeth and the Hotel Manager  they were very helpful making  a big effort in helping me solving the problem.
I would like to thank you personally.
It is not easy to find peolple so kind around.
I hope to go back soon

title: 서비스가 친절해서 좋았어요
text: 남편과 결혼기념일을 기념해서 방문했었는데 아주 좋았어요, 서비스도 친절했고 센트럴 파크랑 가까워서 산책하기도 좋고. 근처에 쇼핑할곳과 식당도 많았어요. 코로나때문에 조마조마 하며 갔던건데 호텔이 깔끔해서 마음이 놓였어요. 침대도 편안해서 잘잤구요, 뉴욕이다보니 길거리 소음은 있었지만 다음에 또 기회가 되면 가고 싶네요. 아 근처에서 먹은 할랄가이즈도 맛있었어요!
