title: we had a pleasant stay
text: Front desk personnel, LUCY was welcoming our stay. our room was clean and comfortable. I like the view from the balcony. NYC city view!  and I like the location as well, nearby central park, 5th ave. I wish I could go back.

title: Poor management inflexible choose other options
text:
The hotel would not allow a change of date and charged a full fare on a no show despite the fact was just trying to change the date not to cancel the reservation.
There are many similar options I stay in the city 75 nights per year the Fitzpatrick was closed so thought I would try this location I would encourage you to try another property

title: Outstanding
text: My husband and I stayed here one night in early August, and then returned last week for three nights when I was coming to NYC to have surgery. We have both stayed in hotels around the world, but no where have we been treated so kindly as when we stayed here. Raymond at the front made sure we were in a room that would be quiet and cozy, and the friendly gentleman at the door (we unfortunately did not catch his name) was ready to provide suggestions for dining, etc. The room was clean ( I had no concerns even with COVID) and the hotel took care of any of our requests. The part that meant the most to us was that we felt cared for during a visit that was not for enjoyment especially being five hours from home.   We will be returning to Hotel 57 for my post-op check and look forward to seeing the staff again.

title: Raymond- Best "Crisis Concierge"
text:
During the NYC Covid-19 Crisis, Raymond, one of the front desk personnel, was extremely helpful. Although, he could not operate in the true sense of a Concierge because there were no tours to book or restaurants to reserve,  he gave a list of restaurants that delivered. He was able to facilitate hailing a cab when they were at their scantiest.
 The hotel, clean rooms, comfortable beds, 
and location, location, location! Minutes from everything; Central Park, Park Avenue and Grand Central Station and amazing roof-top view. When the Crisis is past, will be returning!

title: great location, clean, nice staff
text: this hotel is a good choice for a mid price clean hotel in a great location. there's nothing remarkable about it, but it gets the job done well. This is the second time I have stayed here (prior was in 2018) and it has maintained its standards.

title: Home away from home in NYC
text: I had to be away from my apt for a couple weeks and I'm so happy that I chose Hotel 57! The staff went out of their way to be helpful and make me feel at home, especially Danny, Raymond and Lucy. I'd recommend Hotel 57 to anyone traveling to NYC - thank you for a great stay!

title: Will stay Again if back in NYC.
text:
Great boutique hotel. Prime location! Great walkability 
to central park. Would benefit from a small in-room refrigerator.  Rooms very clean and comfy beds. Great staff. Would recommend and stay here again.

title: Great rates/ spotless rooms/very delightful staff
text: You cannot find a better location to be near everything but the staff is what makes this place perfect.  The rates are reasonable .  I will be back for sure.  been here handful of times.  Every time is spot on.

title: Great Value
text: Friendly staff, easy check-in process, and I really appreciated having in-room coffee/tea. Hotel 57 is a great value for this area of the city. The old Renaissance sign had just been removed, and the new sign had not yet been hung. I do recommend the new sign be in place soon.

title: Not a 4 star property
text:
The hotel star rating shows that this is a 4 start property. It is probably a 2 star at its best. Google’s description about the hotel is not correct, so don’t trust that.

The location of the hotel is great but apart from that there is nothing special about this hotel. There was no hot water to shower in the morning and the HVAC system is very noisy. 

I am sure people can find a hotel that gives them a better value for money.

title: Worst Hotel EVER in NYC
text:
I visited the hotel as I had to attend a master program in NYC.
The service was so poor that my self and many of my colleagues we had to move to another hotel.
The reasons: no hot water at the shower, the heating wasn't working, lack of clean and a lot of noise, it is almost impossible get to sleep.
They should closed the hotel, please do not go.

title: Muito bom!
text:
Excelente hotel! Não aparenta ser um hotel novo, mas é muito bem cuidado 
e conservado. Localização excelente, perto de várias estações de metrôs, da 5a. avenida e do Central Park. O café da manhã não é incluso, mas por U$ 10,00 comemos a vontade.

title: Hotel57 continues 2B my 1st choice 2book in NYC! Jeremiah@Front desk ensures each persons stay exceeds expectations!
text:
Hotel 57 is a centrally located hotel that begins with warm welcomes as soon as one walks into the front door. The smiling faces of the engaging front door staff is indicative of people who are genuinely happy to be working at this Particular Hotel57. The front door staff introduces themselves and a first name basis relationship is established while assisting each guest with their luggage and escorting to the front desk, where he introduces you to the person at the front desk who will be assisting you upon check in. 
Personal attention continues with guests being  greeted by sincere smiles from those at front desk. The kind, sincere front desk staff (including but not limited to) Jeremiah, Raymond, Elizabeth, Lucy, 
attend to each individual upon check in & make sure to listen to each guest’s requests before assigning a specific room. 
The Front desk staff always looks to accommodate guest’s individual requests like floor preference, view from room, bathroom type, upgrades and refrigerators whenever available for duration of gust’s stay. When I’ve decided to extend my stay the front desk makes this seamless by assuring to keep me in the same room. 
Rooms are equipped with very comfortable beds, marble floored bathrooms, lots of space to keep your personal items. 
The rooms include ample closet space to hang clothes, full length mirrors inside the closet door, as well as, bedside drawers for additional storage space, which accommodates both a short term or long term stay! 
The room also features large flatscreen TV, with premium channels, showtime, complimentary streaming of HBO GO & YouTube and Netflix streaming is available to those with a Netflix account. 
The room features a desk & chair area to accommodate those who need a place to concentrate, get work done, or ‘plug in’ with ample outlets available to use your computer or just a comfortable place to plug in hair dryer & get ready after taking a shower or bath-always reliable to be filled with hot water or temperature of your choice! 
The housekeeping staff is kind, attentive, and  accommodates guest’s time preference for service.  They generously supply towels, soaps, shampoo, conditioner etc....
The hotel has a bar/lounge area in the lobby where breakfast is available 6:30- 10:30am if guest chooses for about $10.00. The space is comfortably arranged with tables, couches, chairs, Books and daily Newspapers. The lounge is available with a menu including wine beginning at about 5:30pm. This area is very peaceful, comfortably set up to read, dine, small meet ups, and is never overcrowded as some other hotels can be, since this is a boutique style hotel with about 210 rooms. 
There is a newly renovated Gym on the third floor available to guests 24 hours a day equipped with weight equipment, cardio machines, and floor space to do yoga and stretching etc... large windows that offer a beautiful view of the city. The third  floor also features a business room equipped with computers and printers for guest use. There is a rooftop available to guests as well. 
The front desk staff is easily reachable from your hotel room phone or in person. The staff at this hotel is especially warm and makes a point of learning guest’s first name, especially returning guests. The staff made it easy to have deliveries sent here and safely accepted, signed for, and often staff will offer to bring to your room upon arrival. Both Abraham and Daniel kindly brought packages to my room when delivered. 
The people at Hotel 57 work together like a family and this is also an integral part of what makes the guest feel ‘at home’ while staying at hotel 57. Thank you to the kind staff at Hotel 57 for making sure each stay exceeds expectations and every time I stay Hotel 57 feels like I’m walking into a place that feels like a home to me:) Jill

title: Field supervisor
text:
Beautiful room very friendly staff. I was upgraded to a suite for no additional cost.
I was accidentally charged twice and the staff caught the issue and removed without me even asking. Staff was extremely helpful and actually informed us of things to do around the location

title: Don’t book! You will spend 1/3 more at the checkout
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We prepaid US$120 a night on Hotels.com. But at the checkout we had a surprise: a fee “facility fee”, more US$35/night. The hotel is not the facility itself, is it? We spend more 240 dollars at the checkout, it is the minimum wage in Brazil, in other words, many people work the entire month, 8 hours a day to have this money! And the problem is not the value itself, there isn’t a fridge in the room, there is no restaurant, a day we were trying to have a bottle of water because we’re thirsty and we had to wear a lot of clothes to go to buy water at night and it was like 0°C outside! This hotel doesn’t worth the price! We’ve traveled to many places in many countries and we have never seen something like this hotel. The fee is written when you book but it is used to guide you to a mistake! Don’t book!

title: 4 stars is a stretch
text: Nice staff, cute (but tiny) lobby, no amenities.  Elevator and hallways outdated.  Seemed like more of a younger tourist vibe and not as upscale as hoped. More like a 3 star hotel at best.  Got a good deal last minute but wouldn't stay again.

title: Great location.
text:
I’ve been to New York several times and stayed in many different areas around the city. The location of Hotel 57 is great, close to the subway (I took the train from JFK and it was only a 5 minute walk). Close to UES and Hells Kitchen. 

Upon my check-in, they couldn’t find my reservation so that was a little frustrating after a long day of travel as I sat in the lobby waiting. I get upstairs to my room, it’s quite small - enough room for one. I was only staying for a few days, so I only had a carry on luggage but if I had a check-in or another person, it would get quite tight.  The TV didn’t work, like I said - I was only there for 2 nights so that didn’t bother me too much. Beds weren’t terribly uncomfortable but the pillows were quite lumpy. One of my bathroom glasses wasn’t fully cleaned, it had soap/toothpaste residue still on it. 

I didn’t use any amenities in the hotel, as it was a quick trip with a jam packed agenda but if I was traveling solo again for a short time, I would consider Hotel 57 since the price was quite reasonable.

title: Won’t Stay Here Again
text:
Staff was friendly. Rooms were tastefully appointed. Gym facilities were good. 

But the bed was horrible (and I brought my own pillow) and the WiFi was so bad it was unusable. I even paid an extra $10 for the “faster” service. If you’re going to be staying there for a work related trip and need decent internet i the room, this is not the place to stay.

title: messed up charging system, charged me extra 100 dollar for no reason
text:
I've stayed there for one night on Feb 6th, prepaid the room online with 138.79 USD.  was asked for 50 USD deposit while checking in. When I checked out on Feb7th, I got charged for 87.86 USD, since I was still in the city, I went back and asked them right away, they said it was 40 USD facility fees, they don't know why there's 87.86 USD, but since it's still pending on the bank, so it will be adjusted later. 

today, I checked my bank account again, it was not confirmed bill, which is 137.86 USD, means they didn't return my deposit money, neither the unknown uncharge for 87.86 USD. 

yet still haven't got my money back, 

be careful when you stay in this hotel, always aware of your credit card real charge!!!

title: Quaint, Perfectly Situated with exceptional service
text:
A very special thanks to Raymond Tassiello. He went above and beyond in every conceivable aspect. The customer service he exemplified is truly the difference between a one night stay and a week stay. It leaves a lasting impression for repeat business and encourages me to recommend this place to friends and colleagues alike.

I checked in here sick and through the gracious hospitality of all staff they allowed me to feel like I was not only safe but looked out for too.

This is an exceptional, classy hotel with soft beds, a large variety of premium channels (HBO, Netflix, YouTube), has a marble floor bathroom, and a spacious gym with a nice business center. 

Two very big thumbs up!

title: Lovely staff, comfy room and very convenient
text: We stayed here for 2 nights on our second trip to New York and weren't disappointed. The room was quiet and spacious with a separate area for bedroom, dressing and bathroom. Bathroom was clean and well designed. There was plenty of storage space and room to sit and relax. The bed was very comfortable as well. It only took a few minutes walk to get to Central Park and Grand Central Station. The business centre was great to use to print boarding passes for the journey home as well. Nice decor and clean all round. The staff at the desk were friendly and very helpful. All in all a lovely place to stay.

title: Excelente ubicación, mala atención y predisposición
text:
Excelente hotel con locación más que privilegiada. Alrededor de 10 cuadras a Times Square y 3 cuadras al Central Park.
El hotel es cómodo, con habitaciones confortables y café de cortesía en el lobby.
En caso de no tener desayuno hay dos cafeterías muy cercanas. Una a 50 metros (DD) y otra a 100 (Juan Valdez).
Lo que no estuvo bien fue el trato que tuvo el personal del hotel, que no ayudó en nada en cuanto a los medios de transportes que solicitamos para ir al aeropuerto, hasta se negaron a llamarlos. 
Si destaco la amabilidad del “botones” brasileño que ayudó con las maletas, siempre sonreía y abría la puerta al entrar y salir del hotel

title: Great value with great location and helpful staff and bellmen.
text:
This hotel is a great value and the front desk staff and bellmen were welcoming and very helpful.    The rooms were clean but lacking somewhat in amenities and features were present but not useful.

We were there for a girls trip to the city.    When we checked in, there were no robes in the closet.   The coffee service was missing instructions and the stirring sticks.     There was no notepad, pen or book of hotel services or numbers on the desk or in the drawers.

The rooms are very dark so in the morning, with the blinds closed for privacy the room was very dark.    At night, there was not enough light.    I'm not sure if it was the light bulbs or the number of lights/lamps.      The reading lights are on top of the headboard and useful but the switch is up there too so you have to get out of bed to turn off your reading light; not very practical.

There was no seating in the room other than the desk chair but we did have a terrace with seats (but not useful in January).

The closet space was plentiful and beautiful wood paneling but there were 3 hangers in each closet.    Not even enough for 2 ladies to hang all their clothes for the week and we had to request more.

The bathroom was clean but there is no makeup mirror so bring your own.   The tub/shower was clean but outdated for the rest of the room with the shower curtain and fixtures.   Aveda amenities were very nice!

There is a coffee service in the room but there are not outlets where it's stored so you have to move it to the desk.   

There are plenty of outlets for plugging in and charging all your devices.

There can be some noise from doors opening and closing on the floor.

title: Like a school report - ok but could do better
text: A comfortable reasonably priced hotel in mid town Manhattan just a stones throw from Central Park and MOMA and the other nearby Art galleries such as the Metropolitan museum. Subway stations very close by and all of Manhattan quickly accessible. The Staff were very friendly and helpful - only breakfast was something of a disappointment with a very limited choice and NO BREAKFAST AT ALL at weekends and holidays!!!!!!!! Also no mini bar/ fridge in the rooms . However, overall I enjoyed my stay and the general facilities were good.

title: Great Property, location and team
text: First stay ever, for 2 nights.  Older classy property that has a good lounge for platinum and higher, and nice balcony off the room for a very different street view vibe.  Steve Park, the front office Director helped instantly sort out a request around a future room stay and was fantastic, professional and very responsive, as was the entire front desk staff.   Better customer service overall than many NYC Marriott properties so looking forward to future stays.   Also great location to central park for jogging!

title: Wow. Great From Start To Finish
text:
As soon as we stepped in, the warmth and caring nature of all the staff was clear and plentiful. We had a hiccup with a purse we thought we’d lost, they were quick to help and very sympathetic, ensuring it’s return was then kept safe. 
We were given a great room, it was clean and prepared well every day (although not all glasses/towels used were replaced like for like). Every time we returned from a day out or coming down in the morning the greetings from all staff were genuine and outgoing, they all were so happy to help and provide a compassionate environment. The bed was VERY comfortable. 
Everything you need is very close including the Subway. Have your coffee from Juan Valdez on 57th across the street and your pizza from My Pie pizza just around the corner on Lexington - both awesome. CVS Pharmacy for cheap beer, daily essentials, chocolate and tit bits further down Lexington several blocks. 
If returning to New York we’d definitely stay here again. Thank you Jennyffer 😘 !!!!

title: Like going home
text: I had not stayed there in almost four years but was greeted by name as if I was just there.  The staff is awesome and even (as a Gold member) allowed to check in early.  It was like going home again.  I’ll visit again soon

title: Great Location, but not my favorite Marriott in NYC
text:
My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel between Christmas and the new year. The location is excellent. it is on Lexingtion and 57th. It's only two short blocks from a subway stop at Lexington and 59th street. It is a short walk to 5th Avenue, Central Park, and Times Square. We found the location to be a convenient base for exploring the city. The room was ok. Even though we were on a fairly low floor (7), the room was quiet. The bed was comfortable even though it was only a full sized bed. The room was decently sized. The bathroom was good. There were only two working elevators and they are very small. We had to wait for a second elevator several times.

On the negative side, the lounge is not up to par with other Marriott properties. The room was not as clean as I would have preferred. Even though I am a titanium member, there were no upgrades available. They did not provide the extra towels, washcloths, and pillows I requested through the Marriott App.

Overall, it was a great vacation and the hotel served its purpose.

title: Decent
text:
This hotel has good location and the room was of decent size (we had a room with two double beds). There was no problem with noise during night (considering it is on Manhattan), and the beds were comfortable. As such we got what we need in a room: good nights sleep in good beds.

Only disappointment is that we arrived at 15:00 but was told that the room was not ready until 16:00. That was ok, we walked around and had something to eat - but when we returned at 16:10 the room was still not ready. We got quite impatient and was told to wait in the saloon. The room was not ready until after 17:00 and we were tired after a long trip from Europe.
The staff compensated us with a complimentary breakfast and ensures bonus points - so we were fairly treated - but the wait was too long. Apologies though to the staff for me getting quite impatient :)

All in all I thing this was a fair value for money hotel. We saved approx 500 usd compared to Hilton Midtown for a four nights stay.

title: Nice place to stay in NYC
text: Clean, nice rooms, helpful staff. Not in the tourist zones but close enough to walk to most places and closes to mass transit. Around 30 min to LGA in an Uber. Rooms were a nice size and staff was helpful and friendly.

title: quello che cercavo...
text:
Visti i prezzi che girano a Manhattan il Renaissance ha soddisfatto a pieno le nostre aspettative.
Camera bella e al 6 piano non sentivamo nessun rumore dalla strada.
La posizione e' molto comoda sia per visite a piedi sia per la fermata del metro.
il personale e' estremamente gentile e paziente.
il rapporto qualita' prezzo e' il punto forte della struttura.

title: Thank you
text: Booked a single room for a quick family trip to NYC, using Bonvoy rewards points. Upon check in, Jennyifer realized that the room I had selected wouldn’t be comfortable for my daughters and myself.  She found a larger room for us, added had a rollaway bed delivered so that we would be comfortable.  Throughout our stay, Jennyifer greeted us, remembered our name, and made us feel right at home.  Thank you for the hospitality!  It was much appreciated.

title: A Broken and Sad Hotel
text:
I've previously stayed the the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 over 5 times,  while I lived in New York, it was the go to place for my mom to stay at while visiting. I love the location and the overall vibe of the hotel. I have NEVER been so disappointed with a hotel in general, never mind the service and cleanliness. After an 8 hour flight delay I was excited to check into a hotel I have always adored. Arriving to the hotel, I noticed they have moved the lobby and consolidated it making it much smaller with no public space. When I arrived to the front desk, the gentleman who assisted me seemed to  rush the process (something I usually want to happen) but to the extent that I had no idea what was going on. I heard "upgrade" something I was hoping would happen as I'm a Gold Bonvoy member, but wasn't informed of the room category/type. Pleased with this news, I was excited to get into my room and relax briefly before heading to our reservations for dinner. Turning the lights on, the room was much smaller than the room I originally reserved (300SF superior queen room) this room was 260 SF, which was confirmed by the hotel manager Joyce. Aside from the room size and being downgraded from the room I originally booked was the issue of cleanliness. While the majority of the public spaces are clean, the room was NOT. The shower head was infested with mold, the tub had standing water in it and the floor seemed grimy. The bed skirt also had mold and marks, it seems as though they haven't changed out or cleaned the bedskirt in a decent amount of time. The sheets had small black specs that could be brushed off and the headboard was falling apart, I even had the nails/hardware on top of my pillow. The next morning I met with Joyce, to see if my original room was available to move to, and she noted that the hotel was fully booked and nothing could be done. The customer service isn't how I remembered it- employees would go out of their way to please you and make your stay memorable and enjoyable- not this time. Even the smallest request of asking for a pint glass from the lounge to use for iced water in the morning was declined. 
This stay was a Christmas gift to my boyfriend. A visit New York, a special place for us and visit all things we miss. I am extremely disappointed and saddend with this visit, something that I thought would be a surefire gift with outstanding service and was everything but. This hotel seems broken and sad, something that can't be fixed overnight.

title: My worst nightmare
text:
On my last day of visit, as I had some hours between my checkout time and my flight departure, as is usual, I left my luggage with the concierge of the hotel. When I came back to pick up my bags, what was my surprise when they told me that they had lost one of my travel bags. Unfortunately for me that bag contained most of my kids Christmas presents

If that was already bad for me, the response that I’ve been receiving from the hotel is even worse. Nobody takes care of the problem. 

The only thing that I know after three weeks is that my case is probably lost on a pile of claims in a anonymous insurance company, and that Marriott doesn’t care at all.

title: Good location, friendly staff, but dated room and almost no common areas
text:
Stayed here for one night on a solo trip. Here are my thoughts:

Pros:
--Great location, close to Central Park, shopping in and around Fifth Avenue and the MOMA, among many other things. Also easy to get to and from LaGuardia from this location.
--Affordable, "smaller" guest room is great for solo travelers.
--Bathroom was larger than your average NYC hotel bathroom and the design was Japanese.
--Smaller room had everything I needed -- even an iron and ironing board!
--Friendly staff were able to accommodate an early check-in.

Cons:
--There are almost no common areas in this hotel. The "lobby" is really just a couple of chairs near the check-in desk.
--There is no cafe/restaurant in the hotel, so you're on your own to find breakfast in the morning. (Not great if you're not a morning person.)
--Walls were thin and I can see that noise could be a problem, though I seemed to get lucky.
--My 13th floor room and the surrounding hallways were dated and show signs of serious wear and tear. The bed is not the usual comfy Marriott bed I have grown to expect from this brand but was instead pretty hard and uncomfortable.

Overall, good value and location but not ideal for stays of more than a couple of nights.

title: Don't be fooled by some negative reviews: better than expected, by New York standards
text: I am slightly puzzled by several negative reviews. I thought that I was treated well by Ren 57. Generally speaking, I start to like Renaissance brand of Marriott better after last several stays in Renaissance hotels worldwide.  Granted, I have Platinum Status, so I burned Bonvoy points for a free night. Otherwise, it is an expensive hotel, as expected in MIdtown with an excellent location close to Central Park.  One negative moment: not much of a lobby, tiny one. However, they have pretty nice Lounge on lobby level, and I was able to host the meeting there.  Lounge is quite good for breakfast, and for a drink too.  Rooms are on a larger side by Manhattan standards, and well equipped, and so are bathrooms. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again, especially if the price is right.  Service is mostly competent and friendly.  All in all, good one night stay.

title: Location location location
text:
Very good location, clean rooms, small but modern a tiny lobby. Location is main highlight: Close to Central Park, subway, many shops 5th Ave, etc
Hotel can get very busy during peak hours, I arrived around 2PM there were no rooms to check me in and they were storing around 200 pieces of luggage (lots of people in same situation)

title: Awful hotel
text: I have been here for a few hours and considering checking out as soon as I get up.  No service - they have one person working - they don’t respond at all.  Room is ancient and in poor shape.  Not clean.  Sink in bathroom does not drain.  Just all around bad.

title: My New Favorite Place to Stay
text: I came across this hotel on a recent trip to New York.  Wonderful!  Great location - close to the subway lines and very walkable neighborhoods.  Tasteful decor.  Fantastic, personal, friendly service from ALL staff.  I highly recommend this property.

title: Pessimo!!
text: Esperienza molto negativa che sconsiglio assolutamente!!È la prima volta che negli USA trovo un albergo, per giunta un marrriott, così scadente. La posizione è abbastanza centrale e vicina alla metro, ma questo non è sufficiente a compensare le anguste e vecchie camere. Che dire.. sono basita... con mio marito arriviamo a tarda sera e ci viene data una camera oscena! Un letto di cm 130 ( misurati!) in una stanza altrettanto piccola con una finestra con un muro davanti. Un bagno allucinante, da terzo mondo!! Al posto del frigo 2 bottigline di acqua messe su uno scrittoio, la manopola dell’acqua fredda in bagno che gira a vuoto e un un’unica asciugamano, insomma una singola. Dato che dovevamo rimanere molti giorni, anche se tardi, scendiamo giù x chiedere il cambio della stanza in quanto non era quella la tipologia acquistata, la nostra prenotazione indicava chiaramente una matrimoniale e quella che ci avevano dato era chiaramente una singola. Insomma non c’è stato niente da fare, x loro quella era una matrimoniale. Vergognoso, una stanza indegna perfino per una stella. Giornalieramente abbiamo chiesto la riparazione della  manopola del lavabo ma mai aggiustata, denti lavati con acqua bollente. Una doccia altrettanto vergognosa con sifone fisso senza neanche la possibilità di regolarne l’altezza, quando era aperta faceva un rumore paragonabile ad un vapore che secondo me si sentiva in tutto il palazzo. Vergogna!! Per non parlare poi del fatto che per una sola notte che ci siamo allontanati x una escursione non ci hanno voluto mantenere i bagagli... vergogna!! Scriverò anche al marriott non è giusto che una catena così prestigiosa debba essere squalificata da cattive gestioni. Evitate questo albergo, a New York ci sono alberghi bellissimi con letti enormi e camere spaziose e con panorami mozzafiato x non parlare dei kit di cortesia... neanche le cuffiette x i capelli!! Noi siamo abbastanza giovani e normotipi, ma mi chiedo se fossimo stati un po’ anziani e con qualche kg in più che facevamo? Dormivamo a turno?? Ma non finisce così...

title: Like a boutique hotel
text:
New York City is like an old open book, you can go anywhere from this midtown hotel, use your legs to walk and your eyes to read! since we are the Bonvoy member, we get free  breakfast, free water, free books to read in the one and only one lounge, even free drinks for happy hour. Room WiFi is free and easy to use, the only one thing I hope to improve is the pillows- new down feather , please!
The cleaning lady forgot to clean our room but the front desk call them to do it and give me a free drink while waiting, thank you Raymond, I’ll come back next time!

title: Great Location.
text: The location is great. Only a few blocks to subway and attractions. It would put it over the top if they had free breakfast and/or happy hour like other hotels of similar value.  Most of the front desk staff is nice, including the bell boy.  If you are a Marriott Bonvoy member and are checking in before normal time, be sure to tell them or "you will not get a room early"  Miraculously a room was available when my travel partner mentioned that she was at silver level after initially not saying anything.

title: Great location
text: The rooms were a little small, but most of NYC hotels are that way. They were clean and the staff was great. The location was pretty nice. If you like to walk, you can get to Times Square. Only a couple blocks from grand central.

title: Small, needs maintenance, noisy
text:
The Good:
- Wifi performance
- Quality of the bed

The Bad:
- Old, old, battered furniture
- Small in every sense. Bath is small even for a 10 year old
- Windows do not keep street noise out, needed ear plugs to sleep (extremely rare for me)
- Wifi wants your personal credentials for free access (NO WAY!)
- No bar, lounge or anything like it.

title: Localização excelente
text:
Além da localização, o funcionário da portaria Daniel é excelente. Trata-se de um brasileiro que se esforça muito para te atender bem. Estive por quatro dias a trabalho no Sheraton. Trata-se de um hotel que teria tudo para ser excelente apesar de ser bem antigo. Quanto ao quarto, não espere que aspirem o tapete ou limpem o chão do banheiro...pois se esperar irá se frustrar. Qualidade da limpeza: sofrível...
Há também um senhor bem alto e calvo na recepção que nitidamente demonstra a sua irritação e falta de educação para qualquer coisa que lhe seja dita ou perguntada que fuja ao seu script...parece um fio descascado pronto a entrar em curto circuito ao menor contato... bastante desagradável!

title: Great spot in the City
text: Booked the Renaissance 57 as a place to stay for 5 nights. We had two rooms, which were perfectly fine - Double bed, nice Bathroom and good room amenities- TV with many channels and Netflix, Aveda products, Tea and Coffee Machine. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly throughout - nothing too much trouble, and it was also a very well run establishment. Clean and tidy place. Location of the hotel was also great for the Lexington Ave, 59th St and 53rd St Metro, as well as Bloomingdales, Tiffanys and Central Park. Not as busy as Times Sq, which worked for us. Also, great for Marathon route as two blocks up from part of the route. Managed to access all the City visitor spots when required with ease as well. Great trip and would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in New York.

title: Excellent Service
text: The staff has a high level of customer service skills. Very helpful from restaurants to upgrading your room! I travel a lot and very reluctant to stay in different hotels. This was my first visit and it will be my “go to hotel for NY next time” Raymond at the front desk is exceptional by giving you his undivided attention and making you feel like you are the only guest. If that was not enough-The Room was super clean! Aveda products in the bathroom. All around great service, clean and coveinently located-

title: Southern Hospitality with New York Flare
text: What a surprise, the Renaissance 57 in New York delivered everything we were expecting and more.  Raymond and the staff were so accommodating, informative and really made this southern family feel at home.  The rooms very adequate, clean and extremely quiet to be in the middle of NY.  Few blocks from Central Park and close to Bloomingdales.  Be sure to have a Cappuccino in the lounge area and take the elevator to the 17th roof top - what a view!  Can wait until our next visit.

title: Great hotel with super friendly staff
text: Staying at the Renaissance 57 tonight and it’s a really nice hotel for the rate and Diana at the front desk was extremely nice, efficient, and frankly just pleasant to deal with after a 4 hour train ride. Also I wish all hotels included a couple of free bottles of water like this one does.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: We loved our 7 day stay at Renaissance, it was near everything we like, perfect for couples and walkers. Comfortable and nearby breakfast at a good price. We would’ve liked some food service in the hotel but it was ok. I would stay again.

title: Better stay elsewhere
text: The hotel is old and tired. I was given a renovated room, which does not mean a lot. The a/c did not cool the room lower than 76F and the noise from the unit is so loud that I could hardly hear the TV. Bad night. Not in line with Marriott standards.

title: Worst service ever
text: We stay at a lot of NY hotels in this price range. We don’t mind the small rooms, which is normal for New York, but we had the worst service here we have ever had. We got no toiletries the first day we were here. When we tried to call to complain, the phone didn’t work.  When we called on our cell phone no one answered. The phone is still not working and it is 3:45 pm the next day and our room has not been made up yet. When we complained to the manager he did nothing except give a rote apology.

title: Amazing stay
text: First trip to NYC and if I ever make it back I hope to stay her again !! Staff so helpful especially Daniel and what a fantastic base to everything ! Rooms super clean and bed so comfy !! Coffee in the foyer a welcome sight in the morning !

title: Great stay, superb service!
text: I was a very happy with my weekend stay at the Renaissance - especially because of the wonderful customer service. I was greeted by the bell man as soon as I stepped out of my Uber who helped me with my luggage. Raymond at the front desk was particularly excellent. He was super nice and welcoming.. gave me suggestions of near by eateries. He provided excellent customer service all around. This hotel is very lucky to have him! Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Motel 6 Quality
text: I was not happy with the room. It was very small. There was about a 2 foot clearance between the end of the beds and the walls. Lights switches did not work. One of the blinds was not functioning correctly. The mattress sagged. (For the price I paid for 2 nights, I paid for a new one.) The air conditioning was loud. Bathroom fan was not working. The TV volume was defective. Everything looked beat-up and worn/old.

title: Excellent Service
text: Raymond and Jennie at the front desk were extremely accommodating and helpful when my family was checking in. They went the extra mile to make sure all the room types matched the different requests. I can't thank them enough and would highly recommend the hotel. It was very charming and centrally located

title: overpriced
text: Extremely disappointed. Trip Advisor seems to be be editing my review.  Too expensive, No amenetes, not even a coffee bar.  Dark interior.  Why would you stay here when you could stay in a better hotel for less of a price.  Marriott is taking advantage of its members.

title: Perfect Location - Good Rooms
text: This hotel is in the perfect NYC location. I was able to walk to Plaza Hotel, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Hotel rooms were decent sized but be aware this hotel does not have the typical amenities you would expect from a Renaissance. If you are ok with that then this is a great hotel.

title: A wonderful surprise!
text:
After living in NYC for many years, I adjust my expectations for NYC hotels and usually understand that there are compromises in space and that the buildings are generally older. 

However, I was pleasantly surprised at the size and quality of the room. Service is top-notch and the location is close to everything. I plan to continue to stay here when traveling to NYC for business or visiting friends. 

Thank you to the Renaissance team for a great stay!

title: Tourisme
text:
Hotel tres bien placé, propre. Climatisation tres tres bruyante. Affreux. Mal insonorisé. Chaque jour il manque reassort de the ou gobelets ou cafe ou savon jamais parfait. 
Personnel souriant mais c'est tout : on nz peut avoir aucun service. Nous avions un probleme de telephone et souhaitions appeler en local une personne = refus, imprimer un email de reservation navette pour notre départ = refus aussi. Ils disent la poste pas loin... Sans compter l'absence d'explications pour joindre la réception de la chambre.
Le reveil pas mis à 0.
A part emplacement rien à retenir !!!! 👎

title: Posizione ottima
text:
L'Hotel si presenta in una posizione molto buona sulla 57th street, vicino alla fermata della metro, molto vicino a Central Park ed alla 5th Av.
La struttura è un po' datata, l'assenza dei doppi vetri fa sì che si senta il rumore del traffico anche dal 13 piano; la stanza l'ho trovata molto pulita ma senza il mini BAR.
Diciamo che per essere un Hotel a 5 stelle mi sarei aspettato di più, ma evidentemente la classificazione non è paragonabile a quella europea.
Ad ogni modo lo consiglio.

title: Amazing hospitality!
text:
We stayed at Renaissance 57 for our mini honeymoon! Let’s start from day 1: Daniel the bell boy was amazing! He gave us great directions on how to use the subway and he gave us a lot of recommendations on non tourist places to check out. Raymond checked us and made sure we had a great room! The room had an amazing soaking tub and a great view of Lexington Ave. Day 2: Jose and another bell hop guy I can’t remember his name but he was SO amazing. They kindly held the door for me with a huge smile every time! They were great guys all around. Day 3: Stumbled in a bit intoxicated and the front desk guy was great!!! Very welcoming and was nice! Day 4: Check our! We hated to leave this hotel because the staff was absolutely amazing. From the moment we checked in till the moment we checked out the entire process was stress free! 

I would like to give special attention to Raymond. Raymond went above and beyond. Raymond was simply amazing. He had a hand written front and back list of restaurants for us to check out. He made a difference in our trip. He made sure we were happy with our room and everything you could imagine. It’s employees like Raymond that make or break a business and I can’t get over how awesome he was!!! He was so friendly at all hours of the day and he was very helpful. When we return to NYC next year we plan on only staying at Renaissance 57. 

Don’t forget about the absolutely amazing rooftop terrace they have. The rooftop offers gorgeous views of Lexington Ave! Not enough guests take advantage of this terrace. You are able to bring up drinks and snacks and have a nice romantic evening up there. 

The entire staff was great. I am forgetting a few of the women’s names but everyone was wonderful!

Courtney

title: Lackluster Hotel in Top Location
text: Staff was friendly and helpful, but the hotel was otherwise lackluster.  Despite being in an historic building, the hotel was over-modernized and stripped of all its character.  My dreary room, while large, lacked furniture and instead had a series of floor-to-ceiling wood cabinets that resembled the AA Admirals Club lounge at LGA.   There was only one nightstand, but lots of less-than-useful cabinetry.  Lighting in the bedroom area is via small low-voltage spotlights and very dim.  And you need two keys here, a white one (NFC) for the room and a black one (magnetic stripe) for the elevator.  The black key demagnetizes itself just from looking at it.   In four days, I had to have it reprogrammed three times, just to ride the elevator!  Definitely not one of Marriott’s better properties, but the location at 57th and Lexington is its main selling point.  Will I stay here again?   Only if the price is right.

title: Very nicely designed and decorated room
text: I spent one night here during a quick trip to NYC.  Two blocks from the subway stop at 59th and Lexington where I hopped off the E train from JFK.  The lobby experience is sort of non-existent; check-in and a few seats.  But the check-in was memorable because the young lady who helped me remembered my name the following day when I checked out; very unusual in New York.  My corner room on the 8th floor was lovely.  Very nice design and very nice decor.  Large bathroom with window, small sofa, comfortable bed, three windows wrapping around the corner.  I could not have been more comfortable.  There is no food-service or beverage service in the hotel and that is odd.  But guests are invited to bring their own to the hotel's 17th floor deck.  I would return for the nice room experience.

title: Not Up to Par
text:
I travel a lot for business and pleasure so I stay in a lot of hotels AND my best friend is a room manager at a Marriot so I am very familiar with the hotel brand.  HOWEVER, this hotel which I DID stay in before was not up to par.  

The ONLY person I would exempt from this is Raymond.  Check in was quick and easy and as my handicapped cousin was joining me for one night I had requested a larger bed even though I had booked a queen.  Unfortunately it was downhill from there.

The room was fine but the tub was slow to drain, no robes in the rooms that needed two trips from housekeeping.  Hairs found on the bed.  And Ive visited nyc frequently so Im aware of the noise level but it was unbearably loud.  I could not get ANY sleep as there was construction and drilling right outside.  The windows do not filter ANY noise.  Diane from the front desk said there were NO rooms until 3pm which was fine so down we go at 3pm and waited for the room we were reassigned to be ready.  

We go up and its a queen bed.  So back down we go and Im told "sorry, the construction is the city, its not our fault." I asked if there were any king beds on a higher floor and got "sorry, you should have actually been charged for a bigger bed." As Im about to reach in my bag for my wallet, I get "We have no king beds available as theyre all booked. Theres one other but its the same floor and still likely loud" Sorry but what a load of crap.  So Im told I have to pay, which I was readily able to do and even if I was, there was no availability? 

This hotels standards are NOT up to par and with the supply of nice hotels in midtown youre better picking a different one. My stays at Warwick, Intercontinental, and Lex were are superior to Ren57.

Im sure the usual response of "we apologize and hope to make your stay better next time" is what Ill get but listen to me and the other reviewers here, there is no accountability and no effort to make your stay comfortable except condescension. I leave two stars instead of one because of Raymond who was nothing short of courteous and professional.

title: Excellent location & great staff
text:
I am so pleased with my stay at this Renaissance hotel in NY. It's my second time around and I don't regret it at all! 
The location is excellent and the staff is very dedicated. Special thanks to Lucy & Daniel for making my stay an enjoyable one. See you soon!

title: Very nice stay!
text: Stayed with my daughter for 4 nights. My flight was cancelled the first night due to a storm in NY. The Front Office manager (Steve) was very kind and accommodated the changes in my reservation. Thank you! The location was great, and the room & bathroom were very clean! The housekeeping was efficient and very sweet. The best part about my stay in this hotel was Raymond! He was simply AMAZING! I felt so lucky to be checked in by him. Raymond was able to suggest delicious places to eat, and great places to check out around the city. I nominate him for one of the Best New York Ambassadors. As well, I'd like to thank William for also being so sweet with us too. I LOVED the location as well!

title: Reasonable price for a decent hotel
text: Stayed with my family of 4 for a long weekend. Room is large but a little dated and in need of update. Fine for our needs just not outstanding. Be sure to ask for a walk in shower if you cannot handle climbing into a very deep tub. No restaurant, although decent diner next door and lots of close by options. No real lobby either, but that wasn’t a huge need for our group. Beds are comfy and nice to have aveda shower products. Location is walkable to Times Square, Central Park and not in the chaos of the super touristy area. Valet parking is 60$ but convenient.

title: Dirty bathroom
text: Checked into the room today and found strands of hair in the tub and sink. The front desk sent housekeeping right away, but it still makes me wonder whether there is other mess lying around. Hotel did not even offer to change the room. You expect more out of a 4-star establishment. Do better.

title: Great hotel and great staff!!
text: I have stayed at many marriotts but this is probably my favorite now. It was my first time staying and right when I walked in I noticed how nice the hotel seemed. The lobby is pretty and service was so easy to check in. Water bottles in room are complimentary. My room was so nice. I was on the 15th floor and my room felt like a mini studio apartment. The bathroom is separate further back in the room separated by a wooden sliding door and the shower is really spacious. The view from my room was also pretty which is rare. Usually you are just looking at the back of a building. I needed a few things during my stay like a wine opener toothpaste a shower cap and everything was quickly delivered my room. Also the man behind the front desk during my stay, Raymond was really a gem. He couldn’t have been more helpful. Offered me a later checkout offered suggestions for dinner lunch directions etc. offered to let me check bags for the day after checkout and the list just  goes on. It really adds to an experience when the staff are so nice and welcoming.  Highly recommend. I will be back!!

title: Great staff and perfect location
text: My girlfriend and I are in NYC very often and have stayed in many different hotels in Manhattan (mostly Marriott brands). Our stay at the Renaissance Hotel 57 however was our best hotel experience in the city so far. Steve and his staff are extremely friendly, supportive and made us feel very welcome. The design of the newly renovated lobby and lounge are typical for Renaissance hotels and really make you feel at home. The rooms are a little old fashioned but are very clean, the bed was really comfortable and our room was very spacious for Manhattan standards. We especially loved the rooftop terrace which is a real jewel in this location. We can’t wait to come back!

title: awesome front desk people
text: William at the front desk was so welcoming. He knew it was our anniversary and did some special things for us. The hotel is in a great location. It's very clean. Our stay was great! The continental breakfast was also great.

title: Outstanding customer service
text: 1000% recoomend this location. The whole staff were so friendly and professional! The hotel was super clean and cozy. You will look at the building from outside and think it's a small hotel, but the room was very spacious and we couldn't believe the bathroom and shower! So fancy and nice. Beds were really comfortable ( I have sleeping issue and can't sleep on any kind of mattresses). Everything was 10 out of 10 for this hotel. I will always go back here if I am visiting NY.

title: why do i stay here...
text: I stay because of the location to the businesses I visit.  But the hotel is dark and the rooms really lacking.  The front desk staff is marginal and not helpful especially when it comes to a billing issue.  The doormen however are great and help with baggage and getting cabs and ubers to the right spot for picking up.  Marriott should be ashamed of this property in their Renaissance brand.  But overall in New York City, unless it is the JW or the Ritz, most Marriott properties have a lot of issues. Hilton/Hyatt or independent hotels may be better choices for a more pleasant stay.

title: Not a 4 star hotel...
text: Unfortunately the hotel despite a good liaison and a good brand is very below par , old rooms,  inadequate facilities in the room,  old furniture and a bathroom from the 70s. Very off putting !! Oh... and we have booked a "superior" room.

title: Great Stay as Always
text:
This is my wife's favorite hotel in NYC and is quickly becoming mine.  We have stayed here 4 times in the past 2 years and the service is exceptional.  I estimate that I have spent approximately 350 nights in hotels in my life and Raymond at the Front Desk is by far the best/nicest employee I have ever encountered (everyone at the front desk and bell staff were great!).

The rooms with terraces are awesome.  We stayed in 1505 and Raymond arranged for the fold-out bed to be made up as well as bringing in an extra bed when we had an extra child in the room.  I can't say enough about this hotel and the staff.

title: New York Hospitality at its BEST
text: I travel quite a bit for business but I have never received such gracious service. Raymond and Serge were manning the front desk and promptly offered me a cold bottle of water on a very hot summer day.  They were terrific in recommending dining places in the area and genuinely made me feel at home.  The hotel is clean, the location great, the bed comfortable but the service really made this hotel stand out.  Who said New Yorkers aren't friendly?

title: Ótima localização
text: Pontos positivos: localização, próximo ao Central Park, 5 avenida, comércio e restaurantes sem o tumulto da Times Square. Quartos são um pouco pequenos p os padrões americanos. Banho de chuveiro muito bom. Não possui restaurante.

title: Nice hotel
text: We stayed for a week at this hotel. We had 2 rooms. Although they are small rooms they are clean and have all you need. The staff were very helpful. Disappointed to be told on check in the roof top bar is no longer there. Just 2 tables and a few chairs. Sad really as the weather was great and an evening on the roof would have been nice. You can take your own food and drink up and hope for s seat. On check out we had a 2.5 hour wait for our transfer and asked for the tv to be on but they said it can’t be turned on. Almost a reception close down for July 4th. Service wasn’t there. Felt let down. We wanted to watch the England v Sweden ladies football.

title: Raymond
text: Excellent location. Super friendly and helpfully team. Raymond at reception has lot’s of recommendations for restaurants in the area and the best way to buy tickets for the broadway shows. Try the 17th floor for the view over Mid town Manhatten.

title: Extra Friendly reception!
text:
All the receptionist were very nice. However, Mr  William was extra very helpful, friendly and willing. He answered many questions that we had regarding the stay, security, transportation, sightseeing etc. 

We will definitely stay at the hotel again for next travel to NY. (good location with reasonable price).

But, Housekeeping could be improved. (Some funky smell when we first checked-In).

title: Comfortable New York Hotel
text: We stayed here for one night on a Groupon deal and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a good location for access to Mid-Town and Upper East Side, in a nice neighborhood, walkable to many attractions. We had a room with two full size beds which had fairly comfortable pillows. The lighting in the bathroom was good with bright lighting and the towels were nice. We would stay here again.

title: Get the Balcony
text: Sat night stay 3pm arrival, front desk is very friendly.  I booked a queen balcony mainly for the balcony and was impressed.  Room seemed extra small but very clean and bathroom seemed oversized compared to room.  Since there is no restaurant and executive lounge is closed on weekends Marriott Platinum got us extra points.  Balcony is big with table and 2 chairs and housekeeping must keep it clean, no bird poop or garbage.  We made good use of balcony had drinks and snacks in the evening before dinner.  Go to Essa Bagels really early to avoid lines and stop at Dunkin Donuts for coffee and enjoy it on the balcony before your neighbors wake up.  My balcony encompassed 3 rooms each separated by low walls see pics.  I’m glad we ate early since people in room next to us were out on their balcony smoking shortly after.  I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Best service and hotel!
text: What a great hotel! Very happy with how clean it is. The service is top notch! The front desk staff William and Diana were so welcoming and helpful. The manager on duty at the time upgraded us to a larger room and personally walked us to it to make sure we were pleased with it. Thank you for helping make this a great vacation so far!

title: Nice hotel in midtown NYC
text: We stayed here when attending a gala at The Park Avenue Armory. This was a great location, convenient and walking distance to much of what we needed. The room we stayed in was a Junior Suite, so it was a little bigger than a normal NYC hotel room, very nice for 2 tall people who normally feel cramped otherwise. Our room, while located near an elevator, was quiet and peaceful. No problems checking in or out, and valet parking was easy.

title: Great location near lots of subway lines
text:
This hotel has a great location near shopping (Bloomingdale’s is just two blocks away) and its central location makes it easy to head uptown to the Met or the Guggenheim or downtown or to Brooklyn. 
The room was spacious by New York standards and had beautiful wood paneling - seemingly vintage. The bathroom had been redone but there was no fan so it really fogged up. Also, the weird sink was designed so you couldn’t fit your water bottle under it to refill it. Nice Aveda products. Plenty of towels. 
The staff was friendly and efficient. The roof terrace was a beautiful spot. Too bad it’s not a bar anymore. 
There’s not a restaurant but the Palace diner is two doors down the street for a typical diner breakfast or a quick bite.

title: Good location nice staff hotel a bit tired
text:
Over all it was a pleasent  stay. We stayed a corner room on thec12th floor and although you knew you were in NYC it was not noisy. The lighting is a bit dim and the plugins for your phone etc was present it was only on one side. We travel light and if you take out the ice bucket and coffee  maker  there was enough shelves in the closet. The house  keeper forgot to clean the room one night. My wife called the desk for towels and it took repeated calls and 45 minutes  to get them  a pain as we had an appointment  and then had to rush. The location of the hotel is good as it is away from the busier streets but still close to central park and about a mile from the theater  district. 
  We are titanium members and although they have a comfortable  lounge the food etc is not what I expect from the Renaissance or the Marriott. I know this a level 5 but I have had better food in a springhill suite.

title: Titanium downgrade followed by dishonesty
text:
I will tell you my story and you decide if you want to stay here.

I am a titanium member.   I booked the highest category room, a skyloft suite, on the Marriott website at a regular rate.   I arrived today with my family and was told at checkin that I was “upgraded” to a carriage house suite.  

When I arrived in the 5th floor room I found a small two room suite with no Terrasse or view and small windows.   I called the front desk, and the agent there assured me that my suite was the same category and same size as the sky loft suite. I asked to be changed to the room that I had booked, and she kept me on hold for about five minutes until the manager came on. He then explained to me that there had been a pipe break in the sky loft suite and that it was not possible to put anyone there.

I wonder whether there is only one. I doubt it.

He assured me that the carriage house suite and skyloft suite are the same size, and the only differences is no Terrace.  He offered me 35,000 points compensation for the circumstances and apologized that the front desk people didn’t tell the truth. I had little time today and was with my wife and daughter so had no other choice but to accept.

Tonight I looked at the website and it turns out, unsurprisingly, that the carriage house suite is 36 m² and the skyloft suite is 51 m².

Bottom line, I was downgraded, will be charged the same amount for the higher category room, and misled twice. First at the front desk who tried to pitch this to me as an upgrade. And then by the manager who assured me the suites were the same size.

The room decor is decent and location fine, but that does not remotely make up for this treatment.

title: Treated Like Family
text:
I travel a lot for work and play and most hotel experiences are generic and fairly forgettable.  Arrive, check in, get key, leave.  If you are lucky, you might get a smile or a hello from the staff. 

The staff at the Renaissance 57 does not fit this mold.  Everyone, from the front desk staff to the bell staff to the management treats you like family.  I've found, in particular, Diana and Lucy are just amazing.  Such friendly and kind people.  

I only go to this hotel perhaps once every few months, however I am greeted like I am there each week.  Everyone knows my name and I get such a warm welcome. 

Full disclosure--I am a Marriott lifetime titanium member.  However, I don't feel that I would be treated any differently if I had no status--the whole team just creates an overall friendly atmosphere.  

Other than customer service, the hotel stands out for location.  If you are heading to Central Park, Columbus Circle, upper Manhattan--the location is perfect.  It's away from the insanity of Times Sq and Midtown without being too far.  There is a Whole Foods blocks away and a ton of local "non touristy" restaurants. 

The hotel is in a historic building, giving it character.  If you want sleek, glass, modern rooms, this is not your place.  However, if you want interesting rooms that are all slightly different with amazing bathtubs--come here!  I have also had the pleasure of occasionally being upgraded to their balcony rooms.  You never want to leave that balcony with the views and atmosphere. 

I rarely write reviews, since I feel like everyone is so different with what they like in a hotel.  However, the staff at the Ren57 impresses me so much that I just HAD to give them a public compliment.

title: Comodidad y ubicación sin desperdicios.
text:
Todo en el hotel estuvo magnífico. La ayuda que nos brindaron acomodando a toda la familia en el mismo piso y resolviendo inconvenientes de último momento fue de gran ayuda. 
El desayuno es completo y sabroso y la atención muy eficiente.
Daniel especialmente se prestó muy amable y estaba pendiente de todos nuestros requerimientos. 
Gracias miles, esperamos volver pronto.

title: Ótimo Hotel
text: Fui a trabalho para NYC e a empresa reservou o hotel. Já conheço a rede de outras viagens e adorei esse de NYC. É menor que os outros que já fiquei mas mesmo assim bem aconchegante. Deu um problema na minha reserva e me realocaram um dia para um hotel próximo. Eles não souberam me especificar o tipo de erro mas como forma de pedir desculpas, me colocaram no melhor quarto, com uma varanda incrível e vista pra o Chrysler building. Um elogio em especial ao Raymond que foi muito gentil.

title: Couples retreat - best time!
text: We visited the Renaissance NYC on 57th street with 2 other couples and truly had a blast. The location was absolutely perfect as we knew it would be steps away to the all that we had planned. Shopping at the infamous Bloomingdale's and iconic landmarks like Central Park and St. Patrick's Cathedral along with excellent restaurants made for a perfect location. The service of the hotel was very good and came across many exceptional employees who made our visit memorable. I wish I could remember all of their names but one employee in particular who we cannot forget was Jay from the housekeeping staff. He was kind and truly expressed a genuine care for making sure we were provided with everything we had asked for. We happen to come across him 3 times during our stay and each time he would stop to ensure we were enjoying our stay. The 2 other couples also enjoyed Jay and referred to him as our gentle giant.  for being tall and kind. Well done to the hotel and look forward to coming back again soon.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
Jose Rosado is extraordinary - he knows NYC better than most.

Jose always has great ideas for dinner,locations,sightseeing and more important transportation around NYC.

Jose is laser focused on customer service day in and day out - and always greets guests with a smile and making you like a valued guest

title: Good hotel
text: Room was clean. Great front desk assistance. Good location. Very happy with my stay. Be sure to note the square footage of rooms and bed sizes when booking. Netflix on the TV. My only complaint was no coffee in lobby on weekends. There’s a Starbucks right around the corner!

title: Are. You. Kidding. Me.
text:
I always like to start with positive, when I have a more, how should I say? "constructive" review....so let's go with positive. Very kind, professional, efficient staff at front desk, door, and the lounge. Everyone with whom I interacted was wonderful and service-oriented. Also, everything in my room was functioning, clean, and relatively modern. They don't have room service, but I actually didn't mind going to their little lounge to get my glass of wine - it was cheaper and they were fine with either staying there or making me feel welcome to take it back to my room. My room was noisy with street noise, and I was on the first guest room floor, so there was a lot machine noise from below, but I get it - I booked my room late; it's NYC; etc.

Now. I know that I booked my room 2 days before my stay. I know that it's mid-town Manhattan, and 2 blocks from Central Park. I know that with those factors, I might expect to pay a premium. And I know space is valuable in NYC and rooms can be on the smaller side compared to other cities. So please don't think I'm naive about what's reasonable. That's not my complaint. My objection is that the hotel even sells the room I had (and I have to assume many others the same size). It was MINISCULE. My room was a double bed, with literally ONLY room to walk around the bed on all sides. Maybe 2 feet on each side - maybe. (Plus a tiny bathroom, where you had to climb around the sink to get in the tub/shower.) I am not exaggerating. I like to do yoga when I travel, and the only place I had any room was from the room door to the bed (which was just the depth of the bathroom), and in that space, there was not sufficient room to extend my arms. 

A room like this should not exist to stay in....AND CERTAINLY NOT FOR OVER $700/NIGHT.

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
We were somewhat conflicted in our opinion of this hotel. Overall, we felt that it did not measure up to the standard that we have come to expect at a Renaissance property.

Our first room looked tired. There were no curtains just simple Venetian blinds, no pictures or wall decorations, and most importantly, no drawers and very limited storage space at all. The lighting was not very effective, especially for reading in bed. The bathroom had been renovated, but still had limitations. The sink had no stopper and the bath/shower no grab bars and a smooth tub bottom. The staff did, however, provide, upon request, a bath mat to mitigate the danger. The toilet had to be replaced as it did not evacuate even after multiple flushes. Finally, the room was very noisy, with street noise and sirens throughout the night. These noises were not diminished as there were only Venetian blinds on the windows.

Now, the good. Firstly, the staff. They were friendly and accommodating to our requests. They offered useful advice for dining and transportation to the airport on departure. They also accommodated our request for a change of room to a quieter location, which they effected efficiently. The room was on a higher floor on a quieter side and the windows had noise dampening curtains. Unlike the initial room, there was sufficient storage space, including drawers and effective lighting, a great improvement. For our visit, we found the location to be excellent, central to the attractions that we wanted to visit from Broadway, to Fifth Avenue, to the "Museum Mile".

The hotel was under some renovations, which we hope will extend to the rooms and return it to the Renaissance class.

title: Good stay with nice staff
text: Enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance. Clean room, short distance to the most attractions, more quiet neighborhood compared to further down town. Nice people at reception with Serge and Slavic helping us find directions, fix taxi and general small talk.

title: Excellent Service!!
text: We stayed 2 nights at the Renaissance. The service Raymond provided us was exceptional. I stay in Marriotts close to 150 nights a year and Raymond went above and beyond making sure we were fully accommodated the length of our stay.

title: Could not have been more pleased with the hotel's location and outstanding service.
text:
My wife and I celebrated our anniversary in NYC and were very pleased with our choice of this hotel. 

The room we checked into did not match the description when I reserved it, and when I brought this to the attention of Katherine, the manager on duty, she was extremely apologetic.  She moved us into the best room in the hotel - with a king bed, 2-3 times the space, windows on three sides, and a large, private terrace.  The room could not have been better.  Very clean, spacious bathroom, beautifully appointed. Beautiful hardwood floors. See photos! 

The hotel is located within an easy walk to the subway, near Central Park, and surrounded by great restaurants, close to great stores.  The terrace was spacious and had great views down E. 57th Street and Lexington Ave.

In addition to Katherine, we also appreciated the great service by Danny, who helped us with our bags upon arrival, and Raymond at the front desk, who was helpful to us throughout our stay.

The hotel's proximity to the subway made our getting around really easy and enabled  us to make the most of a holiday weekend getaway.

title: NYC Vacation
text:
My husband and I just stayed at this lovely hotel again. This is our third stay. We keep coming back because of the great location, clean rooms and amazing staff! We love Serge. He has made our stay so enjoyable. He always remembers our names. He makes us feel welcome with a nice smile and suggestions for dining or things going on in the city. 
We will be back in the Fall. Thank you Serge!! You made another exceptional Holiday for us!!! 😊

title: A Comedy of Errors - not funny
text:
I have stayed at this property a few times and it was always adequate for my needs. I needed tone in NYC on April 1 and called that morning and reserved a room for that night. Everything was fine until I got a voicemail later that morning stating they mistakingly made my reservation for March 31 (a date that had already passed) and that they had no availability for the night of April 1 and would delete my reservation. Ok fine - I decided I would just drive that 1.5 hours home after my appointment.

Fast forward to my credit card which was charged for the night of March 31! I phoned the property which claimed they had no record. I called Marriott directly who then phoned the property and that went no better. They gave me an email address at the property to contact and that person never responded. 

I am a very long-time Marriott 'Elite Member' who will now be looking for alternatives and canceling my Marriott VISA Card. Beware making reservations at this property (and other Marriott properties given their not-so-long-ago data breach)!

title: Love this hotel
text: Always love staying at the Renaissance Hotel 57. Hotels location is great, and the staff is awesome especially Serge Lambert. He is always in the best moods and always makes me feel welcome. Love this place.

title: New York Vacation
text:
My wife and I have stayed at this wonderful hotel 3 times in the last year. We always stay for 9 nights. We feel so comfortable do to the accommodating staff. Serge, is the most incredible!! He is so gracious and hospitable. Every time we have a question about dining reservations or various things to do around the area, he has an answer. He makes us feel  SO welcome! The hotel is in a very convenient location, just blocks away. 
We will return and stay here again, as we feel that Serge makes us feel right at home!!! Really, this is our home away from home because of him!! Thank you!!!

title: The prefect home base
text: We loved our room. We loved the attention paid to us by the staff. In particular William Bravo was great checking us in and looking out for us throughout our three night stay. Everything we needed was a simple walk away. Food. Shipping a package. A Whole Foods Grocery.

title: First Class
text: The service and hospitality here are First Class all the way every time. Diana and William at the front desk are incredible in the way they greet you with a smile and the 5 star service you get the minute you walk in the door. I have stayed at this hotel several times so far this year and every time i am even more impressed at how they stop at nothing to insure you fell welcome. Lastly Danny at the front door has to be one of the most exceptional persons i have ever meet. No matter if you travel for business or leisure i highly recommend that you stay here if you want to have a First Class  experience from the most First Class Team. Thank you.

title: 5 stars for Daniel !! always gives the best service!!
text: Hi- the hotel is a bit outdated, slow elevators, dark rooms, and key snafus. But love the location. Daniel M the bellman gives extraordinary service and not only takes care of the bags but orders the car service for trips to LGA. He makes it all worthwhile with a smile! Will be back

title: Kinda nice,but......pricey
text: My niece was part of an event recently in NYC.  Myself and 3 other family members stayed Friday overnight there. I paid @ $350 plus $60 for parking.  We had a room that was way too small with 2 queen beds in  it.  Room was neat and clean but we had no room to move around in it. There was no lighting in the room except for the 1 lamp on the nightstand.  Imagine 4 women trying to get dressed at once in a cramped unlit room!   The location of the hotel was not bad. Overall The staff was very nice and attentive and the experience wasn’t bad. Next time we may have to cough up a few more bucks for a suite there or go to a motel.

title: Хороший отель
text: Большой плюс отеля - его месторасположение. Самый центр - рядом куча магазинов, ресторанов, метро и все туристические места. При этом, достаточно тихое место. Завтраки весьма скромные, но достойные. Входит в цепочку Marriott.

title: Nothing works
text: The bed was comfortable and the desk agents were friendly. I did have issues with things not working, however. My room key had to be replaced twice because it stopped working. I didn’t have it near other cards that would demagnetise it so it was a mystery. The conference room key never worked despite replacing it twice. The television was not hooked up. The room phone would not connect to the front desk so I used my cell to call and have the TV fixed. It was repaired quickly and with a smile. I have just never had so many issues and time is valuable on business trips. The real plus was that the hotel staff were friendly and did try to help.

title: 3 nights in New York
text:
Great hotel, decent size rooms for city centre hotel and a lovely stay. The beds were amazing, we slept really well. The tv has Netflix built in, if that’s important to you!  We didn’t have breakfast in the hokey as there are a few places nearby like cafe olympia and little Collins. They do great coffee and muffins. 
We booked a double room for myself and my son as that was all that was available on Expedia. When we arrived the hotel concierge look at us, adult and 15 year old son and said, you have only one bed, let me see if we can give you 2 beds. This was done quickly and we found ourselves with 2 double beds. 

Many thanks, we had a great time in New York and would love to come back to you.

title: Very nice staying
text:
It is my second time choosing this hotel. Very good location. Rooms are comfy and big. Special thanks to Raymond helped us change room to a better one! And he remind us that we have breakfast included in my room package. We could definitely come back because of the perfect 6 nights staying and Raymond’s warm smile! 
写了半天英文说提交不了？！
这边挺好的 性价比高 房间算大的了 而且比较安静的区域 前台的Raymon特别好 第一晚有点噪音没睡好 也是因为时差 他马上帮我换到了别的好的房间 更敞亮了 早餐也还行 没什么太多选择 但是比较健康啦 又方便

title: Leave for lack of restaurant stay for the outlandish lack of concern for their elite guests
text:
So after a 5 hour flight where I had just received  a standing ovation for defending the delta attendants from a terrible customer - I made my way to my first stay at the Renaissance 57 in New York - a “full service hotel.”  Upon arriving I was told the bar is closed but I asked about room service as this is a Renaissance after all and all Renaissance’s have restaurants as opposed to their 20 lower level sister properties, and was told it was closed and they had noted that on the app when i made the reservation.  Disappointed i headed to my room but decided to check the app where there wasn’t a single notification of this in the booking process.  Nothing I love better than a customer service LIE.  I went back down figuring I could walk to get a snack but stopped by the desk pretty irate and hangry at this point.  Front desk guy continues lying who called his manager over who was completely dismissive of the situation saying it was on the site, completely forgetting the app lie.  When i said your company encourages people to book on the app, she could care less and told me to call customer service .  I asked to use the phone and she told me that’s for customers (I guess Lifetime titanium elite doesn’t make me one).   When I mentioned there’s no minibars and I’d like A soda I was told the bar has them but closed 5 mins earlier so no dice.  Great information and effort.  

Rudeness up and down and when I called the 800 # was put on a 20 minute hold  - all this time missing food and my chance to work in the my room.  30 minutes later I returned with food from another hotel (not that they would offer to go get for me).

Hands down - THE WORST 4-star experience I have ever had.  Everyone i know will know to never stay here - this hotel is an embarrassment to the Renaissance and Marriott name, an insult to hotel employees everywhere and a black stain on Marriotts technology.

Good job Marriott!  WAIT - how do I really feel????

title: New York trip
text: The hotel is very nice, rooms are large for New York and modern. The location was close to Central Park. We did not have a lot of interaction with the staff. But the lady who did the breakfast was lovely. Yes I would stay in this hotel group again.

title: Great location, very clean and modern, and super staff!
text: This was our first stay at this hotel and we chose it given the close proximity to our son's new apartment.  We were greeted by amazing staff (specific shout out to Raymond and Oiana!), were impressed by the quality of the recent renovations, and were especially pleased with the free upgrade to a suite that we received.  Overall great experience and would definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel in a great location! Compliments to Serge!
text:
The service at the hotel, amenities (for the price), and its location are first-rate. The service was quick to help, thoughtful, and hospitable. My compliments to Serge, who helped my family and I numerous times and was always congenial!

I used the gym 3 times and found everything there that I needed (e.g., free weights, weight equipment, treadmills). 

I would recommend this hotel for both tourists and business travelers.

title: good location not so great room
text:
first time in newyork, location was great everything was with in walking distances, tube was not so far 2 minuet walk at a max, bloomingdales was on your door step.
