staff - as tourist coming from london we needed a little help with suggestions and bookings, when we asked reception for help with a booking we was told they do not run a concierge service, which i totally understand but also came across quiet rude.

Room - was very small me and my partner were fighting for space as it was a small double! rooms were cleaned daily but the bathroom and shower wasnt very nice looking a bit dated VERY SMALL the whole apartment was tiny and squashed for place.

i would reccomend this as a business night stay not for tourist.

oh yeah there was also a $300 deposit which i never read before booking nor was it in any of the booking confirmations annoying so had no idea till check in... and i got a surpise charge of $5 from the hotel which they never sent me an email to why i was chrged for this.

for £200 a night i felt it was a total let down.

wouldnt stay again

title: Felt like home
text:
I was there for business. I missed being home and the staff made me feel much better about that. It was amazingFrom the food to the bar to the room I really enjoyed this the hidden bathroom a lot I highly recommend that you stay here
Serge,Jose, Danny,Daniel,Kathy,Lucy,Diana, Maggie and Elizabeth and Kathy

title: Serves the Purpose
text: The staff at the hotel is very friendly.  Hotel is clean and location was great for me but location in NYC depends on where you need to be.   It is a short walk to the 53rd or 59th street stations.  I always consider Renaissance a little more upscale than a regular full service Marriott.   Not the case here.   Didn’t really that they don’t have a restaurant.   In NY with so many choices who wants to eat in a hotel.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet even on the 8th floor.   But then hotel is definitely tired and rooms are in need of renovation.  Our room had virtually no lighting.   We had one small lamp, and limited light in the closet area.   Literally had to use the flashlight on the cell phone to see things in the closet or safe.   There were no working entrance hall lights and none of the switches alongside the bed controlled anything.  For a king superior  room it was very small.  There was no recognition of my platinum status or was any of my preferences even noted or recognized.  The best thing about this hotel was that I was able to check the reservation regularly on line and the total price dropped $150 for the 3 nights after my initial booking.   Wouldn’t stay again unless they renovate the rooms.

title: Girls weekend
text:
Christina, Raymond, Serena thanks for a great weekend. You took good care of us. Room and bathroom were nice sized especially compared to some of the small hotel rooms in New York. It seems silly to say but there shower was refreshing and well appointed. 
Adorable rooftop sitting area. After dinner we bought dessert and sat up there. Enjoyed the view and the peace and quiet. Who knew we were in the middle of New York?
I will definitely return the next tome I’m in New York. The picture attached is the view from the roof.

title: Nice - almost a boutique hotel
text: This is a nice hotel. It has the feel of a boutique hotel with the full features (hotel points for example) of a typical Renaissance hotel. It's in a nice part of town - maybe 2 blocks from good shopping, restaurants and mid-town businesses.

title: Great Hotel, Great Customer and very central location
text:
This hotel was a very pleasant surprise to my wife and I. Having lived in manhattan and visited several times, I have always stayed at the Westin near Grand Central..However, Raymond & Diana were really nice. As a titanium elite member, we did get an upgrade. The gym was a decent size and efficient. (Would've preferred a peloton or two) :)

The hotel is located very close to the 59th and lexington (off the 6 train), which makes its very ideal..Definitely would stay here again over the Westin, because the customer service at the Westin is quite poor...

title: Great Hotel!!
text: Amazing location, clean, and beatiful!! Diana was so helpful and kind! She upgraded us and made us feel at home. The lobby was tastefully done and the seating area passed the lobby was so beatiful and comfortable. Our room had a balcony and an amazing view! The fitness center was big and very clean. Great hotel!!

title: Thank you for the amazing hospitality!
text: Thank you Diana, Serge, Raymond and the entire staff at the hotel! You made my entire week’s stay special with your inviting personalities and eagerness to help as well suggesting best restaurant great restaurants and more. It is individuals like you that make our trips memorable. I will definitely be back again. Keep smiling and doing wonderful work :-)

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
It is very rare that I give something 5* but I loved this hotel. It's not the biggest of hotels so if you're wanted some of the extras that come with that kind of thing then this is perhaps not for you. The bar and lounge area was small but lovely and relaxing, I especially liked the quirky hidden bathroom- thank you William for helping me find it!
I stayed here with my husband and 15yr old son for 4 nights. The room was spacious for a city hotel and absolutely spotless so a shout out to housekeeping for that. Beds were very comfortable which is just what you need after a days sightseeing. We an issue with the shower on our first morning but it was resolved quickly without any fuss. The bathroom was a big and stocked with a decent amount of toiletries and plenty of towels- we had a half bath which was perfect for when you've spent all day on your feet.
The gym was great for a small hotel and got a big thumbs up from my son and husband. Although weather was too chilly for sitting out on roof terrace but we did pop up for a look and take in the great view, I imagine in warmer weather it would be lovely.
The location of this hotel is perfect, close to the hub of things but quiet enough to be relaxing and escape some of the hustle and bustle.
Lastly I want to give 5* to the staff, from the moment we arrived to the moment we left they we friendly and super helpful. On our last day after check out our luggage was safely stowed away while we had a last day exploring the city before catching a late flight. Our transport back to the airport was arranged by the hotel too so all went smoothly and was stress free. Daniel and William in particular were the nicest and most cheerful people we met in NY.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Do they clean the rooms here?
text: I will start w this hotel is decent. I was staying here for a work event. Check in begins at 3pm, yet, my room still wasn't ready at almost 4pm. I popped out after dropping my stuff + when I got back, had to call to get a remote as there was none in my room + the tv was on + you cannot manually turn it off. Ok, no biggie, they dropped one off. When I went to take a shower on my first morning, there was hair from the previous guest dried up + on the wall, there were also remnants of their toiletries left on the bathroom counter. Upon leaving for the day, I told the front desk, where they assured me it was going to be taken care of. When I got back later that evening, the bathroom still had the hair on the wall + then the lightbulbs were flickering over the desk. Only when the manager called me about something totally unrelated, I told him what was going on + he sent housekeeping up. However, I checked out today and there are still gummy bears (NOT MINE) on the floor in the room. So, do they really clean these rooms...doubtful. Good location though, but probably won't stay here ever again bc of their lack of cleanliness + not even caring about it. You can definitely find a comparable room in this area + possibly a bit cheaper.

title: Can’t say enough good things!
text: We can’t say enough good things about this hotel! It is centrally located and very customer friendly. Every time we came in they greeted us by name, and made sure we had everything we needed all the time. When we called for help when the safe didn’t work, they showed right up and fixed everything. Our room was upgraded because there was a vacancy and the room was perfect. We should specifically call out the front desk personnel for doing a great job. We will be back!

title: Great stay at the Renaissance.
text:
Loved my stay at the Renaissance in New York.  Diana Salazar hook me up with an amazing corner room on the seventh floor. She made me feel at home while away from home. It’s amazing employees like her that make hotels great. I wish there were more Diana Salazar‘s at all the hotels a visit when traveling. Even after working a double shift, she was kind and Patient with all the guests that she was checking in at the front desk. Everyday she worked, she asked how my day was and if she could do anything to make my stay better. I hope this review makes it to her management team. I watched others work the front desk and they were no where near the level of perfesionalism Diana  exhibited. Thanks for an amazing stay Diana. Hope to see you again when I return. 

Sal Bono

title: Impeccable Service, Old Building
text: At the beginning of the stay until the very end, customer service was second to none. Danny helped with bags, recommendations for excursions and even gave a tour of the building, including the rooftop. The ladies at the front desk were super friendly and nice, especially Lucy. And even though their concierge area is small, Jorge Rivera took good care of me in the evening. The rooms are pretty large by NYC standards, but the walls are very thin (could hear conversations, TV, music, walking) and did not make for a good place to entertain company with even 2 people. Rooftop views are awesome, but the floor is not stable and tiles move under your feet. I would still consider it for business only, but would not come for leisure.

title: Great location and service
text: This hotel is in an excellent location; walking distance to the park, everything in midtown, and two blocks from a subway station.  The hotel room was clean, well-laid-out, with decent finishes.  The rooms are small, but I have stayed in smaller in NYC. The lobby and bar area are small, but efficient.  My only complaint is that the beds are firmer than they should be. Where this hotel really excels is the staff.  We interacted many times with the front desk and bell hops.  Every interaction we had was exceptional.  They all went above and beyond to make our stay great.  Unfortunately, I’m terrible with names and can’t remember the names of all the exceptional people.  The bell hop that helped us with our luggage on the way out was Daniel Machado.  Thanks for everything.  We’ll be back next year.

title: Very helpful staff, great location
text:
If you are looking for a great location, very helpful staff and a worry-free stay in NYC, this is a great choice. I had forgotten to print a ticket that I needed and they took care of that for me, and also I had to check out at 4 a.m. and requested the invoice be divided because I had business charges that needed to be separated -- all accommodated with the utmost kindness in addition to hailing me a cab to the airport!
A few considerations. My room was very small. Fine for one person but two people might find it challenging. There is no convenience store or restaurant / bar at the hotel but there is a Whole Foods a couple of blocks up. There is a very nice limited-offering bar that is open for a few hours each evening. I went there every night I stayed and the service was excellent and its a very nice space to relax and have a quick drink.

title: Super service and good location
text: Christina and Raymond at the front desk were very helpful during my stay—both of them went out of their way. Good location seat from the tourist crowds. Central Park is a 10-15 minute walk past lots of shopping windows. Nicely designed boutique hotel with a super staff.

title: Enjoyed on every level
text:
Every interaction was excellent. Breakfast simple but delicious, satiated and enjoyable.  
As platinum/titanium no real perks above nonmember except for room upgrade since  everyone gets access to the breakfast.  So a great hotel for Marriot members at any level.  

Room nice.  Bed comfortable.  Bathroom small (but this is Nyc) however very functional and ample light. Heating responsive and not too loud.  

This is the way to convert a historic building correctly. They got it right!

title: william
text: Excellent service! Merci as tous pour l’accueil William a donné un donner un excellent service. Je vous recommande, c’est un des meilleurs hôtels que jai pris. J’ai un mot,simplement wow! et aussi beau quartier!

title: The Most amazing Staff
text: Ive stayed over 4000 nights in the Martriott branded hotels alone and William here at this hotel has to be one of the most amazing man ever to deal with. Ive stayed here many times now and really always come back beacuse of the staff

title: Business / Personal
text:
The best aspect of this hotel is the staff, in my opinion.  Raymond, in particular, could not have been kinder and accommodating.  I'm not familiar with NYC and had a lot of questions which Raymond took time to answer and ensure I was comfortable with the directions he'd given.  Other front desk staff were also kind and helpful.

The room I had was clean and a good size for the price I paid.  The bathroom was updated, and stocked with Aveda products which I personally like.  Only downside is there is no on-site dining so there was no room service available; however, there are eateries nearby.

title: Renaissance 57 hotel has a great location
text: We spend 4 nights at this hotel. Very serviceminded staff, always there to help ... its location is so good that its walkable to either Central Park or to Broadway theaters.. The hotel doesnt have breakfast service but 20 meters away from the hotel there is an excellent, typical american place called Palace Restaurant.. We had a great and very busy time in New York !!!!

title: Good enough given this prime location
text:
The hotel is located in the heart of midtown and close to lexington av and 5 th avenue. Every where can be reached easily and they have metro station nearby. I arrive there late and seems like they are very busy and only one reception responsible for checking in and operator job. I hear he speak loudly to engineering over the walkie talkie for some guest request. He is efficient to confirm me everything but he fail to tell me all elite members benefit until i ask. Anyway, it is just minor. I stay here for quick.

The room is actually quite comfortable but it is not renaissance standard while you will feel like you are in courtyard or fairfield inn by their decor and furnishing. They use aveda as amenity and the shower is great, though there is some minor dirts in the bathtub.

The following morning i enjoy the buffet continental breakfast in the lounge. It is actually good and there are lots of businessmen having meeting. Anyway, i check out early and it is actually quite good in terms of efficiency and proximity to the business centre. I miss the aft tea happy hour which is offered to eite member during the early evening time.

title: Needs updating
text: I stayed here for an overnight business trip as the location was close to my meeting. The staff was very professional and very nice, however, I felt like the hotel is in desperate need of remodeling. The building itself has history but the interior could still be modernized. Additionally, there is a Marriott club and breakfast provided but otherwise no restaurant which was disappointing. In general, I did not have a sense that I was at a Renaissance. I don’t think I would stay again.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: Loved coming back to the Hotel after a short stint at another hotel on My previous visit. Love the location and accessibility to restaurants around the hotel. All the management and staff including the housekeeping are very warm and welcoming. I feel at home. The only place and person I feel uncomfortable is with the Barman Jorge (pronounced as Horhe) who is very uptight, rude and unhelpful. He makes you feel that you are in his space and I have decided not to visit the lounge till he is working there. In my opinion he should not be allowed to deal with any guests as he has no idea of how to talk to guests.

title: JSP
text: I love this hotel!  The staff- William, Danny and Diana- make you feel so welcomed. I travel to NY frequently.  Staying at the Renaissance 57 is my home away from home.  Everyone is so accommodating!! I can’t imaging staying anywhere else.

title: courteous staff, convenient location, aging property
text: We often stay at this hotel due to its location and relative affordability. I would like to say special thank you to William who was genially helpful in finding me a quiet fresh room away from elevators and street noise which is often a challenge in Manhattan. The property definitely needs a lot of work but what is lacking in swanky facilities expected of Renaissance brand is often made up by the dedication and friendliness of its staff. Also a lady (Maggie?) in the concierge breakfast makes the best macchiatos to set you for the day.

title: Medical procedure
text: I would like to first thank Daniel who greeted us with a huge smile at 715AM, and remembered us from a previous stay 10 months ago,  for all his assistance.   Next I need to really give William at the front desk a HUGE THANK YOU,  he was able to give us a very early check in,  my husband was/is having a 5 hour infusion at his surgeons office across the street from the hotel.  He just made the day alittle bit easier for my husband who was extremely nervous about the situation.   Looking forward to our stays for the next 2 weeks and any future stays.

title: Great customer service!
text: Booked a room  last minute due to impending snow with my mom. Very clean and well run hotel. The front desk staff very friendly, especially William who was kind enough to offer us complimentary breakfast to avoid us walking around at 7 am in the bad weather.

title: Amazing customer service from Diana!
text: I stayed at the Renaissance Hotel 57 for an interview. All of the staff were very sweet and helpful! Diana, in particular, was extremely helpful! She helped me figure out breakfast, map out the fastest and easiest route to my interview, and stored my belongings for the day of. She was so accommodating and went above and beyond to help me, even letting me change in the lobby bathroom after my interview. She was encouraging and supportive, making my stay so enjoyable and saving me a lot of stress! My room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. They were quick to change towels and give extra soap, etc. I highly recommend this hotel. It was affordable for the area, and I had a great stay.

title: Renaissance New York 57 Hotel
text:
I travel frequently staying at different hotels world wide with NYC in particular being frequent destination for me. 

First time staying at Renaissance New York 57 Hotel. The location is excellent and the room size is decent for NYC but it’s really the staff that make this hotel so great and why I give it 5 stars. 

Diana, Raymond and the team are so helpful and accommodating it’s really refreshing to see in NYC. Great customer service. 

Will definitely be coming back. 

Great job guys !!!

title: Great Staff!
text: Raymond and Serge were great at welcoming us and making sure our stay was great! Anytime I walked through the lobby, Ray always greeted me by my name and recommended some great local spots! I will definitely come back to this hotel in the future.

title: Very accomodating front desk team
text: Very pleased to receive a warm welcome from the entire front desk team at this property.  William and Diana, perpetually friendly and very helpful in finding a room that worked for my three day business stay.

title: Amazing location and price but needs work
text:
I stayed here for 4 days for work. The staff was excellent. The rooms were modern and clean, and mine even had a view.
The location was incredible (right by Central Park), and the price is amazing for the area. It even has a fully equipped gym.

My only complaints are that the walls were thin so you could hear your neighbors well; and the water came out of the sink very murky (it was the same for my colleague in his room too). I complained but they couldn’t do anything. Needless to say, i brushed my teeth with a water bottle. Other than that, great stay!

title: Perfect Place to Stay!
text: I stayed at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 one night recently and everything about it was great!  Raymond was so delightful at the check in desk and I believe he upgraded my room to a newly renovated room!!!! The room was very clean, quiet and peaceful! (The location was so convenient for my early return to work the next morning that made it a great night stay in the city!) Thanks again to Renaissance and Raymond for the great service! I hope to stay here again soon!

title: Spectacular location
text: Good hotel. However, the room was REALLY small. I have to pile the luggage to make some space. The WiFi was good and the bed comfortable. I got a really low price (well, low compared to other NY hotels) so I had a nice stay

title: Good location. GREAT service
text: I travel a lot for work and occasional for in. This is exactly what I want from a 4-star hotel. Convenient location, good gym, functional rooms with good layout, clean and pleasant throughout. No room service, but proximity to good restaurants: Le Colonial just 2 min away is terrific, there’s a Fig & Olive nearby and so much more. Very good free Lavazza coffee weekday mornings. With all that going for it the staff and service were the standout elements. And Diana is an absolute star. I’ll be back!

title: Exceptional service at Renaissance NYC 57!
text:
This is one of my best hotel stay experiences at Marriott chains: very nice room and great-quality of services. I especially want to thank Mr. Raymond Slawomir who has been attentive, super professional and friendly to help me to accommodate my room requirements and provide me the city/restaurant information. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would come back here again. I’m even thinking to ask my company to get a corporate rate contract at this hotel. 
Thank you very much Raymond and thank you, Renaissance New York 57 that you made my day!!!

title: Valentine's Day Upgrade
text: Had a wonderful stay at Renaissance 57. The service was great and William was able to upgrade us to a great top floor suite to celebrate Valentine's Day. We really appreciated the gesture and the great view of the Chrysler building. Thanks, William!

title: Excellence in service
text:
William at the front desk, resolved a problem with the room quickly, professionally and expeditiously. His kindness and empathy made our stay feel at home. Thank you William!
The hotel is comfortable, excellent location and at a great price. I recommend it.

title: Great service
text:
William at the front desk made some very good dining recommendations to me.  God guy, friendly and professional.  
Each front desk person was the same.  Each wanted to make sure I was take care of during my stay. 
Thanks 
John

title: Great place to stay - Outstanding People
text: I am in NYC often for business and I only recently started coming to this hotel.  The hotel is great but the people are what really stands out at this place.  Lucy and Elizabeth at the front desk are best I've seen!  Always saying hello, address you by your name and always go the extra mile to help out and provide a great experience!

title: 有歷史的旅館
text: 旅館看得出非常老，有升級的小套房但沒什麼感覺，設備一般，在紐約算是交通還方便但沒有太多特色，應該算是普通的選擇

title: My new NYC go to
text: It's in a great location, has been nicely updated, and is an absolute bargain. Three blocks north and 3 blocks south are different subway stops, offering numerous trains, allowing easy access to numerous NYC attractions. The rooms, typically NYC small, are recently appointed and comfortable. More boutique in feel, than a typical Renaissance,the lobby offers nothing more than a small sitting area. There is no bar or restaurant, but Marriott members do get breakfast and a late afternoon happy hour. It's not a top notch hotel, but it is well run, comfortable, well located and at a great price point. I recommend it and it will be my new "go to" in New York City

title: GREAT SERVICE!!
text: The Renaissance New York Hotel 57 customer service was exceptional! Jose and Raymond were of great help to my family and I. I would stay here again and highly recommended to anyone looking to stay in the area.

title: Great front desk service
text: We stayed at the hotel Jan 26-28, 2019. The room was nice and the hotel was fine with a great location for us. But- what really stood out was the incredible service and kindness shown by the front desk agent- Raymond. He is such a great asset to the the hotel and a credit to the Renaissance/Marriott brand!!!! His suggestion of a bigger room and his advice of where to dine was truly appreciated!!!

title: Best hotel to stay in NYC
text:
Great location - very good located - just 2 blocks away from fifth av. and many other attractions - Confortable rooms but bed could be a bit bigger - Friendly staff - fair price!!
See you for our next trip to NYC :)

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: I only leave reviews for places that I truly love and appreciate. So I decided to leave one for the Renaissance 57. Let me tell you- I come here all the time. It’s my Go To. Whether I am staying in the city for work, or just want a quiet romantic evening with my boyfriend. The staff here is so friendly and welcoming. The guys open the door when you first arrive and then you are greeted by the front desk personnel. My favorite is Serge! He’s very sweet and funny and makes you feel so welcome! Check in is super fast, even when they have a line, and the rooms are very nice and clean. Love the bathtub. One of my favorites in the city when I’m not home of course : ). Location is great - in midtown so relatively close to everything or just a short cab or train ride away. Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent Service!
text: My friend and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend for one night. The check-in was smooth and we did not experienced any trouble with the transitioning to our room. The front desk was very professional and I felt respected from the staffs. Our room was also spectacular (we stayed on the 14th floor), with all the amenities provided. I just have to pack a few change of clothes and ready to go! We experienced minor troubles with the shower as the handle would not budge/turn on. We called front desk at 3AM (yes, we shower late after a long night), and after a few minutes they sent an engineer over to quickly fix the minor problem for us. I definitely had no complaints about this hotel and would DEFINITELY recommend this place to anyone. I will come back for another stay as well!

title: Manhattan Hotel
text: This Marriott is well kept, reasonably priced for NYC and close to the subway.  Stayed here 2 times in January and will stay here 2 times in February.  For Platinum members they provide breakfast on site or give you a coupon for breakfast 2 doors down.

title: Best experience ever!
text: I've been to New York many times but this has been my best experience by far! The hotel staff were absolutely amazing especially Raymond and Danny A.They went above and beyond and were super helpful. The hotel was beautiful and clean and would definitely stay here again. 😍

title: Great value, great staff, great location!
text:
Absolutely fabulous stay 18.01.19 through 21.01.19 - great value, and staff were very friendly. My first time in NYC and it didn't disappoint. Staff gave some great recommendations whilst there, and the Breitling boutique is literally just a few hundred metres away.
Trump Tower just around the corner, Times Square and Central Park all within walking distance. WTC One and GZ a short sub trip (<$5) too. Check out the 9/11 museum - it's a must and very emotional experience, but in a positive way.

title: A Bit Disappointing
text:
The hotel itself is in a great location - right at 57th and Lexington just a few blocks from 5th Ave and Central Park.  Great neighborhood with lots of food and shopping options outside the hotel.  The hotel is dated and in need of an overhaul.  It's very clean and my room was spacious, but it was the little things that matter.  The lounge for premium guests was big and located just past the lobby on the first floor.  It had bottled water and a great coffee/espresso machine for all day use.  

I had a queen room with a terrace (I specifically booked the terrace room to enjoy a little bit of the city from my hotel room).  The terrace door between my room and the patio was locked.  I tried to call the front desk to ask them to unlock it (it was a deadbolt with a key) only to find the phone in my room did not work.  I did speak with someone in person at the front desk and they promised to get it unlocked (the front desk staff were surprised it was even locked in the first place).  Despite two separate requests to get the door unlocked during my stay, it never happened.  The phone was also never fixed so I could not call a third time to ask.  The room description online indicates there were robes in the room, however, there were none.  Overall, this is a fine hotel but the lack of attention to detail and outdated decor would make me pick another property next time I'm in this area.  Marriott should do better - NYC is a competitive hotel market and there are other options close by.

title: Skip this property in clear decline
text:
In 2011/2012, we stayed at this hotel 3 or 4 times when in this city for work and fun.    It was small, cozy with a pretty good breakfast restaurant on weekends and concierge lounge during the week.

So we decided to try it again over the MLK holiday weekend after most recent stays at the JW Marriott Essex house.

I was completely astonished how much this property has declined.  The check in desk was previously on a middle floor near the concierge lounge and restaurant and there was a nice meeting/hang out space.   Now, the lobby is on street level with a tiny lounge in the back only open M-F.  The restaurant closed a year or so ago I was told and there were no dining options .. as a Lifetime Marriott Plat, I honestly thought full service props were required to have an onsite restaurant and likely will write corporate to ask them.     The rooms haven't been updated at all since the prop I think converted to a Renaissance around 2010 .. carpet is dirty, tired - furniture is old, no USB or anything modern.    

I really considered a 2 for the rating but the staff still tries.  I always felt sorry for them.  Raymond at the front desk was very helpful and caring.

I am not sure what the future of this hotel will be - I would think a gutting is needed or a debranding will occur soon.

title: Love this hotel
text: My family and I stayed at the hotel after Christmas and as always the service at this hotel is superb. Serge always remembers my family and I by name and always smiling and ready to assist and so very knowledgeable of the area and things to do.  I love staying at this hotel, it’s small, but clean and the staff is awesome. Thank you Serge for being genuine.

title: Great location and no resort fee
text:
The location of this hotel is great - there is a subway stop 2 blocks away that has the 4/5/6 and the N/R/W/Q so both the east and west sides of Manhattan are easily accessible. You’re also only a few blocks away from Central Park and 5th ave shopping. Times Square and the theater district are a 15-20 min walk away and there are plenty of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops along the way. 

The hotel is clean and the rooms are decent size for NYC. The front desk staff is polite and helpful. We were even able to check into our room a few hours early. 

But the best part of this hotel was that there was no “resort fee”. Many of the Manhattan hotels charge a $30-$60/night fee for access to their facilities on top of the nightly room rate. The Renaissance doesn’t have a restaurant or bar in the building like many of the hotels charging this fee, but you’re in NYC. Walk outside the door of your hotel and there are plenty of places to explore!

title: Good value for business travel
text: Excellent location, rate was very good too.  Staff is very nice.  Serge was very helpful. Room was small but for one person it's fine.  If you are two or more, spring for a bigger room.  Bed was a bit lumpy and squeaky.  Could use a replacement.

title: Renaissance New York Hotel 57
text: The hotel is in a great location.  Amenities were normal.  Very expensive for a hotel, but it is New York.  Clean.  Staff was so-so, but reasonably nice and accommodating.  The rooms were on the small side.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in Renaissance hotel for our first visit in New York. We checked in quite late on Friday night, not sure what to expect from this hotel and the city.The location of the hotel is excellent, close to subway stations and there are restaurants and bars nearby that front desk suggested. Thanks to the staffs at Renaissance for making our trip convenient and memorable. Will stay here again when we come visit NYC next time!

title: A wonderful place to stay
text: My husband and i spent two nights in January 2019 at the Renaissance 57.  We had a wonderful experience thanks to the friendliness and kindness of Serge who treated us royally when we told him we were celebrating our 54th wedding anniversary.  From Serge we received excellent restaurant recommendations.  I was surprised to learn that the wifi was free in our hotel room.  A great place to begin 2019.

title: Wonderful experience after a long wedding
text:
Newly married and completely exhausted, my new wife and I were met with a much needed warm welcome from Raymond at the front desk of Renaissance 57th. He made the check-in process quick and easy. He added that my wife and I check out the view on the 17th floor which topped off a special day with the beautiful NYC skyline. 

After a quick shower, my wife and I decided that we wanted to celebrate more, just between us. Although, it was past midnight, Raymond pointed us to the closest bar and handed us two umbrellas as it just started to rain.

Overall, after a long and stressful day, the service at Renaissance was exceptional. We were finally able to relax and enjoy ourselves. Thank you Renaissance and Raymond you made our wedding day truly special and memorable!

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: Lovely hotel, stayed just after Christmas and staff were very friendly. Hotel room was clean, everything you needed for a short trip. Location was brilliant. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone wanting a nice hotel.

title: Excellent service, great location. Raymond and Serena were incredibly nice!
text: I booked my mother-in-law into the Renaissance 57th for a few days around NYE. My wife and I were staying at a different hotel a few blocks away because it our hotel was full and she decided to come last minute.  It was one of her first times staying in NYC and she was apprehensive, but Raymond and Serena were so nice and made her feel welcome and at home. Their level of service was outstanding and they constantly made sure she was well taken care of. The location was central to everything, and the lobby was nicely renovated. The room was great and the bed was very comfortable. I would stay there again especially because the prices are so reasonable.

title: Great stay for the price
text: Excellent location on E 57th and Lexington. Within walking distance to Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Check in was smooth and all of the staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. The hotel in itself is nothing spectacular but it was exactly what we needed for our stay. It was clean, cheap and convenient. There aren't a lot of extra amenities but hey, it's a clean place in Central Park South for $130 a night. Overall a nice stay and we would stay here again.

title: Good service and location
text:
We were welcomed and treated will here. Especially Jennifer was very helpful. Always smiling. 
We would stay here anytime visiting the city. Nice location near central park and shopping.  Thank you.

Thank you and

title: Friendly staff, Great Location for tourists
text: We stayed at renaissance New York Hotel 57 in a Room with Terrance. It had an amazing views of Midtown. Loved the staff here! Raymond checked us in and he was fast, efficient and so friendly! wish the property had F&B service but there were many great restaurants nearby it was not an issue at all.

title: Strange place.  Poor service.  Low prices.
text:
The good:  location, price.

The not so good:  pretty much everything else.

I have had varying levels of Marriott status, but they would not let me check in early.  The young man who worked in the baggage room did not put my bags in the room when it was ready (even though I asked:  I think that his response was “I’ll try”).  It did not appear to me that the hotel was particularly busy at that time, either.

At some point, I realized that the room was missing a bureau.  I have never stayed in a normal hotel that did not have a bureau!  And there was lots of space in the room (especially for New York) — so this tells me that there used to be furniture but probably got tossed out when it got old, and has not been replaced.

The window coverings also seemed to be slapped in there, but not really designed for the windows.  I think that my bed was covering up part of one of the windows as well.  Various things were off about that room (and property).  It needs a gargantuan overhaul, but for the moment, the room rate is one of the lowest if not the lowest in that neighborhood — so enjoy it.

If you like tea, there is a tea kettle in the room but no bags — so bring your own and that will be one nice thing to enjoy.

I remember thinking that the bathroom floor was cold and wished that I had brought slippers (there are none in the room).

This was not my favorite stay but it’s hard to find a better deal in New York City.  What is sure in life is death and taxes, and also, you totally get what you pay for!

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: I stayed here for a night during a busy holiday weekend and had a lovely time. The room was a junior suite on the 15th floor, and it was large and well-appointed.  The coffee provided by the hotel in the was surprisingly good with liquid creamer (not often part of a hotel coffee set up). The price was decent as well.

title: Not a good value for Platinum members
text: Good location near a variety of restaurants - close to but not in the midst of the midtown bustle.  Small lobby.  Despite platinum status was given a very small room with one full-sized bed.  Club access was provided including coupons for two glasses of house wine or Miller Light over the course of a three night stay.  Breakfast in club was adequate, cheese and crackers and pizza were only options in evening.  Historic wood elevators, but elevators very small and slow - can take 15 mins to get to lobby in morning, particularly if on a low floors as most elevators going down are full before they reach floor.

title: GREAT MIDTOWN LOCATION
text: We stayed at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 for 4 nights recently with three other couples to take in some sights and sounds and food.  The staff was friendly and got us into our room as soon as they could (the previous guest had a 2:00 check-out).  The room itself was off the charts and well worth waiting for...top floor, windows on three sides, 14' ceilings, outside wrap around balcony on two sides with table and chairs...a great place for our group to congregate and start off each day or evening.  Our doorman (Daniel Machado) went out of his way to make us feel like we were the only ones staying at the hotel...he met us with a smile and a warm greeting every time we returned to the hotel.  Central Park was a 10 minute walk away, Grand Central Station was 15 minutes and Rockefeller Plaza was 20 minutes of walking time away.  Subways were 2 (short) blocks from the front lobby in neither direction up/down Lexington.  Although the hotel itself did not have a restaurant, there was a small bar in the lobby, but the hours never seemed to line up with ours (that may have been more on us than on them).  However, we discovered several little restaurants within a block or two that were fabulous venues (one has a Cabaret show every Sunday night starting at 9:00!).  If you're looking for midtown stuff to do, this is a great base.

title: Your at home
text: Hotel is in a great location, rooms are small but clean. The staff is amazing especially Serge Lambert and Kathy were so professional and very knowledgeable of the area, and always smiling when you see them. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family, you will definitely be treated like royalty.  Hotel is going through renovations however the staff is so accommodating that guest are not affected by the renovations during their stay. I’ll be back for sure.

title: Very Nice place to stay in NYC
text: The hotel overall is very nice.  The location is great.  The rooms are small but adequate.  The cost is high, but that is NYC.  The service was outstanding from the front desk to the bell men.  A special shout out to Jose who coordinated our transportation for us throughout our weekend stay.  He and his partner at the bell desk were always available to assist us and did it with a very good attitude.  My future trips to NYC will include staying at the Renaissance 57.

title: Wonderful Staff
text: We stayed here Wed night before thanksgiving. While my wife and I were sure we booked here our reservation was in the system for the Times Square location. For a number of reasons that would not work for us and we out ourself at the mercy of the staff. To make natter worse we have three small boys under the age of 7. Although an extremely busy day in the city, Steven(i think that was his name) worked with us and was able to get us 2 room next to each other and worked with the Times Square location to work out the details. Nice hotel, great location, great prices and a fabulous staff. Highly recommended.

title: Strange room layout, but good hotel
text:
Stayed here the weekend after thanksgiving, it’s very close to the subway so easy to find and get to (we came from Newark). We found it nice to walk to Times Square and Penn Station areas.

Easy to check in and we were happy that the room was on the 11th floor as we thought we might be lower down having booked relatively last minute. There was hardly any traffic noise in the room and the bed was comfortable. There was also free water in the room, but the larger water bottle had a $5 room charge. All the staff were friendly and the hotel was clean.

The room had a odd layout, the main light was by the door which meant it was dark in the room even when it was on. There was no fan in the bathroom so there was condensation everywhere after a shower. The coffee machine and everything was hidden in a closet, probably because there was no table in the room. There was also no fridge in the room.

We were using the hotel to sleep, so the lack of bar and restaurant was not a problem for us. Being downtown and close to the subway we would stay here again.

title: Excellent Reception and Service in a Snow storm
text: We were staying one night and felt like we lived there.  Arrived in a middle of a November snow storm, very unexpected for hotel and the City of New York.  We were driving from uptown to midtown and didn't know the exact location of the hotel and missed the entrance.  Because of the snow could not arrive at front door.  The doorman met us at the corner.  Took the car and the bellman helped with our few bags.  It could not have been any more helpful.  From this first impression it only improved. The doorman highly suggested we walk to our event that night, since car service would be impossible.  They gave us each umbrellas.  The room was clean, quiet and modern.  The only problem was food and water was not available due to the storm.  The attendant at the bar was not helpful.  In the morning much nicer and food was fine, though we were heading out to a brunch.Will definitely stay again when needing to be in midtown Manhattan.

title: Wonderfully located low service hotel.
text: Even though there is no service or food available, this was a good deal. The rooms are nicely appointed with great bathrooms in stone tile, good water pressure. The beds have duvets and the curtains are black out so we slept very well. They thoughtfully put out coffee on Thanksgiving knowing everything would be closed.

title: I am very THANKFUL!
text: Thanks to Diana and the team at the Renaissance NY Hotel 57 and the lead usher at St. Patrick’s Cathedral, for going above and beyond in finding my wallet and contacting me to let me know where it was. The contents were intact! So grateful and thankful!

title: Great Location, Good Rooms
text: Stayed for 6 nights hreat hotel brilliant location near Central Park and Times Square small reception area and no bar or restaurant on site but its New York and there is loads of places nearby for all types of cuisine! Stayed for thanksgiving the hotel is great if you want to see the parade you can pick it up in 6th Avenue, rooms large and comfy beds nice bed linens great housekeeping and complimentary toiletries.  Would definitely stay again. Well done Marriott

title: Old Hotel But Great Front Office and Reception Team
text:
The Hotel Needs a lot of work and the house keeping needs to more vigilant on the small repairs and tears it can report to management. 

I will however stay again at this property as Platinum Members are recognized  and the front office team led by Lucy Raymond are delightful and address all issues with care and a smile. People can make a weak property stronger.

title: Great Location and Service
text: This was my second stay at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 this year. While it is an older hotel it has a great location, clean well kept rooms, and a staff that seems earnest about taking care of their guests. Even on lower floors the room are quiet both from street noise and from the heating/air conditioning systems in the room and there is never a long wait at the elevators to get to your floor.

title: Very well located
text: The hotel is very well located right next to Lexington Avenue and 57th. It is close to the Upper East Side, to Central Park, and all important avenues. There are several nice restaurants and shops nearby. It's not the classical Renaissance I'm used to, the lobby is small, and there is no restaurant. Staff was nice and helped us when we needed. Our room was large and although we reserved a room for 3, there was only one bed. I had to sleep on the couch that turned into a bed, but in 5 minutes I discovered it was very unstable, and bended to one side because there were no "legs" on the couch to support the weight. Nevertheless, it is a good hotel, located in a premium area.

title: Sized Appropriately and Convenient
text:
Looking for a nice hotel but not one with thousands of patrons fighting over elevators? Try the Renaissance 57! Avoid the large crowds and stay in a well positioned hotel in Manhattan.

The service staff are helpful and provide plenty of options for food in a three block radius.

Also many locations are in walking distance.

title: Great location but very small room
text: We stayed in this hotel for three nights, from the 27th until the 30th of october and could walk to many attractions that are walking distance from it. The room was very clean, but a little small; we had to keep most things in our luggage. One complaint we have is that by the time we reserved, the website said "breakfast included" but on saturday and sunday they have no breakfast. Monday and tuesday breakfast was nice, and Margarita, the lady working in that area, was very warm. So was the man in the frontdesk, really helpful all the time, and the ladies too by recommending places to eat.

title: Ok but...
text: Stayed here for weekend in NYC. For the price it's a little dated. Rooms are small and bathroom has no space to put any toiletries at all. Staff was very friendly at checkin and came right away to replace broken tv remote. Clean and comfortable enough beds- just think it's a little expensive for what it is but it IS NY after all!

title: Great Location and Ambience
text: I had a great stay here at this hotel which is within walking distance of many great sites in New York. I was well looked after with a polite and professional staff eager to help. Rooms are a little small but I did not really spend much time in the room at all. The heater took a long time to heat up the room.

title: Comfort, location and service with a smile!
text: My wife, myself and 2 other couples booked this hotel for a 4 night stay begining of october. We came to New York from Canada for a first time visit of the city. Upon arrival at the hotel, we parked the vehicle on the street in front of hotel . Staff from the hotel helped us unload our baggage and a valet took the car to a remote parking. Employees in this hotel are courteous, patient, friendly, helpful and caring. The hotel is modest, yet well appointed. Rooms are not huge but all you need . Beds are comfortable for a good night sleep. Clean and well kept hotel. Well located a couple of blocks from Central park. Prices are average. In the morning, we would walk to Cafe Olympia on Lexington (5 min walk) for a delicious breakfast at a good price. Would go back .

title: Stay clear
text:
I am a Marriott platinum lifetime member and I use to like this place and make it my go to hotel for both business and pleasure. NO MORE!!!! Even though it’s going through a renovation they don’t have any idea about customer 1st attitude or attention anymore. Although some of the staff members are ok there were a few that found it to be to much trouble to get a bottle of water for me during my stay not to mention several other issues during check in which was rectified but not without me voicing my concern.

Sorry but this is end of the road for me with this property.... I’ll be going to Marriott on Lexington from now on.

title: Spectacular staff at mediocre property
text:
Pros: 
Knock-you-off-your-feet-great staff
Comfortable beds
Immaculate Housekeeping (particularly impressive for an older hotel)
Superb soundproofing for street noises

Cons:
The worst furniture and decor (except for the beds) I've seen in a full-service property in decades.
Terrible soundproofing for hallway noises

Because the rooms here are so far below Marriott standards, I was fully prepared to write a three-star review, but there's no way around how much the consistently great staff improves the experience at this hotel. From the moment I walked in -- every time I walked in over the course of a three-night stay -- I was made to feel so welcome that I couldn't help but smile. Every bellman (I wish I'd gotten their names) went out of their way to look me in the eye and greet me, and it wasn't the off-putting, cynical, expecting a tip kind of friendliness that often mars the experience at many hotels.

Housekeeping was similarly gracious, and more importantly, did a stunning job of keeping this older property not only clean, but fresh.

The stars, however, were Lucy and Serena (I hope I spelled her name right) at the front desk. They were pure joy, and had me laughing every time I saw them, while also being remarkably efficient with guest after guest. Even when I had a complaint (I was given a terrible room -- dark, stark, depressing -- for the first night. It was an upgrade from the one I'd booked, thanks to platinum status, but still pretty awful...details below) there was no way to be upset, because these two lovely humans softened the blow with warmth and kindness. Though the hotel was booked the night I arrived, but Lucy found me a much nicer room for the remainder of my stay, and I was truly grateful.

The biggest problem this hotel has, is the room decor. The first room I had (310, near the small business center and the gym) was larger than some, but was so bare-bones that I actually laughed. Not just dated, which can happen, but so terribly designed and haphazardly slapped together, that the underlying message is that guests simply aren't important enough to be given a pleasant experience. Tons of random outlets scarring the walls, the cheapest-looking/feeling desk I've seen since the 1970s (seriously, Motel 6 wouldn't be caught with something of this quality) awkwardly set against a wall that was way too big for it, and harsh, compact fluorescent lighting...and not enough of it, at that. I can make allowances for the fact that there was only one small window -- I knew this was an older NY building when I booked the stay -- but the tiny, single-panel, horizontally sliding, supposedly decorative blackout shade was absurd, a random piece of fabric that had nothing to do with the rest of the room. The same can be said for the artwork -- really nice black-and-white NYC photographs -- seemed to be just thrown on the walls. It was like someone said, "we're supposed to put decorative art in our rooms," but had no idea that it's supposed to make the room feel better to guests. Even the placement of drinking glasses (I didn't see them until the second morning..they were in the closet?!?) screamed that the designer couldn't care less about the guest experience. The apparently new thermostat was placed in the same spot as the old one, but it had a smaller footprint, and no could be bothered to paint the wall so we couldn't tell. The only things that saved the room were the incredibly comfortable bed -- mattress, pillows, and sheets -- pleasant carpet design, bathroom, and the aforementioned brilliant housekeeping.

The second room (1405) was much better -- including more windows, better placed furniture, and a comfy, stylish couch -- but many of the same absurdities remained. Also, while the first room had a tub, this one didn't, even though there was clearly enough space for one (in fact, I am guessing they removed the tub when they redesigned the bathroom.) I'll never understand why some hotels seem to think that limiting our options in that way is somehow a good thing. 

Finally, there was a cold snap in NY this weekend, and the heat in the second room wouldn't kick on, regardless of how high I set the thermostat. The front desk said that they would send someone up to fix it, but I never found the right moment to ask for it, so that's on me.

Bottom line: this physical property has a staff that is much better than it is. I can only hope that management brings the physical experience up to the same level as the personal one.

title: “Great Locatiion with Genuine Service”
text:
I try to make into the city once month for dinner and and show being I live out in Long Island and like to spoil my wife by picking different hotels each time. My choice with Renaissance 57 was truly a perfect visit which is not easy as my wife and I travel a lot. For my wife to tell me that there is no reason to ever think of any other nyc hotel, the hotel truly exceeded our expectations. 

In short, great front service and excellent housekeeping cleanliness. In fact I asked a very nice gentlemen who I believe was part of the housekeeping crew named JayJay for assistance to wow my wife with flowrts and although I knew that it would probably be something the front desk would do, I was in a rush and simply thought I would ask him,  not sure what or how he arranged it but within a short period of time the door knocked and they they were. Thank you to him and the other genuine care we received during this well needed vacation. 

Cheers!

title: El pero hotel en el que he estado
text:
Llegué a ese hotel por su ubicación central, la cual es indiscutible. Los cuartos son chiquitos, oscuros, viejos, mal maltenidos. No tienen servicio de restaurante ni al cuarto. La atención es pobre, grosera y poco preocupada. Porque tenía una fiesta solicité el lavado de un traje y camisa. Llegó después de la fiesta y ni siquiera aceptaron no cobrarme el servicio.
Para colmo, alguién murió en un cuarto de mi piso, por lo que no me dejaron entrar todo el día a la habitación.
Este hotel es realmente und esastre digno de una película de horror de Hollywood. Cómo se atreven a cobrar tarifas de hotel de 5 estrellas???? No lo entiendo. 
Por mi parte sólo espero nunca más en mi vida llegar a un hotel de horror como este.

title: Not quite up to usual Marriott standards
text:
Stayed on 14th floor. Looks like a condo conversion - room across the hall has an eviction notice with several dates posted. And hallway carpet is in poor shape with masking tape for patches. 

Bar area is starting to look nice - but concierge services with only 1 free glass of wine and $14 for a second in a plastic cup? Surprising. 

Maybe a few months down the road, it’ll be a fully loaded Marriott, but now? There are others on Lexington Ave that I’ve stayed at that are MUCH nicer. 

I’m a loyal Marriott member. Front desk were great, and guest room looked nice, but considering everything else, this was the worst Marriott I’ve stayed at - and I’ve stayed at Marriott/Renaissance hotels in Europe and the US. Again, surprising.

title: Tired
text: Although the location is great being just a short walk from Central Park and the shopping districts as well as nice residential areas, this hotel is suffering the effects of time with the decor being very dated. The staff are, however, very friendly and helpful

title: Very good choice
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance 57 on a recent long weekend trip to New York to visit our son, a recent college graduate who took a job teaching in New York.  We chose the hotel because of its excellent location at 57th and Lex, which is near everything, including the subway stop at Lex and 59th where our son would be coming in from Queens, and because the price was good for an upscale hotel.  We stayed in room 413, which has no view (the windows look out on a brick wall 20 feet away), but was large and very comfortable, with two queen beds, surprising for NY.  The hotel is large and quite nice in décor, with very friendly and helpful staff.  Their restaurant is being redone, so no amenity there, and like most nice Manhattan hotels there aren't grounds, pools, or the like.  If there was a cocktail lounge, we didn't see it, but this is, after all, NY so there's no shortage of places to go.

Over all, a good choice, and we'll likely stay again.

title: Great Location
text:
If you wish to be near say St. Patricks, Trump Tower that area of NYC this is the place to stay. I found the staff at the front desk to be excellent. The room was clean and well maintained.  Even the staff in the halls greeted me.  I was very pleased with my visit. 
Now the negative is there is no room service there is no place in the lobby to buy say soda or a snack.  As far as eating out there are many places nearby. I went out the door and found to my left next to hotel a nice place for myself to eat. I was there on one night business, they have a business center ( but the printers were down and anything printed had to be emailed to the front desk) There is a small fitness center as well. The wireless worked fine for me as well.  I have stayed there in the past and it has always meet my expectations with the exception of the lack of room service.

title: jgsher
text: Hotel is apparently under repair construction but that does not keep them from charging full NYC prices for rooms. We paid over $400 for a room that had not been updated, refreshed or remodeled in years and years and years. The bathroom looked like something out of 1950 with a rusty sink drain. There were two small glass shelves to put things on. The platform beds were very uncomfortable and the pillows were very used. There was no coffee refreshing on Friday into Saturday and coffee nor breakfast in unavailable on the weekend. This was the worst Renaissance we have ever satyed in.

title: Lucy is the best!!
text: I got to know Lucy, at the front desk,  the 2nd day after we arrived. She was so sweet and friendly and she introduced me to my new favorite type of candles, Lafco!!  Would stay that this hotel again, just because of her!!!

title: Good Location, Confortable Room
text:
My husband and I stayed at a good sized corner suite. The king bed was very confortable, as well as the half a dozen pillows available. The cleanliness was ok.
However, the room needs some remodelling: the air-conditioning is old and noisy and aims to your back, there is no fridge or frigobar - it is available upon request, but there aren't enough for all the rooms at the same time. The room is poorly lit. The furnishings have no style at all.
The staff was nice and helpful.

title: All about Rooms, Proximity and Staff!
text:
Okay, I stayed with this property for 12 nights from 9/8/18 to 9/20/18. 

Basics: The rooms were always clean, the staff was super generous, the location was right there for everything. 

Details: No (big name) hotel will give you nothing complimentary in NYC. They had water bottles, ready to have tea and coffee every morning near the lift area and a warm welcome everytime you see the generous staff. I did a lot of online shopping and i realized they have a great security control over online products received for their guests. Further, they have bigger rooms when compared to general same star properties. 

Suggestions: Enroll into Marriott rewards program for free Wi-Fi . they have internet TV for your binge watch if you stay at the hotel. My colleagues chose Double Tree by Hilton at Lex Ave, the gave "no water, no internet and no consistent cleaning of rooms". they were always envy with the kind of stay I received.

title: Pleasant stay
text:
We booked the Skyloft Suite on the top (17) floor, and were very happy we did. Large room with large windows on 3 sides, hardwood floors and fabulous bed with crisp sheets. Wrap around balcony with seating area, and a great view of the skyline. Perfect way to get a feel of the city. 

Kudos to the entire hotel staff. Very kind and helpful. We were offered to have a refrigerator brought up to the room the night we got to the hotel (which arrived 3 days later :-)) but it made a difference, staying there for a week.

Apparently the hotel is currently undergoing some renovation, so there is no restaurant.
Breakfast is served for those with breakfast included, and Marriott elite members, in a lounge area in the lobby. No breakfast on the weekends, and when we showed up in the lounge on monday - labor day - we were greeted by coffee a small selection of pastries and muffins. Apparently no service on the holidays either. The breakfast selection the rest of the time is quite basic - but does include scrambled eggs, cold cuts, processed cheese, bagels, jam, fruit, youghurt - and good coffee.
The hotel was supposed to have a concierge lounge for Marriott elite members, but all there is - is the same lounge area that is being used for breakfast, and at night it turns into a bar area - for all hotel guests. Being elite member, you recieve ONE complimentary drink in the lounge - for the entire stay. Really Guys?

All in all we had a very nice stay. Several areas of the hotel needs to be refreshed, but we liked that the hotel has a more intimate feel to it, than many of the larger hotels. 
The Art deco’ish decor is fun, and you can feel the history of the hotel. There is a huge terrasse on the top floor for everyone to use, and it is recommended. Great place to hang out and enjoy the Skyline.

Hotel has an awesome location, easy access to shopping, restaurants, subway and many sights.

We would like to return to the hotel, when they have finished the renovations...and maybe reconsidered how to appreciate Marriott elite members. ;-)

title: Great Customer service and great location
text: My friends and I stayed here for a few nights since the day we arrived Diana S. and Daniel were very great and accommodating. Hotel is very clean and close to Central Park, 5th avenue, Rockefeller, and subway stations all within a few blocks!!. It was my first time in New York, and let's just say I did not want to come back to LA. I definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Awesome Stay
text: My wife and I have stayed   this lovely hotel twice this year. We love it here!!! First of all Serge, Francis and team always make us feel at home and totally comfortable. They are attentive and so friendly. The hotel has a great location only two blocks from the subway. We love the cleanness of the room. We will keep coming back! It is  home away from home thank you. Robert and Gina.

title: Prima hotel en gunstig gelegen
text: Prima hotel, niet heel goedkoop maar met een redelijk ruime kamer met double bed. Helaas geen ijskastje op de kamer, wel een koffiezetter. Compacte badkamer met bad en douche met flinke krachtige straal. TV met internet tv als je even je voeten wilt laten rusten. Vriendelijke service

title: Great Team, Great Location
text:
Visiting New York for Business or Leisure? This hotel fits perfectly for both. Is a gem in midtown. Relation between rates and product is awesome. The room I stayed was the smalles but still very comfortable. The working desk was properly placed and had a comfy chair.
Close by 2 subway stations 59th and 57th in the orange and green line. You can take a walk to the central park and the 5th avenue.

title: Excllent Location with great staff
text: Rooms are small but the location is great. The front desk staff is top of the line. The entire staff has been great but Maria has been extraordinarily good, hence deserves a special mention. You have a choice of walking down to your destinations or hopping in the taxis, the location is that good.

title: Veramente valido!
text: Hotel situato in posizione strategica, a pochi passi da chrysler building, dal MOMA, dal Rockfeller e dall' Empire, molto bello, personale simpatico e molto disponibile, noi avevamo la stanza al dodicesimo piano e da li, si godeva di una vista sul chrysler building veramente eccezionale! Dispone an he di una terrazza panoramica di libero accesso, dalla quale ammirare il panorama... Stanza molto molto bella e pulita, consiglierei a chiunque di soggiornare in questa struttura!!!

title: Great Staff but unconforable bed!!!
text:
Position: about 10 minutes away from subaway. The Hotel is located in a quite zone. Good for family and people that want stay out of the caos! 

Staff: In my opinion the staff is out of this world! fantastic!!! 

Room: I didn't sleep!!! the bed was orrible! too small and unconfortable! 

Price: the price is high! 

To sum up: I suggest this hotel only for the availability of the staff.

title: Ottimo!
text:
Devo premettere che io 5 stelle le do molto raramente ma questo hotel posto non lontano da Times Square(15/20 minuti a piedi) ,che è anche la piazza più suggestiva e conosciuta di New York, mi ha soddisfatto pienamente!
Dall' accoglienza sino all' ultimo minuto trascorso all' interno dell' hotel!
Camere davvero molto spaziose,personale pronto ad esaudire ogni tua richiesta e qualità/prezzo davvero invidiabile difatti l' hotel era pieno! La posizione non è centralissima ma le fermate della metro sono davvero molto vicine e permettono di raggiungere in poco tempo i tanti luoghi di interesse!
Insomma,non c'è da pensarci due volte prima di scegliere il Renaissance Hotel.

title: Diamond in the Ruff
text: Hotel is in a great location, rooms were small but clean. What makes this hotel out rank the rest is the staff especially Serge and Francis. It was my family’s first time in New York, Serge and Francis made us feel like family. I would definitely stay again.

title: Awesome customer service
text: I have been a guest at this hotel a few times and have never had a bad experience. From the initial greeting by desk agent, Serge Lambert, I knew that we were in good hands. Serge was extremely professional, proficient and accommodating.  The exchanges with him set the tone for our stay and contributed to an awesome experience overall.

title: Avionce Hoyles
text: Came up to New York City for a family trip and the Renaissance was the perfect pick for hotel. The rooms and accommodations were great, perfect for a family trip.  We were greeted and taken care of by the niecest front desk attendant Mr. Serge Lambert,  who made our trip even better!!!

title: Disappointing Renaissance Property
text: As a frequent business traveler, nothing bothers me more than a less than 5 star hotel acting as if YOU are the one lucky enough to grace their presence vs the other way around.  This was one of those hotels.  I was greeted at the door kindly enough by the sincere bellman, but that is where the service stopped.  Immediately as I walked up to the front desk, it was if I was one of the minions who dare to stay at this hotel.  (Mind you, I am an Elite member of Marriott, but clearly that does not matter here).  I booked what was available on the app whilst I was at the airport, getting bumped off a flight.  I was happy to find a room despite the last minute booking.  I kindly asked if I could have my usual upgrade and a tub to soak my aching body.  The front desk attendant coldly replied "Well, we've been oversold forever.  So, I highly doubt it."  I quickly told him I booked the room an hour ago, so please look and he just rolled his eyes with disdain like "Do I have to?"  He looked over the the other female attendant and pointed to my room reservation muttering something of the like "she booked our smallest room."  Honestly, that was my only choice given and who really cares?  I do not expect to be treated like royalty, but I do think loyal members - no ANY human being - should be treated respectfully, regardless of room size.  She noticed my status and smiled and said "give her this room."  He looks up and says "You'll get your tub, but not an upgrade" coldly in my face.  Sheesh.  Now the room.  Small - let's just say I haven't seen something so small in years.  The distance between the door and the bed was about 5 feet and the bed to the window, well, that was mere inches (let alone my carry on bag actually couldn't fold out completely on the floor...anywhere).  The tiny bathroom was renovated and the bed was comfortable enough.  But, shangri-la it wasn't.  So, if you book the lowest rate, know that you're getting a cracker box and do not be surprised.  Beyond sleeping and bathing, I barely used the room to prevent from feeling claustrophobic.  Congrats to other reviewers who were elite members that got huge rooms and balconies.  I wasn't one of them.  There are NO services for Elite members on the weekend....no food, happy hour, nothing.  Now I know you travelers who think this is a complete first class complaint.  But, when you spend quite a bit of money to stay loyal, you want the perks.  The perks make the difference to your stay and to your wallet.  I was told Elite members would get extra points for this inconvenience.  I got ZERO extra points.  i just got credit for the stay, that is it...oh, and a bottle of water.  They'll get points for location, but that's it.  The construction and the service was enough to never want to come here again.  Save your money - there are hundreds of other 3-4 star hotels better than this one, which tarnishes the Renaissance name.  Skip this one.

title: Great customer service.
text: I stayed at this Marriott location on Wednesday, August 16, 2018. I was impressed by the customer service, particularly from Lucy Cox. I will make sure to look into staying at this property in the future.

title: Very nice hotel in a great location, doing the best they can with renovations in progress
text:
Nice hotel, we were upgraded to a room with a terrace.  The executive king suites are very roomy and a space that we enjoyed hanging out in.  Our only issue was that the AC in the living room didn't work, they came to fix it and it worked for an hour and quit working again, however the AC in the bedroom worked great and since it's all basically one connected space that AC unit was able to keep the whole place cool

They restaurant and social spaces are under renovation, that is the only downside, but not their fault.  Morning breakfast was great.  Overall the service was excellent

title: Really Enjoyed My Stay
text: Great staff and loved my room which was nice and clean.  My room had coffee maker and tea, bottled water and other amenities.  Had great view of the city and within walking distance from shopping, restaurants, Central Park, Times Square and much more.  I will be back to this hotel and hopefully get the same room.  Special “shout out” to Diana S…thanks for all your help.

title: Disappointingly misleading
text:
The hotel advertises on its website a fantastic rooftop with bar... well don't expect that to be real, when i asked at reception how to access it, they said to me that in fact it no longer exists, it is shut down! When I asked - so why do you guys still advertise it on your website , no good answer was provided, I was told I could speak to the manager...
Otherwise - the rooms are very small - size of a shoebox - relatively clean but with not much amenities. Aside from a good location, I would say an verall quite disappointing experience to be honest.

title: We stayed at this hotel as part of our 29th anniversary celebration in NYC.
text: When my husband mentioned that we were coming to NYC to attend a Yankee game and celebrate our wedding anniversary, we were treated like royalty! (not that we wouldn't have been otherwise, but everyone was so nice!) We especially appreciated the complimentary bottle of wine from Kathy Castillo, manager on duty, and all of the genuine kindness and excellent customer service from all of the staff. The card wishing us a happy anniversary was a particularly sweet touch. Thank you again and we will definitely be returning and advising friends and family to check out this wonderful hotel!

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Six days of bliss at the Renaissance Hotel! Serge Lambert was at the helm in excellent customer service and a sensitivity to the needs of his guests. Clean, modern and in a great location. Would definitely stay here again!

title: 飯店品質及服務普通
text: 飯店交通算方便，但房間有點霉味。且服務人員對會員status識別能力不佳，須提醒兩次才告知有提供早餐。而且checkout至今兩週了點數及stay都還未到帳

title: Awesome Staff and Comfy Bed
text:
NYC in the summertime is awesome, but a little stressful due to the heat, humidity and tempers flaring due to the weather. Renaissance New York Hotel 57 was an oasis. 

STAFF: The staff from front desk to housekeeping to door/bellhops were professional, responsive and polite. We even received handwritten thank you notes from housekeeping for tipping them. 

ROOM: As others shared, the room is a bit worn, but many in the city are - because of the amount of people who have traversed the hotel. However, the room was huge (corner room 1601) and clean. Bathrooms were large with marble floors. The bed was comfortable - and no bedbugs or bugs of any kind! YAY! The air conditioner was loud, but sooooo refreshing!

LOCATION: Location is sooooo convenient. We were able to walk to ATMs (3 within a few steps from the hotel...HSBC, Citibank and another bank - forgot which one) premium shopping (3 minutes) like Bloomingdales. Rockefeller Center (8 minutes); Central Park/The Met - art museum, not the opera house (leisurely 25 minutes). Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is surrounded by many eateries, so food was not a problem.

title: Renaissance hotel it is not
text:
Having traveled and stayed in other Renaissance hotel I do not feel that this hotel lived up to the Renaissance hotel brand. I feel it is more of a boutique hotel. Nothing screamed luxury or refinement. The lobby is small, the music is WAY to loud (think club music and volume) I could hardly hear the lady checking us in.  The breakfast was pitiful and again the music was WAY too loud at 7AM.  They only had eggs, oatmeal, cold cuts and cheese, bread and pastries, but no butter or cream cheese, no orange juice or milk. 

We were in a sky Suite on the 17th floor

Housekeeping is very inconsistent, one day when they cleaned our room they took all the towels but never replaced them, when the replacements showed up (we weren't in the room), they only left two bath towels and nothing else. Each day we had issues with housekeeping.

The bathroom was small, marble flooring, the counter where the oversize sinks were on had no room for our stuff. The door to the shower leaked and the marble floor would become very slippery, we had to use a bath towel because housekeeping wouldn't leave a bathmat. 

The bed was huge, but it was like a futon bed, it was about 14 inches off the floor, not the easiest best to be in and out of. The hardwood floors were all scratched which was ashamed. 

We liked the location but was VERY disappointed in the hotel we cut our stay by one day that is how disappointed we were if you have stayed at a 
Renaissance hotel before you will not get the same experience at this one. 

BTW, I am Gold with Marriot hotels and know a good hotel when I see it.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: After a bit of a debacle with my billing (my own fault), Diana Salazar (front desk) went above and beyond to help make the situation right! She was able to assist me with my bill, get me into the right room and made my stay at the hotel even more pleasant. As a person who travels regularly for business, I have had a couple of issues with the direct billing aspect at times. Diana was able to contact my corporate office right away and straightened everything out, allowing me to focus on my business at hand. I was thrilled to find that she took the initiative to correct the issue without me even having to remind her. I have never been treated with as much respect and kindness from a hotel as Diana showed. She is most definitely a jewel the crown of the Renaissance 57.

title: Walk Friendly Location
text:
Small euro-style boutique hotel within walking distance of all the midtown must-dos.
We enjoyed Central Park, Schubert Theater, Times Square, Guggenheim Museum and 2 nights of fine dining on this NYC visit. 
Gym available.
Next to typical NY diner and around the corner from Starbucks.

title: Last minute Mommy/Daughter weekend
text:
I made a last minute quick trip to NYC to spend a couple of days with my daughter... I’ve always seen this hotel when booking past trips and have been hesitant to book. This time, the rate was too good to pass up. As a Marriott Platinum Elite, I’ve had some good upgrades but this one just was great! It made my daughter feel like a little New Yorker in her very own place! The front desk staff has been great with amazing suggestions! I can say, we will be back here! So many good, affordable places to get a bite or a cup of coffee in the area and such a nice walkable area... 
We will be back! We ❤️ NYC!

title: Price gouging
text:
I booked a room for ONE night through Priceline for tomorrow or so I thought.  The system in order to show me a better rate changed it after I put in the correct date I assume to show me a better rate.
