Well I didn't notice and booked the room and saw that it said that my reservation was in 29 days.  I called WITHIN 30 SECONDS to Priceline who called the hotel and BOTH CLAIM its the other companies responsibility to cancel the reservation.  I then had the choice through the hotel to either pay 150 more for the night or lose the money due to the fact that I do not want, need and cannot use the date a month from now due to the fact that I am staying at the hotel because my husband is in the hospital for BRAIN CANCER. I have gone back and forth with both companies for the last hour and no one will take responsibility so I had to suck it up so so I do not lose 130 bucks I have to pay an additional 150 so I can have the room for tomorrow for a total of maybe 5 hours to shower and close my eyes while my husband rests after a procedure on his BRAIN.  I do not believe that this cannot be fixed by the hotel.  I informed them I have stayed there 11 times since Feb/18 (whether booked under my name or my fathers name) and they do not care.  I am letting Renaissance know right now that due to this I will never stay there after Monday.  I have no choice on Monday but after that....that is it.  My husband and I will always have to deal with his BRAIN CANCER...and I will always have to stay somewhere but please be aware you have just lost thousands in business because your company will not do the right thing. Oh and in case your thinking I'm making this up....I'm not.  You are screwing people who are fighting brain cancer with a brand new baby, and a new house to pay for.  
I will make sure everyone that can know about this will know about this.  BTW I posted a link of our story below.  It proves I am not lying about my husband.  They know why I needed to stay there...I explained I was staying a few hours to get a few hours rest and a shower and told them my husband was in the hospital with brain cancer.  They don't care...they just tossed me off to Priceline which refused to anything as well.  Both garbage companies.  Don't use either company.

title: Prima verblijf
text:
Wij hebben een aantal nachten hier verbleven.  Het personeel is zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam.  Om toch de straat op te kunnen gaan konden gaten tijdens regenbuien gratis een paraplu lenen.  De kamer was enigzins gedateerd maar zeer netjes. 
De ligging van het hotel is ideaal. 
Prijs- kwaliteit verhouding is prima.

title: Serge Lambert is the best!
text:
I often base my stay at a hotel on how I am greeted when I first arrive. Serge Lambert, the Front Desk Agent, customer service was extraordinarily  superior. His warm demeanor was a welcomed reprieve to a challenging week. I was celebrating my best friend's birthday and had made certain request of room location and fruit basket. 
Everything that I ordered was in place. Our room was very comfortable. The beds and pillows were fit for delightfully welcoming!  I'm looking forward to visit again soon because it's convenient to everything!!! Thank you again Serge Lambert!! You're simply the best!

title: Lekker hotel en prima gelegen
text:
Geen opdringerig gedrag. 
Perfect gelegen en uitermate vriendelijk personeel.
Goeie bedden en uitstekend badkamer met heerlijke douche. 
Daniel Machado is een van de vriendelijke personeelsleden  daar die altijd voor je klaar staan

title: Convenient location
text: This hotel was close to Bloomingdales and Central Park and to the Green Subway at 59/Lex which is open at weekends when other stops are not. However, this was a very expensive hotel considering it has no restaurant open or a bar, the executive lounge closes after Friday morning and only opens on Monday morning. There was no obvious fitness area or at least it wasn’t pointed out. As a Platinum member, we were allegedly given an upgrade but our room was dated and the AC was noisy and the room was permanently stuffy. The bed was clean and comfortable though. Since it’s NYCity, I think all the hotels charge whatever they want.

title: The staff made our stay feel like home
text: This little hotel is very well located. It’s 2 blocks away from the subway. Rooms are clean and the bathroom’s size is comfortable. What makes this hotel awesome is their staff. All of them were extremely friendly and helpful. But the star of them all is Sergio Lambert. He is an amazing human being. He made our stay feel so at home. Thank you guys 💖

title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location
text: What a great hotel.  Love staying here while we're in NYC.  The rooms are nice, quiet and cosy.   The location is excellent for sightseeing.   Lots of great places to eat and shop close by as well.  The concierge at the hotel was very helpful finding us reservations and suggesting places to visit.   We look forward to our next stay!

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed 6 night in this hotel and we really enjoyed it.
The hotel is a little outdated, but clean, nice big rooms compared to other city hotels and very nice staff.
We had ordred a regular room for 2 persons with cozy bed. The bed was very small, so we got an upgrade after talking to the staff the first morning. The upgrade was very nice with a large kingsize bed, even bigger room, very big bathroom - We are very happy with the help from the staff.
Nice area in the city, quiet at night, close to 5th avenue, Central park, and metro.
We will strongly recommend this hotel and will come back when we come to NY next time.

title: Lovely and cosy.
text: Stayed here to spend new year in New York! Lovely hotel and staff. Not far from Times Square, we walked most places everyday, so quite close to a lot of shops, with a Starbucks right outside the main doors! Bit disappointed that the restaurant was closed for building upgrades whilst we were there. Also rooms are quite small but we didn’t spend a lot of time in it.

title: Much Improved
text:
We had not stayed here for a couple of years and it is much improved. Check in is on the main floor( used to be on 2). They have a preferred Rewards breakfast/ cocktail room . The gym is all new & a great size for the hotel.
All in all TERRIFIC!

title: 1st time to New York City
text: The hotel was excellent!  We were traveling with family so had two rooms, lots of bags.  Greeted by Danny M who was personable and so helpful.  At the desk Serge and Francis was also excellent!  It was 5 star treatment and customer service!

title: Good location, ok hotel
text: The location is nice, corner of Lex and 57.  Few blocks from Central Park.  The front desk is on the foyer area in front of the elevators; lounge is one flight up in, what appears as the hotel's library.  To be honest, meager lounge.  Unless your a elite member with access, I wouldn't pay up for it as its pretty sad.  Offerings are just above school breakfast/lunch.  You're better off heading out to the many eateries that NYC has to offer.  Rooms are modern, but small.  Gym is small and business center is a broom closet.  Otherwise, good location.

title: Never Again Will I Stay Here!!!!!
text:
This past week, I flew into NY for a quick business trip. Prior to my trip, I made a reservation 3 weeks in advance to stay here! My flight landed around 11pm and I made it to the hotel around midnight. When I arrived, the guy behind the counter checked in the  gentleman in front of me. When I got to the counter, the hotel clerk behind the counter told me he had given my room away! 

After the initial shock wore off and my questions got me no where, the clerk opened the safe, handed me petty cash and put me in a cab to stay at the DoubleTree Hilton. While my room at The DoubleTree was comped, who puts a young female in a cab, after midnight to go and stay at a competitors hotel? Not only that but why was the man ahead of me able to check in to a room while I was told my reservation/room had been given away?! When I asked the clerk behind the counter if he would be adding Marriott points to my account he said “No”, grabbed my carry on and hailed a cab for me. 

This is hands down, the WORST treatment I have ever received at a Marriott!!! 

DO NOT STAY HERE!

title: Essential
text: Quello che ti serve a Manhattan! ottima posizione, buon rapporto qualità prezzo, buona pulizia! personale molto cordiale e sempre disponibile. Non ho mai fatto colazione perché c'è uno Starbucks proprio di fronte. Rispetto alle altre mie esperienze a Manhattan questa è stata sicuramente la più favorevole. Bravi!

title: Average.
text:
We stayed at this hotel for a "Christmas in the City" trip and were very underwhelmed. We are Marriott rewards members and stay pretty loyally at Marriott hotels for both leisure and business travel. Generally we are able to check-in early with advanced notice if needed. An advanced notice was given in this scenario (2 mos) and it was confirmed that we could check-in at 10 AM when we arrived. We arrived around 10:30AM and were told that check in was not until 3PM. My account was noted, but the front desk employee let me know that an early check-in would not be possible. This was slightly upsetting as we had planned to get to the room, freshen up and then explore the city for the rest of the day. We went to lunch, meandered and then arrived back at 3PM on the dot ready to check-in. Surprise! Our room wouldn't be ready for another hour. Back out into the city for an hour. 4PM, room still not ready due to some "late checkouts." We did not get into our room until almost 5PM, and no apologies were made. The staff were not accommodating at all, and honestly they were at this point annoyed with our requests to check into our room. 

Once we got into the room everything was nice. The rooms are larger than they appear on the website. We found the entire place to be clean, well decorated, the doorman was incredibly nice and helpful! I would stay there again, but I would NOT do so if I needed to check in early OR have any special accommodations.

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights over the Christmas holidays. Super helpful staff, they checked us in early after a long overnight flight and getting soaked by the rain!
Room was very nice, modern and larger than I expected for a New York hotel.
Ideal location, close to 5th Avenue, Central Park and the underground. 
Will stay here again

title: Amazing Balcony & Great Service
text:
Traveling for business originally for one night - first time staying here. 

Francis at the front desk was great - mentioned "we're a boutique hotel so some of the rooms are cozy." I'm a Platinum Marriott member so sometimes get upgraded and he got me in a deluxe room. I've stayed in New York frequently so I'm used to small rooms. The room itself was spacious for New York but wow - two balconies, one approximately half the size of a basketball court. 

Overall, the hotel is smaller in size but offers a great location and price. I arrived in a cab and walked to my client, so I didn't have a parking experience.

Since I ended up in such a great room, I decided to stay a second night. Again, Francis was helpful and accommodated me quickly and easily. So far, it's been excellent.

title: Good location, friendly staff, but not overly comfortable.
text: Small hotel, started off rocky with nowhere to leave the car to unload and a very slow check in process. The room was tolerable, nothing exceptional to note. The lounge was undergoing construction and what was used as a lounge felt very transient. Certainly other hotels I would pick for a better experience.

title: Small NYC hotel, big on value, location and hospitality
text:
Being Brooklyn residents, we decided to enjoy a Saturday night stay in the city.  We couldn’t be happier with our selection, in terms of value for price paid.   Sure, if we needed everything to be “perfect” we could have chosen to spend $900 per night down the street at the Park Hyatt.  But perfection isn’t a requirement for us, as we look for a solid combination of value, comfort, environment and service from the heart.  That’s exactly what we are experiencing this weekend at Renaissance Hotel 57.  
We booked a higher level room and we got it, we booked a hotel in a great location and we got it.  The team has provided us with heartfelt service and hospitality from check-in.  We are choosing to focus on all the positives.   We are already looking forward to our next stay.

title: Clattering, loud lobby, good location
text: The lobby gives a terrible impression -- very small and all tile where every noise is magnified. Loud music makes being there unbearable. However the location is prime -- , right near the 59th st. Lexington Av subway station with multiple lines. We also took a quick bus ride up Madison Av to Museum Mile. The rooms are very small with bulky built-ins. Spot lighting is trendy but the areas not lighted are very dark. Good breakfast places near-by.

title: BUGS IN BED
text: Upon checking in my 500$ for a weekend room, the staff and the ambiance great. Arrived there early and dropped off my luggage to go explore NYC until I could check in 2:30-3. I get all checked in, went up to my room and wanted to take a quick nap before dinner. Put my jacket in the closet and went to get in bed but before I lay down I saw a small dark spot and wasn’t sure what it was. So, I went to swipe it off the bed but it started crawling. I pulled back the cover and saw 2 more bugs. After that I went downstairs to complain and tell them I needed a refund so I can go to another hotel. They manager told me she will change my room and adjust my bill. So, I accepted that and went to my new room. It was a little nerve wrecking the whole time because I could barely get good sleep because I was afraid something would crawl on me while I was sleep the rest of my time there. My bill was adjusted 30$ for the inconvenience. I will NEVER stay at this place again or suggest this hotel.

title: Great location! Friendly and helpful staff! Clean and efficient rooms!!
text: Front Desk Manager Katherine greets you with a beautiful smile! She Makes Marriott hotels look good and gives the utmost customer service with the help of her accommodating staff.  we are considering to return in August for a family vacation and staying at the same hotel.

title: Poor customer service. Rooms are tired and worn.
text: Was there on business for two nights. Nice corner room on high floor but in need of a remodel. On checkout day I received an email with an invoice not showing the total amount that was debited to my credit card. I did not open the attachment until the next day otherwise I would have asked for a printed copy at front desk during check out. Despite several requests I still did not receive the correct invoice being told by a "manager" in the billing department that they could not find my reservation/bill (?1?) and they would call me back. Two weeks later - still waiting.

title: Very close to my doctor appointment
text: We decided to stay in New York although we live very close in New Jersey due to early morning doctor appointment. Any accommodations in Manhatten are not inexpensive, but I tried to find a reasonably priced hotel near the office. We were delighted at the friendly, helpful staff from front desk, bellman, maid and breakfast room service. The room itself was certainly upgraded, clean and well done. Breakfast was excellent and I am so pleased to see such a comfortable place to stay.  I totally recommend this accommodation.

title: Wonderful staff and nice location.
text: Great location if you want to do Central Park and the MET.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Many smoothie and coffee places nearby. Also just a few blocks from the subway. The room was very clean and comfortable. Would go again.

title: Stylish and well located
text:
Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is the right choice if you are looking for a beautiful and stylish hotel in the Midtown area. This hotel boutique has a graceful design with gorgeous furniture and elegant environment. There is an enchanted lounge where it is possible to relax and enjoy the place to the sound of good music and a nice restaurant that serves tasty food.
Despite the diminutive size, the room was lovely: the bed and the bathroom were excellent and there were useful equipment and accessories.
Furthermore, it is well located: few squares to Central Park and the 5th Avenue.
I indeed was immersed in the Renaissance atmosphere in my stay there and I recommend it for sure to everyone who wants to a modern and great hotel in New York City.

title: Boyfriend Birthday Weekend
text: First time Staying in NY ... we stayed in room 609 June 15 to 17 room size was ok for me and my boyfriend Ny rooms are small anyway. To me the hotel is in a business District. We basically just use the room to sleep. We court a uber carpool to go everywhere we got on the subway once to go to the yankees game. The hotel  was a good ways from times square. Probably wouldn't stay in this area again just rather be closer to more action. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Rooms too small, there are better choices
text: Good location, gloomy reception but the rooms are just TOO SMALL.  You cant walk around your bed, the desk is almost a "hole in the wall" the a/c was noisy enough that I had to switch it off at night.  In addition, no free wifi in the rooms (nearly $6 a day!) and breakfast is an addl $25 (unless you are in their VIP programme).  Sorry, but there are many better places to stay in the area and I would not return to this establishment.  I stayed there because a client "recommended" it - Should have checked on TA first!  To be fair, fitness center is ok.

title: Disappointed
text: Well are really disappointed with the Renaissance here in New York. We usually stay at Marriott but since the Renaissance are in the Marriott family we decided to give it a try. The rooms are small outdated. In order to have a double bad they charge me $92 extra a night, even thou I am a Marriott gold member. The beds are uncomfortable and small nothing like the Marriott beds. Even thou breakfast finishes at 10 am. when we arrived there at 9:40 they were removing everything already. Breakfast is only Monday to Friday and we were not informed. In my case I love being a Gold member so I don’t have to worry about a place to have breakfast in the morning. The lounge doesn’t have a door so they make you feel so uncomfortable when you enter and the barkeeper requesting roudly to see the room key. Definitely not coming back to a Renaissance.

title: Not worth the price - high end "college dorm room"
text:
Small room with bad maintenance.  There is just enough room to walk around the bed.  I had to look for the light switch to turn on the lights in the bathroom.  I finally found it after entering the bathroom and CLOSING the door to reach the wall BEHIND the door.  The bathroom is not made for anybody tall or big.  Tall/big people may have trouble fitting in the bathroom and closing the door.  There is hardly enough room for the towels.  Too many issues to write about.  It is like a high end college dorm room.  

Just skip it.  There are plenty of other decent hotels in NYC!!

If you want the dorm room experience, pay the lower price and go to a NYC hostel.

title: Terrible night's sleeo due to climate control problems (third time)
text:
I've stayed at this property several times.  The location is great and the staff is friendly, the rooms are always clean and the prices surprisingly reasonable for the location.  Great for a 1-2 night business trip.

That said, I've never gotten a good night's sleep here.  They have the HVAC controls preprogrammed to a heat setting of 73°F and an AC setting of 75°F.

I sleep in 68-69°F, and realize this is unusual.  At most properties (I'm on the road more than I'm "home") it's just a simple matter of turning the temperature down.  I actually can't sleep above about 71°F.

These thermostats are preprogrammed in a way that makes it impossible to manually alter the temperature for more than about 2 hours. After that it returns to the pre-programmed settings above, including turning on the heat until it reaches 73 degrees.

Knowing this had been a problem before, I spoke with the front desk about the temperature and they assured me that maintenance would come up and fix it. When I returned I checked in at the front desk again and they told me maintenance had fixed the problem.

I don't know whether or not maintenance actually went in, and I don't know whether or not maintenance understood my request or somehow it was Lost in Translation between the front desk. However the net result was that a couple hours after I went to sleep, the heat turned on and I woke up shortly thereafter on able to fall back asleep again.

After several hours, I finally figured out how to reprogram the thermostat myself, which involves a complicated process of changing approximately 5 presets stored in the thermostat.  This is an unreasonably difficult process for a guest to go through at a purportedly upscale Marriott property.

The worst part, however, was being told by the front desk not only that it would be fixed, but having it later confirmed that it was fixed, when in fact it was not.  I realize that these new thermostats are more complicated and may pose challenges for maintenance technicians who are just becoming familiar with them. However I would expect that for a Marriott property they would take this into account, and take steps to ensure that guests can set the temperature overnight to their desired level which allows them to sleep.

Regrettably, I will not be staying at this property again until the problem is fixed. This is unfortunate, because as I said, it is otherwise an excellent property for business purposes in that part of the city, which is a frequent destination of mine.

title: Great location on the east side but room sizes vary greatly
text:
I stayed here five days during a conference in April.  Last time I was here I had a very small room so I asked to be upgraded being a Marriott gold member.  The rooms vary tremendously.  You could have a very small room or larger room with a balcony.

I was surprised that the hotel charged to use their business center, computer an d printer.  This is unusual for a Marriott and I suggest they make it complimentary. People at the front desk , Francis, William Bravo, and Raymond Tassiello, who each printed for me the updated speech after several edits.This was particular helpful when I was working late at night when they printed and delivered it to my room.

They offered complimentary breakfast for gold members and the quality was average.

title: Great for a weekend trip
text:
Stayed here for a quick weekend trip. Room is deceptively narrow but there was plenty of closet space and I was surprised at how big the bathroom was. 

Both nights there was construction work right on 57th street but we never heard any of the construction noise so if you want a place that can be quiet despite the bustle of NYC then this place might do it.

title: Great Mother's day weekend in NYC
text: Room updated and very clean with comfortable beds.  Had a great view.  Bathroom updated with modern conveniences -- very nice.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Although the restaurants were under renovation, staff recommended other places to dine.  Would definitely stay there again.  Within in walking distance of dining establishments and shopping.

title: Pretty Awful
text: Cold showers, small room, bed frame made for bruised shins, generally tired, asked for a coffee in check out at 0530 and told not served until 0630, bulb in room not replaced following request. Good example of what hospitality is not about....

title: Good location, poor hotel
text: I stay at Marriott properties in NYC over 20x per year. This property has a great location but that’s about it.  The rooms are sub par and majority of the staff is impersonal. We witnessed some staff being aggressive and rude to other guests.  I contacted the General Manager prior to my visit and never received a response despite my Lifetime Platinum status. My experience leads me to believe they may have a leadership problem. There are better Marriott hotels in this price range to stay at.

title: Centrico y amable atención
text:
Este hotel está excelentemente situado en midtown East Manhattan,  cercano a la céntrica 5ta ave., Rockefeller Center, Tiendas, Restaurantes y Central Park.  Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero limpias, buen equipadas y con buena vista de la ciudad.  El baño es pequeño, sin embargo moderno y cómodo. 
Algunas areas como los ascensores necesitan ser  renovadas. 
En el area circundante hay opciones para desayunar y comer.

title: Nothing Special in Accommodation But Good Location
text: Kind of a barren hotel with limited amenities unless you are some type of super rewards memeber. But it's a great location if you intend to shop at Bloomingdales. The room windows are secure and unless you continually run the air, the room has a musty odor. I don't ever watch TV but I noted that if you have accounts with internet TV providers, you can access them here.

title: Outdated Property - Unprofessional Staff
text: The boxed cabinetry reminds me of my small dorm room when I was an undergrad.  Needs a makeover.  But the real reason for my low rating is the unprofessional service from front desk personnel (not all but the ones who appear to be 'in charge') and the male lounge attendant.  Do they really need jobs where they deal with the public?

title: Muy lindo hotel
text: Hemos parado varias veces y siempre hemos quedado muy conformes. Esta vez reservamos una suite, muy amplia. Tiene una excelente ubicación para visitar New York. Camas muy cómodas. Sin dudas, volvería.

title: Good not great
text: Great customer service and very friendly staff, ok sized room, and large bathroom. My only gripe is that my room was next to an elevator bank and it was slightly discomforting due to the noise especially after hours.

title: Great Midtown location
text:
The 2-queen room was spacious by NYC standards, spacious bathroom. Had all the amenities you’d expect as well as free mini fridge and bathrobes which we just had to request. The location in Midtown East 57th and Lexington is close to Rockefeller Center, Central Park and lots of restaurants, high-end shopping and smaller boutiques.
Service was friendly and informative, we felt welcomed immediately.
Good continental breakfast included on week days, we had vouchers for same at neighboring restaurant on weekends.
Uber costs: from EWR $49,  to LGA $34, to Times Square $12 + depending on time of day.

title: Ótima opção para andar a pé por NYC
text:
Hotel super bem localizado! Próximo da 5a avenida e Central Park. Próximo tbm a farmácias, e o supermercado Whole Foods!
O quarto do hotel tem um bom tamanho, limpo e com chuveiro muito bom!
O atendimento foi ótimo tbm! Equipe super solicita! Fui com meu filho bebe e me emprestaram por toda estadia um microondas para que eu pudesse esquentar as papinhas e esterilizar mamadeiras! Só nessa atitude o hotel me ganhou!
O café da manhã eh a parte e caro, mas na frente do hotel (atravessando a rua) tem uma Starbucks!

title: Small but efficient and nicely redecorated rooms and great service.
text:
We travel to NYC 4-5 times a year.  The Renaissance was always an "OK" choice in midtown.  After a recent renovation, however, I can highly recommend the place.  The rooms, while still on the small size, make the most of the space and are now decorated in current good taste.  Marble bathroom was spotless and water pressure surprisingly good. Our room had great natural light--sometimes hard to come by in midtown.   Some street noise, but to be fair, we were in a room at the corner of 57th and Lex--only so much you can expect.
The staff at the Renaissance were exemplary.  In particular, Elizabeth at the front desk was professional, friendly and efficient--always offering us any extras we might need.  
She and the other lobby staff also LOOKED professional (have you, like me, noticed how poorly dressed--even slovenly--registration employees look at a lot of nice hotels these days?  No excuse.)  We also got the royal treatment from Daniel, the valet--who was above and beyond courteous and helpful.  He remembered us from a visit a year earlier--and at the end of the visit remembered our car.  Pretty remarkable.  Employees like that ensure that we will be back.  Thanks for a great stay at a reasonable rate.

title: La peor experiencia de mi vida
text: Desde sorprender  a housekeeping revisando los cajones de mi cuarto para supuestamente ayudarme a encontrar algo que había extraviado hasta esperar durante 30 minutos ayuda para bajar mi equipaje y tener que hacerlo yo solo ante la mirada despreocupada de gerentes de recepción y sus asistentes, pasando porque un empleado sugiera que haberse transferido de Ritz Carlton a este sitio había sido su más terrible decisión... todo lo peor que uno pueda imaginar...

title: Best Service
text:
Excellent Hotel
A special mention to Daniel the brazilian staff guy
The state of the art in terms of customer orientation and services 
Very helpful and smiling
He us always helping to solve any issues and provide great advise
Not so common in hotel industries

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text:
Disclaimer: I look for cleanliness, comfort and service when I stay at a hotel since I’m only there to sleep. How big the room is or how many amenities it has are not priority on my list.
As for this hotel, the employees were lovely, from the doorman to the front desk to environmental services, everyone was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, space well used and quiet. The gym had basic equipment and was clean. The location is great, you’re within blocks from various train stations for different subway lines and you can also walk to Central Park or Times Square (if you don’t mind walking that is).
Looking forward to staying here in the near future.

title: Excelente localização!
text: Confesso que foi mais do que eu esperava, o quarto é pequeno e o chuveiro mais ou menos, mas no geral tudo excelente. A localização é perfeita, você consegue fazer muita coisa a pé e mesmo se tiver que se locomover de uber não fica caro. Nós amamos e eu voltaria com certeza. Fomos muito bem atendidos pelos funcionários, super cordiais!

title: Engagement
text: I proposed to my wife at this hotel. I spoke with the GM before our stay and they set up the room/terrace for the engagement while we were at lunch. The staff was above and beyond what I was expecting for our stay!

title: Averagee hotel in a great location with helpful staff
text: The hotel was undergoing some renovation when we stayed and I am hoping that will extend to the bedrooms which felt tired. We had 2 rooms each with 2 double beds and whilst one felt small the other was very spacious. In the smaller room there was totally inadequate hanging space. HOWEVER, if like us you are using the hotel as a place to sleep and wake up then, if you can get a good priced deal like we did, it is worth it given the location close to Central Park and 5th Avenue. One point in its favour is the staff who were extremely friendly and helpful, none more so than Daniel the bellman who welcomed us with a friendly smile every day and is a credit to the hotel.

title: Decent Stay
text: The hotel is at a prime location - close proximity to restaurants, subway station and shopping spots. I reached the hotel early but wasn't accommodated for another 2-3 hours. The rooms are small with a stand-in shower but the city-view made up for the lack of comfort. I expected to find a luxury boutique-style hotel but was left disappointed with the adequate features present.

title: Glorified hostel
text:
The rooms in this hotel are awful. I have stayed in New York hotel rooms countless times so I am used to rooms that are smaller than other places.  But the rooms here are like closets. Some have full size beds, which are acceptable if you are in college, but not for adults.  The carpet looks 30 years old, and the only lighting in the room is one desk lamp.

There are a million hotels in New York, stay at any other one.

The picture below is the entire room!

title: A Disappointment
text: I have always liked Renaissance hotels.  However, this Renaissance hotel was a disappointment.  As a Platinum Premier Rewards member, my "upgraded room" was very small, had a tiny closet and tiny bathroom, and was so darkly decorated that it was depressing.  Also, the Concierge Lounge was relatively small.  Again, very disappointing for a Category 7 hotel!

title: Not exceptional, but not bad
text: just like my title says, it was an average experience. room was clean and nice size for NY. i have seen a lot worse. my only complaint was that there was nowhere to get a soda or snack. after a 3 hr flight delay, i wanted something small. the front desk was kind enough to give me a water and a bag of chips from the gold members reception.

title: Excellent mid-scale option in mid-town
text:
The Hotel 57 is in a good location between both Central Park and the attractions of midtown (Empire State, Times Square, etc), so it's a great mid-scale jumping off point for those wanting to explore the city on foot. The Met is about a 25 minute walk to give you a frame of reference (MOMA is much closer).

The building doesn't quite have the flare that the Algonquin or Lexington have, but still has plenty of early 20th century charm, down to the small elevators and oddly-shaped rooms. The corner rooms will be the most likely to have good views out over the city, but at under 20 stories tall, don't expect to see much besides street views and the balconies and terraces of nearby condos.

The rooms are up to typical Marriott standards. The beds are comfortable, there's plenty of linens, and it's not too noisy, though the walls are a bit on the thin side. You can and will hear people talking in the hallway, but that's to be expected in older buildings. The bathrooms have a combination tub/shower.

When we stayed (March 2018), the lounge is only open on weekdays and there's no in-building restaurant due to renovation, but the full menu from the restaurants are available for room service.

Parking is $55 a day and is valet-only. Park by the entrance on 57th Street and a valet will come out to take your keys. It can take some time to get your car back so plan ahead when needing it. There are subway stops 2-3 blocks away so take you to further destinations if needed.

title: Bed Bugs
text: I don't usually write reviews I leave that up to my wife but this time definitely could not resist. My stay at the Renaissance Hotel 57 was horrible. I would like to emphasize the word horrible. I stayed  at the Renaissance Hotel 57 the weekend of St. Patrick's Day 2018 which was my wife's birthday weekend. I booked room 1504 for two nights well and then I had to get switched to another room because we found a bed bug crawling on the pillow the morning after our first night. While laying in bed talking to my wife, I saw a bug on my wife's pillow above her head. I freaked out and jumped up and googled the picture of a bedbug and to my surprise the exact same copper colored bug was on the pillow. I was furious because of the amount of money I spent on the room and the amount of time I spent on my wife's birthday trying to surprise her with a weekend in Manhattan at the high-end hotel.  When I called the manager to come she had the housekeeping manager remove the bedbug with a credit and inspect the headboards. tomorrow her in one of the security guards didn't really take it as serious as I expected. The housekeeping manager put our clothes in a bag and washed them in the hotel laundry. My wife was the calm one but as you could imagine I was the angry one with all right. The only good thing that they did was take $100 off the night rate. I personally would never recommend anyone to stay at the Renaissance Hotel 57 because that hotel has bedbugs.  I'm not sure if it was in every room but it definitely was in room 1504. I'm not sure if it was something that just started but I would never recommend anyone to stay there. Do yourself a favor you're better off sleeping in your car off the Westside Highway  or something. I'm not giving this review to try to get attention or anything but I  really want to inform everyone about this place. I don't complain I don't like to bother people I don't even like to give the reviews but in this case I definitely had to because of what I have experienced.  My wife took pictures of the bug and  and made a 311 complaint to the city. Please do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. The bad thing is we all look at Manhattan and look forward to staying in a four-star hotels but who knows what might be lurking inside of those walls I learned a valuable lesson. Looks can be very deceiving.

title: Review
text: The room was very tiny for a US hotel. The staff were friendly. The rooms were well cleaned. It was basic - the ambience was nice with a nice fragrance. The location was central but I will not book it again. It

title: Needs a LOT of work
text:
I seldom comment on a hotel within the first few hours of arrival.  This hotel is in desperate need of attention.  The furniture is painted over (i assume to cover up age) and that paint is bubbling.  The room looks like a prison cell (not that I've been in one but seen many on TV!).  The carpet has an odor.  Simply tired hotel without any public area and no bar or restaurant (apparently being remodeled right now).  I stayed at this hotel five or so years ago and did not have a good impression then.  I thought I'd give it another shot and I can say definitively, I will not be returning.

Too many hotels in NY to choose from.  Not sure how Marriott can allow this hotel to stay in their system.

Not even a complimentary water to offset the lack of amenities in this hotel.  The management company should be fired and Marriott should be ashamed they are allowing this hotel to remain as a Renaissance.

title: I Should Have Listened to These Reviews
text:
Marriott PP and Shareholder. This stay has to be in my top three worst hotel stays. Three different rooms in three days (due to room size, housekeeping leaving a previous guest's sock on the floor, the air conditioner malfunction, the heater was 'repaired' with a cardboard box and towels), an arcing electrical outlet and a water leak in the bathroom). Fortunately, I received a random survey from Marriott. I received an email from the Director of Front Office with the same canned apologies as shown in the other reviews. His email asks for me to contact him via phone to discuss. I have left two voicemails and one email. No response in the week since his email. This speaks volumes as to the level of customer service and value they place on guests.

Hopefully Marriott will end their association soon

title: Nice Hotel in the East Side
text: I checked in about 10pm and Diana recognized my Marriott status and since I requested a quiet room she found one for me on floor 17.  Great room, nice views of Lexington and 57th and it was quiet enough for me to get a good nights sleep.  I did not know what to expect as I had booked this before I read the reviews but I have to say my experience with the valet, Diana at the front desk and other staff members was very positive.  They also served a decent breakfast in their concierge lounge.  I have stayed in so many hotels in my time and because of the way I was treated and comfort and quiet of my room I will stay here again.

title: Amazing Hospitality
text: This hotel should be so proud of their staff.  Service as hospitable as this is hard to come by, and in this hotel's case, it wasn't just one person but honestly everyone we encountered who were professional and nice.  The two that we dealt with the most was Raymond at the front desk and Daniel, the Bellman.  There was also an amazing woman who was always there greeting us at the door, but I did not get her name, unfortunately.  This hotel was not fancy but the location was perfect, it was spotless and, as mentioned, the staff is top-notch.  We will be back because of all of that and we will surely recommend you to our friends and family.

title: great location and staff
text:
this is a great hotel with a wonderful staff.  Location is perfect.
The rooms can seem a little small but comparable to most of the city.
My only issue is that they have been renovating their lobby for over a year.  entering requires taking 2 separate elevators.

title: Good Staff but very small hotel
text:
My very first trip to New York for a Business Trip, booked this hotel as all my colleagues did the same. The reason we booked this one is because it was at a stones throw distance from my office.

Staff is nice and polite, good area around. Rooms are cramped but clean.

Choose this hotel for 2 reasons: Nearby work or its cheap.

title: Motel style
text:
Let me start by saying i am Platinum premier member with Marriott for over 10 years. 
When I arrived to the room I realized the sheets had blood stains on them as you can see in the pictures. 
This place has no class, the rooms have no life to it. This morning when I woke up I had no hot water to shower When I complained they called me a liar and did not believe me. When I came down I asked them where to purchase coffee and they advised me there’s no restaurant on site and they can’t provide with such services. 
The Hilton garden inn down the block would be a much better choice as there rooms are way better and they give you coffee and breakfast as well as hot water to shower. 
I would never walk in to this hotel motel again. 
It’s an embarrassment to the Renaissance name!!!

title: Amazing Staff & Room
text: Beautiful art in the lobby. Bed was very comfy and shower pressure was perfect. A special thank you to William and Elizabeth. They took great care of my mother and I and it meant a lot to me that she was very happy. I will definitely be back soon.

title: Friendly staff working at a disappointing hotel
text:
First and foremost, the pictures available on booking.com are far from realistic.
After we've checked in, we were shocked that for the price we were paying the couch was stained and there was dust in the incredibly small closet.
Second, we had to use the restroom right after checking in and we're grossed that almost every single time you'd flush the toilet, the toilet paper would just come back. Unless you flush the toilet 3-4 times, you'd end up with disintegrated paper floating around. Yuck.
Third, the windows are incredibly small - I believe this might be a New York thing or maybe something specific to the neighborhood. However, they could at least make sure they're clean: besides the fact that they were small, it was highly disappointing not to be able to look out the window because of the large and old dust stains.
We eventually tried to upgrade to a suite or a superior because we were unhappy with the room and bed size too (no, even as Europeans, the bed was just too small to be comfortable for two persons), but that wasn't possible since we apparently were in a Junior Suite and the more spacious rooms were unavailable during our 6 nights stay.
Since we were informed there's no breakfast available (which is incorrect - it's only available for Gold Marriot Rewards members - or higher), we decided to buy some fruit to have for breakfast in our room. Unfortunately though, there's no fridge in the room. On top of that, even a lousy half-liter bottle of water is being charged for $5.00.
I hoped there'd be a desk in the room as I was told. However, the desk is literally a small table embedded right within the wall-large closet, designed in the corner of the room. As you sit down at it, the chair's legs get blocked by the corner of the bed - that's how large the room was. Everything is just impossibly tight and narrow around the bed, and trying to get some work done at the desk is helpless.
Last but certainly not least, we were disappointed by the Internet connectivity. On one hand, it's only available to Marriot Rewards members - you could register for free, but still. Unless you do so, you have to pay $16 + tax per day. Second, if you are a Marriot Rewards member or choose to pay the aforementioned amount, the provided connectivity is extremely poor, almost useless. They even had a network outlet in the room, but that didn't work.
All in all, the hotel requires some absolutely necessary renovation - in its current state, it's far from being a four-star hotel.

title: Criminal behavior & deceitful staff
text:
Booked this room for my 18 year old daughter who was auditioning at a nearby college. 
I pre-paid for the room with my credit card and called the hotel (on two separate occasions) to be certain that my daughters debit card would not be charged for the room cost and only be made available for incidentals incurred during her stay (as she only had a small amount of money in her account). 
Upon check-in, they took my daughters debit and charged the entire cost of the room (which was already paid for on my CC), leaving her with $15 for two days in NYC. Needless to say this caused a tremendous amount of stress and numerous phone calls to the hotel itself where the woman was extremely rude and unhelpful and also lied about being a manager. I was told that there was nothing they could do and that they would refund the money AFTER CHECKOUT. So I then escalated to Marriott customer service where I was told (after a 2 hour conversation) that the funds were "released" but that it would take 3 - 5 days for the bank to process it. So the next morning we added more funds into my daughters account so that she could finally get something to eat. Not once did the hotel staff offer any type of solution to the problem that THEY created. No offer of even a gift card to a Starbucks, or the concierge sending her to a local restaurant (they all have connections and I've been comped more times than I can remember by the concierges in various Boston hotels)  - nothing but rude and unethical dealings at this one. I've since escalated this to the office of consumer affairs (Mr. Marriott's office) to let them know that this hotel is tarnishing the Marriott name and is the furthest thing from the usual quality of a Renaissance Hotel. I can only hope that corporate truly looks into this matter and does something to fix it! We frequently stay in NYC and will certainly NEVER stay in the hotel again.

title: Don't stay here- overpriced and out the way.
text:
Large bathroom and modern style.

Don’t stay here, it’s not worth the money. I have been to New York a few times! You don’t need to do this one. It is trying to be something it just isn’t. The staff were unhelpful and a little rude. One of the receptionists LIED about putting us in a bigger room next to elevator that was switch off at night so didn’t make noise! Bed was tiny and loud ALL NIGHT. No free WiFi. No free water. Way too expensive! I could go on!

title: Good value in a convenient location
text: Although the hotel is under renovation, this did not bother us too much.  The location is superb, and the rooms are huge by Manhattan standards.  The subway is close by, and the staff are quite friendly.  I stayed here twice in one week, and can highly recommend this hotel.

title: Mmmmhhhh wait bit more of it
text: I was three nights at this NY hotel, the bed was ok, the shower have a few problems with cavitation of the hot water...was not fluid and noise...the concierge is friendly and with helping attitude. At night they just ket a single people at the regsitration and is very complex to receive help from him...we were stand ther for five minutes and the people in charge just send us to our rooms without interest to solve our wifi problem...no restaurant at this moment and they have a breakfast area that is just for its membership...is a big mistake! if I dont have an option for my guests at least I open this for All...At least I think this will make the guest feel more comfortable...as said wait more... I was on the tird floor with no nice view...

title: DONT STAY HERE
text:
The hotel looked like an abandoned building. The corner shop was closed, so the block looked abandoned. The double door hotel entrance had a luggage rack blocking its use the entire trip because it was cold out (possible safety/code violation).  When you pulled up at night there it was very dark, minimal lighting outside, and no doorman. 
The restaurant was closed. They did not even have a coffee station. I reserved two beds and I received one double bed in a room slightly larger than the bed for two people. I was not able to sleep. Despite the fact that I am an elite member, they did not honor my reservation request for two beds and said they were sold out. I checked in before noon. I would think that would be early enough to get the room that I requested. Hotel looked empty to me....

title: Comfortable stay at a reasonable price on Manhattan east side
text: The lobby is small and dark, and you Wonder a litle what the hotel will be like.  The check in was friendly and efficient.  An added plus for us was the valet parking. The rooms were not large, but as we only were two it was ample Space for us. The restaurant was closed at Our stay, a minor inconvennience particularly as there is a diner Next door With great breakfast.  Our main reason for choosing this hotel was the parking and location. That the hotel otherwise lived up to expectations was an added plus.  If we can get rooms at the price we got then we will be back.

title: A Lax Commitment To Guest Safety At This Hotel
text:
I stayed in this hotel recently. I am Lifetime Platinum with Marriott. At about 10:00PM the night I stayed, the fire alarm went off. Often these alarms are false, and as there was no sign of smoke, I called the front desk using the room phone. Unfortunately, no one at the front desk answered my call. I called multiple times, still no answer. 

I consider the fact that a guest cannot communicate with the front desk during a time of potential risk is a safety concern, a violation of the tacit contract between hotel and guest for our safety, and therefore unacceptable. I doubt the Marriott brand standards accept this condition. Ultimately I learned from a staff person I tracked down in the hallway that it was a false alarm.

The next day at 7:00AM, I called the front desk. Again no-one answered.

I went to the front desk about 7:15 and spoke with a front desk agent. I asked her to have the GM of the hotel call me regarding my guest safety concern. I did not receive the courtesy of a response from the GM.

At 11:30 that morning, as I was departing the hotel, I again asked to have the GM call me. I was told by the front desk manager that he "was too busy in construction meetings" to call. The front desk manager asked me "how can I make this right" which I interpreted as him being ready to put extra points in my Marriott account. I declined as my concern was the safety of guests in the hotel. Besides, I have more points than I can use.

I again left my contact info, and again did not receive the courtesy of a call from the GM. This lack of commitment to customer service and safety is the reason I am writing this review. I am left to conclude that a guest's concerns are not important to the management of this property. 

ATTENTION BUILDING OWNERSHIP AND MARRIOTT CORPORATE: The performance of the GM of this hotel should be reviewed immediately. 

To the GM I say-shame on you. You are apparently too cowardly to confront legitimate guest concerns, even those as critical as safety. Those of us who regularly stay in hotels are dependent on efficient and effective property management, including a meaningful commitment to safety. Based on my experience in your hotel, I can't imagine you will ever possess those management traits.

title: Luggage stolen from hotel's checked luggage facility.
text: My backpack was stolen from the checked luggage facility and iPad and other valuable items were taken.  Met with senior hotel management on same night, filed loss report,  There was no question that the theft occurred and the hotel accepted responsibility.  Was assured (promised) that I would be compensated. Have followed up with many unreturned telephone calls, unanswered emails, etc.  Have even escalated to Marriott Corporate Customer Care and now to Marriott Consumer Affairs.  Now 40 days later and no one has even contacted me about the loss.  Have been loyal Marriott customer (Platinum Elite) for almost 50 years and never subjected to this kind of treatment.

title: リピートはないかな
text:
クリスマス時期にホテルが取れず、マリオット系で探してこちらに一泊だけしました。
古いブティックホテルをマリオットが買い取ったとしか思えない、ルネッサンスとも他のマリオット系ホテルの建物とも装飾とも全く違っていました（バスアメニティーだけが同じ）。
サービスが悪かったわけではなく、ただ私の期待と好みに合わなかったです。

title: Marriott's Rennaissance 57 NYC
text:
A wonderful Marriott Hotel on East 57th & Lexington.  Favorite lodging selection is either the Skyloft Suite, when available, or the Cartiage Suite.
Staff is very cordial, knowledgeable concierge always ready and willing to help guests experience NYC, regardless of interest (s) or time of the year.

Room service for dining in is excellent, but the traveller will love the Restaurant & Lounge.

Special travel packages, year round, make this Marriott Property a great pick when in New York, and a wonderful and memorable place to stay.

Great professional staff that loves their guests. Multiple stays at this Hotel throughout the years have proven one great benefit - consistently great stays.

Treat yourself and yours and select your Hotel stay at Rennaissance 57.

5 Stars +

title: Amazing location within walking distance of everything
text:
Hotel is very conveniently located, however, when the renovation of its lobby and restaurant area will be completed then everything will be much better.
Service overall is good. No complimentary water in the room something which I found extremely strange. Also, internet is chargeable in all areas of the hotel even for houseguests!

title: Worst Marriott hotel
text:
This hotel charged me additional $90 without my permission. And refuse to refund it.
Incredible!
And the room is the worst one I ever stayed. Small, with EXTREMELY poor sound isolation (I could even hear toilet sound from adjacent room). As a platinum member of Marriott, I received no upgrade, no breakfast and a worst room. Thanks.

title: Great location!
text: Close to breakfast place and two blocks from subway and 5th Ave, this Marriott boutique hotel offers a great stay for Marriott members. Rooms comfortable for 4 woman to prepare for the dayLobby renovations will enhance roadside appeal.

title: Good hotel but rude and incompetent, lying staff
text:
As a platinum Marriott member, I've had more than my fair share of hotel nights am generally not a demanding guest. I understand mistakes happen, and that's fine. However, this place takes incompetence to a malicious level.

1) Sneaky fraudulent extra charges: secretly added a parking charge of $58 one night in my 7 night stay in Manhattan- and since it's Manhattan I don't even have / need a car. There was no agreement, no mention of this, only the appearance of this on my folio. Sneakily fraudulent.

2) When I called the front desk to ask for this to be removed, the person on the line apologized and promised to remove the fraudulent charge. Charge still not removed until I insisted on staying on the line until I get an updated folio emailed to me.

3) A front desk manager at 2 am refused to price match to Hotel Tonight per Marriott policy and refused to make a new reservation for me or extend my reservation. He (claimed to be named William) made me feel as if I should head over to the Hilton instead...

4) When I asked for water to be sent up, the staff member entered my room WITHOUT KNOCKING while I was changing...

Overall, great location, close to my work, nice rooms and facilities, but will not stay again due to incompetent staff...

title: Tiny room
text: My room had a standard bed and not much room but the rate is reasonable. There is no restaurant and the breakfast lounge is quite limited. Beside all that a decent hotel in a great location. It is currently under renovation so you might check in that.

title: Great Location
text:
I love Marriott Hotels. When I first came into this hotel I was surprised by the small rooms and hoped for something larger, but I was told they are all the same. That is a drawback, but the proximity to everything New York made it worth staying here. 
The beds, as always at a Marriott were very comfortable. 
The price is reasonable compared to other hotels in the vicinity. The staff were very friendly and offered up a few free drink vouchers. Very much appreciated as you all know how expensive New York can be. Hospitality lounge is closed on the weekends and breakfast fare is average.
There's a McDonalds around the corner if you want their breakfasts:)  Over all we enjoyed our stay very much.

title: Muy recomendado
text: Es un hotel muy buen ubicado en el centro de Manhattan en NY. Nos quedaba accesible todo. Es un hotel acogedor, limpio, silencioso. Su personal es muy agradable, en seis noches la pasamos muy bien. Se lo recomendamos, nos dieron wifi de cortesía, los desayunos incluidos, cafe, agua siempre disponibles.

title: Nice Stay at Renaissance 57
text:
Overall, I had a good stay at the Renaissance Hotel 57.  

One thing to note is that the hotel is currently under renovation so the restaurants are not currently operating, but its also a good opportunity to get a good deal!

I am a Marriott Rewards member and was upgraded to a nice corner room which was fairly large for NYC standards.  Room was clean and comfortable, although nothing to write home about.  Location was convenient to exploring Manhattan, however ask for a higher floor if possible to avoid noise.  Staff that I encountered were all friendly and helpful. 

Looking forward to staying at the hotel again after the renovations are complete.

title: My First Stay!
text: Diane Salizar checked me in and she is so welcoming and has a great personality.  I can imagine it's not easy to be welcoming all the time when you're standing on your feet all day and since the hotel is undergoing renovation, they're positioned right by the front door and it was frigid in NYC during my stay.  Diane is a excellent resource for restaurants and recommended a great restaurant near the hotel where I had the best Chilean Sea bass and experienced a great restaurant that I will revisit.  I'd walked by this hotel for years and Diane gave me a bit of history about the building.  It was one of the first women shelters in the city and still has some elderly residents.  I had what is classified as a "cozy room" which is very small but beautifully appointed.  Like most visits to NYC, I spend very little time in the room. The décor of the hotel is nice and the elevator lobbies are nice and offer seating with is unusual.  I'm a big user of hotel irons and had the best Sunbeam iron which happened to be brand new without any iron scorch marks (the cord still had the plastic twist on it). The bathroom is nice with glass shelves and cubby holes in the wall for amenities and wash cloths.  The hotel is conveniently located to great shopping e.g., the flagship Bloomingdale's is two blocks away and Barney's and Bergdorf Goodman are nearby.  The hotel's restaurants are currently closed due to the renovation and aren't scheduled to reopen until later on this year.  Be sure to say hello to Diane during your stay and tap into her knowledge!

title: Bad experience
text:
My daughter and I stayed at the hotel from the 21st Dec - 26th.  The hotel staff seemed friendly enough on arrival.  We had separate rooms.  My double room on the 6th floor had been updated.  A small room, with hardly any luggage space and not really big enough for two people.  My daughters room was old dark wood and tired looking on the 4th floor awaiting renovation .
The hotel is in a great location, close to 5th Av and Central Park. We had a great time together exploring NY.  That’s the positive. 
Bad customer service really taints a customer experience .
On our departure, our problem started with the bill.  Expedia had taken monies, the hotel had taken monies so charged twice.  It took three people to solve this problem and our time .  We specifically requested which cards to take monies from .  We were assured by the lady on the desk that this would happen and not to worry.  On my return to the UK, they did precisely what I asked them not to do and charged the wrong card, causing problems .  We have e mailed the hotel twice with no reply, clearly choosing to ignore the situation .
Poor customer service in this day and age is unacceptable, and with so much choice in NY, I would research and stay somewhere, where customer service and experience is a priority.

title: Christmas in Renaissance New York Hotel 57
text:
Our party of 4 stayed from 22/12/2017 until 25/12/2017.
Some aspects of this hotel were very good but a few issues due to renovation that spoiled the experience.

We had board on a room only basis but were unaware prior to arriving that there were no dining facilities at all and you had to leave the hotel for everything. 

The hotel were very accommodating in that they allowed us a later check out on Christmas day as we were being picked up at 4pm to travel to JFK airport.

We still had to wait about for a couple of hours after check out and there were no facilities to get even a complimentary coffee or drink and the the restrooms were closed due to refurbishment. We eventually spoke to a member of staff who provided us with a key card for the restrooms in their business facility. 

As we were facing a long flight back to Scotland this was disappointing as we didn't really want to be out trailing prior to our departure.

Aside from that the rooms were comfortable, clean and well serviced each day.

title: Given its NYC, look elsewhere
text: I (sadly) would like to echo the very well written review by ‘mbateacher’ on Dec 12th of this year.  I should have known it was trouble the moment the word “boutique” was used to describe the property.  The lounge only had water, no soft drinks.  Yes, it becomes a tacky bar at night.  Bed is far too firm.  Zero storage space in the room.  Staff seem friendly but there are so many other issues that make staying at a different Marriott property more advisable.  Renaissance hotels are usually spacious and chic with areas to hang out in, definitely not the case here.  Location played a big part in this choice, but next time I’ll just walk a couple extra blocks.

title: Boutique hotel-feel but the rooms...
text: It tries to be a boutique hotel, but the rooms are dated and nothing to shout about. The location is great - a few blocks away from 5th Ave and Central Park. The staff were very friendly and helpful, which made up for the drab room. I was told that there was a nice rooftop bar, but it was undergoing renovations when I stayed there.

title: Not impressed
text:
Checked in today.  The superior room is anything but superior. It’s a drab wood clad room with no fridge, no shower gel and minimal toiletries, no minibar, no kettle and only 1 bedside table. There’s no restaurant and only a bar that’s open mon - fri 5pm - 10pm
The Christmas decorations are practically none existent.  There’s a lot of work going on in the hotel at present but in my opinion they should close the hotel instead of the half hearted attempt to keep it running at a 4 star level, because they’re failing miserably.
Not what I’d expect from the Marriott brand.

title: Super friendly staff, great location
text: I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews but the location and price were right and I knew I was only staying one night. As a Marriott Gold member I’ve come to expect a high standard and I was not disappointed. Check in was smooth, Frances at the front desk was welcoming and worked hard to accommodate a special room request. He even gave me drink vouchers for the lounge.  The room was nicely decorated and did not feel cramped. Club lounge breakfast had lots of options like eggs, pancakes, oatmeal, meat and cheese, fruit, pastries, etc. Best part was the espresso cappuccino machine. Only down side was the noise from the trucks and ambulances driving around all night but this is nyc. Bring ear plugs.

title: Great hotel with Fantastic location!
text: I'll admit it - after reading reviews for this hotel on TA, I was concerned about our upcoming stay. We were traveling for a wedding and this was where the block was so I figured we'd give it a shot. What a pleasant surprise! It was much, much better than what was being said on this forum! First of all, they were able to accommodate an early check-in which was great, especially given how many people were in line to ask for it! While the lobby downstairs is small and a bit cramped, I told my husband to wait on the second level lobby with our bags to create a little more space. There were stairs to do so or he could have taken the elevator. I suggest people do this so it's not overcrowded in there. The woman who checked me in was very helpful and the process was efficient and streamlined. We went up to our room and we were given a great corner suite with a big window and sofa/futon as well. This was definitely the biggest room I've ever stayed in in NYC. The bathroom was beautiful and clean with everything functioning just fine. While many reviewers cited to noise at night, we really didn't hear much at all! And we weren't on a high floor either. On top of the great room, the hotel is located on 57th and Lex, a great central place to stay. I loved being able to walk to the Bloomingdale's just 2 blocks away! Thanks Renaissance, for a great stay and we are looking forward to staying again.

title: Double charged, poor communication between managers
text:
First, I will say that I travel 150+ nights a year for business, and this is the worst customer service I have ever experienced. 

I was supposed to stay 2 nights paid and 2 nights on points. I was told the rewards certificate would be applied at checkout. At checkout, no one could figure out how to apply my rewards certificate and they said they'd have to charge all 4 days and correct the folio when the manager got in later that day. I disagreed and asked to wait to checkout until a manager arrived. The front desk messed up the request, and pushed the checkout through immediately and charged me for 4 days, not 2 days.

It's been more than a week... and I've called daily to check status. I've gotten 3 different managers and each is equally "surprised" and has supposedly never heard of me... despite being promised that people are leaving messages/notes for the manager. Platinum rewards line says hotel has to fix it, managers at the hotel say that they can't alter past folios. 

Location is great but the tiny rooms, poor communication and bad customer service/follow-up are a huge turn-off.  I've been a Marriott/SPG loyalist for years, but if this folio/charge isn't corrected soon, I'll need to find a better rewards program. 

... not sure how a $500 adjustment is worth losing a $100,000+ a year Platinum member.

title: 4 days stay Dec 2017
text: I had a great stay in renaissance hotel 57th street. I spent 4 days during Dec 2017. The hotel is conveniently located on east side of Mid town. Central Park, Time square and multiple other central locations are within 10-15 mins of easy walk. Metro is 3 blocks away. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only low point was lobby renovation, which is totally understandable and had  minor impact on check-in. Bottom line - great hotel.

title: Excelente ubicación y las habitaciones EXTREMADAMENTE silenciosas para NY
text: Un hotel con personalidad, con habitaciones silenciosas. El servicio fue muy agradable, facilitándonos mucha la estancia. Está situado de forma muy cómoda para moverse por midtown con tiendas y atracciones muy accesibles.

title: Perfectly Placed New York Hotel
text: Trip away for a long weekend of chillin' with my hubby.  The hotel is in a great spot, you can see it from the entrance to Bloomingdale's, lots of restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk, and a couple of great breakfast places.  It is a shame that the restaurant and bar were not open due to refurbishment - and to be honest they didn't notify us of that in advance so we only found out on arrival. I probably would have changed hotels had I known - BUT once they get that open it will be pretty perfect for a reasonably priced Manhattan hotel. Our room was small but that is fairly standard for New York. Everything was clean and the bathroom was huge! Can't fault the staff, they were all really helpful and friendly. Would recommend.

title: The smallest room I have ever stayed in even for NYC standards
text:
To start out, I am a Marriott Platinum and travel a lot. I often stay in NYC and usually love the hotels and rooms I have stayed at in the past. This was the first time staying at this hotel and it will be the last. 

Let's start with the room. I was told that all rooms are the same when I tried asking to be moved to a different room. Assuming this is true then that means all the rooms at this hotel are TINY and i mean tiny!  It is a closet space room. The bed was only a queen and has no box spring. It was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in at any hotel. The TV sits inside a cabinet making it impossible to see if you were working at the tiny desk. The bathroom is a tub and extremely small with a small (modern) sink and no place to put any of your toiletries. This was seriously the most uncomfortable and smallest room I have ever stayed in and certainly should not carry the Marriott name let alone the Renaissance name.  

There is currently no restaurant on site. They are remodeling or building a restaurant which should be open by the Spring of 2018. 

The concierge lounge for reward members is a tiny make-shift place and is only open for breakfast. At night it turns into a make-shift bar. The "breakfast" is the absolute worst that I have ever encountered at a Marriott. There was no bacon or meats just cold powered eggs, some fruit and some other small items. The coffee was the worst I have ever tasted and I ended up just going to the Starbucks across the street. 

The service was exactly the same. The simple task of combining two reservations together (4 days paid, two days on points) became a nightmare where we had to get new keys and when we went down to get new keys on the day the reservations switched to points, she could not do it without our ID which we left in the room but had our current keys with us. It was just an attitude of not wanting to assist in any way. 

No news paper under my door, no bill under my door. On the check-out when we finally were able to get a copy of the bill they charged us $5 for a water we never took. She clerk said she could not do anything and we would have to call the next day to talk to a manager. 

Just everything about this hotel was .. dark, depressing, small, claustrophobic, with not much in the way of customer service. This could and did leave a bad impression of the  whole stay in NYC. 

I will say the location is great. I like staying a away from the Times Square tourist area and there are some great restaurants and bars within walking distance. However, I would gladly stay at any of the other Marriott's and walk to this area in the future.

title: Boutique Type Hotel
text: Nice boutique type hotel very close to the UN and the Rockefeller Center. Rooms are nice and contemporary but a little smaller in size but thats expected since we are in NYC. Very close to 5th avenue and other restaurants for good dining options.

title: city life!
text: My boyfriend surprised me with a 2-night stay here for my birthday, this way we could be tourists for the weekend (we actually live in NYC but we are always too busy to see the city ) we planned different "city activities" and it was always great to come back to our hotel room. The rooms are small but very cozy and romantic. The hotel was under renovation but the staff was very warm and helpful. we will def return.

title: Quaint New York hotel with boutique touches
text:
I enjoyed my stay the the Renaissance 57 for several reasons:

-- It's an excellent location, in the midst of excellent shopping, two blocks from Central Park, but out of the Midtown hubbub.
-- My room was lovely with nice furnishings.
-- Service was excellent, starting with Diana at the check-in desk.

The Renaissance is in the midst of lobby renovations, but the other amenities made up for that issue.

title: Not Impressed
text: My dad and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. The staff was all extremely friendly and helpful, however, we were not able to get a room with 2 beds even though he had called and asked for that. We were upgraded to a bigger room with a sofa bed (didn't even have extra bedding) but it was still very small and dark. The bathroom was the nicest part but it was half the size of the room and the bed was so close to the wall you could barely fit through. The view wasn't bad. Overall the experience wasn't great compared to other hotels we've stayed at, the hotel is definitely older and i don't know if they're renovating the rooms but they could use it

title: Disappointing
text:
This hotel is in a very good location.

However, the windows are poorly insulated and the noise from the street made it impossible to get a good night's sleep. 

Housekeeping cleaning at 11 PM, talking loudly in the hallway and running the vacuum cleaner did not improve things.

Front desk appears to be poorly staffed at night. It took me five phone calls to reach someone when I wanted to point out that cleaning rooms at such a late hour was probably not such a good idea. When my call was finally answered, the person sounded disgruntled and was not particularly concerned. She did however inform me that she would look into the matter. Her apology was perfunctory. There was no further housekeeping noise that night. 

Chipped furniture, faucet in the bathtub coming out of the wall, dirty windows, crummy coffee for the coffee maker and no coffee cups after the first day...for  $ 300 a night.

I travel a fair amount, the majority of my trips are to Europe. I like to stay in nice hotels and I do not mind paying more if it is warranted. This hotel has clearly seen better days. I have stayed in other hotels in Manhattan. This one was the worst so far and is not worth the money nor the four stars. 

I understand that this hotel is being renovated. In all fairness, there was no construction noise during my stay.

Some suggestions:

Assess all rooms and fix obvious flaws.

Man front desk at all times.

Address complaints in a professional and caring manner.

No housekeeping noise after 10 PM.

title: Good location; solid choice
text:
small room but nice and clean; the hotel will finish renovation in Spring of 2018 -- i asked the staff. it common areas has art nouveau movement touches, which I hope they keep during the reno.

the rooms have coffee machines to make hot drinks! always a plus.

title: Wait to visit until after their renovation.
text:
When I visited they were in the process of renovating the lobby but I don't think this has had an impact on my personal experience. 

Positive points:
- very good location
- excellent bed with the softest sheets ever.

Negative points:
- It sounds and feels like a small earthquake when the subway train passes.
- very noisy and uncontrollable heating system, though they promised it would be updated during the upcoming renovation of the rooms.
- takes forever before the elevator arrives (I don't know if this will be fixed in the renovation)
- the hallway where my room was located (3rd floor) always smelled like warm meals were being prepared. Not a fresh smell, more like dingy carpets where decade-old smells are trapped in. The renovation may also help here.
- took a bath, brown water. Yikes.

My conclusion: try to find out when the renovation will be finished before you book this hotel.
For future reference, I was able to find a deal of $600 for three nights, all taxes included.

title: Not a great choice for us.
text: The hotel is undergoing renovation of its restaurant and is suffering some of the side effects.  While the staff were all helpful and friendly, there were lots of issues with noise and general disruption.  I think we could have done better and wish we had.  One advantage is the location.  It really is quite ideal.  However, the general quality is just not what it should be for the price at this point.

title: Closet sized room
text: The location was right. However, this is one of the smallest rooms that we have stayed at. My wife and I couldn't pass in front of the beds without bumping into each other. Nice place if you want to get close to your companion.

title: Needs Work
text: Lobby and restaurant under construction. Felt rooms were very small. Junior Suite was not very big. Housekeeping failed to clean room first night. Front desk area under staffed. The front desk staff was helpful when not busy. Better Marriott/Renaissance choices available in NYC.

title: One night stay that wound up being 2
text:
I am a platinum member so i was upgraded for my one night stay (but didn't know i was upgraded) to a beautiful suite with lots of room and lots of windows. The bathroom was newer and very pretty, plus clean. There is only ice on every other floor, and there is no vending. I was sent to a store about 2 blocks away (in the dark, female traveler)

I checked out and headed to the airport, but was socked in by remnants of Harvey. So I decided to come back to the 57.  This time when I got to my room, I realized I had been upgraded before!  Wow this thing is small, which isn't a big deal, just shocking from my first night! 

The staff was very friendly and helped me to get a car for my 4am departure, rather than tracking down a cab at that time.

Overall, this is just an OK property.  It is very unique, and appears to be going through some changes. It is an excellent location and I would stay there again.  Maybe waiting until the restaurant is back open!

title: Not worthy of Renaissance name- ratty and old. Needs total overhaul. No room service.
text:
This place hardly merits the Marriott name- it's TOTALLY undeserving of the Renaissance label.   The place seems very old (80s?) and is ratty- chipped stairs and furniture surfaces in the lobby.  Chipped furniture in the rooms.   Really worn out and ratty.  

As others have mentioned it is a former apartment buildings- this is evident in the hallway design.

Service is also not worthy of the name.  When I went into the tiny lobby on the street level there were three workers there chatting. I felt like I invaded someone's private conversation on the subway platform, not that I was in a hotel that was supposedly high end.  Took a minute for one of them to even notice I was there waiting to check out.

Restaurant is closed so no room service at all. 

There's a sign in the street level lobby that says "Pardon our dust. New lobby coming in December 2017"   If it's all new and they haven't even begun construction in late October, I wonder if it is truly a major change or a minor spruce up.

The maid forgot to clean the toilet one night.   First time I've ever had that happen in ANY hotel ever.
