Sinful to ask this price for this place.  Marriott should evaluate this place and either upgrade it to meet the standards of the Renaissance name, or downgrade its branding.

If you like the location, try the Fitzpatrick right across the street. MUCH MUCH MUCH cheaper. You get a lot of space, and friendly service.

title: Poorly maintained
text:
This hotel has clearly had an overhaul recently. The lobby is newly renovated, and the rooms have fairly new furniture. The bed was comfortable enough. The bathroom was a mess. The shower head was leaking and spraying water all over the bathroom soaking everything. The sink had low water pressure. 

The location is a bit of a problem as well. The corner of 57th and Lex is loud. Even on the 7th floor, the traffic noise made it hard to sleep. Try to get an interior room if possible to avoid the noise.

title: Nice Old Hotel
text: We stayed in the Renaissance 57 for 8 nights in mid-October.  We had trouble booking a room for that length of stay during the time we wanted.  We found that the Renaissance 57 had rooms available for the 8 nights that we needed.  We found that it was a nice, old hotel with a lot of character.  Upon check in, we were upgraded to a room with a terrace on the 15th floor.  It was a nice room in the corner overlooking Lexington and 57th.  The location of the hotel could not be better.  We attended an Opera at the Met, went to Central Park, were close by to the subway station on Lexington and 59th.  We were able to get all around the city with ease from this location.  One issue with having a room in the corner overlooking a busy intersection was the noise.  When they say that NYC is the "City that never Sleeps," they are not kidding.  There was street construction going on all night for 5 nights.  There was jackhammering, backhoes ripping up the street, and dump trucks taking all the debris away.  We arrived on a Monday and did not get a decent nights sleep until the Saturday night when the workers were not jackhammering.  Even though the windows on the room were double pane, the noise was coming through the AC unit which was right next to the bed.  The views from the terrace made the noise a little bearable.  The is not a restaurant in this hotel yet, it reopens in the Spring of 2018; but there are a lot of good places to eat nearby.  The staff were exceptional in this hotel.  They were helpful for all our needs.  If it were not for the noise at night, this would have been a great place to stay.

title: Don't stay here.  It's a cheap for a reason
text:
Peering through the reviews I wish I'd thought to look at TripAdvisor before booking my trip....I travel frequently for work and am Marriott-loyal so when I saw that there was a Renaissance close to my work meetings at a reasonable room rate I jumped right on the opportunity.

I should have checked out WHY the rooms were so inexpensive.  Firstly it's a bizarre property - you take an elevator (or stairs) up one floor to the tiniest elevators that ever existed to access the rest of the property.  This is not ideal when an elevator (or two!) are out of commission and people are trying to leave for work meetings / tourist attractions / checking out at heavy traffic times in the morning.  

Separately my room in particular had drawers that would not close which was aggravating and my next door neighbors were extremely loud.  Can't fault the hotel for loud guests but be advised the rooms do not do much for soundproofing.  Rooms also do not have coffee makers which is an inconvenience when the hotel does not have an operating restaurant.

Also from a service standpoint, I forgot my phone charger (my fault completely).  I checked in relatively late and asked the concierge if there was a nearby bodega where I could pick up a charger.  He said that he could do better since there was a 24 hour Apple Store 2 blocks away.  Now if you are sending a petite female guest out to run an errand in the 11pm hour of the night you might want to disclose that the Apple Store is not just two blocks up but four very long midtown blocks over.  I was dressed in athletic gear and wound up running the whole way because it was much too far for a quick pop over walk two blocks situation.  

Renaissance 57 fell short on lots of fronts for me, I will not be staying here again in the future.

title: Tired...
text:
This place needs a total overhaul.... what a worn out dump! The room was disgusting to say the least. The amenities were junk.

The concierge PM offering were straight out of the freezer... in the morning little better and late...

This place is not up to Marriott standards, at all! 

The staff was quite friendly, but come on! You have to do better.

title: Outrageous!
text: The worst part is I used to be a fan of this hotel and a regular after it was renovated in 2008.  What a difference 9 years make.  The hotel lost it's charm, the decor now appears dated, the furnishings worn, the elevator slow, unreliable.  When we visited the restaurant was closed. Quality control?  There isn't any anymore.  Our first room had issues in the bathroom, the sink drain clogged.  They moved us to another room. The new room had no fridge.  I complained and they brought us an old bulky noisy little fridge but it did the job.  Later, when I opened the faucett water poured out of the handle and made a mess.  I called and they fixed it.  That night, I took a shower and noticed the shower wasn't cleaned all the way through, there was long women hair and soap scum from a previous guest stuck on the wall.  They sent cleaners that day to clean the shower again.  On my last day as I was leaving and doing a last inspection, I noticed something bulky behind the mattress and the headboard.  I moved the mattress a bit and noticed a bottle of soda left there by a previous guest!  Oh my, I can't believe I slept 3 nights with soda behind my head.  Terrible.  The worst part is that complaints seem to have become a habit for Renaissance staff.  They don't even feel bad.  They brush any complaints under the rug with canned responses.  We didn't receive any redemption of cash or points despite all the complaints

title: Location, location, location
text: Tiene una ubicación increíble cerca de todo y en medio del más puro NY. De ahí en adelante es un hotel muy normal. Las habitaciones un poco viejas y en términos generales necesitan una remodelación. Dicho esto, el servicio es muy bueno.

title: 48 hours of total madness
text:
Normally we stay at Renaissance Midtown Manhattan which is ALWAYS AMAZING! but this time my husband mixed up locations on reservation and we ended up at Renaissance 57... big mistake! On Thursday morning we arrived at Renaissance 57early so we although we were hopeful we were prepared for room not to be ready, so we drop bags and head out to breakfast.Upon our return stop in lounge ( as we are gold members) no beverages available and a dismal lounge:(  not what we are used to as the Renaissance Midtown lounge is readily stocked with a variety of beverages) soo ok guess we will just go to room .We wait awhile for elevator to take us to 16th floor arrive in room 1606..room has strange layout with a connecting door? view is non existent .. I am definitely NOT at Renaissance Midtown where we always get Amazing views. Any how we unpack and head out determined to enjoy NYC we do and have a late night.Fast forward to Friday morning .. our plan was to sleep in. Curtains had been drawn prior to bed were sleeping late!.... NOT!! phone in room begins ringing at
 7:30 am!! back to back and each time we answer ..NOTHING! finally we call downstairs to front desk they have o idea why phone is ringing and it actually rings while we are talking to them!! come to find out the mysterious "door" was an employee office/lounge and the phone line in there is crossed with our room so every time the hotel gets a call it rings in our room!! so now we are completely awake unfortunately and decide to just start the day. We leave our room at 9am with a plan to shop and explore the city come back before 8:30pm dinner plans  take a nap and get dressed. we return to our room at 5:30pm .... Room has NOT been cleaned ..no beds made .. no clean towels. we call down to front desk again .. another apology:( they offer to send housekeeping we request they come at 7:30pm explaining what happened that morning and a need to rest before dinner. Front desk agrees , we prepare to take nap right?.. WRONG!! as soon as we lay down there is loud talking and laughter from the mystery room that connects to ours!! the employees are on break and apparently are having a BLAST! we ask them to quiet down explaining we are directly on the other side of door.Finally we can get at least 45 min nap before dinner.. WRONG again!!  here comes housekeeping knocking at 6:30//!! WTH!! so now sleep interrupted its time to dress for dinner and they only bring two bath towels no wash clothes!! WTH is going on Marriott?? now after all this we are given apologies and promise of 20,00 marriott points for inconvenience .. I get home check our Marriott account and what do I see ?? only 10,00 points added . :((!!  WORSE Marriott  hotel experience EVER!! Never staying at Renaissance 57 again only gave it two stars for location. Oh and the phone call email from management we were promised has yet to come 4 days later.. we will be contacting corporate office.

title: Great location - fantastic staff
text:
Great location - close to metro and within walking distance to Central Park and most other tourist sites. Hotel has a funky/artsy vibe, rooms are a decent size and well maintained. The hotel restaurant was closed at the time of our stay (under renovations), however this was not a concern to us. 
The staff were probably the highlight - very friendly and helpful.

title: Great location but thats it
text: Had a room with 2 double beds for my family of 2 adults and 2 kids.  Was quite disappointed with the size of the room.  Not much space to move around the bed.  Hit my shin at the bed corner and ended up with a massive bruise!  Rooms were dated and greatly in need of a renovation. Location of the hotel was fantastic though, 10min walk to central park, under 10mins to 5th ave, about 20min to time square and subway just 2 blocks away.

title: Posizione ok
text: Hotel in ottima posizione. Vicino a Central Park ed al centro ma anche alle fermate della metro. Struttura di 17 piani con una terrazza da cui poter godere di una bella vista sulla città. Non un hotel modernissimo ma con camere comunque buone. La nostra stanza era abbastanza grande con due letti king, cassaforte, bagno ampio e sempre super rifornito con biancheria pulitissima. Unica pecca il Wi-Fi a pagamento: a New York nel 2017 dove qualsiasi esercizio ha il Wi-Fi gratis mi sembra abbastanza assurdo. Nel complesso comunque un buon hotel con personale gentile e un buon rapporto qualità-prezzo.

title: Great hotel, but terrible concierge lounge offerings.
text:
I'm currently at the hotel. I've stayed here probably 5 times and one of the things I like the most is that the concierge lounge has a great breakfast. Espresso machine, nice food offerings, water and diet coke in the mini fridge. 

Well...I guess it's since the restaurant at the hotel is closed for renovations but the breakfast is beyond bad. Scrambled eggs with slices of American cheese (seriously? This is currently a $400 to $500 / night hotel. American cheese?) and poor quality cold ham. Crusty oatmeal, crappy sliced bread and fruit that tastes like it's leftover. If you're lucky enough to get any. 

Today the espresso machine wasn't working right, and the press pots of coffee were empty too. The fruit was almost gone and not replenished by 8:30 am and the eggs were cold. The bowl of mixed up kinds of yogurt didn't add anything. 

Yes there are still waters in the little fridge, but no diet coke. Ok, a small thing. But it's one of the little things I like about it. I was told that they ran out, then was told that they have some but have to save them for mixing at the bar in the evenings....

The elevators are driving everyone crazy they're so slow. It's a joke between everyone as it's so bad. 

On the plus side, the rooms are clean, small as everything is in NYC, and the staff is great. Even the housecleaning people are friendly and happy. 

As of today - hooray - I'm lifetime Platinum and have seen it all. I don't feel like this is quite up to the standards I've experienced in the past. I was hoping for an upgrade but they said since I'm here for 8 nights they can't do an upgrade for that many nights. I'm not feeling like a valued Lifetime Platinum member for sure. Hey, offer up an upgrade for my last few nights, even if it's a room change. I'm flexible! 

I might have to find a new home away from home in NYC.

title: Disappointing
text:
Stayed at this hotel this week, was there for 2 nights. I can say I was disappointed. The first room I got had a wet carpet and although i was changed to another room it left a bit of a bad first impression. The rooms are very dated and small not worth the money asked. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment which means there is no restaurant or breakfast etc. If I had known that before booking I wouldn’t have booked.

On a positive the staff after really great and very polite. Internet is great and good for business emails etc. Location is very good and you can walk to a lot of places 

Once the hotel is renovated it might be better but until then I am not sure I would book here again.

title: Reserva pelo Hotéis.com
text:
Meu marido e eu fomos pela primeira vez a Nova York e ficamos nesse hotel em agosto 2017.
Pontos positivos: boa localização, próximo de muitas estações de metrô, quarto muito espaçoso e reformado, com banheiro de bom tamanho e sem aquelas Cortinas de box horrorosas que alguns hotéis possuem. Em frente à porta do nosso quarto havia uma máquina de gelo, então comprávamos bebidas e usávamos o gelo do corredor. A máquina até era meio barulhenta, mas como sempre chegávamos cansados no quarto, dormíamos como pedras, portanto não foi incômodo algum o barulho. Na verdade quase não dava para ouvir de dentro do quarto. Tínhamos uma bela vista do 11 andar. Nesse hotel há um funcionário brasileiro muito solícito e querido, que nos auxiliou quando precisávamos de ajuda para metrô, etc. 
Fizemos nossa reserva através do hoteis.com e deu tudo certo. Estava com receio, pois nunca havia usado essa ferramenta de reservas e não conhecia essa empresa até então, mas no final foi ótimo, pois conseguimos uma boa tarifa. Nossa diária era sem café da manhã, o que acredito que seja bastante comum em Nova York, o que nos atrapalhou um pouco, pois nada melhor que acordar e tomar um belo café da manhã no hotel. Tínhamos que nos deslocar a lanchonetes próximas. Se você gosta de Starbucks tem uma praticamente na porta do hotel.
Pontos fracos: o quarto não tinha frigobar ( o que acredito ser comum em NY, mas mesmo assim fez muita falta pra gelar uma cervejinha 😬). Nos arredores não haviam muitos restaurantes por estarmos na parte mais do centro comercial. Mas resolvemos isso facilmente: através do TripAdvisor, que informava os restaurantes disponíveis mais próximos. 
Enfim, nossa estadia foi ótima, gostamos muito do nosso quarto espaçoso, e com uma breve caminhada você chega até o Central Park, um belíssimo lugar para se visitar em NY. Indico, e voltaria a ficar nesse hotel novamente.

title: Dreadful experience
text: Sky loft room is good. That's about the only good thing about this hotel. Poorly managed and run downed facilities, no restaurant, no breakfast on weekends, no in-room dining service (had to order delivery from nearby restaurant), no mini bar, dreadful laundry service (items came back 1 full day late and mixed with other guests clothing...unnaceptable), package delivered to the hotel 1 day prior to my departure could not be found by the hotel staff (eventhough USPS shown signed receipt) until I check out and was already on my way to the airport, etc. Won't be staying at Renaissance again. Ever.

title: I was a little disappointed.
text:
The staff was friendly, but going into the hotel you enter looks like the basement, check in and get your room key.  Then you take an elevator to the lobby cross the lobby and take another elevator to your floor. The restaurant is CLOSED until spring 2018.  So no room service.  I asked for recommendation at the desk and found a nice little  restaurant around the block.  Checking out was easy next morning .  The location is good.  But it was a strange room never did I see so many built in cabinets.  Room seemed to be clean, also missing was a 24 snack shop at the front desk.
No pool but I think fitness center.

title: Bottom of the table
text: With 30 years of dedicated patronage I am Lifetime Platinum member of Marriott's rewards program. I therefore almost always try and stay at a Marriott property when I am traveling.  The Renaissance Brand is a step above the regular Marriott's and always comes with a greater expectation of service and amenities. I can honestly say having stayed in Renaissance properties around the world this is the worst one. This property is old, run down and currently operating on a skeleton offering. There is a renovation going on that has the hotel with no restaurant what so ever. The concierge lounge is tiny and provides a weak offering both in the evening and at breakfast. I found the service to be slow and very less than proactive. For example I had to call multiple times to have simple requests fulfilled. My room was extremely dated and small. The discount versus other Marriott properties near bye was not enough to soothe my regret for selecting this property for my most recent stay in NYC. I strongly recommend you avoid this property.

title: Amazing staff
text: The staff at this hotel is amazing!!! They are so helpful. The room however, was not as good. The room was literally falling apart. The cabinets were unhinged and a bunch of lights were burned out. There were no food options in the hotel, which was disappointing. The lobby was really small. It is a nice hotel but did not go above and beyond.

title: Welcoming
text: Boutique hotel. The staff is polite & friendly.  Wanting to spend more on dining & entertainment selected the "cozy" king, which  still offered a work area and function chair. Bed & pillows comfortable, the bath contemporary with plenty of quality towels. It is nothing like our previous stay at the Marquis on Time Square but the Renaissance is a property I would stay at again. Note- their restaurant is closed until January 2018 for renovations.

title: Nice Hotell
text: Nice place to stay. Great location for shopping ! Could use more amenities. No shop for sundry items and restaurant will be closed until  the middle of 2018. Staff very nice and accommodating. The smallest bathroom sinkI have ever seen in a hotel.

title: Nice room and excellent location
text:
Check in was smooth and nice. Room is very well kept and bedding is very comfortable. The property does have an old New York high rise charm to it. The location is very nice and there a lot of nice restaurants around. Check out was smooth as well.
PROS- Location. Rooms are nice and comfortable.
CONS- None

title: Not for me
text:
Let me preface this review by saying I wanted to stay somewhere a little "different" than our typical Marriott/Courtyard/Residence Inn type of visit. I searched Marriott brand hotels only as we are Platinum Elite members so we are loyal to Marriott brand hotels. The Renaissance 57 was certainly not the cheapest option, or the most centrally convenient choice given our touristy itinerary but it appeared unique from the website photos so I opted to pay a little more for the memorable experience. I am admitting that a portion of our not so great experience is my fault. 

Upon check-in we were told that hotel was at full capacity so there was no upgrade available. Not a big deal but as we absorbed the weirdness of the hotel, I immediately regretted my decision to stay someplace "different." This place is truly very weird. From the super dark entrance, to the "take the elevator up ONE floor, walk across the hall and wait for another elevator to go up another two whole floors," to the yucky weird carpet, and the halls so narrow to our room that I had to pull my bag BEHIND me, not beside me; this place was really bizarre. Even the elevator call buttons looked like some creepy Alice in Wonderland creature things. It was just outside of my comfort zone. 

Our room was disappointingly spartan. Very basic and lacking anything other than the most basic amenities. We were told that the restaurant was being remodeled but we were not told that the rooftop was closed for renovation so that was a real bummer. We also noted that other floors appeared nicer than the third floor, where our room was, so perhaps the rest of the hotel is nicer than the third floor? It's possible. 

The real disappointment came on day two when we arrived back to our room at 1 am (after being gone all day) to find that our room hadn't been cleaned leaving us with no fresh towels, no coffee for the morning, and no fresh products. I called the front desk and an associate arrived immediately with fresh towels, coffee, and products but in the meantime, we had discovered that there were hair pins all over the carpet that we hadn't noticed the night before. Clearly, not only was our room not cleaned on our second day, it had not been vacuumed before we arrived. That's just GROSS. 

Upon checkout, I informed the desk clerk that I was very disappointed that our room hadn't been cleaned and even more unhappy that it hadn't been vacuumed BEFORE WE ARRIVED. He told me he would have Catherine, the manager, contact me to discuss. Catherine called me almost immediately and was most apologetic. She said that had I spoken to her the night before, she would have moved us to another room. I truly appreciate how responsive she was and that she would have corrected the issue had I contacted her sooner but, I really don't think we wanted to change rooms at 1 am. So again, I'll share part of the blame for our less than great stay. 

I will say this... all of the staff was extremely friendly and I am very impressed with Catherine's speedy response to my complaint and genuine willingness to correct the issue. That being said, do your homework before booking a room here. Read the reviews and ask yourself if you like dark, weird, places with no restaurant and no rooftop and paying more money than you could book a Courtyard down the road. If that sounds appealing to you - go for it because the staff and management are really nice - but this place just wasn't for me.

title: A nice boutique hotel that is beginning to fray
text: The Renaissance 57 is a convenient locale for all of mid-town Manhattan. The hotel has a boutique feel but is beginning to show its age. The elevators are slow and a bit creaky. There are only three, counting the service elevator and one can wait for up to 10 minutes at busy times of the day. The hotel restaurant currently is closed for renovations which is no hardship given the plethora of restaurants in easy walking distance. The M-Club has a light breakfast option and hors d'overes in the evening. The rooms are small but comfortable with a European feel. My room lacked a club chair or divan, but others have extra seating. The desk has ample electrical outlets and USB charging ports but none for foreign connections.

title: Deceiving hotel from the lobby...
text:
Upon arrival you are greeted with a standard (but small) reception area. Up one flight of stairs is the lobby - both are fairly fancy but quite dark with their interior. You are told at check-in that this is a 'budget hotel' - why they feel the need to tell you that is beyond me - maybe to pre warn you to not get your expectations up once you see your room?! We were given a standard room, and it is exactly that, very standard, and dark. Everything was wood - a wooden side board that housed the air-con unit - a full wall of wooden panels, mingled in with a wooden wardrobe...it definitely felt like you were stuck in the 90's, BUT, it did its job. The red carpet looked old and I was glad I bought my travel slippers with me because I wasn't too keen on walking on it bare foot. 
Space wise, there were 2 of us and we struggled. I wouldn't suggest booking a standard room if you have more than 1 suitcase each. 1 of ours had to go in the wardrobe, and the other just by the door. If one person opened the wardrobe door, the other person couldn't get passed to the other side of the bedroom. It got rather annoying!
However! The bathroom was lovely and spacious, and both modern and clean. It had both a bath and a nice powerful shower. Complimentary Aveda products were provided and lots of large towels. 
Internet is NOT free here (I learnt the hard way). You have to go to the lobby if you want to use their free Wi-Fi. There isn't an on-site restaurant here however there is a gym that is free of charge. 

Area wise, if you want to spend a lot of time in Central Park, this maybe for you. If you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Times Square then you're looking at a 25ish minute walk.

It wouldn't be my first pick of hotels (this came in a package) but if push came to shove I wouldn't object staying here again.

title: Average - Not a Renaissance standard
text:
We stayed for 2 nights and I chose the hotel based on Renaissance brand. As name of the hotel suggest it is on 57th street (Corner of 57th and Lexington) with very short walk to the Central Park. Nearest subway is 2 small blocks away.

We booked room with two double beds but because hotel had no available at the time we checked in, we were given two rooms with one double bed in each for the same price - which was great (I am not giving credit to the management as they reacted to the problem they themselves created). Check-in lobby is tiny and a main lobby with executive lounge and sitting area is one floor up (where you have to change elevators to go to the room).

Overall looks of the hotel - quite worn. Elevators are old, Executive lodge breakfast is quite poor and so are the hors d'oeuvres in the evening. Corridors are dark, card readers in elevators not working. At least lounge provided unlimited supply of bottled water. There was no restaurant in the hotel - sign said it will reopen soon, but as such at the weekend where lounge was closed too there was absolutely nothing to be had. There is however a Starbucks across the street and Subway around the corner. 

Rooms are quite small, but this is New York. Bathroom small but reasonable and reasonably clean. The biggest headache was a/c unit in the room which produced 65db noise (average conversation) and was so loud I had to use earplugs.

TV has netflix which is a benefit if one have time to watch TV.

Overall, I have nothing serious against this hotel, it is just not at the level of Renaissance brand and have nothing exceptional for the price we paid - just average.

title: Worst hotel EVER!
text:
This place was a total dump. First room they showed us had what looked like a bedbug crawling across the Mattress( ugh!) second room was even smaller, had ripped, stained sheets and chipped, cheap looking furniture.  
Staff was rude and not accommodating, they would not give us a refund or allow us to switch rooms again despite showing them the video of the live bug and the dirty bed. 
Don't waste your money on this dump.

title: Very disappointed
text:
Small room , smallest I have been in. Noisy too. Construction going on, did not see on it on one of their websites.
Horrible buffet breakfast. The area for breakfast was small and not clean.
Check in was unfriendly and NO platinum recognition.
Front desk manager tried to prove me wrong about the knowledge of construction. Imagine I would go to hotel with contruction when I need to relax and conduct business?
At the time , and I proved it, it was not on the Marriott app.
No onsite restaurant to entertain too.
The location is good. 
Much better hotels in the area for same or better price. You will get professional service too!

title: Ancora New York! Siiiiiiiiiiiiii!
text:
prima tappa di un viaggio tra Stati Uniti e Canada. New York si gira sempre molto volentieri.
l'Hotel si trova molto vicino a Central Park. discretamente vicino alla Grand Station, al Chrysler Building.
l'Hotel avrebbe sicuramente bisogno di una rinfrescata come quasi tutti gli Hotel di medio livello della city, ma - rispetto a molti altri offre camere meno piccole e sicuramente vivibili.
purtroppo fanno pagare la wi-fi che è cosa abbastanza antipatica...
dire comunque tutto sommato bene.
le stanze sono abbastanza silenziose anche se danno sulla strada.

title: Good location for shopping & Park
text:
Hot shower, nice to with Netflix in room & great location near shopping within a mins walk. Food was also close by and lots of options.  Subway was located close.  Central Park 8 min walk. 

The hotel was under renovations so the restaurant was closed. 

I would stay here again

title: Staff was spectacular
text: The staff is great at Renaissance 57 and we plan on staying there on our future visits.  We have been to New York a lot and have stayed in many different places and this by far was the Best.  Good location, clean and met our needs perfectly.  Daniel M. the doorman/baggage man was excellent and very friendly and helped us with our bags several times and opened the door for us every time.  Omar and Diana were also very helpful and friendly with all of my questions and needs.

title: A poor hotel for elite members
text: This really is not up to the Marriott brand. The amenities are non existent with only water in the lounge. The management are in denial that this is the most basic amenity when other comparable hotels including all full service branded hotels have juice, sodas and coffee. Also was told that no one else has complained about lack of amenities but upon looking at hotel reviews on Marriott.com there are a number of complaints on this very issue and most coming from gold and platinum members. There is no follow up (this was also reported by many other guests in reviews), I asked for a mattress topper that should have come as standard, was told housekeeping would take care of it and never did. As a boutique hotel, they justify calling standard size rooms suites which is ridiculous. Gave 2 drinks coupons at check in but the restaurant was closed for renovation so you could only redeem if you happen to be in lounge between 5-7pm. Staff were friendly but put simply the hotel lacks the basic level a Marriott should be. First main job, sort out the lounge. Simply having water and chips is not good enough for a full service property and this has been highly commented on in reviews and yet management remain in denial and committed to cost cutting on providing an acceptable lounge to elite members.

title: 위치 좋은 클래식한 호텔
text:
위치가 좋습니다.
다만 캐리어 끌고 다닐 땐 윗 쪽을 쳐다보지 않으니, 
호텔이 보이지 않아 찾지 못했었습니다.
호텔은 오래된 듯한 클래식한 호텔입니다만 나쁘지 않습니다.
W처럼 프론트 데스크에는 사과도 놓여있었고요.

title: Excellent location and customer service
text: My husband and I just spent 5 nights at this property. Our room, 503, although small, had a great view of the corner of Lexington Ave and E. 57th St. This is a very central location so I highly recommend that you stay here and get a street view. Marriott rewards members get free wifi. If you're looking for a good midtown hotel stay here and not in Times Square which.has way too many people.

title: Good hotel in a good location
text:
We stayed at the hotel for a 4 night break in NYC. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. It's in a good location within a reasonable walking distance of time square, Central Park and Empire State etc. We walked to most places apart from when we visit the south of Manhattan and when we went to watch the Yankees. On both of these occasions we used the subway which again was only a short walk away.
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and I would happily stay there again.

title: THEFT
text:
This was the best trip ever and the hotel was in a great location.  It was ruined when my wedding ring was stolen from the room and nothing has been done.  I have not heard from the hotel and the insurance folks made me an "offer" for 1/2 the value of the ring.

DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND SAVE YOURSELF THE HEARTACHE OF STAYING HERE!

title: It is not Bad!
text: I stayed here for 2 nights and 3 days. I stayed in a Superior Guest Room and it was bigger than I expected for NYC. The room was clean and the location was great. It was in walking distance of everything and the subway station was not far either. The only thing that bothered me was how slow the elevators were. I do think they need to do some upgrading. Other than that if you need some where to sleep and shower at a great price, this is a great place to stay.

title: Looks like an Old Apartment Bldg
text: Didnt mind the hotel and lounge area, potentially very trendy and the location was great.  However, the rooms and hallways were no where the level I would have expected for a Renaissance Property.  Hopefully upgrades are planned for the future as the rates were much to high for the level of rooms.  The bed was super comfy though!

title: Ótima localização
text: Próximo a quinta avenida e ao Central Park esse hotel com apartamentos medianos e um bom serviço é uma excelente opção. Possui um bar movimentado e não oferece café da manhã. O restaurante será reinaugurado até o final do ano. O preço é caro, bem ao estilo Manhatan

title: Buena opción
text: Buen ubicado. Todo impecable. Buen tamaño de la habitación y baño cómodo. Un poco engorroso el acceso porque hay que subir en un ascensor y luego cambiarse a otro para llegar a las piezas. Hice mi reserva por booking, me equivoqué  y agradezco mucho que me cambiaran a otra habitación sin costo extra.

title: It needs some upgrades but its a good value for New York City
text: Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is located on 57th Street and is several blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square.  The hotel is DARK and the décor is a bit unusual and could use some updating.  The service was great but don't expect this to be a Renaissance to have large rooms or new features.  It is a bizarre setup with the check in desk on the ground floor and then you take an elevator to the lobby, cross the lobby area to another set of elevators that will take you to your floor.  The elevators are small, dark and appear to be a bit rickety.  The motif is something out of the movie Beetlejuice and could be what makes this a boutique hotel. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean although they are a bit small and could use a makeover.  All in all I was there to sleep and not there to enjoy the scenery.  There is a small bar off the lobby area and there is no restaurant until January 2018.  Since I was there on the weekend the concierge room was not available although I was compensated in Marriot points for this.  To get to any of the midtown tourist sites you should bring your walking shoes or count on taking an Uber for about $8 to $9 or a taxi   There are a variety of restaurants and bars in the area of the hotel if you plan on staying close by.  If you have a car do not park in the garage next to Renaissance.  Pull up directly in front of the Hotel and they will valet it for you.  Its less expensive and you don't have to worry about it until you leave.  Be aware that there is a very small loading and unloading area in front of the hotel.  Its New York what do you expect.  Its much better than what I saw in midtown where people were trying to negotiate there luggage while walking through Time Square.  All in all the Staff was great, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.

title: こぢんまりしたホテル。立地よし
text:
5番街から程近く、セントラルパークの南に位置するホテルです。買い物に便利でしょう。ただし、トランプタワーにも近く、滞在中トランプ大統領が帰って来たということでその周囲は警官だらけでした。返って安全かもしれませんが。
内装はきれいです。シャワーなどもAVEDAのアメニティでした。難点はやはり狭い。NYなので、仕方ないでしょうが。レストランでの食事はまあまあ美味しかったです。

title: Friendly staff, stylish art nouveau interior design.
text: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel bar is a great way to kick off the night with it's unique decor and gracious bartender (Jon or Jorge? Couldn't make out his name on the card he gave me). Plus the hotel is within walking distance of Time Square and Central Park.

title: Fawlty Towers
text:
Really bad experience and frankly an embarrassment to the Marriot brand.

On check in I was informed that I my reservation was one night shorter than it actually was - this led me to making a non refundable reservation at another hotel (as the night receptionist informed me he could not help me) Later the hotel informed me that I indeed did have a reservation for the correct amount of nights leading me to simply losing $350 for the other reservation I was forced to make..

First room was tiny and probably last renovated 30 years ago. A/C made the noise of a jet engine and kept me awake most of the night. . After request I was moved to a larger room . This room was not cleaned on either of the days I stayed in it.

I had several parcels delivered to the hotel , despite tracking notifications the hotel claimed for 3 days nothing had been received. Finally at the intervention of Roberto (only saving grace at this eatablishment) the packages were finally found.

At check out nobody bothered to ask how my stay was - I assume they knew the answer.

Stay away !

title: Great Service
text: The staff at this property is so pleasant and accommodating.  On a gray, rainy evening, Jorge lifted my spirits with his friendly personality and he made me feel so welcome in the lounge.  I travel a lot for business and it is so nice to feel like you are at a home away from home.  Diana and the bell man always try to get to know hotel guests and suggest spots they might enjoy.  I look forward to coming back to this hotel!

title: Our favorite home-away-from-home in NYC!"
text:
We have stayed at Hotel 57 many times over the past 10+ years.  The location is perfect - within walking distance to all the shopping and great restaurants, and a short cab ride to train station, SOHO, etc.  Being welcomed by so many familiar faces (many of the staff members have been with the hotel for years) adds a lot to the comfort of our stay at this hotel.  The rooms, and the common areas in the hotel are always kept very clean.  Serge Lambert took such great care of us during our stay - helped us find some new restaurants - and made sure we were happy with our rooms.

The hotel is currently undergoing renovations and is without a restaurant. There is a wonderful diner right next door - The Palace Restaurant - where you can dine in or get take-away.

Because we love the location and the staff of this boutique-style hotel, we were not bothered by the lack of a restaurant.  We look forward to seeing the renovated hotel during our next trip to NYC.

title: Great location but needs updates
text: Small dark room. Hotel seems dated in many areas. Minimal amenities. No vending machines. Restaurant said it was under renovation, however I ever saw any activity. The positives are the great location. If you are outside all day and just looking for place to sleep, then this is great property.

title: Great Mid-town Hotel
text:
This property is in a great location in mid-town Manhattan. The customer service is fantastic. We arrived early and they allowed us to store our bags while we went out to explore.

We were in NYC for The Classic East concert and added a few days.

Our room was 1213, king bed room. It was close to the elevator. We didn't hear any noise from the road except sirens and just a bit of noise from hallway.

The room was clean and big enough. The bed was comfortable with great pillows. The bathroom was a nice size and clean.

The best part about the hotel was the restaurant next store. The Palace Restaurant is a great New York diner with amazing home-made food. They are so hospitable and extremely welcoming. We ate a lot of meals here. 

You cannot go wrong with this hotel for a trip to NYC.

title: Family trip
text: This was a girls trip and we had a great time. The hotel was fine but the restaurant was closed for renovations and the rooftop terrace was closed as well. While this was disappointing and inconvenient, Jorge, in the lounge was a great asset!  He was very professional and accommodating. He went out of his way to ensure we had a good time. Thank you, Jorge!

title: Bem localizado
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, no upper est side, próximo ao central park e quinta avenida. O quarto é simples e a cama pequena, mas o banheiro é muito bom. Não serve café da manhã. O bar é bastante legal e o restaurante estava fechado.

title: Not the same as it used to be
text: My wife and I got married in NYC 4 years ago and we chose this hotel for our room block. Everyone loved the hotel. It's a renaissance but feels like a boutique hotel. Bar and restaurant were fun in a good atmosphere. Anyway, for my wife's b-day we booked a room the weekend of 7/29/17. The room and bathroom were fine but the restaurant was closed and the bar was open Friday night (oddly not Saturday) but it wasn't clear it was available to all guests anyway. Bottom line, for the price we paid for a NYC hotel I can't really complain but don't expect anything special from this hotel. It's a shame because in the past it was a great value in a fun atmosphere.

title: hotel descuidado y pequeño
text: No se parece a otros hoteles de la marca Renaissance ni de la cadena Marriot. Es un hotel viejo, que está descuidado, no tiene restaurante ni bar. Está en remodelación por tanto no conviene llegar ahí. Para el precio recomiendo otros dentro de la zona de Manhattan.

title: great atmosphere
text: The entrance / lobby and 1st floor area have a great atmosphere in a superb location in Manhattan. The (bath-)rooms are good, relatively spacious and wifi works. Service is friendly and accommodating.

title: The hotel has gone downhill
text: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times, but we have not been back for over three years until we visited this weekend.  What a difference. The hotel seemed dingy rather than the elegant spot it was three years ago.  The room was not in great shape.  Our bedding was torn and frayed, and in general the room looked beaten up a bit.  We were sad to see that Opia had closed.  The service at the front desk was not impressive, and we just saw that we were overcharged by $250 on my Amex card, despite having a conversation with the front desk about the bill before leaving, where they confirmed that we did not owe anything because our trip had been pre-paid.  I am sad to say that we will likely not visit again. The location is wonderful though and I will look for another hotel in the area.

title: Great hospitality and location
text: One of th e high points of the trip was meeting hotel  Concierge Serge Lambert. He was very accommodating especially since the hotel is under renovation. Great location to see much within walking distance. Good restaurant next door. Hotel is 2 blocks from 59th Street subway station. Hotel rates were reasonable for location.

title: Missing amenities, great bartender
text: There was a lot wrong with my stay at this hotel- but the highlight was visiting the bar and getting great service from Jorge, the night bartender. His service was superb and was the only employee there that made us feel taken care of.

title: Hidden Gem at the edge of the Upper East Side
text:
I stayed here for a quick overnight visit and it was great. Hidden literally under some scaffolding and I walked right past the entrance at first. The front desk is on the ground floor, and you go up 1 flight to a lovely ornate lobby. It's cosy and comfortable, just the right size. Little bit of separation between sitting areas and the bar restaurant, but it all blends together nicely.

I was given a corner room away from the street, so it was quiet and spacious. The bathroom was gigantic relative to most NYC hotel rooms.

title: Location was good. Room Decent.
text:
Was here with wife and kids. Even to NYC standard this hotel needs to improve. Rooms were warn out. Breakfast way too expensive. No minibar only ice on the flor below. Would have expected more from this hotel brand...
But the Location can only be beat if you find a place upper west next to the park (in my opinion).

title: This is a great place.
text:
Well priced gorgeous modern rooms and staff that bends over backwards for you. 
Location is top notch. I see no reason to stay elsewhere ever. 
They are so accommodating it's awesome. 
I asked for early check in and late check out. No problem. 
They are ridiculously nice. .

title: Muy bueno
text:
La ubicacion del hotel es genial, las habitaciones son muy comodas, todo muy limpio, lo mejor la vista desde la terraza, con unas mesitas y sillas para estas comodos. El servicio de bar en determinadas horas es gratis (gaseosas, papas fritas..)
Lo recomiendo definitivamente.

title: Modern, clean - A nice hotel
text: I've stayed here on business once. Perfectly located for my needs. Didn't really use many of the facilities. The bar area was nice enough to meet up with people after work before heading out into the city. Hotel is modern, clean and the staff were friendly. I'd stay here again.

title: Memorial Day Weekend Vacay
text: I've been to NYC a handful of times now and this was by far the best location I've stayed in! For the price it can't be beat. The room was nice too. The renovations did not interfere with the stay at all

title: Not Up to Marriott Standards
text: I stayed at this property in June for 4 nights.  I am a long-time Marriott hotel guest at many properties world wide with prior high levels of satisfaction.  My stay was a surprising disappointment. I could not believe that this was a Marriott property! It seemed like a budget hotel (although not the price).  The rooms are extremely small and cramped.  My room was missing a lamp when first entered.  The room was near the ice machine which ran all night - very noisy.  A request for a different room was denied (I was told that the hotel was solidly booked and someone would get back to me the next day to see if something could be arranged when the hotel was less booked - no one ever contacted me and at that point I was too busy with my reason for being in NYC to change hotels).  In addition to the guest room, the hotel common areas are shabby and worn. The elevator shakes when going aloft.    The hotel is under construction but this was not clear when my reservation was made.   Many times there was no one in the lobby to assist with needs - the hotel seemed understaffed and deserted. The guest services are limited - many aspects were closed off.  It was quite noteworthy that although I was not satisfied upon check-in no one ever followed up with me during my stay.    I will continue to book Marriott properties but not this one.  I have never posted an online review - I wanted to spare others my experience.

title: Good Location...however
text: The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Central Park and Park Avenue etc. I travelled on my own and the room is the perfect size for one person. My check in experience was fantastic with William and he was very informative of the activities for 4th of July. However here is my issue. I wasn't leaving for the airport until 1.30 I called reception and asked if I could have a late checkout. The woman on the phone was rude and wouldn't even hear me out. On my way back that same evening I spoke to another person at reception and they were happy to accommodate my request and said it wouldn't be an issue. So my question is how is it acceptable for one staff member to be rude and not even hear out a request whereas another staff member accommodates the same. The other issue is about the $5 Bottled water. I got my own water and didn't touch any of those bottles in the room. When my bill was slipped under the door I was charged for the bottle of water and I called reception and was told it would be taken off. While checking out another lady at reception asked me if everything was settled and I brought up the issue of the water bottle charge and she said it would be taken care off. I looked at my statement today and the charge for the $5.44 has gone through and it's showing on my statement. It's not a matter about the $5 it's a matter of principle and the fact that they committed to twice fixing this mistake and yet it has not been done. Would I stay here again nope there are better hotels for the money.

title: Worst Renaissance Ever
text:
Rooms are absolutely tiny and congested. The queen bed is too small for two people. Slept on the floor because the extra rollaway bed won't fit in the room. 

Worst Renaissance hotel ever. I've stayed other Renaissance properties worldwide and they are absolutely on another level. 

Lack of staff in the hotel. Takes a really really long time to get anything you request for because they don't have enough staff. 

Being a part of the Marriott group, have no idea how this qualifies as a Renaissance?? 

Check in area and lobby is tiny. The elevators are very very old. 

There is an odd smell in the hallways as well and in general the hotel is old.

title: Shouldn't bear the Renaissance name
text: I have never had such a bad experience in a Marriott property. Hotel is under renovation but doesn't state that on their website. Furniture torn and scratched and restaurant closed (this is supposed to be a full service hotel and therefore have should have a resraurant). Rooftop terrace was closed and when I asked an employee about it they answered,  "everything is closed". Complained to the front desk and they just gave me a phone number to complain to. Especially sad because the staff was generally really good, but this property should not bear the Renaissance name.

title: New York Stay - June 2017
text: My partner and I had a great experience at this hotel.  Upon arriving at reception we were warmly greeted by the reception staff and provided the right advice to the hotel in general.  As we were there for a special occasion, they kindly upgraded our room plus additional inclusions.  The room itself was a good size for New York standards but importantly was clean and comfortable.  The shower itself had great water pressure.  The location of the hotel in midtown east we found good as it was within 15-20 minute walking distance from the main tourist areas (eg: times square) and short walk to the nearest subway station.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Good Hotel in a Midtown
text:
After arriving in the big city, we were quickly checked into our room with the nice receptionist. I forgot his name but he was quite delightful and offered us some recommendations since it was our first time in New York. This hotel is located conveniently in Midtown Manhattan which makes it walkable to some of the bigger attractions in NY and if it something isn't in walking distance, the subway is a great option! Some recommendations for things near this hotel: There is an amazing pizza place right next to the hotel outside. Delicious and can easily be taken back to your hotel to eat. There's also a 24-hour bagel place about 10 minutes away that serves amazing fresh bagels. Want some dessert? Go to Bloomingdale's and get you some banana pudding from Magnolia Bakery inside. 
Now on to the hotel itself! There are two "lobby" levels. The first one is where you check in but you need to go up (either by stairs or elevator) to the next floor where you can access your rooms by a different set of elevators. The hallways and interior were dated and kind of bleh. The room was actually really nice but also equally small (it's New York, what do you expect?). The bathrooms appeared to be renovated and was the best part of the room. One big problem that we experienced with this hotel (we came here in December when it was cold) was that there was a lack of hot water in the mornings. This was an issue for me because I'm a morning showerer and it's fortunate that I was here on leisure instead of business. 
Overall, we got a really good rate on this hotel during peak Christmas time so I'm not complaining. It's a solid mid-range hotel that doesn't really stick out in any way. I hope the water heating issue is fixed, and if not, at least it's probably a seasonal thing. But it's a nice hotel, updated rooms, is in a good location, and the staff is wonderful.

title: casi perfecto
text: El hotel es muy lindo. El titulo casi perfecto se refiere solamente a que te cobran el wi fi en la habitacion. Sin embargo podes usar wi fi gratis en el lobby. Por el resto todo estaba excelente. Limpieza, comodidades, atencion. Esta a unas 12 cuadras de times squares. Cerca de central park. Es un poco mas caro que muchos otros pero tiene logica en relacion al servicio que ofrecen. OJO. sin desayuno

title: Dumpiest Renaissance Ever...Feels Like Budget Hotel
text:
I normally like to stay at Renaissance hotels (one of Marriott's higher-end brands), because of the quality, but this place is like staying in a budget hotel.
Pros:
* Located on 57th which has a lot going on
* Room was clean and recently renovated

Cons:
* Hotel entrance/check-in area is like going into a dungeon (I thought I was entering the loading dock area it was so drab and poorly lit)
*The common areas, including the lobby, look like they haven't been updated since 1960s
* My room was the size of a shoe box.  I checked out a day early to go onto the next city on my trip because I was dreading sitting in such a depressing hotel
* As a plantinum member with Marriott, I was disappointed by their breakfast offering, which is better at about every other business hotels I've stayed at

The Renaissance at Times Square is phenomenally better than this place (there's no comparison...almost like they're entirely different brands).

title: Extra charge of 178$ after 2 months?
text:
My wife an I had a pleasant stay at Hotel 57 in March 2017. However the following experience completely destroyed this. 

One of the 6 nights at the hotel was paid by my Marriott membership program. During checkout they charged me for all 6 nights. After complaining, they changed the bill. 

2 months after ( the 29th of April) Hotel 57 charged my bank account 178$ without by approval or any kind of information from the hotel. I immediately contacted both Hotel 57 and Marriott. I got a fast reply ensuring that I would get a refund. 

I have never received any refund - despite calling Marriott customer care for updates on a weekly basis. Each call was a positive experience including a promise to solve the issue within 2 work days. Obviously this has not happened.  Besides my refund I have asked for an explanation. How can this happen and how do they ensure that it wont happen again?

I am extremely disappointed with the treatment and I will strongly advice you to avoid Hotel 57 in the future. I must also admit that it is disappointing the Marriott customer care is not able to solve the problem.

title: Great for Business or Pleasure
text: I travel to NYC frequently for business and recreation and always end up staying at this hotel due to great location and typically great rates. The hotel has gone through some renovations over the past few years and the results are great. The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are comfortable. The staff is always very friendly and happy to help in almost any way they can. One thing to note is that some rooms can be very small and would not be ideal for traveling with families. Other than that, this is a great mid price range hotel.

title: Small Boutique Hotel in good location
text: Stayed here after a show at Carnegie Hall. Great location but a bit pricey and small. Real nice bar but we weren't allowed in (private party on a saturday night!). Undergoing renovations now. Enjoyed watching the filming of a TV show across the street...

title: great hospitality
text:
We spend 3 nights at the 57Renaissance and it was a pleasure! The location is very convenient, centrally located just 3 blocks from 5th avenue but at night times very quiet.
The staff is very helpful, i forgot a shirt and the staff contacted me about that.
The rooms are very clean, i guess they are renovated recently. The bar was nice to have a couple of drinks (prices are reasonable). Good WiFi. So overall everything was good ! Next time NYC i'll see you again 57Renaissance!

title: Semana en New York
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, ceca de central park, buen servicio , se descompuso el aire acondicionado y nos resolvieron el problema de inmediato.
La entrada al metro queda cerca.
Lo que si no le gusto es que el restaurante tiene muy mal olor y su mobiliario se ve descuidado, necesita una renovación, al igual que las cortinas de la entrada de los elevadores.

title: Small, cramped space, but good location.
text: The bedroom was cramped, but the bathroom was quite nice. The view from my room was also quite good, however they were doing construction on the hotel so balconies/verandas were closed off. Décor was dated and I would recommend passing on the restaurant for what the city has to offer outside the hotel doors. I liked the location and spent time walking in Central Park. Also walked to and from a production of Wicked at Majestic Theater one night.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We visited Renaissance Hotel last weekend and we had a great time. Room was a bit dark but we were on the third floor so it was expected. Bathroom was big and clea. Staff throughout the hotel were very helpful and polite. Restaurant was lovely. Breakfast was good. Location is superb with walking distance to the main attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting New York.

title: Great week in New York and at Renaissance
text:
We visited New York for a week back in late May and loved the place. Our hotel - chosen blindly, was an excellent overall choice. Location was superb, room small by comfortable, and the service excellent overall.
Admittedly there is some ongoing construction outside at the front but this didn't put us off overall.. we would go back to that hotel again any time!
Thanks for a great time and good service

title: Perfect hotel in Mahattan
text:
Wonderful hotel staffed with uber friendly folks who are always smiling.
Pernell, the man at the front door is awesome. He remembered my name and my wifes every day for the eight days we were there. Always happy to see us and offer suggestions on what's what in the area.
I like the concept of checking in on the bottom floor, then heading on up to the lobby and the elevator to the rooms.
The elevator is right next to where you check in, so you check in, hop on the elevator and head on up. If Pernell is around, or one of his co-workers, they'll grab your bags and get them upstairs for you.
The lobby is small, but that's OK by me. I wasn't planning to spend time in the lobby anyway. The woman who was at the desk in the lobby was super awesome to us. We arrived after a red eye, before our room was ready. We let her know how tired we were, so she got on the phone and booked a massage for us around the corner from the hotel. We had to pay for the massage, but it was cool how she took some time out to help us get that scheduled.
The rooms are great, we had room 1505. Super comfy bed, the shower was really large too. The water pressure was a little lower than normal mid morning (8:00-9:30), but that is to be expected anywhere.
The wonderful woman who cleaned our room each day did an amazing job. The room was spotless and the bed was made perfectly every day.
We needed more towels one night. They arrived within 60 seconds of me hanging up the phone.
I really like how it is an old building, but they have updated parts of it so it is newer. Once in our room, we never felt like we were in an old hotel.
The big screen TV was nice, right by the bed. WiFi coverage was strong in our room.
The restaurant in the lobby had good food and good coffee.
You're two blocks from a Whole Foods Market that is open until 11:00PM, a coffee shop and two pizza places are less than a block away. One pizza place is right next to the hotel, the other across the street.
There is a subway stop two blocks away, green #4 Lexington Avenue Express #5, and #6, and another 4-6 blocks away, the E, F, Q, and M, to get to other parts of NYC.
This is now our favorite hotel in Manhattan.

title: Very friendly staff!
text: The hotel lobby is currently undergoing renovation, but the rooms were nice. Small, but very nicely appointed. What really stood out though were the staff. All of them, the receptionists, doorman, cleaning staff, were all so friendly and helpful. Great location as well, walking distance to a lot of key attractions in New York (5th avenue, Central Park, etc).

title: Small but Fine
text:
I stayed for just one night while I attended a fundraiser in NYC. This is an old building that has been refurbished but still keeps certain elements of charm of days gone by. The "Cozy Room" was definitely just that, and perfect for a solo guest. Double bed, safe, closet with full length mirror, coffee maker--the usual. Climate control was powerful; nice towels and linens.  

The hallways ARE noisy; I would have preferred that the foot of the bed be near the door vs the head of the bed, but that wasn't to be. Good location for my purposes. I would stay again.

title: Buon albergo
text:
Il livello dell'albergo è buono, mi aspettavo qualcosa di meglio ma evidentemente i lavori che sono in corso presenteranno presto dei miglioramenti. Scomoda la lobby al secondo piano, per accedere alle camere bisogna prendere due ascensori, la zona della lobby è piacevole e molto bello l'idea di poter fare colazione nello studio gratuitamente durante la settimana.
La camera è stata in parte una delusione, troppo rumorosa pur essendo al 9° piano e con molto spazio sprecato perché d'angolo: probabilmente sono stato sfortunato. Servizi nella media per un hotel di lusso.

title: Well located for business, quite old and noisy.
text: The hotel is undergoing some renovation and I hope it addresses many issues. It is an historic brick building, very nice look. But the windows don't close properly so you hear the noise from the street, same goes for the inside doors or connecting room doors. The elevators are old and very noisy. The rooms are large enough for NY and the service is very good. No problem staying here again.

title: Excellent stay for multiple reasons
text: We stayed here for the weekend and found the hotel to be in an excellent location and a great value. The rooms are small but adequate and clean. The service throughout the stay was very good especially at check in with Raymond who was very courteous and pleasant. The gym is in great condition and also decent equipment and clean with fresh towels and water. Nice little business center as well. Close to everything. I definitely recommend and would stay here again..

title: Horrible hotel, stay away from it.
text:
I don't even know where to start from because there are so many bad things about this hotel, so let me  make a list:

1- the queen size bed is NOT a queen size bed, it is a full size bed, and it is not a comfortable bed. The sheets were completely wrinkled. If you want to sleep don't stay here. 

2- the windows have no blackout so if you stay here be ready to wake up at 7am everyday 

3- the room is SUPER noisy, not from the outside but from the inside of the hotel. Doors being slammed all the time

4- from the 3 elevators only one works, so take a deep breath of patience when you come in or out the hotel because you'll spend AT LEAST 10min on the elevador. We stayed there 3 days and the elevators were not fixed, so I'm guessing they just got used to having one elevator for everyone: guests, dirty laundry, technitians, etc. 

5- they are going through major construction in the lobby so the lobby and check in/out area is super small and messy. 

There are hundreds of good hotels in NYC, please do not stay here, you'll thank me later.

title: Not Bad
text:
Things I didn't like about the room...very limited counter space in the bathroom. Single sink. No full length mirror or even half mirror, the only mirror in the room was above the bathroom sink. No dresser or drawers to put clothes in. There were 2 closets with hangers. And there is enough space for a dresser, or to turn one of the closets into drawer space. 
The  hotel decor is a little strange. Flowers and pink and white glass. 
We had breakfast in the restaurant. It was $18 for 2 eggs on top of one piece of toast with a little mashed avocado. The free breakfast isn't much. Make your own pancake, a pan of scrambled eggs not cooked well enough for me, oatmeal and fruit. Get breakfast next door at the Palace instead. 
Everyone at the desk, maids and downstairs doorman was friendly and helpful. 
The roof top balcony is closed. The outside  of the hotel is undergoing renovation. 
Nearby attractions: Rockefeller Plaza, Museum of Modern Art, Bloomingdales, south Central Park.

title: Room 1207 sets a new standard for bad
text: Ok so the hotel is under construction so the lobby situation is bad.  I'll give them a pass on that.  The restaurant and bar area has no AC blowing and is approximately 146 degrees in the muggy NYC heat this week... I'll blame that on the construction.  The elevators being basically dysfunctional and requiring an extra 5-10 minutes to get up or down and then randomly stopping at every floor en route?... not sure what to blame that on.  Room 1207, hands down the noisiest room I've ever stayed in at a hotel anywhere in the world.  I'm pretty sure its the elevator that every time it passes sounds like it is dragging a metal bar that is grinding in to your hotel room wall... I checked in at almost 1am and was fried so I didn't ask to change rooms and kept thinking it was something that would stop, big mistake. Now on to the shower, the shower head is one of those spray heads on a hose that you can pull off.  The hose was split and leaking so about 3 drops of water make it to the showerhead.  To shower I had to bunch the hose up and hold it over my head so water would actually get on top of me.  If it wasn't clear I'll never stay here again, and you will do so at your own risk.  (2 travel companions with me also had poor experiences)

title: Great staff and location
text: The staff and location of this hotel more than makes up for the strange dated little rooms. I was initially taken aback by the room but as I was not spending much time in it it did not matter.   My husband was in hospital and they were very accommodating about the length of my stay. I was there over Christmas and the location was perfect for wandering midtown and the upper East side. Room was clean and shower was great. The walls were paneled and felt a bit claustrophobic. The rating is based on the staff and location not on the room which alone would rate a 3.

title: The United Airlines of Hotels
text:
I am a Marriott Elite Member so I was excited to experience this property. When I looked at the pictures on the website, I saw large freshly renovated rooms with lots of light.  However, when I returned, it was just the opposite. 

Attached are pictures of the room they gave me. The room was dank, dark, and the size of a postage stamp. The bathroom cut into the room making it impossible to walk on one side of the bed. In the corner, there was an old-time air conditioner that churned away at the noise level of an aircraft engine. Clearly, it was not renovated. 

When I went to complain, I learned that the renovation was underway and they had no renovated rooms to give me - can you say bait & switch? When I asked for a refund so I can find a new hotel, they also refused.

I finally spoke to the front desk clerk - Manija Raofi - who was extremely unsympathetic. She was the one who refused to refund my money and said it was corporate policy. Isn't that was United said when it dragged that doctor out of the plane? I called the booking agent who I worked with and they said it was out of their hands as well. So I guess the only way I can get my $2,000 back is to file a dispute with American Express.

I then booked a room at the Viceroy around the corner and had an amazing experience. Not only is the room renovated and modern (the same size as the Renaissance room bit better laid out), but also they gave me free wi-fi (Rennaissance charges $17 per day) and a $10 food and beverage voucher for each day of my stay. 

A night and day experience. 

PS - I'd like to give a nod to the front desk clerk who was extremely hospitable and tried to make the best light of the situation. Sorry I didn't get his name.

title: Convenience in the heart of midtown
text:
This hotel sits nicely in the midst of NY's upscale boutique shopping district and near Central Park.  It is a converted space with nice artistic touches throughout.  You would hardly recognize it as a Marriott property.  It more has the feel of a boutique hotel sans the manager's happy hour.  

The place has a nice lounge that serves cocktails and beer until 2AM.

Being NY we only ate breakfast there one morning.  The food is really nothing to rave about, it is just standard bland fare.  There is a café next door which has a superb breakfast, just as an FYI.

The staff is very friendly and helpful.  We were immediately given directions to local places to eat and things to check out in the area.

Our room was well appointed, clean, and the bed was oh so comfortable.  We really enjoyed the deep, wide bath tub.  

Honestly for the price and the amenities in NYC this hotel is not only a bargain but a place that I would never have a problem calling my home away form home in NY.

title: I hate this hotel. Stay anywhere else.
text: This place is dark and dingy. The hotel has one valet for the whole place. The elevators are not much larger than a coffin and will take your arm off if you're not careful. There isn't even room to walk around the beds in a supposed "oversized executive" room. I seriously can't wait to get out of here. The worst hotel I have stayed at in NYC and I'm here all the time.

title: Great hotel
text: We spent 5 nights here over Easter for out wedding anniversary.  The staff were friendly and welcoming and the location was great! Around €7 in a taxi to times square but we had a lovely walk most days employing the city. We did not eat at the hotel but the food smelt delicious. Room was a bit small compared to previous visits to New York however it was spotless and the bed was super comfy! We were on floor 4 even though we requested a high room. The noise one night was too loud due to relaying of the road outside, this did not help with the jet lag. Also a loud air conditioning unit. Thanks for a lovely weekend.

title: Ne merite pas ses 4 etoiles
text:
Hotel de charme mais vraiment décrépi
Les parties communes et les chambres ont besoin d un rafraîchissement sérieux
Literie de qualité mais climatisation au bruit infernal et insonorisation des chambres perfectible
Par ailleurs le club lounge menu n est pas du tout au niveau d'un hôtel renaissance et le personnel du restaurant est très moyennement attentionné 
Grosse déception pour un hôtel idéalement placé à 10 minutes de central park

title: Stopover
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist fast perfekt. Das Personal war sehr freundlich. Die Zimmer sind jedoch sehr klein und etwas älter. Sollen bald renoviert werden. Die Preise sind wie in New York City üblich recht teuer. 

The location of this hotel is almost perfect. The staff was very friendly. The rooms are small and old furnished. It will be renovated shortly. Prices are high as typical for NYC.

title: Great pick for a first time visit
text: I stayed at this hotel during the weekend for girls trip. My friend was visiting New York for the first time and wanted to do all the touristy things in Manhattan. It was the best choice we could had made! Check in process went super smooth, Lucy at the front desk was very attentive and helpful. Pharell at the door was great too! We stayed at a double room and even though it was on the small side, most of NY hotels have the same issue. Room was clean, bathroom newly renovated and beds super comfy. House keeping did a great job, we left early morning and returned during the afternoon to change and our room was always clean with fresh towels and beds made. Location was amazing, metro station was just 2-4 blocks away. We stayed at a room facing the street and there was no noise, we woke up at 10am with no issues. Only downside was that there are very few options in walk in distance for a late dinner and this was not the hotel fault. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Business and pleasure
text: Attended the New York Auto Show for business and then stayed a few extra days.  The Renaissance New York Hotel 57 - was close enough to Times Square and Central Park - it was a great location.  But the best was the staff.  Fantastic, accommodating, helpful - service FIVE STAR!

title: A stay in New York City
text: This hotel was for the most part very nice. I had one of the basic rooms with a full size bed. Very comfortable bed and the room was spotless. On the down side, while the room has a closet to hang up shirts, suits, and pants it lacked dresser drawers to store the rest of the small clothing items. The first day I kept hearing this noise like somebody moving things off and on all day and night. I later figured out the bathroom wall was part of the wall of the elevator shaft. The noise I heard was the cables and elevators moving up and down. I spent too much time asking where things are in the hotel because they don't have a directory with information on the hotel in the rooms. I had to ask where the ice is and I wanted a soda and guess what, they have no soda machines in the place. I was told that there was a deli down the street where I could get one. The bathroom was super, and had a beautiful shower. I seriously enjoyed my stay there and I would stay there again if I was going to visit in that area again

title: Easter weekend in Manhatten
text:
This hotel needs a complete overhaul.  Reception/check-in is very good.  Another good thing about this property is that each room does have A/C controls; bad thing is the a/c is very loud.  I was able to prop open the window to get some fresh air.
Mattress is hard, carpets are worn.  Elevators are slow and small. This property does not appear to have a manager for housekeeping; supply closets are kept open 24 hours a day, a vaccum cleaner was stored next to a window in the hall overnight. Looks like they just leave the maids trolley wherever they are when it's time to clock out.  

The worst part was we made reservations for the Pre Fixe Easter dinner at Opia.
For $38pp the menu was a choice of  Salmon Tartare, Onion Tart or Caprese Salad as the first course; second course was roasted fish, mushroom rissoto or lamb  and dessert was milk or dark chocolate egg or ice cream.  (Not much variety).

From the minute we sat down our waiter ignored us.  He came by to give us the menu and take drinks orders.  Some one brought our tea and orange juice.  The waiter was all over the restaurant like a butterfly stopping everywhere except our table.  Finally had to go to the bar to get sweetner for my tea.  After about 15 minutes we had to stop him as he was passing by our table to take our order.  
Someone at the restaurant started playing music, too loud for such  a small space.
Waiter passed by, we requested music be turned down.  He left came back a few minutes later and said the "music is perfect the way it is" under his breath  as he passed our table; again without stopping at the table he said it just loud enough that I heard him.  Guess someone else complained because all of a sudden the music was turned off about 5 minutes later.

Finally got our food, a busboy delivered to our table 1st course items were all good, 2nd course items were terrible!.  We did not see our waiter again until he came to give us the bill.  He told us we would not be getting our dessert because there were too many people in the restaurant.  Needless to say we did not leave this guy a tip.
Probably ignored our table because it was 5 women.

title: I was overnight one night on business
text:
This hotel is very nice.  It is a hip retro hotel.  Small rooms, cool décor, nice restaurant/bar.  Everything in the room was up to date or even cutting edge, particularly the fixtures in the bathroom.  It also made good use of limited space.  Lobby, parlor and restaurant are on the second floor.  Entry is a level down.  Great location, 57th St and Lexington Ave.  Four blocks from the subway at 61st St.  Easy place to get a cab. Three blocks from 5th and two blocks south of Central Park.  My rate was $350.  It cost $426 after taxes.  
I wouldn't bring kids here.  It's upscale and pricey for a family.  Cool New York.  Good place for a getaway.

title: Great option in Midtown
text: I enjoyed my stay at Renaissance 57. They are under construction now, expanding the lobby and perhaps more. I didn't hear a lot of construction noise during my stay. All of the decor in the common areas of the hotel is very dark, but tasteful. My room was small and comfortable. The bathroom was large and had been very tastefully renovated. A big "Pro" was the staff. The wardrobe was large and there was a convenient writing desk. Each person with whom I interacted, including various front desk staff and housekeeping, was extremely courteous and helpful. The vibe in general was very positive from the staff. Great location near 5th Avenue shopping and Upper East Side. Cons: The lighting is strange in the room, including in the bathroom, making it difficult to see well anywhere in the room. Also, the doors to the rooms tend to slam, which woke me up a few times.

title: Very nice visit!
text: Wonderful, quaint hotel with excellent service. Staff was knowledgeable and attentive, able to provide suggestions about local eateries, etc. The only issues were that the interior hallways outside my door seemed loud. Conversations could easily be heard. Also, I requested and was given a late checkout, knowing that I would be out late the evening before. Even though the desk clerk had computers notes acknowledging this, I was called at 8am to make sure they had a credit card in file for payment, since the first nights were paid for by my company. Needless to say, I couldn't not go back to sleep and had to checkout with around three hours of sleep. Everything else was great!

title: Excellent and Accommodating Staff
text: I took a weekend trip here with 2 other girlfriends. I booked what I thought was a room with 2 full beds, but I accidentally booked a 'cozy' room with 1 full bed. The staff was able to upgrade me to a room with 2 full beds at no additional charge, even though it was wedding season. I was very grateful. They were very kind and accommodating. The room was clean and perfectly sized for 3 girls who wanted to spend most time sightseeing. Beds were comfortable.

title: Hotels in NYC just aren't great; this is average
text: Lets be clear - few hotel rooms in NYC are great by traditional standards.  Everything is cramped...  That said, this hotel is average in my "lower the bar for NYC" scale.
