The location is ok - but since it was raining, I was looking for some place )non hotel to eat) and I was stunned by the lack of quality options in a 3 block radius - BLT was booked, others didn't suit my fancy.  The entry is odd - you enter from the street to a cramped room with 2 check in folks and then have to go up a level to the lobby.  So elevator up a floor and then another elevator to you room.  Just created extra for an exhausted traveler.  The decor tries to be trendy and I guess succeeds.  It just seemed dark and loud.  The music playing at 4am when I departed to get to LGA for a flight was so loud in the lobby that it was stunning.  Rooms are simple, small (but average for NYC standards).  The sink gave me problems as the drain was slow and backed up when brushing teeth which meant spittle just sat in there for a hour before draining.  Yuck.  The toilet has a push wall flush (like on a plane) and creates a vacuum that could swallow a small man if caught in it.  Bed was ok.  The door out of the room just had a huge gap underneath so light poured in from the hallway.  People were nice.  Again, average for NYC.

title: Staff is amazing
text: I have stayed here once a month for a couple years and have always been amazed by the staff above all! The staff here are the very definition of hospitality! The hotel also is also beautiful with an old charm personality. Each visit has been better than the last!

title: Loved this hotel
text:
This is such a great location!   Although still undergoing renovation, the hotel is so nice, and the staff very friendly and helpful.  The room was a good size, as was the bathroom (with a bath tub as well as a shower).   And the beds - I think the most comfortable of any hotel!  And the room was very quiet - it's an old red brick building.    

There is a terrace on the 17th floor with great views - it's currently closed but we snuck out there anyway!

This was an interesting stay for me as I stayed here for a couple of months in 1962 when it was Allerton House, a residential hotel for women!   Great memories and still a great place to stay .  The onsite restaurant Opia is very good - see separate review.

title: Like a flight on an old 747 economy class with nice attendants
text:
Ok, perhaps it is a really bad idea to get the very first impression of Renaissance chain in NYC since I basically need to lower my expectation by 2 to 3 levels. 
Pros: a star for location, two stars for very nice and helping staffs.
Cons: this is the tiniest room that I have ever stayed in the entire world. We only got a full-size bed for two of us, reminding us the old days when we were poor students sharing an apartment with others. It worked relatively ok for us, but good luck my Dutch friends! The toilet is worth mentioning, it has exceptionally strong flushing power that you literately feel like on a plane when you hit that flush button. Everything else, as I said, is like flying a very old 747 economy class, limited space, chipped boards, failed table lamp, dislocated night stand that cannot hold your cup, no free wifi (yes, this is year 2017 and there is no free wifi), bottled water for $5 each, etc. etc.   
So overall, maybe it is a NYC issue instead of hotel chain problem, but I will be hesitated to go with a Renaissance next time.

title: 좋은 위치
text: 맨하튼 관광하기에 좋은 위치였어요. 조금 특이했던 점은 1층에서 체크인하고 2층에 올라가야 객실로 향하는 엘리베이터가 별도로 있어요.. 최신식 시설은 아니었지만 막 지저분하거나 그런 느낌은 아니었어요.. 다만, 침대가 접이식?도 아니고 좀 부실한 형태였어요.. 제가 묶었던 객실만 그랬던 것 같은데;; 다시간다면 바꿔달라고 했을 것 같아요;

title: Great classy hotel on 57th and Lexington
text:
Hotel 57 is a classy hotel. This is one of the Marriott autograph collection hotels. It just has a cool feel to it. 
My room has a big bathroom and walk in shower. I have a queen size bed, a chair for sitting by the bed and a sofa. The desk is built into the wall. Plenty of room to get some work done. Big flat screen TV on the wall. 

Opia is a nice restaurant bar. The staff was very nice and provide great service. This is decorated nicely. 

The entire staff at the Renaissance was very helpful and friendly. 

Enjoy.

title: On the Verge - Large, Clean Room - Poorly Lit, Thin Towels
text: I stayed at this hotel for an evening during a long stayover between flights. Check-in staff was friendly and very welcoming. The room itself was clean and my room has an updated bathroom. I would have appreciated more lighting in the room, it was quite dark with all the lights on. The towels were a bit thin and small. Tho hotel could use a binder or map showcasing local restaurants and providing a bit more information about the hotel. For example, I had no idea where to get ice, luckily a housekeeper happened to be on my floor and I asked her (I ended up having to go to another floor to get ice which was a pain). The hotel was a bit dull for the price BUT this is NY and it was close to the train I needed!

title: Location & basic amenities
text:
The location of this Renaissance is perfect for UES activities.  Construction to the outside of the building currently makes it a little tough to find, but once you do it's a great spot.

Check in staff and doormen were excellent and seeing their bright smiling faces each time I went out was a positive.  It would be easy to get lost here, and I took comfort in the hellos and good days.  The concierge lounge is an odd set up - it's in the main lobby, and when I went in the first night for waters I was handed one.  Had to ask for more and was given one more.  Sorry, but I'll give you all my drink coupons and my first born for water - one of the biggest perks of platinum status is the lounge, and ability for me to drink just as much water as I do at home.  I know it sounds crazy, but two bottles of water gets me through the news, maybe.  The first evening I went in it was staffed by an uppity young man.  The second night was empty and all was well.

The rooms are fairly small, but not surprising for being in the city.  I found the décor to be pretty beat up, but it sounds as if perhaps there are some plans to remodel or its started on some floors perhaps?  It's needed.  Style is what I'd call "Nordic Wood".  Lots of panels.  Desk near the window was quite drafty and I liked that the HVAC was one I could control.  Shower was hot and strong.  There is no mini fridge in the room.

I'll be back as this location is pretty central to where I'll be working.  I look forward to getting more familiar with the area.

title: Best Hotel to stay in NYC!!!
text: This is my 3rd visit to the 57.  I LOVE IT.  Cozy, hip, clean and comfy.  Raymond at front desk is the best.  He is kind, helpful and extremely knowledgable of all city sites and locations.  Lucy, Daniel, and Pernel are also helpful and make you feel like family.  The breakfast included is yummy and the bar Opia is great.  Excellent coffee and drinks, entertainment on weekends.  All around great hotel, location and bed.  Will be back soon.

title: Not as Advertised
text: We chose this hotel after having a great stay at the Marriott Renaissance in Times Square. This hotel is no where close to the pictures provided. Only some rooms have been updated. After moving from an old one with chipped wood on all cabinets and peeling fabric from furniture, we were still very disappointed with the "upgrade". The TV was literally hanging crooked off the wall with the cable box dangling down, the sink doesn't drain properly, the lotion had been used and was half full, the mattress was like cardboard and there was exceptionally small closet space. This is a place where you don't feel comfortable walking around in your bare feet. I'm extremely disappointed.

title: Carriage House Room is amazing
text:
This, the check in desk told me, is the nicest room in the hotel and they were not kidding. It's actually a suite and in the living room area is a brick wall presumably part of the original structure. The hotel is more like a boutique hotel as opposed to a major chain and that was a break for me. 
In full disclosure I travel a lot for business so I'm a platinum member of Marriott.

title: Excellent location- large room
text: Stayed on 16th floor, large closet space. Very unexpected for New York City. Great location for shopping and Central Park.  The concierge lounge had a little to be desired but everything else was awesome.  Highly recommend the hotel!

title: Water issues & more ~ Comfortable sleep
text: I spent the weekend at this hotel. Interesting decor ~ very comfortable bed but had issues. When I checked in, there was NO soap or shampoo. Housekeeping quickly fixed that; however my 1st morning, there was no water.... It was quickly fixed, but disappointing. My 3rd morning, I barely had enough water to finish a shower and it quit again.  Internet WiFi is not free.  Rooms are clean, but cold. My room was immediately in front of the elevators; therefore I heard lots of people coming to the elevators, and could hear luggage rolling on the tile floors at 3-4 am!   Lobby is dark. There was good music in the bar Sat. evening. This was my 1st visit to NYC. I could see that it is a very safe area.

title: Nice hotel with wonderful service but the bar is another story...
text:
Spent a night here recently while visiting Manhattan. We were very pleased with the reception and our accommodations. The room was clean, comfortable and functional. However, we had two issues. The doors were thin so we heard  folks in the hall and the elevator ding every time it stopped on our floor. Our other issue was with the bar.

We dropped in for a few drinks after a performance at Carnegie Hall. Our reception by the bartender was very unwelcoming to say the least. The drink menus were tossed at us and every question we had for her seemed to be an inconvenience.  I can't remember the last time we were treated so rudely. In any event. We ordered our wine and took it into the lobby. It's too bad as we had planned to have a few drinks but after our reception, we didn't want to stay.  This is the first time in probably 30 years we didn't leave a tip because she didn't deserve it. The hotel was nice but I don't see ourselves going back.

title: Very Nice Hotel! Hidden Gem
text: So-- been to New York city like 4 times so I am still kinda new to the city .. but this was a GREAT LOCATION... it was super middle to everything the hotel was very nice i had to get a Junior suite and it felt like a normal room.... i definitley reccommend you upgrade to a junior suite.. the bar at night was low lit--music playing great service overall great Marriott hotel.. IMpressed! PS the roofttop seating area was closed when i went but i took a peak and you had views of the Chrysler Building

title: best weekend get away ever!!!
text: i don't usually rave about hotels that i have stayed at, but i just love this hotel that i'm giving my 100% thumbs up. Special shout out to all the staff most especially to Clifford and Imelda who never got tired catering to all our demands. Our room was clean and quiet despite of the hotel being busy that weekend.  I would definitely come back and stay here and would also downright recommend it to family and friends.

title: Muy buena opción de hotel en NY
text:
Estuvimos en una habitación doble. Excelente la limpieza, el silencio debido a la aislaron del dormitorio del exterior y de las demás habitaciones, adicionales de cafetera con servicio de café y t'e, plancha y tabla, baño completo. 
La ubicación es super buena, hay acceso al subterráneo, supermercado, y todo lo que uno puede necesitar , en una cuadra a la redonda. Excelente

title: Pleasant stay
text: We loved our stay at Renaissance New York Hotel 57. Our corner room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Staff were friendly and efficient. On Saturday night after seeing a Broadway show, we travelled back by subway and walked one short block to the hotel. We decided to stop for a glass of wine at the lobby bar and were treated to an excellent jazz band for the rest of the evening. Everything was better than we expected and would certainly stay there again.

title: Putting the "it's only one night" mantra to the test . . .
text:
Like many Trip Advisor reviewers, I travel frequently, both for business and pleasure. For a recent business trip to Manhattan, I went through the ritualistic balancing of cost versus comfort. In this case, I voted for cost, selecting this property at a nightly rate of $199 before tax. My thought process balanced a cost savings, the Marriott brand and a good location. After all, I had upgraded frequent guest status with Marriott. My fallback was the frequently traveler's rationalization, "how bad can it be . . . it is only one night." Read on, gentle reader.

The hotel is in a great location -- East 57th Street between Park and Lexington Avenues and in a historic structure. Sometimes this makes for a quirky but interesting layout (say, like the Westin on Union Square in Manhattan). Here? No charm and hallways and lobbies that are dark, seemingly from the 1980s.. I arrived at the property early and I was told there were no rooms ready. Fair enough. The front desk promised to call when my room was available. Perhaps a place where I might change for a business meeting? You guessed it -- the men's room. Strike one.

I returned to the hotel at 4 pm -- no call, no text. My request for a high floor far from the elevator? 6th floor, behind the elevators. This is a 20+ story hotel. The desk clerk wouldn't budge . . .

Any my room? The walk-in closet in our master bedroom is larger. Truly, this is smaller than my dorm room as a freshman in college. I hit the bed corners with my shins half a dozen times. Oh, and the bed was just slightly larger than that freshman dorm bed . . .  The "closet" was so small I couldn't hand a suit jacket.

The "desk" area literally is a cubby hole under the TV. Not a flat screen -- an old-style full size television. The "desk" is about 30 inches long and 24 inches wide. Very cozy -- not. 

I couldn't find the TV remote, which is a bid weird. On my way out for a dinner meeting at 5:30 pm, I asked the front desk to put one in my room. When I returned some 3 hours later, no remote, In defense of housekeeping, when I called again, the remote arrived very quickly. 

All in all, a night that tested the road warrior mantra, "It's only one night."

title: Atendimento e localização
text: Ótimo hotel localizado na melhor área de Nova York. Os funcionários que trabalham no local são muito educados e prestativos. Apesar de o café da manhã não estar incluído, há dezenas de locais ao redor para comer.

title: excellent staff , perfect location & very nice hotel.
text:
They have a very helpful & accomodating staff, clean & nice spacious room & bathroom.
location is close to everything, personal refrigerator & microwave are available upon request. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my relatives & friends.

title: Second visit as good as the first!
text: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel.  We could not have been more pleased.  The staff is so accommodating, and the location is perfect, close to the theatre district and several museums.  We also took advantage of the Opia Restaurant which is a quiet, comfortable place to dine.  I am certain that we will opt for this hotel on future visits.

title: Good Location, But Lacking Executive Level Amenities
text:
Stayed here Friday, Feb 17, through Mon, Feb 20, for the President's Day Weekend in NYC.  I'm a frequent business/personal traveler to NYC so I know the city fairly well.  I've always wanted to stay at Hotel 57 since they opened several years ago.  When I saw a great rate for this weekend, I jumped on it.  I should of known things were off to a shaky start when I checked in around midnight on Friday.  The reason I opt for mobile check-in is so I can run into the reception area, grab my room key and get to my room to drop off my luggage.  At check-in it was very slow and the front desk staff insisted on handing me every brochure and suggestion for a place to eat every meal.  All great and everything, but not at midnight.  

It appears I was upgraded to a corner room with a little extra space.  It was nice to have the couch and a spacious bathroom.  The room itself seems to be in need of a refresh, the bathroom seemed updated.

As for the rest of my experience it was disappointing not having a fully stocked executive lounge.  Every time I went into the lounge it was often picked over and only had a few bottles of water.  It would be nice if this were fully stocked all day with drinks and snacks.  Also, I don't understand why they shut down the coffee machine in the late morning.  We tried to grab coffee around 10:30 or 11 on Sun morning and the machine was already shut down.  Doesn't make sense to me.  I guess it's their way of forcing you to use their restaurant or leave the hotel.  I also want to point out the attitude of the bar staff.  We wanted to grab drinks Sunday night (3 of us) and the bar tender had a major attitude with us.  She was more interested in explaining their whiskey selection to one individual who arrived at the bar after us than taking our drink orders.  She would start and stop making our drinks in order to appease and flirt with this individual.  Some extra training could be used with the bar staff.

All in all, I probably wouldn't stay here again.  I feel there are better Marriott/Starwood properties in the NYC that would provide better executive lounge and service experience while staying in NYC.

title: Decent, clean and close to everything
text: This was our second stay at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57. Our tour group booked  the past two years. A very nice hotel, clean, spacious rooms and nice staff (very helpful!). For our sightseeing and touring needs, the hotel was perfect. We had breakfast there two mornings, good food, attentive staff. Stopped in the hotel bar in the afternoon, drink prices were a bit high but this is New York City. Overall, I would recommend the hotel.

title: It's a great hotel
text: Booked an one-bed room studio; good furniture in room; great location. Also, compare with other Marriott hotels, it has a better value. Also, it closes to the Roosevelt Island tram; I recommend to take the tram if you've never done so.

title: Facility charge
text:
Can anyone tell me if this hotel charges a facility supplement fee? 

Thanks in advance everyone ....... and any other tips and advice would be greatly appreciated. 
What is the toiletries situation? Xxxxx

title: Amazing hotel.
text: Location - walking distance to most attractions AND FOOD. Very friendly and professional staff. Hotel interior is impecably designed, with blown glass and metal accents throughout. Room was clean and newly renovated. Beds were quite comfortable ( and I am 9 months pregnant with back problems).  Yes, there was an issue with hot water pressure, but it was temporary, and management totally compensated forthe inconvenience.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text: This is the quietest midtown hotel that I have ever stayed at. Our room was right over Lexington, but I did not hear a thing all night. I was disappointed that there was no breakfast option for gold or platinum on the weekend, as that is an amenity that I have gotten used to as a rewards member. Otherwise, it was nicely decorated and very modern.

title: All around we were happy!
text: Three of us met in NYC to catch a cruise. This hotel was recommended as a good location and it was!  Our first room was the double bed version, and for three grown ups it was tight.  So we asked if we could upgrade to queens or get a couch.  We were given a great room, no view, but plenty of room and we were thrilled!  The staff were friendly everywhere and went out of their way to help us.  The concierge was terrific and each day gave us directions and ideas of thing to see and do.  Great tip was Olympia for breakfast down the block.  We left for the ship rested and ready to go! Our room on the 4th floor got the free wifi fm the lobby. Easy walking to Central Park and subways.

title: Localização excelente e muito confortável!!!!!
text: Ficamos 3 dias na cidade de NY no final de janeiro, como tínhamos chegado cedo achamos que não poderíamos entrar no quarto, no entanto o hotel nos liberou um quarto, o que foi maravilhoso pois estávamos doidos para descansar da viagem. O quarto e o banheiro são muito confortáveis e limpos, e a localização do hotel é perto de tudo e estações de metro, fizemos tudo andando. O ponto negativo é não ter wi fi nos quartos somente no saguão... mas acho que todos hotéis de Manhattan tem essa política. Voltaria com certeza!!!!!

title: Buena ubicación, pero servicio sólo regular....
text:
El hotel es sólo regular... Su ubicación evidentemente es un plus, muy céntrica, a sólo un par de cuadras del Central Park y cerca de muchas atracciones... 
Sin embargo, la calidad es sólo regular... El primer inconvenientes fue a nuestra llegada, cuando durante el check in nos dijeron que "no habían recibido la notificación" de la reserva que yo había realizado varios meses antes a través de Booking, señalando que "siempre" tenían problemas con las reservas que se realizan a través de este tipo de webs... En mi experiencia personal, en que muchas veces he reservado a través de esta vía, nunca había tenido inconvenientes (desconozco si otros usuarios la han tenido en alguna oportunidad)... 
Luego, al llegar a la habitación, nos hallamos con la desagradable sorpresa que la ducha del baño se encontraba con una limpieza muy regular, con hongos en los bordes de la ventana de la ducha y en otras estructuras metálicas. Afortunadamente, cuando hicimos notar esta situación en la recepción, nos dieron la opción de cambiarnos de habitación a otra algo más grande, y que evidentemente no tuviese esta mala limpieza... 
Otro punto que no me agrada totalmente, es que en el segundo piso del hotel, se encuentra un resto-bar, en donde hacen en las noches eventos privados, que resultan ser muy ruidosos... De todas formas, la atención y la calidad del resto-bar es buena, por lo que vale la pena de ir a cenar un día en él... 
En resumen, salvo por la ubicación, no lo recomiendo...

title: Great Location, High Price
text: This hotel was in a great location, within walking distance to many shops, attractions and restaurants. The main lobby and entrance was very clean and welcoming, with very nice decor. The part that I wasn't thrilled with was the price, we paid over $600USD a night for a basic room for 3 people with two double beds. The room had a view onto a roof and had a huge pillar in the middle. The beds were absolutely terrible, at least for us. We prefer firm but not too hard beds, these beds were like clouds and the pillows were the same. The management and cleaning staff was very kind and helpful. I will not be staying here again for that price and until they upgrade the beds. Also if you stay on one of the lower floors you can pick-up the free wifi from the upper lobby

title: Ran out of hot water at 8am
text:
No hot water and I have an interview this morning. Front desk said it's because everyone is taking a shower at the same time. Really? What a surprise. Showers in the morning?

Get the basics right, including hot water heaters sufficient to support the size of the hotel.

title: A mixed bag
text:
We had a mixed experience at the 57th St Renaissance.
Plusses:
    Location:   Excellent!  Steps from Bloomingdales, not far from Central Park, and
    near good bus service.
    Staff:   Also excellent!   We found everyone warm, hospitable, friendly, and
    competent.
    Room:   Had everything necessary.   Thermostat actually worked, too.
Minusses:
    Room:   Tiny.  Just about enough room to get around the bed.   Also, as a
    Starwood platinum member I have reciprocal platinum Marriott status, so i
    expected niceties like free water, a bathrobe, etc.  Not there.
    Club lounge.  Good location, on lobby level, and attractive.   But basically nothing
    there, not even diet Coke.  No hot hors d'oeuvres in evening and not much cold.
    Staff was lovely, though.
    Breakfast restaurant:   Really bad, poor and disorganized service (took almost
    TWO hours to get served) and food  not so good either.   However, the restaurant
     manager and the hotel manager were pleasant and apologetic and gave us some
     extra points to compensate, as well as comping the meal.   But we were 8 people,
     there for a major family event, and we barely had time to get dressed and get to
     where we needed to be, much less feeling calm and happy.

title: Great location, but ...
text:
I travel to NY about once a month and decided to give this Renaissance a try due to it's proximity to my mid-town office.  I stayed all of last week.  Overall, the hotel was okay.  However, there were several issues that will make think twice about staying here again ...

*first and foremost was the hot water issue.  I actually time 10 minutes before hot water came out of the shower.  I mentioned it during the second day of my stay and was told this happens from time to time.  The3rd day was better, but my last 2 nights were 10 to 15 minute wait to shower, brush my teeth, etc.
*the overall condition of the room was average.  the panel that hides the a/c unit kept falling off.  several of the outlets did not work which meant my phone was not charged one morning.  the furniture was a bit beat up - looks like it is time for a face lift.  there were not nearly enough drawer space for two adults.
*breakfast was included due to Gold status.  Breakfast was good, but the refrigerator for complimentary drinks seemed to always be short of selection and snacks were just granola bars & mini candy bars.  Have had better selections and experiences at Beverly Hills Marriott & JW Marriott DC. 

Like I said, I travel once a month but I'm not sure I'm willing to give up my usual Courtyard for this location.

title: Excellent choice
text: The location was our reason to choose this hotel. The staff is friendly and very professional. The restaurant/ bar is quite good. Our room was small but clean, well appointed, and very quiet. Car parking is awkwardly offsite but nicely handled by the hotel staff. Transportation is a strong point to the location, with subway and bus service nearby and lots of taxi service always available. Manhattan can be crowded, noisy and very expensive. This hotel provides a very nice break from all three. Its diminutive nature seems cramped when compared to other cities. For those who love NYC, this place is sure to please.

title: Good location, average hotel
text: This was my second stay at this Marriott property.  The first was for business with a midnight arrival and 6:00 AM departure.  The hotel is fine for this type of stay.  For anything longer I would recommend a nearby Courtyard as a better option as the rooms at the Renaissance are small and amenities are minimal.  Check in via web app to avoid having to wait past stated 3:00 PM check-in time.

title: Vale somente pela localização.
text: Quarto pequeno. Banheiro reformado, mas pequeno. Sem café da manhã. No primeiro dia esqueci um anel no quarto e nunca mais achei, acho que foi a camareira que o furtou mas como não vi, não posso acusar. Fiquei no prejuízo. Só valeu pela ótima localização.

title: Great Location, helpful staff
text: Stayed for NYE 2017. Had an issue with some people smoking in the room next to us so we got upgraded to a fantastic suite !!! The staff were helpful throughout. Location is great. Rooms are simple but elegant.

title: The good and the bad
text:
We chose this hotel for a combination of reasons:  the price, the location, the good experience we had with Renaissance in Seattle, Marriott Reward points and, of course, the mostly positive reviews here on Tripadvisor.
The location is very good.  I wanted to be within walking distance of Central Park, Bryant Park, all the major museums etc-and it was.  Although, on the last day of our stay, we did take cabs to and from the Natural History Museum because it was pouring rain and it was the farthest attraction we were visiting.  The surrounding area of this hotel is mostly high end boutiques so at night, there isn't much going on.  This is good because that means it's quiet at night so you can bank of a good night's rest.  This is not so good because it is a 10 minute walk before you come across any interesting nightlife.
The positive reviews about the staff are absolutely true.  Every person I encountered was friendly and enthusiastic about helping me with anything that i needed.
Our room was on the 12th floor.  It was small like i had read in the reviews-but it was big enough for us so we didn't mind.  The bed was very comfortable and we had a nice view from our windows.  The room came equipped with a bed, four pillows, blanket, 2 lamps, 2 phones, tv and remote, 2 night stands, desk, office chair, paper, pen, coffee maker with coffee/tea/creamer/sugar, paper coffee cups and lids, tray, safe, iron, ironing board, full length mirror, folding luggage rack, glass drink cups, tissue box, toilet paper, 2 bars of soap, 2 oz bottle of aveda shampoo/conditioner/body lotion, bath/face/hand towels, closets, and a lot of outlets (very handy).  The room did not come with a microwave, but I asked front desk, and they had one brought up right away.
We did encounter a number of troubles with our stay. The fan in our bathroom did not work.  Our bathtub knob was wobbly.  The light at the room entrance was out.  One of our room key cards stopped working on the second day of our stay.  On the third day, there was no hot water at 10:30 am.  On the evening of the second day, I noticed a neon green sticker on the door of the room next to us (pic).  I don't know if it was there before we came but it said something about NYPD Police and forbidden entry.  The door knob had also been taken off.  It gave us a really bad feeling every time we saw it but decided not to ask what had happened or to be moved-sometimes ignorance is bliss.
We did take advantage of a few conveniences that the hotel offered.  First being the business center.  We had a Statue of Liberty boat cruise that required printed tickets, so we printed them off there.  Internet (on a PC) in the center is pay by the minute and printing is pay by the page.  Second being free wifi for Marriott Rewards members.  And lastly, we stored our luggage with the hotel after we checked out so we could sightsee some more.  
I did like the hotel and the staff.  But there were so many negatives that I don't think I will be staying here again.

title: Excellant mid town hotel
text: We stayed over Xmas for 8 nights.  Location is excellent with easy access to NYC public  transportation on 59th and Lexington.  We were upgraded from a superior queen to a superior king.  With Marriott the wifi was free and due to a special we had breakfast included.  Asked for room facing up Lexington  Ave but settled on a rear room on 16th floor looking down Lexington with no offices nor residences looking in our windows. Elizabeth at the front desk allowed us to select from several rooms.  Had several small maintenance issues which were completed very quickly or while we were out.  Housekeeping was quick, efficient and friendly.

title: Quality lodging, friendly service and a perfect location.
text:
Our family of four enjoyed 6 days in a cozy, clean and well-appointed room—perfectly located on the upper east side. Not too touristy, but with some options nearby. Highly recommend.

As for friendly service-- it doesn't get better than the doorman, Pernell, who gave us ideas for traveling, asked about our days, and hugged us as we left for home.  

Highly recommend.

title: NYE stay, bar too expensive
text: Staying for 4 nights, room ok and functional. Lobby and bar area are too dark , a house wine and a whiskey $30!! Ridiculous prices that spoil the experience, staff nice and friendly, good location for midtown and Central Park . Nice place next door for breakfast and Bloomingdales very close

title: Quirky Older Hotel in Midtown
text: Always feels a bit odd when you check-in at street level then take elevator up one level to lobby and then a second elevator to room. Found lobby to be quite dark so spent less time there than usual. Room was also quirky - bigger than I had expected (was a corner room) but took me a while to find the hidden TV / odd sink / etc. - still four stars based on the great service. Would stay again at right price

title: Perfect location for a Girls Shopping Trip
text:
I stayed here for a girls trip. It offers perfect access to Bloomingdales, 5th ave, and the surrounding area. Great Subway access, so the city is at your disposal! 

Staff was amazing!! Great service. The Queen room with Sofa was extra roomy, as was the bathroom! My room had great views, and I loved the separate heating/cooling unit I the bathroom , and the huge soaking tub!

title: A little different, but that's a good thing
text:
Boutique flavor, quirky here and there.  Street level is the check in, then up one floor to the lounge/restaurant, across that lobby to get to the elevators to the guest rooms.

Staff is very nice, knowledgeable and ever present.  Location is good if you need to be on the east side.

As typical of NYC, postage stamp size room, but comfortable.  TV in an awkward location to watch from the desk (right above the desk in the room I had), but it was ok.

Club lounge for breakfast was fine, no surprises.  

Room rate was good for NYC, bonus of getting Marriott Rewards points for staying somewhere different from a cookie cutter hotel.

title: Older Hotel but Reasonable Value
text: One of the older hotels in the area. Reasonably priced. Smaller rooms (compared to others in the area). Service was good. Has all the amenities. Dont expect too much. Need to have a good mix of hotels in the area for all budgets!

title: A 2 night stay
text:
On arrival we received a lovely welcome ,said we had a reservation new we were hours early,however could we leave a luggage.Girl went on the computer and said our room was ready and we were welcome to use it.
Our room had been descibed as a cosy room,not large however as we were on a sightseeing trip suited us.It was spotlessly clean,and no noise from outside.

title: Ugh...
text:
The Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is one to avoid.  There was no hot water two out of three mornings.  Apparently recurring boiler problems.  The coffee maker in our room was broken.  My wife reported it.  The response from a concerned staff member was to bring her a cup of coffee (kudos), but no one replaced the coffee maker.  I eventually had to personally take the broken coffee maker to the reception desk in order to have someone replace it.  And I'm convinced the furniture in our room was reclaimed from a college dorm from the 1970s.

There are many wonderful hotels in New York.  This isn't one of them.

title: Cool property
text:
Love the old building, very cool but the rooms are small. We booked a superior room but thought that it was very small. Good thing we were only staying one night. 

Service eh, took a long time for someone to come out to the front to valet the car.  

Add the service and the smaller room overlooking the air condition ducts and a brick wall. Eh!

Just glad I booked superior.

title: Decent Choice
text: As Marriott members, we chose this hotel based on price, location and the fact that we could cancel without fee. We found it a good choice. Staff was actually better than decent--they were helpful, polite, handled special requests quickly and professionally, and quite friendly. The property is fine; it has some interesting boutique/artsy design elements, which was cool. But overall the building probably needs some overall work. But it works. The bar was great, live music at night was excellent and a cool addition. The breakfast was okay, but weekend breakfast would be appreciated (weekdays only). I wouldn't make a point to go here again, but neither would I avoid it. A solid, 3.5 stars, decent hotel.

title: Very nice hotel and great staff
text: After leaving Le Parker Meridien we moved our room to Renaissance New York on 57th. It was a great hotel from the moment we checked in. Great helpful bellmen and great service at the front desk. If you needed a taxi or any form of transportation they would make sure that you had it. The rooms are nice and large and the hotel is very reasonably priced. They had a complimentary breakfast and cocktails in the evening. The hotel is pretty close to the shopping areas. It's around the corner from Park Avenue. Also, the hotel retains it's old architecture on the outside but it is modern on the inside.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and the next time I'm in New York we will be staying here.

title: Can Probably Find Better
text:
We stayed 5 nights in the superior queen room. Why they call it superior is beyond me and I am afraid to see what the cozy room is like. We were wondering if we were actually put in the cozy double room by mistake but after asking front desk we were told point blank that it was in fact the queen room. The lady at the front desk was very dismissive and it seem like they weren't interested in what we had to say at all and mostly annoyed by the fact that we wanted to check. The room we got was tiny, nothing like the photos on their website. It was so small that they could only fit one bedside table on one side of the room. I had the luxury of having to charge my phone on the floor next to the bed. 

The bathroom is nicely renovated but the flush on the toilet sounds like a small jet aircraft taking off. Ok if you are staying on your own but when you are with your partner and you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night you will wake them unless they are a deep sleeper. 

The air con wasn't much better. The first two night when we turned on the heating it made so much noise we couldn't leave it on. Sound like you have a generator on in your room. When it is off it blows cold air. I think the room next door was having the same issue since we could hear it turning on from our room. After two night however it seemed to fix itself and we were able to use it with some peace. Not next door though unfortunately. 

They are also doing some renovations in the hotel, we received a letter in our room advising of the potential noise. This might have been good to know before we booked and it might be worth while calling if you are looking to stay to see if this is complete. I can't say this was the most comfortable stay we have ever had in a hotel. We were glad to be leaving. In the end I probably should have gone with the other hotel I was tossing up between.

title: Overall Very Good
text: Had an exciting stay here last week, culminating with a kitchen grease fire that had us all standing outside in the dark from 5:30-7:30 am...  However, the location is good, the rooms were very comfortable, and the staff is extremely friendly.  Only issue is that the lobby lounge should have coffee/tea available all day, not just at breakfast, and the breakfast food tended to start running out well before the end of breakfast.

title: Schönes Gebäude, gute Lage, hässliche Zimmer
text:
Ein tolles Gebäude im Boutique Stil, der sich durch die öffentlichen Bereiche zieht.
Auch die Lage ist gut. Trump ist nur zwei Blocks weiter :-) und viele  Sehenswürdigkeiten sogar fußläufig.
Zwei Nachteile: Die Zimmer sind wirklich nicht schön sondern haben eine sehr schwache Einrichtung. Das Bett ist in gewohnter Marriott Qualität aber der Spanplattenschrank und die kleinen undichten Fenstern sind enttäuschend. Außerdem war die roof terrace geschlossen und aufgrund eines Feuers war auch die Lounge geschlossen.
Schade, ich habe mehr erwartet.

title: Decent stay
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend in April. The hotel is in a great location, very convenient to the subway. The decor in this hotel is strange, I couldn't tell if it was really dated or just trying to be eclectic. The rooms are very large, with a nice sitting area. The executive lounge is a joke, so I wouldn't stay here for that. Overall we had a decent stay.

title: Great location
text: We arrived early and our room was ready which was perfect. Staff is very nice and friendly. Rooms are small but it didnt matter because we only slept there. It was clean and the bed was comfy. Hotel is in a perfect loacation. We used their business center to print out our boarding passes. We didnt use any other service they provide. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Birthday in NYC
text:
Thanks to all the staff in Hotel 57- as i know from my reading of reviews prior to our arrival that the hotel staff read these reviews. 

Now the review. 

From the time we arrived to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday until we departed the whole staff were beyond compare. The front desk staff, Raymond and Serge and the Manageress Kim were all first class and thanks especially to Maggie in the Concierge Lounge who looked after our two teenage boys every morning at breakfast, we had an exceptional hotel experience. 
We had surprises at our room on arrival and during our stay when we had a small problem this was addressed with a "no problem' attitude and was sorted with haste, thanks to Kim. Staff have to be complimented and this goes throughout the hotel even down to the room cleaning staff and porters- all first class.
The hotel itself is perfectly located on a corner near Bloomingdales, a subway, a chemist and the Pig and Whistle Irish bar is just around the corner for a quick beer. To be honest its hard to fault the hotel. Many and varied TV channels on the large wall mounted movable screen and extra room space in the double queen bedroom we occupied. There are 3 Lifts which work perfectly and the whole place, while in an old New York building is spotlessly clean.
 
A few words of advice to the hotel regarding our experience and which may benefit other guests - Copious amounts of hair Shampoo and body lotion/moisturizers are  provided free of charge but for some reason no shower gel in the hotel, we did ask but they dont supply it. The only complaints I have and it annoys me to find fault is that there is a charge of 5 dollars per bottle of water in the room (plus tax), these are small plastic bottles and although as was pointed out to me (afterwards) that the charge is written on the bottle it is so small that it it is almost indistinguishable. Now you have been warned- its free in the Concierge Lounge or for a dollar in nearby shops. Also, although wifi was listed at 15 dollars per day, our teenagers seemed happy enough with the free wifi that reached our 15th floor room, so cant complain. These complaints are beyond the scope of the local hotel staff and cannot be blamed on them. Finally the transport provided on departure by the hotel was perfect, cheaper than the local cabs, more modern and on time. Well done all around. So in conclusion, would i visit again....absolutely, without a doubt.

title: Why bother?
text: I have a feeling that this place is run by a computer which has been instructed to wring as much money as possible from the facility with the least possible input.  This Orwellian scenario is almost working but some of the staff have not gotten the message and do show a bit of human warmth.  The location is good.

title: lovely experience
text:
Our management team & spouses (from Vancouver British Columbia, Canada) stayed for 4 days at the Renaissance 57 this past weekend total of 10 in our group. combination of business & pleasure, the management team used the meeting room & business centre, they found everything went smoothly & the staff very helpful & accommodating. Stephanie the Group Sales Manager was amazing in assisting with all our requests.  
Michelle on the Navigator Desk was also brilliant in helping to arrange a private tour with guide, to selecting a restaurant close by - which was outstanding. 
The hotel is in a great location close to 5th Ave, shopping & central park. 
The rooms were on the small  side but we only slept there (too much to see & do), but clean, comfy bed, large bathroom & closet space is good too. I would have liked to had a mini fridge but that's not a deal breaker.
In all fabulous hotel, wonderful staff & would definitely stay there again if i manage to get back to the big apple:)

title: Unfriendly staff
text:
I needed to take a relative to NYC for a cancer follow-up appointment at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. The Renaissance 57 is listed on MSKCC’s website as having special rates for patients. Because MSKCC rates aren’t on the hotel’s website, I called reservations to ask for the rate for a room with two beds. The rate quoted was good, and I booked the room. I never got a confirmation email but had the confirmation number. When we arrived, we were given a “cozy” room with only one double bed. I explained that I had booked a room with two beds, and the woman at the desk insisted that I had booked a room with one bed. She told me I was lucky that they had a room with two beds, but then she lectured me on how to book the correct room in the future. 
 
The room was tiny and dim, but clean. There was no information about the hotel in the room. The vent in the bathroom didn’t work. After we both took showers in the morning, we discovered that the hair dryer did not work. We asked if they could send one up within 15 minutes so that we could make our appointment. It did not arrive so we went to MSKCC with wet hair. A hair dryer was hanging on the door when we returned. 

When I attempted to print our boarding passes in the business center, they did not print. I did find copies of the hotel’s spreadsheet of revenues for the previous day in the printer. I took these down to the concierge and asked if she wanted them and she said, “No.” I asked how I could print boarding passes and she said she’d send the engineer to the business center. He said that the computer set up for boarding passes was broken and I should use one of the computers that had a per minute charge. So far, not a single friendly word or smile from any staff member.

The evening before our departure, we asked the bellhop to arrange for a car to take us to JFK the next day at noon. He called at 11:30 a.m. and said our car was there. So, we threw our things into the suitcases and dashed downstairs, where there was no car waiting. Ten minutes later, a car arrived, but the driver said he was there to take a party to LaGuardia. We had to wait a half hour in the lobby for our car.  

Worst hotel experience in many years. Not recommended, and we won’t return.

title: Nice hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay at this property. I had a wonderful check in process and was given a very nice room. As a platinum member, they gave me a voucher for a free drink at Opia, which I enjoyed. I also had breakfast there (had to talk business and the free lounge was crowded) and it was also nice. Will stay again as I love the location.

title: Nice hotel, unfortunately ruined by the staff
text:
My husband and I have been at the Renaissance Hotel last august: it is the perfect location to visit New York, central and close to the metro. 
Unfortunately, we have had a bad experience at the very beginning of our visit: as soon as we arrived at the hotel a member of the reception staff asked me to show a credit card, which I immediately gave him believing that he needed it only as a guarantee , since the hotel was supposed to be prepaid by our Italian travel agency. I found out, only checking on my messages from the bank, that he charged me for the whole amount of our staying, guarantee included, without saying a word, without even telling me how much he was going to charge my credit card for. 
I found it deeply annoying: lately, I found out that there had been a problem with the Italian travel agency payment, and that the room hadn't been prepaid as it was supposed to. Anyway, what I found deeply rude was that the guy didn't say a single word to me, not even the price I had to pay for!!! 
And it has been the only time that it happened to me, in a travel of 21 days throughout the USA, in which we have been in plenty of hotels, restaurants, and touristic places of any kind.

title: Nice hotel close to Central Park
text: Central park is very close by. I took an advantage of it and had my morning runs in a very nice surroundings. My Room was fairly small but the setup was excellent and I didn't have any problems regarding the footprint. Great service, clean room. This was a business trip and the location was excellent - just walked to the meetings. Manhattan is a large area of course. Metro is within walking distance. There are several great restaurants in the vicinity as well as fast food places. The gym is well equipped and was not crowded at all at the times I used it. Breakfast at the restaurant located in the same was building was expensive. Would stay again for business, probably not for holiday stay.

title: Incredibly Small Room
text: I was in NYC in April and spent 7 days in 2 mid-range price boutique hotels and they both had spacious rooms, and were quiet. Apparently I was spoiled. I spent 4 nights at the Renaissance. Now I am not a big person, 140 lbs and 5ft 9in. I found the room incredibly small. The bed dominated the room, and it was hard to get around. There was very little cupboard space....I had to hang some of my suits around the room. Only a small desk with a chair to sit at. And it was noisy....even though I was on the 12th floor. I overlooked the street and there was traffic and construction noise all day long. I guess if you are considering a room in this hotel ask about room size and location if city noises bother you. I normally live in a rural setting...maybe I am over sensitive,

title: Decent hotel with lovely staff....if you can get it at a price.
text:
The hotel has a excellent midtown east side location and the rooms are decent sized. There's a good sized desk with plenty of outlets. The entire staff is extremely friendly and very helpful if there is anything one needs. The bathrooms are very comfortable and have decent towels and plenty of shelf space, although there is no makeup lighting or magnifying mirrors. 

On the downside though, the rooms have long since seen better days. Furniture is banged up and some of it shabby, carpets are worn, the pillows are cheap, uncomfortable and not down, and the mattresses are uncomfortable. There are no mini-fridges in the rooms and no robes (although they will put either in the room upon request). There is not enough water pressure in the bathrooms to wash long hair. I finally started going the hairdresser next door for shampoos which was a pricey addition to the cost of the hotel room. There's also no room service. 

All of that would be ok though for short term stays at a reasonable price. The price fluctuates by day though so sometimes my rate was in the high $200s, and some nights it was up in the mid $400s. In the more reasonable price range it's a very decent and pleasant stay. In the $400 range though it's wildly overpriced. 

In spite of the drawbacks, I had a lovely stay there and would consider staying again.

title: Danielle Machado - Bellman
text: Danielle Machado is the bellman at the Renaissance and he is amazing.  One person can make such a difference in your experience and Danielle did that for me.  He was the bright light overtime I came and left the hotel  He was very helpful with any request I had.  What a difference such a positive attitude brings to a guest.  Danielle is a 10

title: Muy comodo
text:
El hotel moderno, cómodo, bien ubicado.
La habitación es de buen tamaño para ser Nueva York. La decoración moderna y acogedora.
Buena limpieza.
La ubicación excelente ya sea para caminar la ciudad o tomar el metro.

title: Clean!
text:
This hotel is clean! The hotel staff was friendly. Okasana  and Sarg were fantastic. Bellmen were lovely.
 I stayed on the 10th floor and had no issue with lobby(2nd) floor noise. It was Halloween weekend and there were parties and there was NO issue. The double bed room is small but efficient.  Did I mention the room was CLEAN.  One night stand attached to the wall was loose(from the wall, so it slanted down) annoying but not horrible. The location is great close to lots of shopping. Small expensive local shops and high end department store along w/ regular department stores ie. Zara and H&M. Walking distance to subways and the surrounding areas are very clean(-garbage on streets for pick up) no alley ways.  Short walk to central park. I had a great lunch at the Palace next door and a Saturday brunch at Eastpole(a few blocks away.) Lots of local residents/and business people. Great stay will definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Small space in great location
text:
Yes, the rooms are micro, and, yes, you might hear NEW YORK CITY (the one that never sleeps, remember) outside. But, you also must remember this place is billed as a boutique hotel and in my many experiences with "boutique" hotels, this one lives up to its category. 

Few gripes: no "in room dining" option. No hotel book in our room. Called housekeeping but they never answered. Not sure of any "opening" times as there's nothing helpful in the room. Dark, dark rooms. Need more lights in entryway and maybe one more bedside table.

But the price is right for this location. Bar/lounge/restaurant is cute; an Ommegang only cost $9 - a "steal" compared to the $12 I paid for a Stella pint at the Hilton half a mile away.

title: Beautiful and convenient
text: This was my first time in NYC and I wanted to make sure that I was in a central place. My boyfriend had been to NYC many times and said that this one was in the best location. He did a great job. The rooms were nice and spacious and the room was super clean everytime we came in from our day of exploration.

title: Fantastic stay!
text:
I stayed here for business last month. Everything about the hotel is top-rate. The room was clean and nicely laid out. It's small, like all NYC hotel rooms, but it felt much larger than it was with ample storage space for luggage and a big bathroom. 

The bar/restaurant was great, as was the adjacent "business center," which was a large, quiet and inviting space for working, and even had a coffee maker! 

The staff is exceptional--helpful with every request. I'm heading back in the spring for a long weekend, and already book Renaissance New York Hotel 57.

title: Not Recommended for Business Travel
text: This hotel is not business friendly. The lobby was very dark and there was no space to work with a coworker. The "business center" was the size of a closet and charges you not only for each page you print but also every like 15 seconds that you use the computer. The rooms were very small but fine. I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel's restaurant. The breakfast menu is very overpriced, and the service was poor. The restaurant was almost empty and yet we had to keep flagging someone down to help us. I have chosen a different hotel for my next business trip to New York.

title: Overall, very nice classic NYC hotel. Excellent staff at every level.
text: We did a weekend stay that had to turn into a one night stay because of family health issues. The people in reservations were very understanding and helpful with our changes. The room was tastefully decorated and comfortable, though a bit small. We were going to take a cat nap before our night out in the city, but that proved impossible because of the Salsa competition in the ballroom below us - though this was hardly at a late hour, so I will not complain - it was over for the time we did retire for the evening. Valet staff - excellent! Parking is more pricier than I thought it would be though - that was an ouch. Bar staff, very friendly and create a very fun environment. Exceptional service from housekeeping - I needed help trying to figure out which train to take to get to the theater, and they not only took plenty of time to make sure we knew exactly where to go, they even gave me their card for the train. Our overall experience here was very good, but rather more pricey than I am used to. I would have given this a three star, if it weren't for the exceptional quality of the service here, from every single staff person we encountered. My hat is off to the manager of this hotel for an extremely professional staff!

title: Not good!
text:
I could go on for pages about how this place could be improved but if the management of such a chain continue to let this place stagnate, what can I do?

Booked in to this hotel for our first stay in NYC. Paid about a grand extra to be able to experience a New York City terrace view.  They say a picture says a thousand words so I'll let the image explain why we were so furious.

We took another room instead but were unable to get a refund.

The best the management could do was give us one bar voucher each (only good for house wine or draft beer).

Breakfast consisted of a self serve counter with a choice of waffles or toast. No option for a freshly cooked breakfast.

After checking out a day early and complaining to the management about the horrendous experience, I was offered a discounted room rate during my next stay... Clearly not hospitality professionals...

title: Perfect Location for me
text: The hotel is a little older and not as chic as some of the more expensive hotels in NYC. But for me, the location was four blocks from my family which was my main goal. I wanted to walk as much as possible. My 'Cozy Room' with one double bed was just right for one but I'm not sure it would work for a couple. The desk area was ideal for work and the bathroom was spacious, bright and lovely. Every member of the staff that I encountered was WONDERFUL! My check in process with Oskana was easy and quick. My 2am early morning chats with William were fun and when it was time to depart, Bill helped by weighing my bags and calling a car for me. They were all very kind, genuine and helpful. These are the people who make NYC such a lovely place to visit. This hotel will be my first choice from now on.

title: Tiny
text: If you are traveling alone this hotel might work for you. However if you try to fit 2 people into these tiny rooms it's not pleasant. Smallest hotel room I've ever seen. And not cheaper because of it. No fridge in room. One sink. One foot of counter space. Very cramped. I have friends who have stayed in New York several times and they also agree that these rooms are smaller than other New York hotels.

title: Are you kidding me?
text:
Reading the reviews here and seeing the pictutes before I booked this hotel for one night, I thought I was booking a very nice hotel.

Upon entering the hotel, I knew I was duped. The front desk was in a small area, covered on one side with drapes from another era. I was upgraded to a Junior Suite because of my gold status. To get to the room you need to take an elevator to the lobby, and then from the lobby to our room. The elevators are old, and although clean do not provide a 4 star feeling. The junior suite was o.k., but the last time the room furniture was updated was in the late 1990's. The paint job was from 2008, per the hotel's website. 

If you are looking for a 3 stars hotel, this is a good one, in nice location. But if you are looking for a 4 stars hotel, that's not the place to stay.

title: Poor Customer Service Experience
text: I stayed at this hotel last week.  The room above mine had a leaky toilet or sink that completely flooded the room and leaked into my room.  None of my property was damaged and I was moved to another room.  But the hotel management never contacted me to apologize for the situation or inconvenience.  If having water pouring from above head and into your clothes closet does not warrant outreach, I wonder what would at this hotel.  Extremely poor customer experience management not in keeping with Marriott's service principles.

title: Hyvä sijainti
text: Tänne on helppo tulla JFKltä ja täältä on helppo lähtee kylille. Kulmilta löytyy kaikki oleellinen pitkään vkl lomaan. Toki aina on syytä varautua hyvillä kengillä, koska jalkaisin NY tulee parhaiten koettua. Hotelli oli siisti ja kaikki toimi moitteettomasti. Pesuhuone oli kaiketi uusittu melko vähän aikaa sitten ja huone oli muutenkin siisti kaikilta osin. Ainoa negatiivinen asia oli ilmastointi, joka oli äänekäs ja heikko säädöiltään. Vaikka kuinka koitti saada huoneen lämpimäksi niin ilmastointilaite ei siihen taipunut :(

title: Una buena eleccion
text: Estuve hospedada con mis papás. Es un buen hotel, muy bien ubicado, cerca a todo, al Empire State, Central Park, Time Square, etc, puedes conocer mucho caminando, habitaciones muy confortables y un trato amable de parte de los conserjes y maleteros. Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: disappointed in our stay
text: We are Gold Elite members and stayed for two nights from October 10 to October 12, 2016.  Upon checking in, we never were invited to use and enjoy the Elite room for breakfast and refreshments throughout our stay.  Friends have stayed recently and enjoyed this.We were not made aware that this benefit was available to us.  Also,upon returning to our room around 3pm on October 11, our room had not been cleaned.  We make three calls over the next hour with no response.  I asked to have a manager call me and no one called.  Also, we were placed in a room that had loud contruction noise just outside our window during the day.  We were not informed of this problem ahead of time and were not offered a replacement room.  We are very disappointed in the service and stay and would like to hear from the manager to address this issue.  thank you

title: Great location and hotel
text:
We stayed 3 nights at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 in October, 2016.  The hotel was in a great location, was comfortable and well-maintained, and more than served our needs for our 3 day weekend in New York.

We arrived around 9:00 at night and were quickly checked in.  The check-in set up is a little odd in that the front desk is on the ground level of the hotel, but you need to take an elevator up to the lobby, and then transfer to another elevator to get to the guest rooms.  Our room was probably the largest we've seen in New York.  There was plenty of room to move around, which is not always the case, and there were two large closets, one with hangers and one with shelves, for clothes storage.  In addition to the bed, there was a small night table and a desk that was built into the wall.  Like the room, the bathroom was large and offered ample counter and shelf space.  One complaint about the bathroom is that much of the wall between it and the rest of the room was translucent glass.  While this gives a nice effect during the day, it leads to waking anyone else in the room up if the bathroom is used at night.  The climate control system in the room seems to run either a little too cool or too warm, but worked well enough on a pleasant fall weekend.  The room's soundproofing could be better.  We could easliy hear doors slamming in the hallway and people walking around.  That being said, very little street noise made its way through and we were easily able to sleep through the night.  The hotel does have a restaurant/bar, fitness center, and business center, but we didn't use any of those.

The hotel's location is great.  There are 3 subway stations within an easy walk (59th and Lexington, 63rd and Lexington, and 51st and Lexington).  From these, we were able to get anywhere we wanted to go in Manhattan and Brooklyn with a maximum of one transfer.  The theater district and Central Park are both a pleasant 20 minute walk away.  There aren't a ton of food and drink options in the area, but with so much within easy reach, it really wasn't an issue.  

The staff at the hotel were universally friendly and helpful.  When I called about an issue with our climate control, the engineer was up in fewer than 5 minutes.  The front desk and bell staff were also constantly asking about our stay and what they could do to make it better.

With its combination of location, cleanliness, and comfort, we found this to be a perfect hotel for our 3 day weekend and we would happily stay there again when we return to New York.

title: Very pleased
text: Our room had been recently renovated. Good lights and counter space in the bathroom! Bed was comfy, closets nice. We did hear that our friends' room, not yet remodeled, was not as good. Staff was friendly. The restaurant, not run by the hotel, is overpriced and underwhelming.

title: We had a wonderful stay!!
text: We stayed here in order to be close to family that lives on the UES and to attend the US Open.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We truly enjoyed dining at the onsite restaurant, they were so welcoming to our late night group including two small children.  We upgraded to a suite in order to have a pull out couch.  We didn't clarify when making reservations but we thought we were getting two separate rooms but that wasn't the case and we just dealt with it.  We even had a balcony which was awesome (and scary!)!  We used uber to get everywhere so we didn't walk around much but could tell that there was lots of shopping right outside our door.  The location seemed to be excellent.  We'd definitely stay here again!

title: Hotel in Manhattan
text: Great central location. Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, and 5th Avenue. My room was lovely and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The bar is on the second floor is nice. Breakfast for Elite members was complementary, basic but good.

title: Excellent location.
text:
Excellent location, friendly staff and great amenities. With that being said, below are some things you have to remember when staying in Manhattan, which will help manage expectations:
1. Noise level. Typically, if your preference is to stay in walking distance to most attractions, the place will be noisy, unless you get to highest floors. I think above 20 or so is where it gets better. If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs, choose a hotel with soundproof rooms, or a hotel on a quiet street - yes, those do exist in NYC! :)
2. Room size. Manhattan is a densely populated area, and most "standard" level rooms will be VERY small and basic. I stayed in Superior room, and it was great.
3. Room service. Quite a few nice hotels do not offer that, and encourage you to use their restaurant instead. While somewhat of an inconvenience, i imagine it helps with pest control issues. This hotel does not offer a room service, but does have a decent restaurant downstairs. They also have excellent espresso machine there.
4. These guys have two elevators. First one takes you from reception area to the lobby, second from the lobby to your room. Not ideal, but I have seen it more than once in New York. It has to do with limited space. I personally took stairs up to the lobby during my stay.
5. If you call uber or Lyft, make sure you are already downstairs. Doormen typically have their own car service handy, and get paid on that. In most cases when there is no parking or waiting area upfront, they will not allow the driver to wait. That's relatively common too.
6. NYC hotels have A LOT of people going through annually.  Expect minor wear and tear in most mid-range hotels, unless the place just re-opened after renovation. I stayed at the Hilton Midown just a few months ago, and it was borderline gross for a superior room at about the same price i paid at the Renaissance. This hotel was superb in comparison.
Lastly, there was scaffolding outside the building, I'm not sure how long it will stay there. Minor inconvenience, as if you don't know exactly where the hotel is (closer to Lexington Ave) you may miss it. I have been there before, so it was not an issue for me, but my driver did get confused.
Overall I highly recommend this place, and would stay there again.

title: Great location...
text:
The hotel location is great.. but is Manhattan so small rooms, loads of noise and a bit overpriced for this type of hotel.
On the other hand , location is great !! Plenty of shops restaurants and bars at your door step.
If you find a website with good hotel deals this is the one to go for.

title: Good well located hotel
text: Good hotel, short walk to 5th ave, perfectly located for shopping and sightseeing, however because of its location it is also a bit noisy but one cannot have everything, if you are in Manhattan it's bound to be noisy.  Clean, good facilities, great staff, ample bathrooms,  very comfortable beds. Not the cheapest but the ratio quality/location/price is definitely worth it.

title: Take advantage of great rates while the hotel slowly dies
text:
Make no mistake - this is a good choice for NYC. Also do not mistake the great rates on offer for a promo - the hotel is trading at discounted rates vs. other full-service properties because it shows all signs of a slow death and is not on par.

What the hotel has going for it is the absolutely great location at the corner of 57th and Lexington, which makes all your Midtown business and attractions walking distance. Couple this with rates few can match and you have a winner for a quick business trip when you'd rather spend your free time enjoying Manhattan than patronizing Uber (or the subway).

The ugly side of the truth about the hotel is that it was built in 1923 and now sits on a slightly forgotten block for which "chopping" is the first immediate association. It has small windows, corridors out of a horror movie, rooms facing nothing but solid brick walls and the building appears to be under "renovation" which upon closer inspection looks more like preparations for demolition.

The rooms are small by American standards but absolutely sufficient, with enough room to unpack for a few days, work and unwind at single occupancy. The work desk and premium chair helped me do my daily emails in comfort and the ample electric outlets (including the radio clock with USB outlet) set an example to many hotel rooms I've seen.

The bed is really comfortable and is absolutely fit for a Marriott property. The little closet is both stylish, cute and practical. The bathroom is quite large compared to the room, but the baths and showers miss out on handsets, leaving you at the mercy of the fixed shower head. Oh, and you cannot regulate water pressure, just the temperature. And they say British bathroom mountings are impractical and weird.

Renaissance makes sure guests will not pilfer extra amounts of bathroom toiletries by providing premium-branded yet absolutely unspectacular amenities, including large bars of brown soap (which housekeeping kept piling in my bathroom for some reason during my stay).

Rooms have a coffeemaker - but not an espresso machine, but rather a drip one making the usual American brownish liquid, incidentally very similar to how tap water looked in my tub every morning. For some reason they had only coffee and no tea bags for the percolator machine.

The entire room looked quite tired, even if apparently renovated in this millennium, and the air conditioning had effectively one mode - NOISY. It did a good job of quickly cooling the room and stirring the stale air inside, as the windows do not really open. Despite facing a large intersection, my room was very quiet (once I turned off the air conditioning). There are some noisy live events on the lobby floor on some nights though.

The two-level lobby and restaurant are very stylish and add the much-needed 1920s flair and some modern feel to the tired hotel, yet are extremely small. For some reason, the tired elevators seem to have a life of their own. The top-level terrace is officially closed, but one can get out on it and take some of the best photos in NYC. 

Service was friendly and efficient at all times and that was just what I needed. Marriott Rewards members, even with no status or stays to their account, get free "basic" WiFi, which is more than enough even for YouTube or music streaming. Make sure to book directly with Marriott as they pretty much always have the lowest rate - and you get points you can now transfer to SPG!

The on-site restaurant deserves a separate review, but basically most Marriott rates do not include breakfast and you will serve yourself well having it offsite.

title: Buena ubicación y buen descanso
text:
Hotel cómodo, muy bien ubicado, céntrico, cerca de importantes puntos de interes.
Personal amable, con buena atención al cliente, buen servicio de habitaciones.
Buena relación calidad-precio para como estan los precios por la zona.

title: Minimalist and awesome
text: What an awesome hotel. Save for its price, the minimalist take on hospitality is quite refreshing. Everything is hidden until you need it, the bathroom sink is ingenious and the entire place sort of traps you in, giving you an escape from NYC. The bar and restaurant downstairs also has great food and smooth jazz music. The staff is super friendly and I love that they have a lobby, as well as a main floor, something that most of New York's restaurants are starting to adopt recently. I'll definitely look to staying here again soon.

title: Perfectly located in NewYork.
text:
This amazing hotel is where we need to be in New York for business and pleasure as well. 

Has a great bar and disco right in the hotel.  

The rooms are fantastic.  

The beautiful atmosphere that you breath in there is fantastic

title: Contemporary Hotel that Looks Dated
text: I stayed at this hotel several years ago and thought the contemporary look was chic - now it looks very tired. It used to have a cool rooftop terrace - it is now a storage area. One of the cool things is that they used to have a cappuccino/espresso machine for the executive lounge available for members to use anytime. It is on its last leg and now is only available for breakfast. Time for a facelift.

title: Good Location, Odd Layout, Interesting interior
text:
I had the opportunity to stay one evening at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57. It was a great, and central location for an event I was attending in Manhattan. Still the layout of the hotel, with the small reception area that required you to take the stairs or the elevator to get to the equivalent of a lobby level was quite odd. The decor was dark and felt dated, but it was eclectic. In addition, the overall layout of the hotel itself was counterintuitive. Still, I was only staying one night, so it was fine. I would have been disappointed had I planned to stay multiple nights. 

The rooms were quite small and dated. You expect that in New York, but I actually expected more from the write up and reviews I checked prior to my arrival. It was a good hour or more with traffic to JFK. No shuttles or transports are provided in kind.

The staff was friendly and I did enjoy dinner at the restaurant in the hotel with some colleagues in the evening. I doubt I'll stay at the hotel again, but for a one night stay on business it fit the bill.

title: Good location
text: Good location in the heart of NYC. Rooms are large and have a coffe machine, safe and iron. Bathroom had a huge bathtub. Only thing bas about this hotel is the Internet connection does not work (lan), and they charge 17 dollars a day for WIFI. WIFI is a basic service that should not cost extra!

title: Good location but slightly miserable hotel
text:
This hotel should be good.  It's in a great location and the overall size and layout of the hotel should make it a good place to stay, but the rooms are really quite ordinary with no "special" touches to make you feel like a valued guest.

I was particularly disappointed by the lack of a room minibar, which combined with the inability of the hotel to serve a cold drink (other than water) in the middle of the afternoon - no bar, no hotel shop, no room service - made it a depressing experience.  Breakfast was nice, but not cheap.

I think there are better places to stay in NYC and I won't be bothering with here again.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text:
Having stayed on the Upper East Side when I was living in NYC in the late 2000s, I gravitate towards staying in a hotel on the east side each time I return to the city. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. The hotel is situated right opposite a SAKS off 5th which had amazing deals! Then a short walk away, you have Bloomingdales (which also houses the famous magnolia bakery), Urban Outfitters, Dylan's candy store, NY & Co., Zara, H&M, VS, Serendipity etc! It's pretty much a self contained shopping district. Then you have the 59th and Lex subway station which is perfect since the 4,5,6 trains take you straight downtown to Union Square, Fulton Street (WTC) etc and also the NRQ trains which take you right to Times Square. It'd also be convenient for those working midtown, either east or west.

The hotel staff were very friendly and the restaurant in the hotel serves up some decent food. The room was pretty generous in size with large closets, which fit my large suitcase flat on the ground (useful so that you don't go bumping into your luggage on the floor of your room). The toilet was clean with good amenities. I was also fortunate that there was some view from the window in my room. I spent 3 nights in the hotel and slept really well, the comforter/duvet provided cloud-like comfort =)

I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

title: Most Friendly People and a Great Location
text: One thing you should know, is that this hotel used to be an apartment building so all rooms are different some are very small and some are even two floors. The rooms are very nicely furnished and decorated. There was great natural light and great views. Also, In the summer there is a nice rooftop resturaunt. This hotel also has a great location. I felt that I was in the middle of everything. If I needed a restaurant, bank, souvenir shop, Dunkin Donuts, pharmacy, there always seemed to be one less than a three minute walk away. The most important, at least to me, was the people. The people at this hotel were some of the nicest people I have every meet especially all of the doormen here. Overall, my stay was great.

title: Nice Stay
text: The room/suite we had was spacious, especially by NYC standards.  Maybe because we were on the 13th floor, we did not hear a lot of sirens or other traffic noise compared to other hotels.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The location was close to the park and museums.  The breakfast was good.

title: Depressing Experience - Sort of like staying in a jail cell.
text:
So when you stay in New York, you expect small rooms, but in this case it was absolutely tiny.  I was only here for one night (thank god) and that was more than enough. 

Room: 
Small, but actually smart design in terms of layout. The problem is the furniture is really old and cheap. They had plastic chairs!  The bed was hard as a rock and uncomfortable with two pillows that were flat.  The walls are concrete and you can see it clearly, feels like a jail cell. 

Bathroom:
Interesting and good if you are an exhibitionist as its all glass so everyone in the room can see everything you do. By yourself, its fine, but if you are with someone, its a little awkward. 

Food:
We ordered room service and they absolutely messed up the entire order. First of all it was bizarre that it was delivered in a pizza box with wooden utensils.
