I get the green movement, but wow that was challenging.  They literally got none of the meal right, we ordered bagels and got donuts and ordered coffee, which came ice cold and no cream. The eggs were made the night before by the skin on them. 

Overall;
One of the most depressing places I've stayed in New York and probably anywhere actually. Will never go back.

title: Bell captain
text: We would like to compliment Pernell, the hotel bell captain.  He was super helpful and advised us on getting around town.  Hotel needs updating, but the service/employees were all very nice.  Good location and easy walk to Central Park, etc.  BLT Steakhouse nearby was excellent for dinner, and the Palace next door serves a great breakfast.

title: In a nice location
text:
The rooms are nice the breakfast is good

The location of the hotel in midtown is perfect for shopping and night life

The decoration of the hotel looks strange at first
Good value for money considering the location

title: Top-notch service in historic building - near Bill Cunningham's street!
text: We spent 4 nights at the Renaissance Hotel (after switching from a not-so-nice hotel in Hell's Kitchen).  What a relief!  To begin, the staff at reception were very kind & helpful - Especially Kim Ng and the doorman, who had the perfect touch and made me laugh!  The location is top-notch!  So close to Central Park, the MOMA and the Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall.  We were upgraded to a room with a balcony, which was so exciting!  The place was spotless and modern.  And they went the extra mile to make my husband's birthday extra special!  What a warm, people-friendly place!  We would love to go back!

title: Awesome time at the Renaissance 57!
text: I visited the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 last week. I visited for 6 nights and Lucy Cox on reception and her team went above and beyond to cater to me while I was there. I felt like family, coming home. The rooms were very clean with big modern bathrooms, great views and most of all a terrific, central location which meant as a single female I could walk everywhere safely. A huge thank you to all the team at the Renaissance. I will be coming back again soon!!

title: Honeymoon & Breast Cancer Walk
text: Upgraded us to a balcony room, every single person was so nice.  The lady that checked us in (Lucy?) was genuine and so great.  We had 4 rooms in our party and she was so patient helping us.  The doorman that brought our luggage was awesome...awesome...awesome.  Friendly, went out of his way and such an outgoing personality.  Thank you.

title: Location not great
text: We visited here as the first part of our honeymoon for 4 nights from 30th August until 3rd September. Firstly the rooms are very small, the bed isn't even a double and we literally has nowhere to put 2 large suitcases and one ended up in the bathroom.. I did know hotel rooms in NY were small, but considering how much they charge I did expect to be able to fit a suitcase on the ground. Secondly, if you want near Central Park this hotel is only a 5 min walk away, as a young couple wanting some buzz at night, we had to walk about 20 mins into Times Square daily. Hotel was clean and basic but for the money we paid, I think you could get much better.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Bell'hotel sulla 57 e Lexington. Struttura vecchia con tipici mattoni a vista, ben ristrutturato con stanze ampie (superior), pulite con comodo letto king. Personale molto disponibile, prezzo adeguato alla struttura e alla posizione.

title: Great Staff at Hotel 57
text: I have been staying at this hotel in NYC for over 5 years.  What a great staff!  The guys at the front door are always there to help and the staff at the front desk is always willing to above and beyond to help.  My favorite is Maggie in the Lounge.  It is great to see her every morning.  She is the best!  Very helpful and always makes sure I feel at home!

title: Concierge Lounge
text: This hotel didn't make me feel like I'm an Elite member of Marriott.  Their concierge lounge is only available from M-F, 5:00 p.m to 7:00 p.m. with only limited snacks like chips or M&M. despite what I was originally told that during their available hours, only water & chips were offered to me.  & no sodas were available which I found odd because the next morning at breakfast, one of the guests was able to get a can of coke from the staff.  I was also not impressed that they put me in a room with renovation going on above me that the drilling & hammering were going on starting from 8:00 am in the morning through 4:00 pm weekdays.  Had they mentioned it to me prior to my confirmation the booking, I'd have avoided this hotel completely.  Not that I'd want to return to this hotel ever again.

title: Dejligt, rent og centralt
text:
Vi boede på 9. sal i et hjørneværelse til to personer, stort og rummeligt og med træpaneler overalt. Badeværelset var lækkert med produkter fra Aveda og rigeligt med bløde og friske håndklæder hver dag.

Værelset var booket via Hotels.com.

Der er strygejern og kaffeautomat og safe på værelset, men af en eller anden grund er der intet "Hotel Directory" - oversigt over hotellets faciliteter, fitness, restauranter osv. Af samme grund anvendte vi ikke nogle af faciliteterne, da vi ikke kunne danne os et overblik over priserne i ro og mag.

Receptionen var behjælpelig med at låne os adapters, da ingen af kontakterne modtog europæiske stik. Og i det hele taget var alt det personale, vi mødte, søde og hjælpsomme. Ingen klager dér. Wifi fungerede fint.

Der bliver spillet høj popmusik i foyeren og uden for hotellet, hvilket virker lidt mærkeligt for et "pænere" hotel. Baren og restauranten på stedet virker cool men vi var jo ikke i NY for at sidde på hotellet.

Beliggenheden er fantastisk, kun 700 meter fra Central Park, hvor vi brugte meget tid på at løbe og bare hænge ud. Området er fredeligt om aftenen, men selvfølgelig ikke stille.

Vil ikke have noget imod at bo der igen en anden gang, for selv om det ikke er fantastisk luksus, så er her rent og pænt og alting fungerer.

title: Great Modern Hotel to stay
text: Great location excellent customer service provided by Serge Lambert at the check in Made feel Like Marriott Platinum member is honored and respected in this hotel. Manila Raofi provided great customer service solving a issue. Management of the property has hired great staff. Hope to visit soon on New York and sure to stay on this property.

title: Quiet little hotel
text: We stayed here for 3 nights over the Labour Day weekend! The rooms are small but the beds are comfy! Most importantly the rooms are clean! The air conditioner is loud and b!asts directly on you due to it being positioned next to the bed! We had to shut it off! My only MAJOR complaint is that they do not service their lobby washroom! There was no soap in the dispenser Friday when we checked in and the Monday we checked out! That is disgusting! I took my own soap in on Monday! Also most stalls had no toilet paper. I know it's  long weekend but come on guys good sanitation is important!

title: EL HOTEL CON EL MEJOR CALOR HUMANO
text:
Llegue una noche de invierno del año 2013, sin conocer New York, sin amigos o conocidos allí, venia de Washington D.C, de reuniones de negocios y quise conocer la Capital del Mundo, viaje en bus y me quede en la esquina del Madison Square Garden, inmediatamente vi un hotel astronomicamente grande y creí que ese seria mi sitio de alojamiento. Esa noche estaba lloviendo copiosamente en New York, por lo cual inmediatamente procedí a hacer mi reservación en dicho hotel (cuyo nombre me reservo), tan pronto entre a la habitación, me arrepentí, pues fui recibido por dos tremendas ratas, allí me di cuenta de la característica principal por la cual jamás me alojaría allí. Sin saber inglés, cogí afanosamente mis maletas y salí corriendo de dicho hotel, asqueado por las alimañas que allí deambulaban. Sin saber hacia donde dirigirme, un  taxi manejado por un Hindú, me llevo al mejor sitio al que podría llegar en New York.... El Renaissance New York Hotel 57.
Aquella noche, tan pronto entre al hotel, el calor del hotel me inundó, aquella noche de 10 grados bajo cero cambió de repente y un calor tropical entro a mi cuerpo. Después la habitación, la atención del personal, la alimentación, la cama mullida y confortable me permitieron dormir 13 horas continuas. Pero ahí no termino todo. Al día siguiente, me lleve la sorpresa de que estaba a tan solo un par de cuadras del Central Park, de la Catedral de San Patrick, de la 5 Avenida, de la Torre Rockefeller. En fin, Lo que iba a ser una estadía de tres días, se convirtió en una maravillosa experiencia de 15 días, y a pesar de los altos costos de la zona, el hotel me pareció super económico a pesar de su lujo y confort. Por lo cual no dudo en recomendarlo ampliamente para todos aquellos visitantes que no conozcan la ciudad o el idioma.

title: Excellent Staff at Check In
text: Lucy Cox was very attentive when we came in at the hotel.  She cared about about our trip coming into New York and gave us suggestions on what to do while in New York.  It made a memorable impression. Happy with the service

title: Throwback to the NYC Hotels of Yore
text:
Yes, this is a New York City hotel which means space is limited. But Hotel 57 is perfect for travelers like me who does not spread out their belongings everywhere or spend much time in the hotel room.

For these reasons, I chose the Cozy Room. I was traveling solo for a full work week in late August, and I didn't mind having a clean, comfortable full-sized bed. There was more than enough room in the closet for my clothes and suitcase. And there was even a shelf in the modernized bathroom for my toiletries. And, as standard with Renaissance, there were Aveda products to keep me fresh.

The staff are wonderfully attentive, taking care of dry-cleaning and providing an umbrella without me having to ask. Housekeeping did a wonderful job each day. And the bar/lounge area was great for an evening nightcap. 

Sure, this hotel is a throwback in size and layout, but it has a great retro decor and a top-notch staff that made it a very comfortably stay for five days. 

In short, I'd book it again.

title: Very nice late summer weekend in NY
text: Very good experience overall. Check in was very easy the room for NY standards was very large with a king bed and couch! Lots of storage. The hotel is in a historic building and is not a luxury hotel yet very nice. We were disappointed the roof top seating area was not open. It was in a great location.

title: ルネッサンスにしては古い感じのホテル
text: セントラルパークから南に徒歩5分くらいで、好立地のホテル。地下鉄の駅にも2ブロック程度で行けるので便利。ただ、このブランドはモダンな感じのホテルが多いのに特に部屋の老朽化が激しくて残念。日曜日はエグゼクティブラウンジも開いていないので、注意。

title: Nice hotel and Superior Staff
text: I have the need to stay in nyc often and when I do, I find myself coming back to this property time and time again.   While the property is in need of a redo, one is planned very soon, the rooms are comfortable and quiet, the location is a good one, and the staff makes me feel like I am an honored guest.  The front door valets address me  with warmth and respect.  The front desk personell  remember me by name, bring a warm smile, and oftentimes find an upgraded room for this weary traveler.  But, the person who brings this property to life for me is Maggie in the Concierge Lounge at Breakfast.  Of all the Marriott properties I stay at in my travels, all of the wonderful Marriott employees I come into contact with, none of them reach the pinnacle like Maggie does.

title: Nice Hotel and GREAT staff!
text: Came in for 1 night, Lucy at the front desk was awesome....went out of her way to make sure I liked my room!  The design and feel of the hotel is comforting and modern.  External renovations don't seem to interfere with the operations.

title: Booked Superior Room and stayed on Standard Room
text: Hotel stay had no troubles except that I found the room small, room 714, and complained that my reservation and payment was on a Superior room, but they said that I was on the Superior room. When I got back home, looked up on the hotel website and found that I stayed on the regular classic Standard Room, and no discount was given.

title: A Marriott property competing with the Kimpton Model...who knew!
text:
We had a weekend trip to NYC with no plans for a broadway show so we decided to go off the "tourist" path and ended up a Renaissance NY Hotel 57. We pre-paid so the price was very reasonable for NYC.

The club level was on the 2nd floor (across from the restaurant). Even though it wasn't open on the weekend, besides receiving 1000 points for the inconvenience the room was open for all the water you can drink. With the brutal weather we have been having this was a great benefit and well thought out by the property.

The guest room was ultra modern with every corner configured for use. Even though the room was smaller than a cruise ship cabin, the set up was so efficient that you didn't feel crowed at all.

The staff was very pleasant and a joy to interact with them.

title: New Eco Friendly
text:
I stay at 50 - 100 Marriott hotels per year for the past 20 years and this hotel is one of the finest Marriott properties I had the pleasure to experience.  The hotel is in a perfect midtown location - close to three subway lines so you can get anyplace quickly.  Was check-in we were greeted by a very friendly staff, and even had a chance to chat briefly with the very pleasant manager.  Being a platinum member, the staff treated me like a VIP and I didn't have to ask or grovel for a nice, high level room with a wow view.  The room was large and very clean.  Great bathroom.  

The concierge room was better than most with many upgrades like Pellegrino water and sodas, and cartons of water versus plastic (great environmental statement). The Lounge is closed on weekends so they provided a $60 voucher each weekend day for breakfast at the rooftop restaurant located in the hotel.. And the restaurant by the way has excellent food and very friendly staff.

title: Wonderful weekend in NYC Thanks to Renaissance 57!
text:
My boyfriend and I took a trip to NYC for our 3rd year anniversary. We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel 57 for two nights. We had unbelievable service from the navigator Carla. She helped us find amazing restaurants, booked our reservations, and even surprised us with a bottle of champagne and rose petals on our bed (see pic). We really wanna come back and stay there again as it was close to all of NY's hot spots! Room was clean and bed was comfy. Nice being able to watch Netflix on the tv. 

Sarah

title: Fantastic Staff, great location
text:
Our visit to NYC started off as a disaster. Our pre planned accommodation fell through and we forced to hot-wire something at the last minute (Which I am not a fan of having worked in the hotel industry as I know first hand how difficult those reservation can be for hotel staff). We arrived 30 minutes after making our booking and the reservation was not complete and Diana at the front desk looked after us splendidly. She adjusted our reservation, made sure we had the room we needed and gave us a drink to apologize for the wait.(even though not her fault) Her patience and kindness was as good as I've ever encountered in the industry and I couldn't be more thankful for it. As we had had a VERY trying day. 

The room was small but comfortable. The air con worked great, which seems like a given but when its 43C outside its a god send. rooms were well made everyday and the floor staff I encountered, friendly. Overall we were very impressed. 

I have been in this industry a long time and it's not often I take the time to write reviews. Diana made that stay for me and because of that I will stay there again. 

Kudos to her and your team.

title: Best staff in NYC
text: This is a boutique property with superb staff who go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable.  Granted the rooms are not the chicest in NYC yet they are comfortable and clean  The location is superb , and near the great shopping of the city.

title: It was okay
text:
Checking in was great, very friendly man checked me in.  My room's AC was not working and didn't have the time to deal with it because I had dinner reservations.  I took a shower, on the way out I told the front desk that it was not working.  

After dinner it was still hot.  I thought if I just sit and relax it will feel better. No, still too hot.  It was midnight and I was not going get any seep so I asked for a new room.  I got my new room and it was better.  My bed was comfortable, the windows have double glass, with that and the AC fan I didn't hear the outside noise.  

The hotel is old and getting tired, my problem was fixed with a new room.   The staff was typical Marriott's high quality.

title: Great Staff and Location
text:
Stayed here for just one night but wish it was longer. 

Our pleasant experience started with check in. The front desk attendant was very welcoming and friendly. Our room wasn't ready but she offered to call us when it was. We went off to lunch nearby and received a call shortly after that our room was ready. 

We were upgraded to a junior sweet on the 15th floor. The room had a lovely balcony on the Lexington Avenue side with wonderful views of the Citibank and Chrysler buildings. 

Unfortunately, the hotel does not have a direct elevator to the rooms from the first floor. You have to change on the second floor or take the stairs up to the guest room elevators. This is a minor inconvenience but may be more of a concern for those with mobility issues. 

The bellmen were friendly and helpful, though we did have to wait at times when there were several guests needing help with bags. 

The hotel's location was perfect for us. Lot's of restaurants nearby, close to the Lexington Ave subway line, easy cross town access. 

Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Full Size Beds are Sold As Queens
text: Just came back from a night stay. The room I book was a superior Queen. When I arrived the room wasn't available so the desk agent said it would be ready upon our return from our day. We came back to the hotel around 10:00pm and went to the room. After a long day of touring we were exhausted and went right to bed. Needless to say I didn't get a wink of sleep. The bed was a full size bed not a queen as booked. It was so small for two adults. I spoke to the housekeeping manager who told me they always have complaints in that room because it says it's a queen but clearly is not. He said he was going to see what he could do to make it up to us. We came back from breakfast and now the hotel manager got involved . He said that it's "their" queen!!! Not sure I understand what that means but I would think twice before staying here if bed size is important.

title: Wonderful service!
text: The staff here is amazing! They were helpful and kind. They kept our bags, ordered us a car and checked us in early, and always with a smile. The location of the hotel is within walking distance or a short subway or cab ride to most locations. People complain about the size of the room, but it was adequate. The reason to stay here is the staff, can't say enough about them.

title: Good, but...
text: We booked this hotel for five nights. We are a family of 3 and we opted for their larger room with 2 queen beds. The hotel is ideally located. Close to shops and touristic attractions while not right in the heart of it. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. The lobby is trendy. The room was clean. The beds very comfortable and the bedding was soft and nice. But the room tiself was not pleasant. It was dark (because of the design) and pretty small. Although we were not in New York to stay in the room all day long, we felt that the room was really too small for three people. So we only stayed one night. The management was understanding. I would recommend this hotel for business, friends or solo. More than 2 in a room is crowded.

title: Great Location - Walking Distance to Tourist Attractions
text:
Booked this property for a weekend of sightseeing in New York - we walked everywhere from this location: Empire State Building, Central Park, Times Square, subway/transit, restaurants, nightlife, theatres. Starbucks right across the street.  Walgreens and a pharmacy a few blocks down to buy sunscreen and last minute items. Did not take a cab once all weekend.

It was nearly 100 F all weekend but the air conditioning in the room, hotel and gym got us through (thank goodness).

Overall, the room was good - comfortable bed, small fridge, large bathroom with Aveda toiletries.  There was one small window in the room that basically faced another building so we had our blinds pulled the entire time for privacy reasons.  That said, we were out sightseeing morning until night so it didn't matter much.

Good hotel for its location!

title: Missing/Stolen items and management did nothing
text:
During my most recent stay, I had two different items go missing at my hotel. I won't go so far as accusing housekeeping of stealing, but some higher end toiletry items went missing on two separate nights and they were likely either taken or thrown away (and they clearly were not garbage).  

They had a retail value of $40, but it wasn't so much the dollar amount I lost, but how the hotel management clearly does not care to do anything about it. On two different occasions, I spoke to managers at the hotel and they all said the right things....that they were extremely sorry, that they would look into it, and get back to me and somehow make things right. It's been almost a month now and even after leaving voicemails, I still have heard nothing or gotten any resolution. 

I'm a lifetime Platinum Marriott member and in all my stays, I've never experienced items going missing like this or experienced management being so apathetic to trying to help resolve what I think should be something they are easily empowered to resolve. So if you care about your belongings, I'd recommend you stay elsewhere. 

In addition, I find their rooms to be extremely small, even for NYC standards and their concierge lounge has one of the worst breakfast spreads I've seen in any Marriott properties in the area (consists of runny scrambled eggs, bagels, and one waffle maker). 

There are plenty of other hotels in the area worth staying at that offer more value and do not create concern for your valuables.

title: Lost its charm - won’t stay again - here’s why…
text:
I have previous reviews on here giving this hotel a 4 and 5 rating, but sadly based on my latest stay, that’s changed big time.

My big beef is that this hotel no longer offers room service, which is a huge need for me on my business trips. There are often times I’m stuck in my room on calls for hours at a time, or I get in late and haven’t eaten, and it’s imperative I can order food to my room. 

Well, after years of staying here with very good room service, there now is NONE. How do i find out? When I call down at 6am before an early meeting and am told there is no more room service. They do have a lobby breakfast bar that starts at 7, but I had calls starting at 6:30 for a few hours so that did not help. I had to run outside in my sweatpants in the dark and wander the streets using my Starbucks app to find one that was open early with food. 

My room did not have a clock, and there was no robe which i thought they used to offer? (I may be wrong on that one… can’t remember.) The windowsill in my shower had not been cleaned and there was a black hair in the tub. (Not mine for sure.) 

And when I was ready to check out, i called down for help with my bags. I waited 10 minutes and no one came up. So i lugged my bag down and the bellman Pernell said no one told him I had called for help with bags. Honestly he is the only staff member there at this point that I feel goes above and beyond for the customers. He’s a gem and really cares. When my Uber did not come in a timely manner and i needed to get to the airport, he arranged a car asap. 

Side note: I found the restaurant had gone downhill since my last visit as well. :( But that's another story.

BOTTOM LINE: The reason i used to LOVE this hotel was for its personal experience and how they went over and above to take care of you. Now this feels like a cheaper version of what it used to be, because there’s no extra perks so WHY would you stay here when for the same room rates you can stay at a full service hotel? No reason. Great location and cool boutique vibe, but that's about it.

title: Very shabby
text: The service here is terrific, so friendly and nice.  But the rooms are quite simply awful.  I feel as if I am staying in a Holiday Inn, circa 1977.  The walls are paper thin and I can hear my neighbor's tv as if they are watching in the same room. The decor is outdated and terrible, the rug shabby, the curtain stained.  There is a wooden desk in the room and a bedside table and that's it.  I would NOT stay here again and am only giving it three stars for the excellent service.

title: Too hot to handle
text:
Check in was lengthy because they could not find my reservation but thank goodness I had a copy of the reservation. Desk clerks were apologetic. The hotel is a bit awkwardly designed, having to change lifts to get to the rooms. Another cosy room expensively priced but the location is great. Asked for a refrigerator, and could barely fit it anywhere. Opening my suitcase was a challenge, i.e. nowhere to put it. 
As a gold status member,  we are allowed a use of the "executive lounge" in this case it was more a small room pretending to be a lounge. Unfortunately, the "lounge' was more like a sauna. There was no AC for some reason, and it was more than 90 degrees in NY that week. The breakfast was really off-putting. 
I did try Opia for breakfast and my friend enjoyed the Eggs Benedict very much and pricing is a bit pricey for breakfast.

title: Several issues, but not bad
text: I stay in NYC about twice a month.  I decided to stay at a different location this trip for something different.  I am a Platinum Marriott rewards member, and was not overly impressed.  1st issue...I had no cell service in my room (804).  However, if i stepped outside my room, I had great service.  2nd issue...The high speed option on wifi was very slow and went in and out most of the week.  3rd issue...Business Center is a joke.  Do not use it.  I was charged for a fax that never went and copies that were never produced.  I called and asked for help and the "Tech" was useless.  Referred me to a 800 number and they were just as bad.  Still no resolution.  The room was ok and the rest of my customer service was great.

title: Great location but quiet
text: We've stayed twice at this hotel in NY. It's not far from Central Park and is on busy streets but since they are double windowed (and double paned as well) it's actually surprisingly quiet and you can't hear any street noise at all if you have the AC on. It could use some upgrades in the main room but the bathroom is up to date. If you want more room get the junior suite. Service is excellent and it's not crazy expensive like some other 4 star hotels in the area.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
Modern, boutique, interesting, just a few way to describe its wonderful decoration. Good services but expensive restaurant (who eats there thought?)
Rooms are perfect sized. Rooftop is great to explore NYs skyline (only in summer). Didn't go to the gym but I'm assuming it shouldn't be very big. Laundry is extremely expensive (don't do it) 
Strategic location to enjoy NY

title: Another Great Marriott Property
text: Was in town for one night.  Renaissance 57 offers a great location in midtown and the hotel is very quiet.  Good service and nice furnishings.  The bed was very comfortable.  Nice bar and although I did not eat there, the restaurant looked good.

title: Better options available
text:
Wasn't a huge fan of this hotel.  Not bad, but not my style.

Pros:  location is fine, plenty of things walking distance.  Friendly, helpful staff.

Cons:  the decor of the overall hotel is very unappealing (I've stayed at 2 Renaissance properties now and both had ugly decor features).  It feels like this is a very poor man's W.  I hesitate to make the comparison because it doesn't come close to a W, but you get the sense that it wants to go after a similar demographic.  From the lobby you have to take an elevator up a floor, then walk across to different elevators to go up to your room.  Not a fan of that arrangement.  

I only stayed here due to last minute booking, no rooms at better hotels were available.  Would stay in a different hotel next time if possible.

title: Ótimo Hotel
text: O Hotel e super charmoso,não parece um hotel de rede,e bem localizado,com uma boa vizinhanca, quarto super confortável apesar de pequeno,excelente rouparia, e tem ainda  um bom bar  um ótimo restaurante.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: I was only here one night, but I thought the hotel was great. Located in midtown, it was easy for me to get to Brooklyn to see some friends, as well as the Bronx to see the Yankees lose. Subway is two blocks away. Shower is great. Room was fine - well appointed, plenty of space with a bed and a sofa.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in May for our 50th birthdays. Needless to say, we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room but on arrival our rooms were decorated with chocolates and party balloons for our birthdays. We were also given free wifi. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and cleaned daily. Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff were really friendly. It is a near to Central Park and 5th Avenue and also near enough to walk to Times Square - we usually got a taxi back in the evening. We didn't use the bar or lounge facilities so can' really give fair comment but there always seemed to be people in both. I would definitley stay here again.

title: отличное место
text: Достойный отель! находится в центре Нью Йорка недалеко от тайм сквер и прочих достопримечательностей! Номер по площади не большой, но очень достойная и удобная ванная комната) прекрасный лобби! в номере на протяжение всего нахождения царила идеальная чистота и порядок! очень вкусный ресторан))))

title: Could have done with a small bar fridge
text: We loved the hotel it was a huge improvement on the hotel we stayed at previously we stayed for 12 nights so it worked well for our family of 4.  Only thing we were missing was a small bar fridge it would have made it easier if we had left overs & would have liked to have some milk for Tea/Coffee.  It was in a good location short walk our favorite coffee shop 'Little Collins' being from Australia we needed a good coffee before starting the day.  We would definitely stay there again it was all we needed.

title: Repeat visit
text:
Well I have red some of the reviews about this hotel and why it's not super plush it accommodates my needs. The fact that there are so many dining and shopping options within walking distance makes it a winner for me.

This last time I arrived to the hotel super early (9 am) and was provided a room so that I could work for a couple of hours. Superb service whenever I visit. They were doing some renovations which happened to be right outside of my room but I didn't mind. I was grateful for the staff accommodating my early arrival.

title: Satisfactory, typical NY small
text: Rooms are small but in good condition with a comfortable bed.  Club lounge is small.  Location is good: close to Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping for visitors, close to all the Park Avenue finance firms if that's your purpose.

title: Needs better management over site, but otherwise great
text:
This hotel is in a great location, and the price is typical very reasonable for New York. It is old, but has lots of character and the beds are super comfortable. My issue with this hotel is that the entire experience was complicated. 
I check in, go to my room and keys don't work. Finally get working keys and the TV remote is missing from room. I have one sent up and decide to go to lounge for my free drink (you get a coupon if you are gold or platinum). I get to the lounge and the only wine they have is Riesling...really?
I go back the next night for wine and chardonnay is available...yeah! I have a glass poured and go to return to my room. NO! you must not leave with a glass...you must pour your wine in this cardboard coffee cup and sip it like a street bum ;) May I have a brown bag with that cup? I take my coffee cup and go.
Next day I speak to bellman about checking out. He says that if I give him my parking pass he will have the car ready at 4:30. I show up at 4:30 and no car, I no longer have parking pass, and no one has had communication with the morning bellman about my car. I wait almost an hour to have this sorted out. I sent a note to the GM last week because I would rather negative statements be used for improvement and not always posted...but since I have not received a response this review is going up.

title: Lovely hotel - comfy beds
text:
We stayed here as part of a competition prize through Virgin Atlantic.  We paid yo upgrade our room to a spacious suite.  It was worth it and the bed was huge and do comfortable.   I think I counted 7 pillows.  The hotel was nice and the staff friendly.  The concierge was really helpful and had so much advice.  
The only issue we had was the aircon in our room didn't work.  They came to fix it but but it was beyond repair.  They offered to move us but as we were only there 3 days we didn't want to waste time we wanted to explore the city.  They offered us some very powerful fans instead which were great and did the job and as an apology they insisted on giving us complimentary breakfast each day which was an added bonus as I think it was approx $15 a day each.
The room was spotlessly clean with a fantastic walk in shower, comfy bed, comfy sofa and tea and coffee making facilities.   We had a lovely view if the city and the hotel was ideally situated close to the subway etc.   I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: Super
text: Great hotel and Extremely clean. Very friendly staff and super location   Would recommend if asked. Right off 5th Madison Park Lexington   I would stay there again  the bar and restaurant are nice. The only draw back no room service  but there is a great breakfast place next door

title: Holiday a great time to visit
text: I will say I was surprised how few people travel to NYC over the Independence Day holiday. This is my favorite Hite for the friendliness of the staff and with few people they can shine even more. We had a small problem with our room and the staff bent over backwards to offer assistance. This remains my first choice for a hotel in NYC.

title: Fantastically obscure
text: Such a tucked-away cool place. My three fairly critical teenage boys found absolutely nothing to complain about. They loved it. Decor is artsy and chic, but in a way that feels cozy. Walked to and from Times Square, and took subway there, both very easy and doable. Nice, accommodating staff, room with two doubles was great size and with a private nook for a blow up mattress because we had five in the room, bathroom really nice. Got back late after a Broadway show and had dinner in the hotel restaurant. It was outstanding. Jazz band was playing, lights were low, seating was loungish comfortable, and food was surreally good. We all slept great. No noise, comfortable beds. Sat on our patio overlooking 57th and had coffee in the morning. Every aspect was wonderful.

title: Almost adequate
text:
NO ROOM SERVICE HERE. NONE.
Arrived at 11:00PM, desk agent quite friendly & helpful although he was snippy and annoyed that we didn't take his list of NYC recommendations. Asked for mini-fridge at checkin & again the next day--never came. The wifi/internet only worked when I tethered to my phone through data.  Husband ONLY had wifi for two hours on one day.  Inexcusable on the wifi.  Only about 7 min of hot water so if there are two of you, and one of you is female....The bathroom was compact & cramped as was the so-called junior suite, which was more like a small bedroom with couch.  Tiny desk space--tiny.  The lounge for Rewards members serves nothing on weekends.  This place was unlike any Renaissance we've experienced, a bit low rent and dated for a Renaissance, which may be why the price is enticing.  Location is great.  All staff with whom we interacted, including restaurant, were pleasant and courteous.  Breakfast in restaurant decent but nothing remarkable. Would not stay here again.

title: Great hotel with super friendly staff!
text:
Great location for sight seeing and is a 5 minute walk from Lexington Ave station which has great links to JFK Airport.

The hotel decor is slightly over the top but that is to be expected from a boutique hotel. The staff upon arrival and each day were very welcoming and chatty. One of the best services that we would recommend anyone to use is the 'Navigator' service in the hotel lobby, they were great throughout our stay, recommending great bars and places to eat that go beyond the trail of tourism.

Our room was great, with an amazing view of the Chrysler building. Great size with large bathroom, only downside was the bathroom door did not lock, but luckily we were traveling as a couple so it didn't matter too much. The room had minor wear and tear but again that is to be expected with most 4 star hotels. The room doors are unable to close without slamming, due to the locking system. This is something that could be heard down the hallways but wasn't too much of an issue as we didn't spend much time in the room.

Hotel bar and restaurant is not a great selling point for the hotel as drink prices were the highest we paid in Manhattan, food was bland and staff we lacking personality which is completely opposite to the rest of the hotel.

Overall the experience was great and we really enjoyed ourselves. Would recommend this hotel for people sightseeing and shopping, if you are looking for trendy bars and cheap prices would be better to stay Downtown.

title: Nice people but poor facility
text: This was our second time here 7 yrs apart and they haven't touched it. Employees are all very nice, rooms a worn and housekeeping poor. Run down hotel. Room are undersized - wear shin- guards for moving around the bed platform's sharp corners! Dark and poorly lit, no place to sit and chill  including you room- overpriced for a 2 star at best.

title: 2nd Time Around.
text: Well this was 2nd time staying at Renaissance 57th, and was again impressed how welcoming and warm the hotel felt.  Raymond at the front desk, with all other front desk clerks are excellent, to Michelle the concierge who always smiles and welcomes you, to Pernal and Daniel the infamous doormen.  Both are extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  Being there in summer this time, I got to see the windows open out to a terrace at the restaurant.  The building is 96years old with a lot of charm.  Very nice hotel, highly recommend it.

title: Disappointing
text: Disappointing service for breakfast.. I ordered an american breakfast, and specified to the waitress, whole wheat toast was my bread choice. 20 minutes later, I received my eggs, meat, and potatoes with no bread.. when I asked where is my bread, I was told that they stop serving bread after 11am, and they ran out of croissants. so she had to ask the chef for an exception. Your better off eating breakfast outside the hotel..

title: Service impeccable
text:
Nous avons séjourner 2 nuits à l'hôtel et avons eu un service hors pair.   Personnel très accueillants, notre chambre était déjà prête à notre arrivée à 10 h le matin.  Le seul bémol est la petitesse de la chambre mais.
.ce n'est pas là qu'on passe le séjour alors.... Je recommande chaudement cet hôtel.

title: Disappointing
text:
Overall I was disappointed with this hotel. We stayed 2 nights at the Omni Berkshire before moving here for our final 2 nights & it wasn't worth the move. We paid extra for a deluxe room, again not really worth it. 
On arrival at 12.10 we asked to leave our luggage & stated we would arrive back later to check in. The gentleman on reception then proceeded to advise us that our room would be ready at 1pm. On hearing this news we decided to change our plans & go grab some lunch & bring it back & eat it on our balcony. We arrived back at 1pm to be told it wasn't quite ready & to go wait in the lounge. Where we waited for another hour. At 2pm we were advised by the concierge that we shouldn't have been told this & that we wouldn't be able to access our room until 3pm. When you only have a few days in New York being messed around like this is extremely frustrating! 
This was a trip for my mum's 60th birthday so I had brought some champagne, to enjoy on the balcony that we had paid extra for. On arrival in the room, we noticed there were no wine glasses. I popped down to the bar where the gentleman advised quite curtly, he could only provide me with a paper cup & I wasn't permitted to have a flute. I mean seriously?!!!!
Finally, be aware, if you pay extra for the deluxe room, be prepared for the noise that comes through the door. I don't know if it's double glazed, but it's loud! All in all, not my idea of a 4 star hotel. 3 at best.

title: decent city hotel
text: The room was clean though a bit on the small size.The beds were very comfortable.There was decent sound proofing so even though our room was on the third floor facing the street,we were not bothered by street noise.The staff was very pleasant.The rate was very reasonable for a city hotel,especially the marriot reward rate.The bathroom was small and there wasn't any counter space..All in all a decent place to stay in NYC.

title: Good location doesn't make up for average service.
text: When my cab dropped me off in front of the hotel, I had to ask him where it was.  Buried beneath scaffolding at the corner of Lexington and 57th, the building was easy to miss, and its unimpressive entrance gave  you reason to question your booking.  Once inside, the staff were friendly enough.  Inside a very small, dark entrance lobby, you are checked in, then directed upstairs to the larger lobby where a restaurant and what looked like a conference room were located.  You walk across this second lobby to the elevators that take you to your floor.  If your favorite color is brown, you will love this hotel's lobby decor--the floors, the walls, the curtains, and the chairs are all brown and for a lobby that doesn't get much natural light, you have to question the color choice.  Once in your room, things get better.  The room, though slightly dated, does look like someone worked a bit harder in making it more sophisticated in appearance.  It was small, but had everything you'd want, including a good room entertainment system that allowed you to access Netflix on TV.  The negative, and the reason I would never stay here again, is the cost of Wifi, a staggering $16.95 a night, the highest I have seen anywhere.  Charging guests for use of Wifi is the biggest rip-off in the hotel industry and it looks like Marriott is not concerned at all about this.  All you have to do to avoid the charge is to become a Marriott Platinum Elite member and you're good to go.  Although asked politely, none of the staff was empowered with the ability to hit a button on a computer that would allow you free Wifi access in your room.  So, if you are not special in Marriott's eyes, and a $16.95 charge for Wifi access appalls you as much as it does me, go instead to any number of hotels along Lexington Avenue that will treat you more like a welcome guest.

title: A bit pricey, but really nice
text: For a quick stay, the place is really nice, though pricey. Rooms are small and you trip over things, but it is clean and quiet and private. Service staff is very nice. Elevators are a little complicated and you have to shift elevators from the entrance to the lobby or take a stares which is a little difficult.

title: A Very Good Mid-town Manhattan Hotel
text: This is an older boutique hotel with limited amenities but located in an ideal mid-town Manhattan location at Lexington and E. 57th Street.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The Opia Restaurant located within the Hotel is a very nice, intimate and convenient restaurant.  The food was quite good.  The outside is under construction but when that is done, it will be that much nice.  The room was comfortable, although rather "cozy."  Seems to be a good in town location for meetings and parties too.

title: magnificent but loud
text: superb hotel with a great restsaurant bvut the airconditioner is loud when it kicks in.  i liked the feekling of excklusivety as there are no crouds and the people are friendly.  rooms are small but well appointed.  the lounge on the first floor is adequate but the selection of food for elite members is sub par in comparison to other hotels

title: Awful in so many ways
text:
Probably one of the most disappointing hotels I have ever stayed in. Room was boxy with a view from one, of the two very small windows, of a wall and from the other the air conditioning plant.

Carpet had large grey edges where it had not been vacuumed in years, closet barely had room for a suit. The room was tiny; a friend staying at the same hotel commented that he wasn't sure whether to sleep in the room and leave his bag outside, or put his bag in the room and sleep in the corridor

You have to take two separate lifts from the reception to the rooms, there was music playing 24/7 in the communal areas (loud and not good), the furniture and fittings are tired and the restaurant service...

Had breakfast twice. The first morning the order was 20 minutes late arriving and was then wrong, the second morning I was served, again after a long wait, 10 minutes before my guest who waited over 30 minutes for a couple of pancakes. They don't even bring coffee and the menu when you sit down. And the restaurant wasn't busy.

All of this for $500/ night!

I can't recommend it.

title: Bom
text: Hotel bom para estadia em nyc. Daniel doorman muito atencioso e prestativo. O hotel tem ótima limpeza dos quartos. Confortável excelente localização. Vale a pena. Perto de restaurantes, metro , supermercado e tudo mais. Tem m restaurante dentro do hotel.

title: Ambushed
text:
There was an excellent offer for this hotel on Booking.com. So we booked a 3-night stay. When we got there, late at night (after a haul from Vancouver, BC) they could not find our reservation and the attendant decided my husband´s name was not on the confirmation slip! Deep apologies came soon but some damage was done. 
A shock: our room was 9 square meters. Did that come with the offer? I don´t think so....there was nothing on the add. We had to take turns walking. Isn´t it against city codes or something? A room so tiny? (the bathroom was OK). Beware everyone - do not take rooms with the ending '09'....Notwithstanding, 'free' internet did not materialize as expected on my cell phone, computer or iPad. A 'technician' was called twice to 'fix' the problem - which persisted for the duration of our stay. I gave up trying to connect!!! Maybe there was a trade-off with the offer - which we were not privy to. Not what we would expect from a Marriott Hotel (we have a Marriott Rewards membership).
Positive points: excellent location and sympathetic (if not effective in resolving issues) staff.

title: Great Location, Friendly and Affordable
text: The hotel was having some exterior renovations when we stayed there in February 2016. So we were pleasantly surprised to walk in and find such a lovely interior space. A great bar and busy restaurant in the lobby as well as funky interesting-looking lobby furniture gave a sense of warmth and was definitely inviting. We had gotten a special winter deal on a queen room with a balcony. Wow!  It was a huge balcony original to the building with plent of room for 8-10 people!  There was furniture out there and a fabulous view of Lexington Avenue!  Really a great stay!

title: Meh
text: Truly disappointed by this hotel.  My wife is Platinum with Marriott- so we stay in hotels often.  This was as cold as country folk imagine NYC to be.  It was a departure from our usual property. The restaurant/bar was a very poor experience and ended the night on a sour note. Our waitress (fjolla?) acted like she would "make an exception" to take a drink coupon. She pointed out that "we are not part of this hotel". She made a harmless mistake and then proceeded to ignore us.  She only had 1 other table, but would look at the ceiling when she walked by is as not to acknowledge our requests.  We won't be back to this hotel or the bar.

title: Finally, a large enough room in NY!
text: I used my Marriott points for this hotel as NYC hotels are super expensive.  This hotel has a great central location and they provide valet parking if you want to use it.  The hotel parking is less expensive than lots right next door.  My room was large enough to have my customers sit comfortably on a couch, not the bed!  Large bathroom, nice bed, good views of the city out the 3 large windows (I had a corner room).  Nice staff.  Two of the lights didn't work but they later gave me 5000 extra points to compensate me.  Lovely bar/restaurant on second floor.

title: Fantastic stay
text: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was great from the moment we entered, upon check in the receptionist noted we were staying for a few nights and moved us to a larger room, a gesture that we really appreciated! The room itself was lovely and clean and had everything we needed. Every member of the team was super friendly and helpful. Cocktails were fab and reasonably priced. Location is great. Loved this hotel, it went way beyond my expectations!

title: Great location in Midtown East close to Central Park
text: Easy to get downtown on the 4, 5, 6 subway lines from 59th & Lexington. It's also easy to get to from Metro North via a station change in Harlem at 125th Street. I had a corner room that was very nice. What I didn't like was the 2 elevator trek to the street from the rooms. Unlike the Renaissance Times Square at least this hotel had a staircase to bypass the street to lobby elevator [when you don't have your roll aboard]. There is also a rooftop deck and it's close enough to Central Park to go for a run. As a Platinum Elite member I was given a free food and drink voucher upon check in which I appreciated. They do have a Concierge Lounge but it was small (no Monday night service either) and the evening offerings were among the most scant that I have encountered.

title: Good to stay at a small hotel
text: I stay here several times a year. I like the rooms except for the draft to the hallway and AC/DC staff. The staff is either very helpful or forget it. Not a fan of the restaurant either. Room configurations are interesting and comfortable. I like that the lobby is small and on the second level.

title: Great New York Stay
text: The staff was excellent all around. The room was smaller than expected, but understandable as it is New York. Very clean, very friendly. Would recommend for anyone wanting to be close(ish) to Central Park. Only strange thing is that ice machines were not located on every floor (or if they were, I missed it).

title: super posizione
text:
posizione perfetta e centralissima a manhattan.

bagno nella norma, letto decisamente piccolo. 

buona connessione wifi

bello l'ambiente della hall.

camera al piano 17 con vista meravigliosa sull'edificio più alto di new york.

il terrazzo dovrebbe essere utilizza di più, vista suggestiva.

title: Older, Boutique, Could use Upgrades
text:
Small rooms, small hotel.  Small staff.  A few good staff members, a few need lessons in service.

No view, Beds are mostly queen or doubles.  Small concierge lounge, with staff that are indifferent at night. Not impressed, and I am a Marriott Platinum member.  Will not return.  There are better choices in NYC.

title: Good NY Hotel
text: Clean, excellent location and modern looking but still has a little bout of the old feel to it as the building is quite dates from the outside.  Also has a good restaurant and bar area.  Only drawback is that the rooms are very small which is to be expected in NY I guess.

title: A good Stay
text:
Stayed for a week, the staff is excellent and very helpful. Though the breakfast remained the same on all days no variety.
The location of the hotel is very good. The hotel charged some extra amount on my card which was not supposed to be, i spoke at the reception and asked them to rectify the same which was done thanks to the team and pradley for the refund, however the room size is very small.

title: Quirky yet sophisticated
text:
My friend and I stayed here for two nights. 
The hotel is quirky yet sophisticated the rooms were well appointed and it's location is centralized to everything!
The staff was attentive and helpful. The doorman went out of his way to catch me a cab when I was leaving during rush hour traffic! Thank you!

title: Terrible service by Raymond at the frontdesk
text:
Quality was average, even acceptable, until I interacted with Raymond at the front desk. He made me feel uncomfortable, he was impatient and arrogant. I understand the nature of my request was not common but he did not show a service attitude and was willing to end the conversation with me as quick as possible, 

I wanted to make this feedback personal, because as an entrepreneur I understand that one person's attitude doesn't stand up for the whole company's culture. In spite of that I will never come back to this hotel because of this experience.

title: Well Located
text: Small hotel very well located in midtown Manhattan close by to all major shopping and dining, rooms are very small and scarce, but beds are quite comfortable. Bathrooms ordinary, and restaurant serves very good breakfast

title: Great service!
text: The room was clean, the customer service was amazing, and the design of the room was enriching. Breakfast and lunch was filling, delicious, and had me feeling to order for more. I give this a 5/5 rating.

title: Weekend Getaway!
text: We loved the hotel!  Our queen room had a fantastic balcony with amazing views.  The bed, pillows and bedding were amazing.  The bathroom was large and appreciated the Aveda products.  The customer service was second to none!  We were greeted by Pradley Concepcion and he worked magic for us. We left something behind and he worked so hard to be sure it was sent to us.  Alex Fernandez made us feel like we were home.  As a seasoned traveler, it was wonderful to find this hidden gem in NYC.  In fact, I would seriously consider an event here and worked with Arleen Beradino to discuss a possible business meeting.  Great location, fabulous staff, can't wait to return.

title: Girls rrip
text: Had the best experience with the hotel and the staff. Rooms were clean and nice. Close to everything uptown. The bell captain Pernell Thomas went above and beyond to take care of our travel needs. He was very kind and gracious. We would definitely go this route again. Loved it all.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Incredibly comfortable and well equipped rooms. I was in a 'cosy' room but it still had a large bathroom and dressing area.

The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the location of the hotel makes it a great choice for staying in New York.

title: Pluses and minuses
text: I booked this hotel for 3 nights on a combination of its location (for my purposes) and price, and was satisfied on these accounts.   Everything looks fine and staff were friendly, but I had some issues with restaurant food (preparation and available choices--quality of ingredients was fine) and service; with plumbing and hot water; and with a very loud fan waking me at night. (Unfortunate, as the room was otherwise very quiet.) Registration is on the ground floor, with the lobby, restaurants and elevators to rooms on the second floor. There was a nice deep tub in my bathroom, but getting in and out for a shower required care and might be difficult for some people. I am of two minds about my stay, so would consider returning, based on my original criteria.

title: It's nice
text:
This is a good hotel, although the rooms are bit on the small side. I like the fact that there is a bath tub and enjoyed the Aveda products. The bed is comfortable, and there is a nice selection of pillows. It looks as though it could use a bit of an update (carpet and wall coverings, and the bed skirt were a bit shabby), and if the could move the blinking fire detector, that would be great. It is right over the bed, and apparently, someone put a small Band-Aid over the light because the Band-Aid fell on me during the night.

The lounge area is very nice and the staff is very helpful

title: A Pleasant Midtown Hotel With Tiny Bedrooms
text: I was late in booking a hotel in New York City and ended up at the Renaissance Hotel on 57th Street in Midtown Manhattan. While the location is great for shopping, sightseeing and business meetings, the bedrooms (at least mine), was very small with nowhere to sit except on an office type chair at a small desk or on the bed. There is no room service at this hotel, although the restaurant opens until late. I did have lunch at the hotel which was good (special of the day  - cod cooked with veggies). Staff were very nice and helpful. There is no parking in the front of the hotel and vehicles cannot stop outside. My driver got yelled at by the cops as he pulled up to let me out. Then a NYC bus honked loudly right behind us. It's a nice enough hotel, but if I'm being honest, I think there are other, better hotel choices in this area of New York City.

title: شارع التايم سكوير
text: الفندق متوسط .. بصراحه الاثاث قديم وكتوب ان تم تحديده لكن هذا الكلام غير صحيح .. يمكن تم تجديد بعض الاشياء وليش كل شي .. بس عموماً الفندق موقعه ممتاااز جداً جداً التايم سكيور اول ما تطلع من الفندق .. افضل ما في هذا الفندق موقعه ..

title: Hard to beat for Holiday weekend in NYC
text: Decided to meet daughter (at Villanova) in NYC for Easter. Chose Renaissance 57 based on TA reviews, availability for room type we needed, location and price. Door, front desk staff and Navigator (their version of concierge) were courteous, helpful and pleasant. Checked bags as room not ready and when daughter arrived we met friends who had just moved to Manhattan. I was surprised at size of room (very large) and recent renovation. It was a junior suite, with king bed and futon-style fold-down sofa sleeper that was essentially a double-sized bed. Both beds were very comfortable for sleeping restfully. Room was stylish with nice views out onto streets on both sides.Bathroom but especially shower was very spacious with enough counter and shelf space for all. Bathroom was not very soundproof but not a big deal. Close enough to walk to most things we wanted to see but also only a couple blocks from subway so we were able to get around town without any difficulty. Didn't have a high enough Elite member status to see what complementary continental breakfast was like, but fitness center had a decent variety of equipment to get in a weekend workout.  Also, though maid failed to replace Kleenex when empty, we survived. Didn't try restaurant in hotel but had breakfast right next door at Palace. I'd willingly stay again and tell others to do the same if they asked.

title: Very nice stay
text: Lovely hotel staff are friendly and helpful.We booked a Queen room with balcony,room was a lot bigger than I expected after reading other reviews.Large bathroom plenty of space in room.Best thing was the balcony fabulous views just to sit and take in the sights and noise of NY fabulous.Only negative why haven't given 5stars was the room air con it's been cold and wet here and with the air con on max couldn't get the room warm.Would stay here again but only if balcony room was available well worth the extra..

title: Staff made the stay enjoyable..
text:
Having worked in the service industry long before entering the business world, if there's one thing I appreciate it's great customer service. 

My experience with Kristina in the loungue made me forget I was away on business. She is an excellent bar tender. Our conversation was engaging and entertaining. It didnt matter what I ordered, Kristina quickly and attentively made my drink and ensured I was happy. 

My experience with staff from check in to check out was great. I look forward to ordering a drink from Kristina next time through NY. 

Thanks for a great stay. I'll be back Renaissance 57.

title: Ask to be AWAY from the elevator
text:
When traveling on business, the most important aspect of a hotel stay is a good night's sleep.  That did not happen.    I arrived at about 1045pm, unpacked and then went out until about 1140pm.  I heard grinding noise a few times before going to bed, but had no idea what it was.   It would last for 10-20 seconds then stop, then again 10-15 minutes later. I was unpacked, settled in for the evening. The noise will stop eventually. No need to call the front desk or move rooms. WRONG!   

All through the night I heard the grinding sound, simultaneously cursing the sound and wondering what the $&@# it was. It was not until morning that I realized it was the elevator.  UGH!  

Nothing extraordinary. Nothing lacking. Comparatively spacious bathroom. Shower was hot. Wi-fi was acceptable speed. No fridge or microwave - but that did not matter to me on this trip. 

A decent hotel, just don't make my mistake.  Ask for a room away from the elevator.  

The business center - 3 stations with large monitors and high speed internet. Better than most hotels, but they charge for it; per minute for Internet and per page for printing. 

Overall probably not a 1 rating, but 1 is comparable to the quality of my sleep that night.

title: Great Location and lovely ambiance
text: I'm just  visiting the place with my friends and we stayed in Lobby area with unique fireplace that you can imagine never seen that before, great staff and very clean area, smells great as you come inside the hotel something like welcoming you with the great scent, I don't know if anyone notice it but I did. Great staff, friendly and always smiles at you and greet.

title: Great place to stay
text: Everyone in this hotel was really nice and the hotel itself was lovely. I had to come on the trip for unfortunate reasons and Justine particularly was so kind about my circumstance. The beds were very comfortable. I would come back for sure.

title: Hotel excelente
text:
Excelente localização , super confortavel , atendimento nota 10 , com funcionarios atenciosos . Fiquei no 7 andar com cama de casal , super macia e confortavel. limpeza impecavel.Fica em uma esquina super importante , ao lado de lojas como a H&M , bloomingdales  ..
A vista do quarto é sensaciona.

title: NYC
text: The hotel is very nice, has a boutique atmosphere. Good location, relatively close to Central Park and 5th Avenue and far from the madness of Times Square. The only negative in our stay was the size of the room. Only open space in the room was the small walkway around three sides of the bed. I'm learning that small rooms are common in NYC.

title: Stay away unless the location is the only one that works for you
text: Can't believe this is a Renaissance! Staying here now and switching hotels tomorrow because the pain of moving hotels is worth not being here another night. I've stayed at several NYC Marriott hotels and this is by far the worst. Writing this from the perspective of a status, business traveler. The lounge has no amenities (not even coffee) during off hours, when it does have service I got two rotten (not ripe) bananas. Couldn't even get a wine glass for my room. The location is decent, but there are so many options around. If this hotel was in a different city I would give it 2 stars, but given that there are several options that are better (even the courtyard brand) I can't give it more than the single star. I would stay away from this one.

title: Great Value!
text:
We returned to the Renaissance 57 last week.  At first we got a very small room but requested the corner (room 1401) and were moved the second day of our 3 night stay.  It's a vast improvement.  Staff could not have been nicer!  

We paid about $270/night and booking directly through marriott.com, the wi fi was free.

title: A well located hotel
text: Though not at all trendy hard to find a better location. Can walk to anywhere. Good restaurant and friendly staff. 1st day tv only had 3 channels and air conditioning didn't work. Day two those got fixed. But never could turn on faucet in bath or shower and for expediency just used sink thoroughly

title: Came with low expectations, but was really impressed!
text:
I love Renaissance brand hotels, but wasn't sure what to expect from Hotel 57. What I found was extremely accommodating staff, great rooms and a fantastic location in midtown. 

Rooms: well-appointed, comfortable, not as cramped as other NYC hotels I've stayed in (esp. in midtown)

Location: GREAT! Close to the big media companies, and all the amenities and sights midtown Manhattan has to offer

Would absolutely stay here again!

title: Quick trip into the city
text:
Booked two rooms here for a quick trip into the city the day after Christmas. One room was a decent sized (by NYC standards) double on the 13th floor. First time I have seen a 13th floor in a building. Second room was closer to my size expectations in NYC - a queen with enough room to walk around the bed. There was a balcony on the room that had a clear view of the Chrysler building - very nice.

Both rooms were very clean, we had drinks in the bar and the staff was quite friendly. Front desk staff was very professional and polite. The bellman was great - super friendly and personable. This hotel is a great location for walking just about anywhere from Times Square north to Central park. The only less than desirable thing was the room elevators stopping on the 2nd floor outside of the bar and restaurant. From there you could take another elevator down one flight or the stairs.

title: Great Stay..and an even better Staff!
text:
I was a bit apprehensive about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews.  I'm glad to report that I am extremely satisfied with my stay so far (checking out tomorrow).  At check-in, i was immediately greeted by a very friendly person at the front desk! Her name is Denise (hope I didn't get her name wrong) and not only was she super helpful but she wanted to make sure that I truly enjoyed my stay and offered that I could reach out to her directly if I needed anything.  That was a great start! The property itself was very trendy (and smelled really nice)!  It's true that you have to take an elevator up to the "Lobby" then take another set of elevators to the room, but it wasn't that bad in my opinion.  I only did that when I had luggage but opted to use the stairs (immediately to the right when you walk in) to get to the Lobby area when I was going out and coming back.  I also read in other reviews that the rooms were super small so I was a little wary; however, I didn't find the room to be small at all for NYC.  Generally speaking, hotel rooms in NYC are smaller than other cities so the size was just fine and very comfortable.  I travel to NYC for business a lot and have stayed at truly small rooms where the bathroom was practically next to the bed, so this was just fine.

The only feedback that I have for the hotel is to have a dedicated Concierge Lounge for Platinum/Gold guests.  At most other Marriott properties the lounge is only for Elite members, but it was open to all guests at this hotel.  I am not trying to be exclusive or anything and I don't really care if the lounge is open to everyone, but this particular lounge is super small.  The breakfast left a lot to be desired and the area where the breakfast was offered was so small you couldn't really fit two people in the space.  I guess I was disappointed since my Concierge lounge expectations were for a typical Marriott property and this fell short.

title: Made NY trip perfect!!!
text: Coming from Queens, I know NYC.  Have stayed in 3 hotels in NYC, and this hotel was surely the coolest.  From the reception (RAYMOND) to Angelo and Pernel in Valet, the employees are like family.  Stayed 2 nights and I felt like they were my new found friends.  The hotel is perfectly located on 57th, closest to Lex. Rooms and beds were super comfy, bathrooms upgraded.  The lounge area was relaxing, with excellent music pumped throughtout the hotel.  The restaurant OPIA was delicious, happening bar with great bartenders and servers.  So in nutshell, loved this hotel and staying there when I return.

title: 맨하탄 관광에 좋은 위치 & 친절한 Staff
text: 뉴욕의 호텔이 그렇듯 르네상스 57호텔도 최신식 시설은 아니었고 약간 올드한 느낌을 풍기는 객실이었습니다. 그러나 객실 내부의 크기는 맨하탄 내의 W, Hilton 보다 약간 큰 느낌이었지만, 가구와 침대 등이 오래되었습니다. 호텔이름과 똑같이 57번가에 위치하였는데, 렉싱턴 Ave는  매디슨, 파크Ave보다 조용하면서도 중심가과 거리도 가까워서 쇼핑&관광에 매우 편리했습니다. 루즈벨트 트램을 타러가는 Plaza에도 걸어갈수 있는 위치입니다. 마지막날 다른 호텔로 옮기면서, 새로 쇼핑한 짐을 closet에 그대로 두고왔는데, 다음날 연락했을때  그대로 짐을 찾을 수 있었습니다. 친절한 Staff덕분에 좋은 기억으로 여행이 마무리되었습니다.

title: Rennaissance at 57th St
text: The Marriott Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is a small boutique hotel.  The standard king room is small but adequate - I would suggest a suite room.  In the weekends, the concierge lounge is not open for breakfast and no coupons given for breakfast, as the hotel does not have an in house restaurant, it is open for drinks in the evenings and you can get a bottle of water only anytime.  The check-in desk in in the lower level and you have to exit at the next level to get to your room.  The check in and out is very efficient - I had two rooms reserved one a king and the other a king suite and they were next to each other.  The hotel is very close to the subway, Bloomingdales, and next door there is a great breakfast café - The Palace Restaurant.  The door people are very helpful to get taxis, and directions.  We would stay at the Renaissance 57 again.

title: Convenient
text: I used this hotel through my travel department from work.  The hotel is clean.  It was conveniently located for my business function I was attending and also for the family events we planned.  I was able to walk to my function and we also walked to Central Park.  Our play we attended was only a short cab ride away.  Check in and out was very easy.  They granted us a late check out so we could squeeze in another site before leaving on Sunday.

title: Location is good - needs updating!
text: Thought I would try out this Renaissance as I had meetings in the area. I had a nice corner room on the 13th floor. The room was nice as I had windows on 2 sides. The hotel is an old conversion so things like water pressure are always an issue in NYC. That being said, the staff is top notch and very helpful whenever they can assist. There is no room service but plenty of little restaurants around the area. Would recommend this hotel if you get a good price.

title: Great location - rooms need a refresh
text: Very "LA" look to the entry and lobby promised a level of hip and cool - concierge lounge was very nice but freezing cold, and my room and my colleagues room had a musty smell.    With so many other midtown choices i'll probably look to another marriott property next time I need a midtown east hotel

title: Christmas trip
text: Spent two nights in December.  Never stayed here in the past but typically like this location.  Close to the subway and all of the fifth avenue shopping.  Not a big hotel so it was nice not to be overwhelmed when coming in from a long day.  Bar was wonderful with nightly music.  Rooms were very nice and the service was great.

title: Tired musty rooms, not customer oriented
text: I am an Elite Marriott member who stays in NYC for business about 6-10 days/month along with travel and staying at other city Marriott hotels for business. I have stayed at other NYC Marriotts that were wonderful as my previous reviews indicate. I decided to stay here as my business dinner was nearby. I asked for King size bed, but when I checked in they said no rooms available with this. Front desk was not courteous, and when I checked back next morning to change rooms the man was very cold and extremely dismissive. The room I was given was outdated, musty and old. I requested a refrigerator and was finally brought one that that had a terrible odor and couldn't use. This is hotel is not customer oriented and the rooms are not up to par for a hotel with a Marriott name attached.  Stay far away. There are many great hotels in this area, this is not one. They had the opportunity to amend this and they did all they could not to.

title: Great location but hotel needs some work
text: Location was great--we were within walking distance to Central Park, Theater, Times Square, excellent shopping, etc., but hotel is quite noisy all day and night. We were in a corner junior suite and could hear the elevator cabling through the wall all night. This coupled with flushing toilets throughout the hotel made sleep for this light sleeper very challenging. There were some broken fixtures in the room and the boutique decor needs some repair. Kind of disappointing for a Marriott property, plus the Concierge level was closed on the weekend. Bed was comfy though and the French Onion soup at the French restaurant inside the hotel, Opia was excellent.

title: Great bar with great service from anyone out of town
text:
Kristina is fantastic!  Great service, very accommodating and welcoming for anyone traveling from outside the area. Ask her about the election and be ready for a great conversation!  
Hotel is in a great location! Very comfortable.   
 This review was completely honest and now the trip advisor app is asking me to complete 200 characters to submit. 
The review was real, but trip advisor is a bit suspect!

title: Awesome location, service and hotel!
text:
This is my first visit to New York City, so we wanted a hotel that would be centrally located to restaurants, shopping, attractions and most of all the subway. The Renaissance New York Hotel provided all those requirements with added value the attentive service that the staff provides!

At time of arrival we were greeted with a warm welcome by Slovik, followed with an attentive guest service agent Oksana, who was very accommodating when we checked-in. We had some changes to our reservations and Oksana made those changes and added our Marriott Rewards information expeditiously.

We found the accommodations to be large, modern, clean and just perfect. The best part was they offered Aveno toiletries which was a perfect treat. This was first time that I had slept 10 hours away from home. The sheets, bed and comforter coupled with the quietness was just perfect for a weekend getaway. The HVAC was quite and warmed the room perfectly with no effort or noise.

We had breakfast in the restaurant Opius, service was good and personable and the coffee hit the spot. We were excited to see New York City, we had inquired with the Navigator Carla, who provided clear directions with the subway which made the day perfect. We came back to the hotel at about 7 only to find Carla again, therefore we asked if she could recommend a restaurant nearby, she referred us to a local Italian restaurant Felidia which was excellent! Great recommendations, and directions really made our weekend stay amazing!

Make sure to go the Empire State Building first where you can get a good sense of where everything is at in addition you can purchase the attractions tickets at a huge discount. If your staying for multiple stays purchase a subway card it's much easier to get in and out instead of paying $3.00 for each way but it also avoids having multiple bills and allows you to enter at any location. 

The location offers plenty of high end shopping, our favorite was Nike, Bloomingdale's SuperDry, and Brietling.

Additional staff that made our stay amazing; Dani, Daniel, the housekeeper on the 15th floor, blond hair and Arleen in Sales.

Again thank you for making our stay memorable!

title: Needs some work
text:
I stayed here for about a week. Hotel staff was very helpful and courteous, but the room itself was pretty beat -- time for some renovations. The woodwork on the desk unit was all worn down and splintering. The electrical outlets were pretty dirty, and the hallway carpets were in serious need of a refresh (they smelled like old carpet shampoo and had numerous stains). Elevators had definitely seen happier days. 

Bathroom design looked kind of cool, but the sinks were a pain to deal with -- there is not much room between the faucet and the drain. Difficult to fill up water glasses. 

I'm a big Renaissance hotel fan--that is my hotel brand of choice, but I'll be staying away from here for a few years until they refresh the place. I recommend you do the same!

title: Clean enough and good location
text:
I found this place slightly odd - the room was ok (basic but with a nice bathroom and a comfy bed) but there was no room service or mini bar so if you wanted a drink you had to go to the bar that is situated in the hotel but has nothing to do with the hotel, I just found this odd. The bar staff were ridiculously rude also! 
We went up to the roof terrace and it was all closed off and looked like a building site - not at all like the pictures.
The concierge also had to google how to get downtown which I also thought was pretty weird.
I'd stay there again but not for a romantic trip (we were on honeymoon)

title: Great location and incredible service
text: I just spent 3 days at the Renaissance and the service was amazing. Everyone courteous and professional. They went out of there way to make sure we were have a great trip. Especially bell man Pernell.

title: Perfect location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights over Valentines  weekend. The whole experience from checking in to having our room upgraded was amazing. The staff were very polite and helpful. We found we had no hot water but literally within 2 mins the maintenance guy appeared and fixed it for us. For us this hotel was in the perfect location to walk to the main attractions with Central Park and Rockefeller being the closest. Also a bonus having Bloomingdales round the corner! We flew into JFK and got a yellow cab to the hotel which is a flat rate (extra charge at peak times) however coming home we flew from Newark so the hotel arranged a car for us, they also looked after our luggage after check out as we weren't due to leave for the airport till late afternoon, plenty of time for last minute shopping! All in all a great hotel and we didn't let the extremely cold weather stop us getting out.

title: As good as it gets!
text: My wife and I spent this past weekend with its record breaking low temperatures at this lovely hotel.  The room was very comfortable and larger than we expected.  The location was perfect; we were able to walk to and from the theater district and the Museum of Modern Art.  The neighborhood around the hotel is filled with an array of high end shopping opportunities.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.
