We loved the restaurant; it was so nice to be able to have all our meals right on the premises.  The restaurant had a sophisticated ambiance, the prices were reasonable, and the food was excellent.  We also enjoyed using the exercise room which was well equipped.  All this came at a price that was so much more reasonable than the hotels we've visited in the past.  We would most definitely choose this gem for our next trip.

title: Great Location
text: This is not the first time in this hotel and NYC. Location is the key asset as well as the Opia Restaurant. Service is pretty match an average Marriot. Rooms are nice but definitely would be good to have them updated. Staff is very helpful. If you are looking for Marriot and location, this is a very good choice.

title: Mini moon in NYC
text: We spent our first couple night of our honeymoon in NYC... This place was great!!! Easy parking garage next door.. Great suite.. Huge bathroom with everything you could possibly need... Very comfortable bed... Great price as well... We will def use them anytime we come to NYC!!!!👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

title: Club lounge
text:
Best in class. In town visiting with daughter. Club provided a great break. Kristina is wonderful. 

App states that I should say more. But I said what is important. This app is flawed because in order to submit I must say more. 

So the app still says that I should say more so here it is. 

Great hotel to stay in. Staff was friendly and understands the traveler. Kristina runs a quiet place, good to unwind and spend time winding down after a busy day.

title: Room with a View
text:
My husband and I decided to make a trip into the City to relax and enjoy all New York has to offer. Our choice of hotels was perfect. The property is beautiful from the minute you enter and the staff is friendly and welcoming. We had a beautiful room on the 17th floor with a lovely terrace overlooking the city. It was just breathtaking and made us not want to leave the hotel. The location was perfect walking distance or a short cab ride to shopping, dining and many museums and theaters. 
Over the years we have stayed in many Marriott properties in NYC but from now on no matter what the occasion we will stay at this Renaissance.

title: Parfaitement placé
text: Cet hôtel de la chaîne Renaissance est superbement décoré et nous y avons passé un très agréable séjour. Situé à deux pas de la 5ème avenue et de Central Park, il permet de découvrir à pied l'essentiel des lieux touristiques de cette partie de la ville. Il est aussi très proche du métro ce qui permet de rejoindre aisément Brooklyn, ou le nord si vous souhaitez visiter Harlem. Sa décor est par ailleurs superbe et ses chambres confortables, bien qu'un peu exiguës. Le personnel est très efficace et l'on y mange très bien.

title: RipOffs
text: I browsed this location to a trip that I possible going to take to New York.  Nothing was set in stone in order to get the final amount I went on and reserved the hotel with the discount code I used it said  you had to pay in advance after I read that I called their reservation line to cancel it over the phone because I never received a confirmation from the hotel.  I call the reservation center and spoke with a lady and she told me that she didn't show a reservation from me so there wasn't actually a reservation out there for me at this hotel so don't worry about it.  So I did exactly that yesterday approximately 2 weeks later I see a charge on my credit card for $1,037 that was never authorized to this hotel.  When I call I can't get anyone directly at the hotel to discuss the matter and the reservation line rep tell me that I do indeed have a reservation with them and it specifically say that it had to be paid upfront and she couldn't do anything for me.  She said she will provide the information to the hotel directly and should hear from them with into 4 to 7 business days.  I am not sure about her but I don't have that type of money to give to anyone for services that I haven't gotten or will get.  To this day I never received a confirmation from Marriot regarding me having a reservation with this hotel in my regular email or spam and I have searched for it with out anything coming up.

title: AMAZING
text: Absolutely love this property!  Every time I have stayed there the staff is incredibly pleasant and welcoming.  The rooms are always clean and well-equipped.  They even brought us a mini-fridge for my daughter's milk.

title: Another great weekend in NYC...
text: The hotel is lovely and convenient to public transportation, great location. I prefer the East side not so many people huckstering on the streets.  Avoid the restaurant, the staff was incompetent and rude.  Breakfast service was a hot mess!  There's a diner right next store called the Palace, they serve  breakfast, lunch,and dinner.  Fast, friendly & reasonable.

title: Always A Good Place To Stay, And Close To Synagogues
text:
When in Manhattan I seek this one out if the price is right.  The staff are courteous, the rooms are - ok, small, but well spec'd - and it's a convenient walking distance - about seven blocks - to the Park East Synagogue (it's also round the corner from Central Synagogue.

I would prefer they didn't charge $16 for the WiFi.

If you want a view, ask for a room above 10th floor with an 06 at the end.  This should get you a corner room looking north down Lexington Avenue rather than just the building across the street.

title: Delightful boutique hotel
text: This is our third time to return to this hotel.While this may not have all the amenities of the Palace Hotel (where we have stayed a couple of times) it is welcoming, cute, art deco decor  and a perfect location. It does not have the Palace high rates either, in fact for NY is very reasonable.   Rooms are not large but have all the comforts needed for a weekend stay. Restaurant is really fine for breakfast or brunch.  We did not have dinner there.  Staff are so friendly and welcoming, especially Sammy the maitre d' who could not be more helpful.  Since we like to come to NY at least once a year this is and will be our hotel of choice.

title: Hotel 57 solid Upper East locale
text:
Having stayed at the Hotel 57 before, about two years prior, I returned on a business trip.  The location is excellent, walkable distance to Grand Central, Central Park and many Uoper East side amenities.

The hotel itself fancies itself as a chic, boutique style hotel, and it fits the bill.  Upon arrival, the mini-lobby on the first floor has two check in desks and a door man.  The door "men" were helpful, cordial and attentive.  The front desk associates were solid and friendly, but not memorable.  

Going to the second floor, there is an in house cafe/restaurant/bar that is congruent with NYC hotel restaurants, but does not have an identity from what I could tell.  

The concierge who was parked in front of the converge lounge seemed to be cold and not thrilled to be there.  This was not my experience during my previous visit and not consistent with my experience at Marriott properties.

The concierge lounge was nice, well decorated, and offered snacks and a light breakfast.  The evening choices were not available while I was there, which I was not sure why.  Usually, there would be light hors d'oevres and soft drinks.

My room was a simple NYC room, with nice appointments, upgraded TV, modern bathroom and a small couch.  I really liked the design and space of the room.

The exercise room was above average for a NYC hotel with newer equipment, ample cardio and space to stretch and workout.

Overall, my evaluation is that for this location, it is 1/4 the price of the Four Seasons, and an excellent choice for a business traveler, couples and small families.  Again - proximity to desired areas is strong with this hotel.

title: Great location.
text: Thanks to TripAdvisor, we found a great weekend rate ($150/night) at this East Side Marriott. We had the smallest double, and the room was very small, but fine for our needs. Everything was clean and working well, the bath was large compared to room, and (contrary to many reviews) a full length mirror was on the inside of the closet door. And the location can't be beat.

title: 12 day stay
text:
The hotel was most accommodating, great location and comfortable room.  I was stuck during the blizzard and they were able to keep me in my room for another week so I did not have to move.

The Club lounge is one of the best in my extensive travels.  Christina makes a great environment and is always so cheerful.  She is great, highlight of the trip.

Pernell at the door made sure to talk to me daily.  It made a great start to my day.

Opia, it's a miss. Avoid, bar is great, food is marginal.

I would highly recommend this hotel for the service, accommodations, and club lounge.

title: Good value, great service in NYC
text: Stayed two nights Jan 20 and 21, 2016. Friendly and efficient reception and check in with William. Small but clean and well kept room. Public spaces are somewhat dated in style but it looks like they spent a lot of money on this property twenty years ago and the fixtures have lasted and aged pretty well. Bar, restaurant, and upper lobby level busy with what appeared to be a weekday business person clientele. Overall a very pleasant NYC experience, convenient East Side location and who can complain when Bloomingdale's is just two blocks away?

title: A wonderful 30 night stay
text: This hotel is fantastic. Originally booked for 27 nights and then for an additional 3 due to the blizzard. The staff are awesome particularly the security. The two rooms we stayed in were always cleaned to a high standard particularly when Monica did it. The breakfast was included for the last 3 nights and had a limited selection but was fresh. The lady who hosts breakfast was lovely and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. We requested a small fridge which wasn't a problem at the start of our stay. One of the bartenders at opia makes a great espresso martini and would happily accomodate our cocktail requests which were not on the menu. We had a slight problem at opia as one of the staff members made some comments we found rude. Turned out it was his first day and upon telling the manager he compensated us with desert, cocktails, drinks and cheese. The situation was dealt with well. We also received complimentary shots from one of the other mangers on another occasion. By the end of our stay we felt like vip guests. There was some dog fur on the floor of the room when we first checked in but when we bought it to the attention of the front desk it was quickly corrected. I would recommend and return! Thanks team you guys rock!!

title: A great stay
text: Wonderful, helpful staff work here.  The room was large and comfortable. Walking distance to everything we needed. Restaurants near by would not be recommended by me. I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Dump
text: This hotel was the biggest DUMP I have ever stayed in.I could not believe this is part of the Marriott family.The room was gross,I felt like I was in a Motel.When I saw gross I mean absolutely disgusting.The furniture look like it came out of the dumpster,stains on the chair that looked like dryed up blood,holes as well the door looked like it was kicked in,the closest door looked like an animal attacked it.The bath tube had a dirt ring around it,the carpet was filthy and coming up from the walls,the sheet on one of the bed looked like it had what I hope was chocolate on them.I can go on,I notified the manager,all he could respond to me was.The hotel is totally sold out,all day I am well aware of the room situation.REALLY, as a manager that is all you can say did not offer to do a thing for us.I had to ask him to get someone in to change the  dedding for me.After that I had to leave I could not stay another night in this DUMP.

title: Quirky favorite in midtown Manhattan
text: I love this hotel!  Second-floor bar and restaurant (Aria) full of character, as are the ladies rooms.  Have not checked out the Gents.  Renovated rooms are lovely, very comfortable.  I have stayed in a non-renovated room, that was not my favorite.  I love this hotel for its location as well, very convenient for meetings.

title: Great Location, Great Value!
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights over the New Years Eve period, we got it for a really good price!

The hotel is perfect if you don't want to spend to much, after all if you plan on exploring New York you honestly only shower and sleep in your room. I felt the room was a little dated and we had a sofa in the room which was cream and filthy with stains! 
Also when I moved the pillows there was a lot of dust in all the gaps of the bed. I think this is just basic cleanliness which wouldn't take long to do on a daily basis, it's a shame really because this is the only thing that lets it down! The room was also very cold unless you had the heating on full blast.
The bathroom was clean and the bed sheets were clean, the bed also very comfortable. 
It was great for what we needed and the area is lovely, glad we didn't stay to near to times square! 
Would definitely stay again!

title: Perfect location!!!!
text: My partner and I had a rather extended stay here and wow what a perfect location it is simply internist convenient position you could want in a trip to nyc and in such a classy area!!! The staff is very helpful and we had no problems with any requests we had. What can I say it's a little old but having travelled to Newport many times that is what is expected but is is still a nice place. In saying that there is a couple of negatives when we arrived the floor in our room was covered in (cat, dog) hair I expected more from the hotel especially to have clean rooms for guests on arrival. But the thing that troubled is the most was the bed. It is old and very uncomfortable. Now to me when one has to put a mattress topper on a bed it means the mattress has seen its days and it's time for a new one so this is something they need to address as not sleeping well is a massive let down on a trip. As for the restaurant the food is great and cocktails are fantastic. The concierge are very sweet girls and always willing to help although they lack allot of knowledge of the area so that is one of the main differences to some of the better hotels. All in all still a perfect stay!!!! Would suggest staying here as the location is enough to make u happy!!!!

title: Lounge bar > restaurant bar
text: Staying here for a week, spent every night hanging with the bartender Christina. Good fun and conversation. The hotel restaurant bar staff across the hall are the more typical nyc dense and dull personalities that people from out of town loathe.

title: bem localizado
text: decoração bonita, bar bacana, quarto pequeno, comporta apenas cama de casal normal. a quadras de estações de metrô, facilita o deslocamento. funcionários atenciosos. wifi gratuito na área comum. o cheiro do hotel é algo marcante!

title: Nice Boutique Hotel - Great Location
text: Lovely place to stay when in New York. We had a great weekend getaway! The location could not be better, easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center and TIme Square - Subway 5 minute walk to take you anywhere. We didn't know what to expect the room to be like because of some of the reviews stating the rooms were really small. We found the room to be very cozy with plenty of storage and a nice size bathroom.

title: What an amazing hotel
text: I recently went to New York for a week long business trip and had chosen the Renaissance as it was close to my office. However, I was blown away by how friendly the staff are, how cool the lobby/bar/restaurant areas are and how comfortable the rooms were, certainly on the cosy side but you have everything you need. Not only this the staff were kind enough to get me a scarf as I didn't have one and they felt it was too cold outside! Above and beyond the call of duty. Reasonable, cosy, great location... It's a great hotel.

title: Good service, shabby condition
text:
We spent a long weekend in NYC and chose the hotel due to the excellent location. We were greeted by Serge at the front desk who was extremely kind and helpful to us. He upgraded our reservation to free club breakfast however it turned out to be served on weekdays only. 

The hotel is in a worn out condition with broken furniture both in public areas and rooms. The building is classy with cool decorations but screams for renovation. Not really good to be enjoying the (excellent) signature drink at the bar on a leather sofa full with holes like in the example pic. On another note the atmosphere is nice and cosy. 

But if you are looking for a good location with moderate pricing and excellent service within the chain this is a place to consider.

title: Excellent!
text: My wife and I stayed for the weekend....great hotel, close to the action.  Staff was really nice.  The bar is a great scene.  Rooms are small but have everything you need...and clean.  Highly recommend.  The terrace on the 17th floor has a great view of the Chrysler building.

title: nice spot to crash
text: I've stayed here a few times for business as my work is directly across the street.  it's nice just rolling out of bed and grabbing breakfast then jetting into work.  The night's sleep was ok, the ledge where the AC vent is was quite chipped and some of the tiling in the bathroom was cracked.  There is a bar downstairs which is quite nice for a night cap or to start your night off.  Staff were also quite friendly. Links for transportation are all really good and all in all a solid place to base yourself.

title: Trip to see the Rockettes
text: The hotel was centrally located to all of the things we wanted to see.  We were in walking distance of Radio City, Macy's, Times Square, and Penn Station.  The hotel was clean, and reasonable (for New York).  The staff were friendly and accommodating.

title: Great Location makes up for small rooms.
text:
When I arrived with my bags, there was no one on the door. I checked in and was asked if I needed help with my bag - I declined. After going up to the 'other lobby', I had to go to another set of elevators to get to my room. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, it was small of course, but there was ample room to move around for two people. I would describe it as more long than wide. 
There was plenty of closet space for my clothes. The bathroom was a nice size and everything was very clean. I really enjoyed the shower. 
I was annoyed that there was no full length mirror in the room because I was going to an event and it's always nice to be able to see your full body and outfit...

I did not eat at the restaurant but it looked nice and the staff was very friendly when I went in to see the menu. I pre-paid for a garage around the corner before arriving so I cannot comment on their parking situation. I also cannot comment on the WiFi  because I never ended up using it. I never touched the TV either.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. You can walk everywhere you want to go like 5th Ave, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. I chose this place because of the location, price, and the fact that they allow pets (I ended up leaving the dog with someone else but it was nice to know I could bring her if I needed to). I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good value
text: Clean room, friendly service. Ok price for NYC. Good location if you want to be near Central Park and 5th Avenue. Free wifi.  Liked the free umbrella use. Eatery and bar was really expensive like $30 for breakfast. Comfy bed, uncomfortable pillows.

title: New York
text: Very pleased with hotel more of a boutique hotel great area everthing in room changed and cleaned daily staff very friendly brochure said free wfi but only on certain deals not ours 2 small bottles of water put in room thought were free but wanted 7 dollars  no complimentary biscuits or fruit in room

title: Good hotel with a few basic flaws
text:
Booked this for New Year's Eve for 3 nights. Great location, very very good staff, excellent check in and even more super friendly check out. Room was a decent size for the city. Gorgeous Aveda toiletries, comfy bed and nice bathroom. However, my 2 major gripes:
1: the heating/air con system is loud. All night, even if you turn it off. Not conducive to a good nights sleep.
2: lack of full length mirror, or in fact any mirror, in the bedroom. Cosmetic mirror in bathroom and that was it. Plenty of wall space for one and come on, you're getting ready to hit the town in nyc? You need a full length mirror!
Other than that, a good stay and I'd visit again.

title: A Couple of Improvements Needed
text: Stayed here for 3 nights over New Year. First impressions were good - stylish decor, very friendly welcome, good bar too. However, the double room was very small, no wifi for customers in rooms, no full-length mirror, or in fact any mirror other than in the bathroom which made getting ready take longer than needed. The heating creaked and groaned all night too, and if the fan kicked in, it was reminiscent of the crystal dome on Crystal Maze! However, great location and good value compared to other places. Maybe a 3* though?

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for New Years and the location is wonderful. Short walking distance from shops, Central Park, and many other places. We booked the room with the terrace and was definitely worth it, since the room isn't very big. When we first got there, we had no water. Apparently there was a pipe that burst and was fixed within 20 minutes. I was never able to take a hot shower, my husband who went after me, did. Guess I warmed it up for him. Anytime we changed the channel on the tv, our window unit would turn on and off at the same time. Most Marriott hotels I stay at have some info about the hotel and a city guide. There was nothing in the room that listed any amenities, had to call down to the desk to find out where , if any, the ice machines are, they're on the even floors. Restaurant and bar were terrific, great food and service.

title: Great Location - Superior Accomodations
text: Near the best shopping and restaurants. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, Central Park and more. This is a boutique hotel that is a converted apartment building. Only maybe 15 rooms per floor and they are recently redecorated and comfortable. There is only one restaurant and with so many choices in the area we did not utilize it. The concierge lounge is very small and closed weekends but reasonably priced for a midtown hotel. We will return

title: Great hotel, fantastic location
text:
We stayed at this hotel over Christmas and it was everything we needed it to be.
The location is amazing, just a few blocks away from 5th Avenue and central park. There are loads of places near the hotel from breakfast, dinner and drinks.
I read a lot of reviews about the rooms being small or dirty and the wifi being slow but I didn't experience any of this. Booked the larger double room and found it very spacious with lots of storage space for our belongings. Room was always clean and tidy as well.
Bar downstairs is very good as well not sure on the food there as I didn't eat there.
I don't have anything bad to say about this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

title: Best Place to Stay Near Premium Shopping
text: My 3rd stay here at Christmas time. Staff are always friendly and willing to help. Valet parking at the front door. Umbrellas available for free. Rooms vary in size but all are very clean and modern. Book a room with a terrace for a beautiful outdoor view of 57th street. Short walk to Bloomie's, Bergdorf's, Torneau, Chanel, Breitling and all of the high end 57th street retailers. BLT Steak is a great resteraunt less than a block walk. The E train subway stop is a short 3 blocks away and takes u to Penn Station. I've stayed all over NYC but keep coming back to this majestic old but refreshed and comfortable hotel.
